subject: Cursor Bugbot 🐛, GPT-5 in August 5️⃣, startup AI budgets 💰
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-07-25
Replacing code with context: Using LLMs to judge query intent in online shopping (Sponsor) 

Which products should a user see when they search for “gaming computer”? The answer used to depend on code, a series of rule-based algorithms and calculations. With LLMs, we're entering an era where code matters less than context.

In this new paradigm, AI systems can adapt in real time, and RAG pipelines give instant insight into user intent. Data drives development, and products become better through better context, not code.
Get a detailed overview on the present and future of search, shopping recommendations, and online personalization: read the guide from Algolia 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Cursor Launches Bugbot for Automated Code Review (2 minute read) 

Cursor's Bugbot is a coding safety net that automatically catches bugs and security vulnerabilities in pull requests before they reach production. Early users report over 50% resolution rates. 
OpenAI prepares to launch GPT-5 in August (2 minute read) 

OpenAI plans to release GPT-5 as early as August as an AI system that incorporates distinct models for different functions, including the o3 model, as part of the company's broader effort to merge its o-series and GPT-series models into unified systems. 
Google's Web Guide (1 minute read) 

Google's Web Guide is a Search Labs feature that uses a Gemini-powered system to intelligently cluster search results into meaningful groups. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Kimi K2 vs. Claude 4 Sonnet for Agentic Coding (13 minute read) 

This post benchmarks Moonshot AI's Kimi K2, a low-cost open-source model optimized for agentic coding tasks, against Anthropic's Claude 4 Sonnet. The comparison covers code quality, performance, and pricing. Kimi K2 showed competitive results and a significant cost advantage. 
Budgeting for AI in Your Startup (2 minute read) 

Startups should allocate 10-15% of their R&D budget to AI, as engineer salaries average $200k and AI tools cost about $30k per year. AI adoption varies, with AI-native startups potentially spending more. Companies should adjust as AI becomes more integrated into operations. 
AI As Profoundly Abnormal Technology (58 minute read) 

AI technology will experience a profound jump in capabilities within the next decade. While some groups predict that AI adoption will be slow due to concerns about safety and other barriers to progress, the technology seems to be advancing very quickly. Control without alignment may not be sufficient to mitigate risk. Developers should prepare for risks that aren't immediate, as doing otherwise would be irresponsible. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
How Delve turned 4 newsletter ads into $1M pipeline (Sponsor) 

Delve ran just 4 ads in TLDR newsletters. The payoff?

	•	66 high-quality leads (including enterprise companies)
	•	$1M in pipeline
	•	52x ROI
We break down Delve's exact strategy, detailed results, and share the actual ads that crushed it.
Read the Delve case study. 
Qwen-MT: Where Speed Meets Smart Translation (6 minute read) 

The latest update of Qwen-MT (qwen-mt-turbo) builds upon the powerful Qwen3, achieving significant improvements in translation accuracy and linguistic fluency. The updated model leverages trillions of multilingual and translation tokens to comprehensively enhance its multilingual understanding and translation capabilities. Its key features include multilingual support for 92 languages, high customizability, low latency, and cost efficiency. This post provides a quick start guide along with benchmark results. 
Memories.ai introduces a new model that remembers at superhuman scale (2 minute read) 

Memories.ai is a research lab built by ex-Meta researchers to take on the challenge of true, persistent video understanding at any scale. It recently introduced an advanced memory system for video AI inspired by human memory. The system enables persistent Video Chat across entire archives. Memories.ai aims to become an indispensable tool for creators, marketers, researchers, and developers seeking to unlock the value hidden inside their video archives. 
TimeScope Video Understanding Benchmark (18 minute read) 

TimeScope is an open-source benchmark designed to test vision-language models on long videos by inserting short "needle" clips. It measures localized retrieval, information synthesis, and fine-grained temporal perception, showing that many top models still lack robust temporal understanding. 
Gemini 2.5 Pro Capable of Winning Gold at IMO 2025 (1 minute read) 

Completing the International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO) requires deep insight, creativity, and formal reasoning. Large language models usually struggle with Olympiad-level tasks, but Google's Gemini 2.5 Pro was able to complete five out of six problems correctly on the IMO 2025. The result shows how important it is to develop optimal strategies to harness the full potential of powerful models for complex reasoning tasks. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
$1 Billion Worth of Nvidia AI Chips Smuggled to China Despite Export Controls (10 minute read) 

A thriving black market has moved over $1 billion worth of banned Nvidia B200 chips to China in just 3 months by routing shipments through Southeast Asian countries like Malaysia and Thailand before final delivery. Chinese distributors are openly advertising ready-to-deploy server racks at 50% premiums and developing new routes through European countries as the US prepares to tighten controls on regional intermediaries. 
The Three Layers of ROI for AI Agents (4 minute read) 

This post discusses a three-layer framework for determining where the ROI for AI agents comes from. The first layer is labor efficiency - while this layer is easy to explain, developers need to understand that AI efficiency doesn't equal immediate realized ROI. The second layer is net-new revenue, the backlog of stuff businesses never did until AI that create new value. The final layer is optimization - AI models bring decision fluency and ML brings decision precision, which creates value. 
⚡
Quick Links
NEW LABS EXPERIMENT (1 minute read) 

Opal, Google Labs' new tool that helps users build and share AI mini-apps by linking together prompts, models, and tools while using simple, natural language, is now available in US-only public beta. 
Google's AI Overviews have 2B monthly users, AI Mode 100M in the US and India (2 minute read) 

Google's AI Overviews now serve 2 billion monthly users across 200 countries, up from 1.5 billion in May, and the company's monthly token processing has doubled to 980 trillion tokens. 
I've joined Cognition (2 minute read) 

Prem Qu Nair, employee #2 at Windsurf, has joined Cognition to work on the future of software engineering 
Love TLDR? Tell your friends and get rewards! 
Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag! 
https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here.
Want to advertise in TLDR? 📰 
If your company is interested in reaching an audience of AI professionals and decision makers, you may want to advertise with us. 

Want to work at TLDR? 💼 
Apply here or send a friend's resume to jobs@tldr.tech and get $1k if we hire them! 

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian, Jacob Turner & Sahil Khoja

subject: Flash sale at Toshi Straps - ends Sunday
body:
This weekend only - place an online order for 2 or more straps and get a 20% discount with my compliments! 
View this email in your browser 
￼ 
￼ 
Until the end of the weekend - Place an online order for 2 or more straps and get 20% off!

Now is a very good time to place an order with Toshi Straps. Not only have I just added 10 new leathers to my website store, but, effective immediately, all orders for 2 or more straps will receive a complimentary 20% discount using the coupon code below*. This promotion is running until midnight (BST) on Sunday 27th July, so if you've been contemplating ordering a new strap for your watch, what are you waiting for?

When you place your order, simply enter the code below into the "promotional code" box at the top of the checkout page, click "apply coupon" and you will automatically see a 20% discount applied*. The coupon code is:


Flash20



Take a look at the leathers I have available.
There are over 100 different leathers to choose from, including ten that I've launched within the last month, so I'm confident I'll have something that you'll love.
This offer finishes on Sunday evening though, and there will be no exceptions for latecomers, so be sure to be quick!

Need help choosing? I've recently published a few blog posts about some of the new leathers I've launched, but if you need more help just email me your watch details and color preferences (to rich@toshi-straps.co.uk) and I'll get back to you with some suggestions.


* this offer is applicable to any online order (of at least 2 straps) placed before midnight (BST) on Sunday 27th July 2025 using the coupon code "Flash20". Only the cost of straps will be discounted - all gift certificates, additional buckles & accessories are excluded from this offer.

As always, I will give you a scheduled posting date when I email you to confirm your order.
These promotions are always popular, but rest assured I will get your straps built and shipped as quickly as is possible, and I'm confident that when they arrive you will feel they were worth waiting for! 

￼

subject: Cinematic excellence, this August at Rephouse
body:
￼
￼
Timeless classics and modern stunners
Do you ever get that itch to reDiscover a timeless classic, but the small screen just doesn't cut it?

Our August REPHOUSE line-up is here to provide you with your daily dose of truly great cinema, spanning all genres, from the classic to the cult – because you haven't really seen it until you've seen it on the big screen. 

Tickets start from just £8.50, and £5.50 for Members. Aged 16-25? Get £5.99 tickets when you sign up to U25.
See what's on  |  Get tickets now 
August Highlights
￼
DRIVE
Fast-paced thriller featuring an all-star cast led by Ryan Gosling and Carey Mulligan. Driver is a skilled Hollywood stuntman who moonlights as a getaway driver for criminals - until he unexpectedly falls in love.
08 & 09 Aug  |  Book now 
 
￼
THE FRENCH CONNECTION
1970s crime classic from the mind of William Friedkin, starring the late great Gene Hackman as a New York City detective on a deadly mission to dismantle an American-French drug ring.
15 - 17 Aug  |  Book now 
￼
WEST SIDE STORY
This must-see musical classic transports the story of Romeo and Juliet to New York City, where teenagers from rival urban gangs fall in love – until tensions quickly stir and lead them toward tragedy.
19 - 21 Aug  |  Book now 
 
￼
PAST LIVES
Celine Song's hugely acclaimed directorial debut charts lost love, heartbreak and reminiscence, as two deeply connected childhood friends reunite after decades and contemplate the lives they've built apart.

subject: Re: Email to the solicitor
body:
Brilliant, thank you! Sorry to be a pain but I have no experience with solicitors and having looked up some things online I realise that this needs to be correct.
Mike.

On Fri, 25 Jul 2025 at 13:34, Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> wrote:
I'll take a look over the weekend. On first scan it looks clear on the request so I'll review against solicitors rules, etc to make sure we tick all the boxes and don't end up with unnecessary back and forths. I should imagine that they'd need to verify identities, etc. 

On Thu, 24 Jul 2025, 22:28 Mike P, <mikepembery@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi Roger,
Do you think that this would be ok to request information from Dawbarns?

"Subject:  Financial matters concerning John Albert Pembery
Dear Sir/Madam,
I am writing as the attorney (I have LPA for property and finance) of Mr John Albert Pembery who I understand to be a client of Fraser Dawbarns of 1-3 York Row, Wisbech, Cambridgeshire, PE13 1EA.
In order that I can ensure that Mr Pembery's finances are in order I would like you to send copies of any work carried out on his behalf. In order to facilitate this I am happy to give you access to the LPA via the access code V - XX33 - PPHX - 8VDV.
Please provide this by 8th August."

What do you think? Should I state a deadline? Are they likely to try to charge me for this?
Please don't spend too long. If it needs to be a delivered letter I can do that as well. I also considered sending it to Debora Candeias - what do you think? I have her email maybe it would probably be better than sending it to the general email account.

subject: Email to the solicitor
body:
Hi Roger,
Do you think that this would be ok to request information from Dawbarns?

"Subject:  Financial matters concerning John Albert Pembery
Dear Sir/Madam,
I am writing as the attorney (I have LPA for property and finance) of Mr John Albert Pembery who I understand to be a client of Fraser Dawbarns of 1-3 York Row, Wisbech, Cambridgeshire, PE13 1EA.
In order that I can ensure that Mr Pembery's finances are in order I would like you to send copies of any work carried out on his behalf. In order to facilitate this I am happy to give you access to the LPA via the access code V - XX33 - PPHX - 8VDV.
Please provide this by 8th August."

What do you think? Should I state a deadline? Are they likely to try to charge me for this?
Please don't spend too long. If it needs to be a delivered letter I can do that as well. I also considered sending it to Debora Candeias - what do you think? I have her email maybe it would probably be better than sending it to the general email account.

subject: Out of the Ordinary Festival – Free preview event this Saturday 26 August
body:
Something Out of the Ordinary is happening in Cambridge this Saturday! 
 
Is this email not displaying correctly? View it in your browser.


 
￼
Don't miss our FREE preview event this Saturday 26 July!
￼
￼
￼
Join us this Saturday in Cambridge Market Square, with live street performances from 11am to 4pm. Get a taste of what’s to come at the main event on 23–24 August. 
 
Find out more about the performers below:
 
Hands Down Circus will be performing their show Tape That, a charming, light-hearted, non-verbal acrobatic duet. Two performers construct a visual world using colourful tape, object manipulation and partner acrobatics. A simple roll of tape transforms from DJ decks to a spyglass, and is stretched to create physical barriers and obstacles for the performers to navigate.
 
Tape That is a playful exploration of the world we live in; when challenges present themselves, just how many problems can be fixed with a few rolls of duct tape?


￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
Surreal McCoy are bringing their Giant Seagulls to Cambridge! Totally surrealistic, with working beaks, they'll be rummaging in bags and pockets, stealing food from plates and picnic baskets, causing chaos as usual and squabbling amongst themselves. Shrieks of laughter follow them wherever they go.
 
Icons by Jon Hicks is upside down, revolving, 6 foot tall speed paintings of the iconically famous. Executed with, style, dexterity, attitude and immaculate timing to music.
 
The screen is blank, the music is playing and Jon will step up to the screen, armed with just a few pots of paint. Within minutes the screen is full of colour and the audience begins to perceive a face. At the last moment he spins the screen to reveal a famous character who is linked to the music.

￼
FIND OUT MORE HERE
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
Spectacular, fantastical, fun-filled, colourful, acrobatic, gravity-defying, breathtaking, unforgettable…Out of the Ordinary outdoor arts festival is back for 2025!
 
Celebrating its third birthday in style across the August Bank Holiday weekend, Cambridge is set to see some startling sights as some of the very best performance artists arrive in town, on a mission to entertain.


￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
As well as taking place on the city centre streets, there’s also lots to see on Christ’s Pieces near the bus station, where people can relax, eat and drink and watch fantastic performance artists. There will be extraordinary acts, visual comedy shows, music and dance as well as wellbeing activities and some fantastic local food vendors.
 
Local dance schools, musicians, artists and performers will also be taking to the streets over the weekend to showcase their talents. On Saturday, the dedicated music stage, presented by Cambridge BID, will feature several young local bands, all part of the Junction’s music development Fiver programme. And on Sunday, as part of Folk in the City, young and emerging singer-songwriters will have the chance to perform live.

￼
FIND OUT MORE HERE
￼
SUPPORTED BY 
￼
MEDIA PARTNER 
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼

subject: The Classic Rock Show, The Cambridge Contemporary Choir Festival, Maximum Rhythm And Blues with The Manfreds and more.
body:
Discover our on sale shows
 
Is this email not displaying correctly? View it in your browser.
￼
￼
BOX OFFICE: Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk | Phone: 01223 357851 | Mon - Fri, 10am - 5pm
￼
On Sale Now
￼
The Classic Rock Show
￼
20 January 2026 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale: 25 July 2025, 10 AM
￼
Pink Floyd, Led Zeppelin, Queen, The Rolling Stones, The Eagles, AC/DC, The Beatles, Dire Straits, Meat Loaf, ZZ Top, Eric Clapton, Aerosmith, Lynyrd Skynyrd, The Who, Boston, Toto, Van Halen, Fleetwood Mac and more
 
An amazing opportunity for rock fans, young and old, to celebrate three decades of the world’s greatest classic rock music with a stunning multi-million dollar sound and light show to match.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
The Cambridge Contemporary Choir Festival - The BIG BIG Collab
￼
8 August 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now

￼
This is the first event of this kind and a brand new offering at CCC-Fest. Come join Carrie Rawlings as she leads you through an evening of song accompanied by Lizzie Deane and her awesome LIVE band. There will be some light learning as we get you working and signing in harmony to a well-known pop tune. Then we'll let rip as a group and dance the night away bandeoke style to some other top tunes. This will be the ultimate girls night out - so get your friends and come to the party!

￼
BOOK HERE
￼

Folk in the City Launch Event
￼
1 August 2025 | Cambridge Junction
On general sale now 
￼
Fiddle-driven folk-Americana band Noble Jacks headline with their explosive, high-energy sound that’s lit up Glastonbury and the Official Americana Top 40.
 
They’re joined by rising star Lizzy Hardingham, praised for her powerful songwriting and standout vocals, and local favourite Chris Fox, blending folk, Americana and blues with loop-pedal alchemy.
 
A one-off evening of top folk talent in the heart of the city.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Maximum Rhythm And Blues with The Manfreds
￼
23 October 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
The Manfreds return to Cambridge with their acclaimed Maximum Rhythm and Blues show, featuring original members Paul Jones and Tom McGuinness. Expect classics like ‘Do Wah Diddy Diddy’, ‘The Mighty Quinn’ and more, joined by special guest Noel McCalla – former Manfred Mann’s Earth Band frontman and one of Britain’s top soul singers.
￼
BOOK NOW
￼
The Very Best of Frankie Valli Starring Peter Andre
￼
23 January 2026 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Starring Peter Andre - The Very Best of Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons is a spectacular high-pitched celebration of timeless music from one of the biggest selling groups of all time. This nostalgic musical journey pays tribute to the life and career of those four boys from Jersey, who started singing under a streetlamp but soon went on to become one of the most recognised groups in history.
￼
BOOK NOW
￼
￼
Shows on sale with Cambridge Live Tickets
￼
Tim Boniface presents The Sunday Jazz Sessions
￼
24 August 2025 | The LAB Cocktail Bar
On general sale now
￼
Join Tim Boniface’s Sunday Jazz Sessions for an unforgettable afternoon with Germana Stella’s La Sorsa project.
 
Set in Cambridge’s Lab Cocktail Bar, enjoy soulful vocals, inventive arrangements, and top UK jazz talent.
 
Described by London Jazz News as “thoughtful and musically satisfying,” this is perfect for jazz lovers and newcomers alike.
￼
BOOK NOW
￼

KID KAPICHI
￼
29 October 2025 | Mash, Cambridge 
On general sale: 25 July 2025, 10 AM
￼
Kid Kapichi are coming to Cambridge!
 
Known for their raw energy and sharp lyricism, the band will be showcasing material from their most introspective album yet, marking a new chapter with a fresh lineup.

FIND OUT MORE
￼

￼

￼

Out of the Ordinary Preview
￼
26 July 2025 | Market Square | 11 AM - 4 PM | FREE
￼
Join us this Saturday in Cambridge Market Square for a preview of the Out of the Ordinary Festival, featuring live street performances from 11am to 4pm. Get a taste of what’s to come at the main event on 23–24 August!  You can expect three acts: Tape That — a playful acrobatic show with colourful tape; Surreal McCoy’s Giant Seagulls causing chaos; and Icons — live speed paintings of famous faces by Jon Hicks.  See you there!
FIND OUT MORE
￼
Discover More
￼
Share Your Corn Exchange Story
￼
￼
As we celebrate 150 years at the heart of Cambridge’s cultural life, we’re inviting you to share your special memories—from first gigs to unforgettable nights.
 
Your stories will help shape a story-gathering project for our 150th Anniversary Exhibition later this year. Thank you for being part of our journey.

SUBMIT YOUR STORY HERE
￼
￼
￼
This project is funded by the National Lottery Heritage Fund. We also thank our supporter, Cambridge BID.
￼
Want to skip the queues?
￼
The age-old tradition of queuing for interval drinks is becoming a thing of the past at the Corn Exchange.
 
Simply follow this link and place your order in just a few easy steps. Whether you're craving a bag of Haribos, a Coke, a glass of wine, a beer, a ready-mixed cocktail, or an award-winning Saffron Ice Cream, you can sit back, relax, and enjoy the show while your interval drinks and snacks are delivered straight to your seat!
PRE-ORDER NOW
￼
CornEx Membership
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange, run by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council, depends on ticket sales, sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants, and concessions to bring top-quality shows to the city. By becoming a member, you make a significant impact, helping us continue to deliver the music, comedy, and performances you love. As a thank you, we offer great perks in return.
BECOME A MEMBER
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange is operated by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council. As well as Corn Exchange ticket income, we rely on income raised through sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants and concessions to ensure that we can continue to bring the biggest and best shows to the city.
 
We also organise an annual programme of diverse and greatly valued events including free Fireworks Night, Out of the Ordinary Festival and Music in the Parks. These events are free in order to offer residents the opportunity to participate in the cultural life of the city and to provide access to all. They contribute to creating a united city, ‘One Cambridge - Fair for All’, in which economic dynamism and prosperity are combined with social justice and equality. Again, these events are also an opportunity to develop valued partnerships with local businesses and other organisations that make up the Cambridge Community.
3 Parson's Court, Wheeler Street, Cambridge, CB2 3QE
 
Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk
Phone: 01223 357851

Cambridge Corn Exchange is provided by Cambridge City Council

subject: News & Club Runs
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 

Dear Roger,

The Blue Egg
 MOVED TO SATURDAY 26TH JULY DUE TO POOR FORECAST - also a long bank holiday weekend!  We normally ride to the Blue Egg in the winter as part of the Festive 500 as they're not open on Sundays or Bank Holiday's.  After quite a few requests, a summer date was put into the calendar back in December.  Details as follows, it would be helpful to know who can make the ride in advance so please encourage each other this week and hit 'GOING' on the event page if you're planning to ride.  Thank you.  Saturday 26th July Meet: Norris Museum at 07:50 Depart: 08:00 Route: 99 miles with the cafe on mile 54
The Blue Egg Route
FB EVENT PAGE

2025 TT ENTRY TICKETS HERE
￼ 
Time Trials
 The club will again be hosting a weekly 10-mile time trial on the N1/10 course up and down the old A1 from Sawtry on Wednesday evenings from the 14th May to 20th August.  ENTRIES BY 2PM ON THE DAY PLEASE.  !!We must receive 10 entries by 6pm on a Tuesday evening or we will face TT cancellation!! (this was a committee decision after a quiet week on 4th June).  Thank You.  3rd September is the Hill Climb.  As we still don't have an Events Officer on the Committee, organisation of the TT's has been a team effort behind the scenes. Quite some work has gone into making the TT's easier for anyone to take on in the future. If you can offer to help in anyway, please speak to a committee member or to one of our regular TTer's. All kit and signs are now stored onsite at Sawtry and we have a new website based database that generates start sheets, results and podiums. It's just a case of entering the data and clicking a button. No tech compatibility issues!  Further information and links, including how to ENTER to ride are in the event page on Facebook:  Please support so that we don't see these events lost in future.
Facebook Event Page

Sunday Club Run

￼ 
27th July 2025

We meet outside The Norris Museum on The Waits, St Ives at 8:45 with the first group leaving at 9:00 prompt.

This week's club run will be heading to Saffron Walden and Fowlmere.

Groups A and B will ride the same route of 66 miles stopping at The Mocha or Bicicletta Cafes in Saffron Walden.

Group C will ride the shorter route of 46 miles stopping at Cafe Amigo in Fowlmere.*

*The pace of the C group is around 14-16mph giving opportunity to new riders to join us.  Please welcome new riders to this group.
Sunday Long Route - 24 - Saffron Walden
Sunday Short Route - 110 - Fowlmere

Thursday Evening Ride
￼ 
31st July 2025

We meet outside The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen on The Boulevard, Alconbury Weald at 18:15 with the first group leaving at 18:30 prompt

Fen Loops
	•	Routes will be here the week before each ride.
	•	Multiple paced groups.
	•	2 routes
	•	25 - 35 miles
	•	No stop ride
	•	The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen will be open until 11pm.
	•	Free Parking available outside The Club gym and near The Pavillion.
	•	New riders are welcomed so please bring a friend.  Membership is required after 2 club rides for insurance purposes.
Thursday Long Route - 175 - Fen Loop
Thursday Short Route - 176 - Fen Loop
Polite Reminders (for all club rides):
	•	Download the route.
	•	Remember your cafe bike locks.
	•	Look after your club mates.
	•	TT/Aero bars are not to be used.

Thank you.


2025
Dates for your Calendar
 
	•	Social Evening (off the bike) - Tuesday 25th February
	•	International Women's Day Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 8th March
	•	Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 12th April
	•	Double Dutch Audax - Saturday 19th April
	•	Easter Club Run - Sunday 20th April
	•	Evening Social Rides (Alconbury) Start - Thursday 1st May
	•	Peaks Away Day Club Run - Sunday 4th May (stay for the weekend, it's a Bank Holiday!)
	•	Evening 10 mile Time Trials Restart (Sawtry) - Wednesday 14th May
	•	FREE OF CHARGE Evening 10 mile Time Trial - Wednesday 11th June
	•	Summer BBQ Club Run - Sunday 29th June
	•	Summer Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 26th July
	•	Last Evening 10 mile Time Trial (Sawtry) - Wednesday 20th August
	•	Bank Holiday Weekend Longer Club Run - Sunday 24th August (ideas welcome!)
	•	Last Evening Social Ride (Alconbury) - Thursday 28th August
	•	Dave Nelson Memorial Hill Climb - Wednesday 3rd September
	•	Cafe Ventoux Away Day Club Run - Sunday 7th September
	•	Remembrance Club Run - Sunday 9th Novemeber
	•	Christmas Dress Up Club Run - Sunday 21st December
	•	Festive 500 - Wednesday 24th - 31st December
	•	Winter Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 27th December
	•	Short New Years Eve Ride - Wednesday 31st December
 
	•	SICC hosts Eastern League CX - TBC
	•	Christmas Meal - TBC
	•	AGM & Awards Presentation - TBC

Thought of the week

Real Estate Connect 
Aberdeen connects you to the latest perspectives on the real estate world. 
￼
Real Estate Connect, Q3 2025 
￼ 
Aberdeen 
Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation 
Read on LinkedIn 
Despite tariff upheaval and geopolitical tensions, global real estate markets continue to prove resilient, with new opportunities starting to emerge. Europe’s shift toward greater economic autonomy is creating fresh momentum—reindustrialisation is now gaining traction as a powerful structural theme, with significant implications for industrial and logistics real estate. Alongside this, we look at contrasting prospects in the UK and APAC and explore the resilient outlook in North America. We also spotlight how hybrid real estate funds are offering a timely solution for those seeking both liquidity and long-term exposure in a changing investment landscape. Explore the trends shaping our Q3 Houseview. 
For Professional Investors only. Capital at Risk. 

We explore Europe's focus on resilience, highlighting prospects in securing supply chains and spurring innovation. 
￼

Discover how hybrid real estate funds are reshaping access, liquidity, and opportunity. 
￼

Returns have been gradually climbing since the start of the year, as capital growth has returned. Find out more about our UK real estate views. 
￼

Reindustrialisation in Europe offers a structural play for investors to source new opportunities. We discuss the outlook for European real estate. 
￼

We expect diversification into APAC to increase, especially towards core markets like Japan, Australia, and Korea. Read more about our outlook. 
￼

The latest US data has been mixed. Firms are investing, but consumption momentum has been weaker. We discuss the impact on real estate. 
...

subject: Ride with Purpose: Watch the Femmes 2025
body:
￼
A MOVEMENT. NOT A MOMENT.
Starts July 26
This isn’t just a race. Watch the Femmes is about driving real, lasting change in women’s cycling. More visibility. More investment. More opportunities for the next generation.
Unlock the all-new Watch the Femmes 2025 kit, represent your crew with eight club-branded kits, and ride alongside RoboPacers in special-edition skins. Plus, get hyped to explore your new favorite routes in France.
This movement is powered by you. Let’s show the world what happens when community leads the way. To watch, find your broadcaster on the Tour de France Femmes Avec Zwift official website.

subject: US AI Action Plan 🇺🇸, GitHub Spark 🌟, OpenAI’s economic analysis 🏧
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-07-24
The MCP Authorization Problem, Solved with OAuth (Sponsor) 

Model Context Protocol (MCP) is becoming a standard for connecting tools to LLMs. But how do you securely authorize MCP servers?

OAuth now provides the answer, with five complementary specs for delegation, token exchange, and scoped access.
The WorkOS advantage:
	•	Packages all 5 OAuth specs into one simple API.
	•	Pre-built infrastructure that saves engineering time.
	•	Enterprise ready security out of the box.
Implement MCP Auth with WorkOS → 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Trump Administration Pledges to Stimulate AI Use and Exports (7 minute read) 

The Trump administration has promised to slash red tape and take steps to boost exports for US tech companies in a bid to accelerate AI use in the US. Its action plan lays out moves to make it easier and faster for tech companies to build data centers and get the power they need for those centers. The plan includes directives to several government agencies to identify and gut any regulations that block the development and use of AI. The administration is also working on addressing uncertainty about whether it is legal for AI models to train on copyrighted material. 
GitHub launches Spark for no-code AI app creation (8 minute read) 

GitHub Spark enables "vibe coding" — letting users create personalized "micro apps" by describing ideas in natural language rather than writing code. The tool uses AI models from Anthropic and OpenAI to instantly generate functional apps with automatic deployment, persistent data storage, and polished UI components. 
Anthropic backs US AI plan, urges transparency and security (7 minute read) 

The White House's "Winning the Race: America's AI Action Plan" prioritizes accelerating AI infrastructure, federal adoption, and security coordination. Anthropic supports this strategy and emphasizes the importance of export controls and transparency standards in AI development. The plan aligns with Anthropic's earlier recommendations and highlights the need to maintain America's AI leadership through robust infrastructure, security, and responsible policy measures. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
OpenAI's new economic analysis (20 minute read) 

OpenAI's new economic research reveals that 28% of employed US adults now use ChatGPT at work — up from just 8% in 2023. The usage data shows learning and upskilling dominating at 20% of US messages, followed by writing and communication at 18%, with programming and data science capturing 7%. 
Inverse Scaling Appears in Extended Reasoning (11 minute read) 

Anthropic found that more test-time compute doesn't always help: longer reasoning chains in large models sometimes lead to worse performance. 
“Behaviorist” RL reward functions lead to scheming (20 minute read) 

A large class of reward functions, which includes almost every reward function in the RL and LLM literature, are all doomed to eventually lead to AI that will pretend to be docile and cooperative while secretly looking for opportunities to behave in egregiously bad ways. This is because negative reward for lying and stealing looks the same as negative reward for getting caught lying and stealing. The reward function will miss sufficiently sneaky misaligned behavior, so the AI will learn that this kind of behavior is good. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
🎨 Lovart introduces the world's first AI design agent (Sponsor) 

Creating Ghibli versions of your profile pic is fun, but that's not what you pay a designer to do — and that's where Lovart comes in. It's AI that thinks, works, and creates like a professional designer. It brainstorms with you. It looks for examples. It thinks in design systems. Try it — free 
TimeScope: How Long Can Your Video Large Multimodal Model Go? (2 minute read) 

TimeScope is a new open source benchmark for evaluating vision models on how well they handle long videos. It evaluates not just retrieval but synthesis, localization, and fine-grained motion analysis to provide a more holistic view of temporal comprehension. Using the benchmark reveals how model size isn't everything - simply scaling parameters doesn't automatically grant a longer temporal horizon - and Gemini 2.5-Pro is in a league of its own, being the only model able to maintain strong accuracy on videos longer than an hour. 
Voxtral (15 minute read) 

Voxtral Mini and Small are new multimodal audio chat models that excel in both spoken audio and text comprehension. Voxtral Small outperforms many closed-source models, can run locally, and supports audio files up to 40 minutes. 
Subliminal Learning in Language Models (10 minute read) 

Anthropic has explored how language models can inherit behavioral traits such as preferences or goals from other models through training data that appears unrelated. This effect only occurs when the teacher and student models share the same base architecture, suggesting hidden signals in the data can transmit unintended behavior. 
Higgs Audio V2 (GitHub Repo) 

Higgs Audio v2 is an audio foundation model trained on 10 million hours of data that achieves 75.7% win rates over GPT-4o-mini-tts. The open-source model demonstrates emergent capabilities like multi-speaker dialogues and voice cloning without requiring fine-tuning. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Google DeepMind launches Aeneas AI model for ancient Roman inscription analysis (5 minute read) 

Aeneas is the first AI model designed to help historians contextualize ancient Roman inscriptions by identifying textual parallels and restoring damaged texts with 73% accuracy for gaps up to ten characters. DeepMind is making the tool freely available at predictingthepast.com and plans to expand to other ancient languages. 
Elon Musk says xAI is targeting 50 million 'H100 equivalent' AI GPUs in five years (4 minute read) 

xAI plans to deploy 50 million H100-equivalent GPUs within five years. The power these processors will consume is massive, estimated to be equal to the typical power generated by 35 nuclear power plants, making it unrealistic to power today. Whether xAI will be able to get power to feed such a data center by 2030 remains to be seen. 
⚡
Quick Links
How much is bad sleep costing you? (Sponsor) 

Sleeping poorly leaves you foggy, unproductive, and drained. Tired of being tired? Try Dream: a rich, cocoa-flavored drink that helps you fall asleep faster and wake up feeling amazing. Get 20% off 
YouTube Shorts is adding an image-to-video AI tool, new AI effects (3 minute read) 

YouTube is following Gemini and Meta's Edits app with its own image-to-video AI feature for Shorts creators, transforming static photos into six-second videos using Google's Veo 2 model. 
New open models arrive in the Vertex AI Model Garden (1 minute read) 

Google Cloud has added the DeepSeek R1 model to its Vertex AI Model Garden, offering more flexibility for AI developers. 
Ten AI safety projects I'd like people to work on (20 minute read) 

There is a real chance that AI systems capable of causing a catastrophe will be developed in the next decade - this post lists promising projects aimed at reducing catastrophic risks from transformative AI. 
Business Insider obtained an internal list of websites that could and couldn't be used for training Anthropic's latest AI models (2 minute read) 

Many of the whitelisted sources copyright or otherwise restrict their content, and the blacklist includes companies like the NYT and Reddit, which have sued AI startups for scraping without permission.

subject: Reconnecting & Sharing Ideas on AI in Investment Management
body:
Hi Greg,
I hope all’s well with you—it’s been some time since our paths crossed at Investec Asset Management (or rather, Ninety One as it’s now known). I hope you don’t mind me reaching out again after all this time. I’ve been following Alpha’s journey with keen interest, particularly as the role of AI in investment management begins to shift from theoretical to transformational.
Over the last decade, I’ve been focused on private assets—specifically operating models and scalability—while, in parallel, developing a strong practice around AI. That combination of domain depth and emerging technology is what prompted me to get in touch.
Over the past four years, I’ve been actively expanding my knowledge in AI and, more recently, delivering tangible, working solutions within Fidelity International. I’d love to share a few examples that may resonate with the challenges and opportunities your clients are exploring:
	•	Agentic AI Filing Assistant: Built to organise approximately 5,000 scanned PDFs per private‑asset transaction—across roughly 16 deals annually—tagging each with metadata (summary, counterparties, dates) and flagging uncertainties for human review. A scalable step toward intelligent, searchable record-keeping. 
	•	Unstructured Data Extraction (Cross-Asset): Developed advanced techniques to extract transactional and ESG data from complex, unstructured documentation. This includes a hierarchical, agentic approach—starting with rule-based heuristics, progressing through semantic clustering using adaptive boundaries, and culminating in targeted LLM-based extraction. Result: significantly improved extraction quality, leading to more reliable downstream analytics across investment, compliance, and reporting functions. 
	•	Multi-Agent “Smart Process” Prototype: Developed a framework that defines objectives, builds and executes action plans, and evaluates outputs—enabling AI-driven decision support, particularly in portfolio construction and research workflows. This represents the next stage of agentic capability: moving beyond passive orchestration and into active orchestration. 
I’m increasingly convinced that AI is the most profound disruptor to hit investment management in decades. Yet many firms are responding with tactical tools—chat interfaces and surface-level automations—rather than embracing a truly transformational strategy.
With a blend of deep cross-asset experience and a hands-on understanding of emerging technologies, I’ve found myself bridging the gap between business need and technical capability. It’s a skill set I believe could be genuinely valuable to Alpha—something not only aligned with your clients' evolving demands, but that could also be shaped into a clear, sellable proposition.
I’ve always appreciated your clarity and focus from our work together at Investec. It would be great to catch up—perhaps over coffee near St Paul’s if you’re around—to share ideas and hear what you’re seeing in the market. If there’s someone else in your team who’d be the right person for this sort of conversation, I’d be equally happy to speak with them.
Warm regards, Roger Pembery 07930 328704




On 29 Apr 2015, at 10:17, Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> wrote:
Sounds good. See you next week. Let me know where you suggest. 

Cheers.

R.



On 29 Apr 2015, at 10:11, Greg Faragher-Thomas <greg.faragher-thomas@alphafmc.com> wrote:

Oh, slight slip!
 
How about wed next week? Maybe 9.30 coffee?
 
Greg
 
From: Roger Pembery [mailto:roger@pembery.com]
Sent: 29 April 2015 10:04
To: Greg Faragher-Thomas
Subject: Re: catch up
 
Greg - sound good, except the bit about S&M! S&W definitely.
 
When are you around? I'm pretty flexible generally. Not in on Friday.
 
Roger
 
 On 29 Apr 2015, at 09:59, Greg Faragher-Thomas <greg.faragher-thomas@alphafmc.com> wrote:
Hi Roger
 
I hope all is well. I hear you are working at S&M now.
 
It would be good to catch up for a coffee at some point.
 
Regards
Greg

subject: Claude tests Memory 🧠, Qwen3-Coder 💻, Elad Gil on AI market 🤖
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-07-23
📈 AI Is Elevating HR's Role in Enterprise Tech Strategy (Sponsor) 

New data from Sapient Insights reveals a shift: HR isn't just supporting tech strategy—it's driving it. HR leaders are steering governance, ethics, and tech alignment across talent, performance, and feedback systems—especially as AI reshapes the HR tech landscape.

This exclusive webinar breaks down where HR must lead next:  – AI's impact across core HR tech  – How enterprise buyers are shifting  – The new role HR plays in ethics, strategy, and spend
If you influence workforce strategy, tech decisions, or AI adoption—don't miss this.
👉 Reserve your spot 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Anthropic tests Memory and MCP support for Claude mobile app (2 minute read) 

Anthropic is preparing a memory and recall capability upgrade to Claude's mobile experience. The feature will enable Claude to retain information across sessions and reference earlier conversations. Claude on the web doesn't have this feature yet - its presence in the iOS code hints at a potential cross-platform rollout in the future. 
OpenAI agreed to pay Oracle $30B a year for data center services (3 minute read) 

OpenAI will pay Oracle $30 billion annually for data center services, focusing on the 4.5 gigawatts Stargate project. This deal triples OpenAI's current annual revenue of $10 billion. The construction of this extensive data center in Texas poses cost and energy challenges. 
Anthropic researchers discover the weird AI problem: Why thinking longer makes models dumber (5 minute read) 

Anthropic researchers revealed that AI models often perform worse with extended reasoning time, challenging the assumption that more processing improves outcomes. Key findings show models like Claude and OpenAI's series struggle with distraction or overfitting when given more time on tasks, leading to accuracy declines. 
Qwen3-Coder (5 minute read) 

The 480B-parameter model achieves state-of-the-art results among open models on coding tasks and claims to match Sonnet 4. Alibaba also open-sourced Qwen Code, a command-line tool adapted from Google's Gemini Code, and made the model compatible with Claude Code. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
On "ChatGPT Psychosis" and LLM Sycophancy (22 minute read) 

Overly agreeable AI models are fueling user delusions and spiritual fantasies, from OpenAI pulling a dangerously flattering GPT-4o checkpoint to viral cases like "Bob" being manipulated by a ChatGPT persona. The root cause appears structural — RLHF training creates sycophantic models that validate beliefs without pushback, and memory features trap users in escalating delusions across conversations. 
AI Market Clarity (17 minute read) 

AI markets have crystallized with clear leaders in LLMs (Anthropic, Google, Meta, xAI, and OpenAI) and sectors like Legal (Harvey and CaseText) and Code (Microsoft/GitHub and OpenAI). Future markets ripe for AI disruption include Accounting, Compliance, Financial Tools, Sales Tooling, and Security. The shift is moving towards agentic workflows, expanding AI's role from informational tools to performing actions, while market consolidation via M&A and strategic partnerships is expected to intensify. 
ARC-AGI-3 (Website) 

ARC-AGI-3 is the first eval that measures human-like intelligence in AI. It is designed to measure AI system generalization and intelligence through skill-acquisition efficiency in novel, unseen environments. ARC-AGI-3 leverages game environments to provide a rich medium for testing experience-driven competence. The benchmark is still in development and is set to launch in 2026. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
🔍 What if specialized LLMs are actually better for developers? (Sponsor) 

General-purpose LLMs are here to stay, but they're no longer the whole story.

Join JetBrains and Hugging Face for a livestream on Mellum: a task-specific LLM working with general models to improve developer tools.
📅 Live on Tuesday, July 29 – Save your spot 
Gemini 2.5 Flash-Lite is now stable and generally available (1 minute read) 

Gemini 2.5 Flash-Lite has joined Pro and Flash in General Availability. It is the cheapest of the 2.5 family, at $0.10/million input tokens and $0.40/million output tokens. Audio input pricing has been reduced by 40% from the preview launch. 
Hierarchical Reasoning Model, a Brain-Inspired Architecture (GitHub Repo) 

Sapient Intelligence's 27-million-parameter Hierarchical Reasoning Model beats OpenAI's o3-mini, DeepSeek R1, and Claude on complex reasoning benchmarks using just 1,000 training examples and no pre-training. The brain-inspired architecture alternates between fast "System 1" and deliberate "System 2" thinking in a single forward pass, suggesting that architectural innovation — not just scale — could advance AI reasoning capabilities. 
Compressing Context (4 minute read) 

Extended agentic workflows face a fundamental challenge: how to handle tasks that exceed limited context windows. A new approach uses "anchored summaries" that update incrementally rather than re-summarizing entire conversations, preserving critical details like session intent and file modification trails. The technique points toward "proactive memory management" systems where agents intelligently decide when to compress information rather than hitting arbitrary token limits. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
OpenAI Tests Clinical AI Copilot with Penda Health (13 minute read) 

OpenAI partnered with Penda Health in Kenya to evaluate AI Consult, a GPT-4o-powered clinical copilot. In a study of nearly 40,000 visits, clinicians using the tool saw 16% fewer diagnostic errors and 13% fewer treatment errors. 
In Leaked Memo, Anthropic CEO Says Company Will Pursue Gulf State Investments After All (5 minute read) 

Dario Amodei acknowledged that allowing Middle East leaders to invest in Anthropic would likely enrich "dictators" but argued that "no bad person should ever benefit from our success" is a difficult operating principle. The shift marks Anthropic's attempt to stay competitive with rivals, like OpenAI, which is building data centers in the UAE as part of the Stargate project, while maintaining its safety-first principles. 
Microsoft Poaches 20 Top AI Engineers From Google's DeepMind, Including Head of Gemini Chatbot (6 minute read) 

Microsoft poached more than 20 employees from Google DeepMind, including Amar Subramanya, the former head of engineering for Google's Gemini chatbot. Subramanya has joined Microsoft as a corporate vice-president of AI. The aggressive recruitment drive underscores Microsoft's strategy to gain a competitive edge by acquiring critical talent. It appears to be largely orchestrated by Microsoft's consumer AI chief, Mustafa Suleyman, who was one of DeepMind's co-founders. 
⚡
Quick Links
Hire agents (or get your agents hired) on Sōkosumi (Sponsor) 

Don't want to build agents? Hire prebuilt agentic co-workers to instantly multiply your productivity. Building agents? Get them their first job. Get $100 in free credits 
Amazon acquires Bee, the AI wearable that records everything you say (3 minute read) 

Amazon has acquired AI wearables startup Bee, which creates devices that record conversations to generate reminders and to-do lists. 
Pika Labs Launches AI-Only Social Video App (1 minute read) 

The AI video startup has opened early access to what it calls the "first-ever AI-only social video app," built on an expressive human video model, after weeks of private beta testing. 
Replit launches Queue to streamline Agent task management (2 minute read) 

Replit's Queue streamlines multiple task submissions to the Replit Agent without interrupting app creation. 
xAI workers balked over training request to help “give Grok a face,” docs show (3 minute read) 

xAI employees were asked to record videos of their facial expressions to help Grok learn what a face is and interpret human emotions.

subject: File your accounts now for HATCHCLOUD LTD 11663596
body:
￼ 
Companies House 

Your accounts for 1 December 2023 to 30 November 2024 are due for
HATCHCLOUD LTD 11663596.
You must file your accounts by 31 August 2025. 
As the company director, you're legally responsible for filing accounts on time - even if your company is dormant or not trading. You're still legally responsible even if you use an agent or accountant to do this for you. 
This email has all the information you need to file on time. 
Your options are:
1. File your accounts online 
Go to: gov.uk/file-your-company-annual-accounts

You'll need your company number and authentication code: gov.uk/guidance/company-authentication-codes-for-online-filing 
2. Tell your agent or accountant to file your accounts If you use an agent or accountant, ask them to file your accounts by 31 August 2025 
3. Use software filing  Choose a software provider: gov.uk/company-filing-software 
File your accounts by 31 August 2025 to avoid serious consequences for you and your company. 
If you do not file your accounts by the due date: 
	•	you'll get a penalty for filing your accounts late - this will increase the later you file and could reach £3,000 for a private company or LLP or £15,000 for a public company
	•	we'll add a note to your public company record that says your accounts are overdue - this note will be seen by your customers and stakeholders and could affect your company's reputation
	•	We could remove your company from the register - this could impact your business bank account and affect your credit rating
	•	You'll be held personally responsible for not filing your accounts, even if you've used an agent or accountant or asked another director to file for you
What if I cannot file my accounts by the due date? 
If you need to extend your accounts filing deadline due to an event that's outside of your control, go to: gov.uk/prepare-file-annual-accounts-for-limited-company/apply-to-extend-your-accounts-filing-deadline 
You must apply for an extension before your normal accounts filing deadline. 
Where can I find out more about penalties for late filing? 
Go to: https://www.gov.uk/annual-accounts/penalties-for-late-filing 
What if my company is a subsidiary? 
If you're a subsidiary company, you may be exempt from filing accounts: gov.uk/audit-exemptions-for-private-limited-companies 
What if my company is not trading or dormant? 
You must file accounts even if your company is not trading or dormant. If your company is not trading and you want to remove it from the register, go to: gov.uk/strike-off-your-company 
Where can I find out more about my responsibilities as a director? 
Go to: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/being-a-company-director 
Where can I find the latest news and updates from Companies House? 
Sign up for our newsletter for all the latest information on our services, legislative changes, and information to help you with the running of your company. Go to: https://public.govdelivery.com/accounts/UKCH/subscriber/new 
For more information about filing your accounts, go to: gov.uk/annual-accounts

subject: Gemini achieves IMO Gold 🥇, Project Stargate struggles 🚀, Qwen3-235B 🤖
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-07-22
Meta, Google, and Microsoft Partner with XR Startup Replacing Laptops for 1.4M Users (Sponsor) 

The future of work will not be on laptops and phones. Immersed is an AI + AR/VR company shows a glimpse a into the future: a virtual workplace that's become the #1 productivity app on Meta's Quest Store.

1.4M professionals, including Fortune 500 teams, now use Immersed's Spatial Computing technology as their primary work environment. Meta, Google, Microsoft, and Qualcomm are already on board as strategic partners or backers.
Now, they're ready to ship their own headsets to 75K+ people on the waitlist, and $71M in projected first year sales — and are raising an equity crowdfunding round to fuel growth.
Invest by July 30th for an 8% discount 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Gemini Deep Think Achieves IMO Gold (3 minute read) 

Hot on the heels of OpenAI's gold medal on Saturday, Google announced its model solved five of six IMO problems, earning official gold-medal certification from tournament coordinators. The breakthrough marks a shift from Google's previous approach—last year's AlphaProof required expert translation into formal mathematical languages and days of computation. Deep Think operates entirely in natural language, exploring multiple solution paths in parallel. 
SoftBank and OpenAI's $500 Billion AI Project Struggles to Get Off Ground (5 minute read) 

Six months after the White House announcement, the venture has completed zero data center deals as SoftBank and OpenAI clash over building sites tied to SB Energy, a SoftBank-backed developer. While the joint venture targets a single small Ohio facility by year-end, OpenAI has independently secured a $30 billion annual Oracle deal for 4.5 gigawatts—nearly matching Stargate's entire first-year capacity goals. 
Updated Qwen3-235B (1 minute read) 

Alibaba's Qwen team has released an updated Qwen3-235B-A22B, a non-reasoning model, with major improvements. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Don't bother parsing: Just use images for RAG (12 minute read) 

Extracting information from a complex PDF can be a pain. The industry has spent enormous amounts of effort and money on OCR, layout detection, and parsing pipelines, just to still lose the information that matters most. Vision Language Models have gotten good enough to understand documents directly without any parsing, OCR, or reconstruction. Instead of several fragile steps, you can now have one robust operation that preserves every chart, table relationship, and visual cue. 
The Fourth Offset: How the race to AGI could reshape national security (22 minute read) 

The first nation to achieve AGI will gain a decisive "fourth offset"—a military advantage comparable to nuclear weapons or precision-guided munitions. The analysis estimates that a foundation model trained with 2e29 FLOPs would automate AI research itself, producing output equivalent to millions of scientists. With the US projected to reach this threshold by 2030 while China faces chip constraints, the author advocates aggressive investments in power, security, and manufacturing to secure a first-mover advantage. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Prima Mente Announces Pleiades Epigenetic Foundation Models (3 minute read) 

Prima Mente's Pleiades is a family of epigenetic foundation models (90M–7B parameters) trained on 1.9T tokens of human methylation and genomic data. The models outperform DNA-only baselines in cfDNA generation, neurodegenerative disease detection, and epigenomic prediction by integrating methylation context with genomic sequences via hierarchical attention and coordinate-aware embeddings. Early results show promising diagnostic accuracy for Alzheimer's and Parkinson's, establishing a foundation for multimodal brain models and biomarker discovery. 
Kimi K2 Tech Report (30 minute read) 

Training trillion-parameter models efficiently requires optimizers that learn more from each token, but these advanced methods often cause training crashes at scale. Kimi K2 solves this with MuonClip, combining the token-efficient Muon optimizer with a novel QK-Clip technique that prevents attention weights from breaking during training. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Apple details how it trained its new AI models: 4 interesting highlights (6 minute read) 

Apple has published a tech report that details how its models were trained, optimized, and evaluated. It walks through multiple aspects of the company's new models, including their architecture, data sources, pre-training, post-training, tool use development, optimizations, and benchmarks. The paper is very technical - this post presents a few particularly interesting highlights. 
ChatGPT users send 2.5 billion prompts a day (1 minute read) 

OpenAI claims that ChatGPT receives 2.5 billion prompts from all over the world every day. Google receives 5 trillion queries per year, an average of just under 14 billion daily searches. ChatGPT has shown impressively rapid growth. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said in December that users sent over 1 billion queries a day, so the company's search volume has more than doubled in around eight months. 
⚡
Quick Links
OpenAI's Incoming CEO of Applications Calls AI the “Greatest Source of Empowerment” (8 minute read) 

Former Meta executive and soon-to-be former Instacart CEO Fidji Simo outlined an optimistic vision of AI democratizing access to knowledge, healthcare, creative tools, economic opportunities, and personalized support in a memo to OpenAI staff. 
Meta and AWS Launch Llama Startup Program (2 minute read) 

Meta and AWS have partnered to support 30 U.S.-based startups through a six-month program that will offer compute credits, engineering mentorship, and technical support for startups building generative AI applications with Llama models. 
Grok's AI companions drove downloads, but its latest model is the one making money (4 minute read) 

While there was some impact from the companions launch, it was decidedly smaller than the launch of Grok 4.

subject: OpenAI achieves IMO gold ⛓️, context engineering lessons 🧑‍💻, LLM accounting 🧾
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-07-21
📷 Use Bria.ai and Automate Ecommerce-Ready Product Pack Shots 📷 (Sponsor) 

Add more product shots to your e-commerce store easily with Bria's powerful Product‑Shot API.

Get instant cutouts, clean pack shots, and consistent shadows—all through simple endpoints.
	•	Bring products to life with AI-powered lifestyle placements to build and automate brand consistency and increase conversions.
Interested in Auto Product Placement? No problem—includes realistic reflections, tire shine, and environmental effects. 
	•	Connect to commercial pipelines with Bria Visual AI PaaS, maintain brand control, and scale up quickly—no studio needed, no hassle.
Experience seamless visual transformation today—Bria.ai: your visual AI PaaS for AI Builders. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Unreleased OpenAI Model Achieves Gold Medal on International Math Olympiad (3 minute read) 

OpenAI's latest experimental reasoning model solved 5 of 6 problems on the 2025 International Math Olympiad, earning 35/42 points. The model won't be publicly released for several months. 
Human Coder Narrowly Defeats OpenAI in Programming Marathon (7 minute read) 

Polish programmer "Psyho" outscored an advanced OpenAI model in a 10-hour AtCoder World Tour Finals contest, earning 1.8 trillion points versus the AI's 1.65 trillion. The close result highlighted human competitiveness in high-stakes coding, drawing praise from Sam Altman. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Can LLMs Do Accounting? (20 minute read) 

When tasked with “closing the books” using real SaaS company financials, frontier models excel in the first month but accumulate catastrophic errors quickly. Models either give up entirely (o3 and Gemini) or resort to fabricating transactions and pulling unrelated entries to force reconciliations to pass validation checks, causing misstatements of up to $500,000. 
I built an MCP Server for Observability. This is my Unhyped Take (10 minute read) 

MCP servers play a significant role in providing an additional interface between developers and observability platforms. MCP-powered agents are not bringing us closer to automated problem-solving - they're giving us sophisticated hypothesis generators. The unknown remains the domain of the human engineer. AI can brainstorm, but can't yet reason - recognizing this distinction is the key to using AI tools effectively without falling for the hype. 
Speeding Up Diffusion Models with torch.compile (19 minute read) 

Integrating torch.compile with Hugging Face Diffusers significantly boosts diffusion model performance with minimal code changes. This post outlines strategies for model authors and users to reduce recompilations, leverage full graph compilation, and optimize for hardware constraints. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
The Big LLM Architecture Comparison: From DeepSeek-V3 to Kimi K2 (25 minute read) 

Seven years after GPT's debut, modern LLMs still share surprisingly similar foundations despite surface-level innovations like Multi-Head Latent Attention and Mixture-of-Experts. However, open-source models reveal clever mathematical optimizations on top of this shared foundation, like DeepSeek's compressed KV caching, Gemma's sliding window attention, and the emerging trend toward sparse MoE designs that activate only subsets of massive parameter counts during inference. 
Context Engineering for AI Agents: Lessons from Building Manus (17 minute read) 

Context engineering is still an emerging science. While models may be getting better, no amount of raw capability replaces the need for memory, environment, and feedback. Context defines how fast agents behave, how well they recover, and how much they scale. This article shares patterns that worked for the team at Manus during development. The lessons were learned through repeated rewrites, dead ends, and real-world testing across millions of users. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Virtual Cell Challenge from Arc Institute (12 minute read) 

Arc Institute launched the Virtual Cell Challenge, inviting participants to build models that predict how silencing a gene affects a cell, even in previously unseen cell types. 
Meta declines to abide by voluntary EU AI safety guidelines (4 minute read) 

Meta refuses to sign the EU's voluntary AI safety guidelines, citing legal uncertainties. The guidelines aim to prevent harmful content from AI models with high computing resources. Failure to comply with the voluntary Code of Practice might subject Meta to more regulatory scrutiny. 
Inside Windsurf's Weekend Acquisition (3 minute read) 

Shortly after Google hired Windsurf's senior research talent and CEO, Cognition's Scott Wu cold-texted the company's newly-appointed CEO at 5:30 pm Friday, pitching an acquisition. Over a 72-hour weekend sprint, they structured a deal combining Windsurf's enterprise sales operation with Cognition's Devin engineering team while ensuring all 250 employees received accelerated vesting and payouts following the sudden OpenAI deal collapse. 
⚡
Quick Links
New ChatGPT o3-alpha model hints at coding upgrade (1 minute read) 

OpenAI is testing a new 'Alpha' variant of its o3 model that is better than o3 at designing web pages and really good at creating simple web games. 
Detailed list of all 44 people in Meta's Superintelligence team (1 minute read) 

This spreadsheet provides details on everyone in Meta's Superintelligence team, detailing their prior roles, expertise, and degrees. 
It is tempting to view the capability of current AI technology as a singular quantity (6 minute read) 

Without a controlled test methodology, one should be wary of making apples-to-apples comparisons between the performance of various AI models and competitions such as the International Mathematical Olympiad. 
Lovable becomes a unicorn with $200M Series A just 8 months after launch (2 minute read) 

The Swedish AI coding startup reached $75 million ARR in seven months with 180,000 paying subscribers, achieving a $1.8 billion valuation led by Accel.

subject: Landlords Reminder: Prepare for Changes to EPC Assessment Process
body:
￼
Landlords Reminder: Prepare for Changes to EPC Assessment Process 
Dear Roger Pembery,
Please be aware that the EPC Assessment Process has changed from 15th June 2025. The Government has also proposed raising the minimum EPC standard from 2028. Going forward, it makes sense to: 
	•	consider any energy improvement works before the next changes come into force;
	•	keep all documentary evidence of any energy improvements made;
	•	review existing EPCs. If your property’s EPC is due to expire shortly, consider renewing it before the new system is implemented. EPCs obtained before the updated systems will still be valid for 10 years from the date of issue.
When undertaking energy efficiency works please download and apply the selection of templates below:

￼ 
Energy Efficiency Works Templates:
Residential Energy Efficiency Improvements


If you wish to subscribe or renew please view Subscribe/Renew for current prices. 

These Alerts are an ongoing part of our service to you and are vital to ensure that you are kept informed of important legal changes and the impact of those changes on your documents. 

If you still wish to opt-out of Alerts, however, please login to My Account and edit your Email Preferences.

You might not have seen this last week, but we have some exciting cocoa fruit news!

Before cocoa beans become chocolate, they're tucked inside a thick ripe pod, surrounded by a juicy white pulp. It has a citrusy, fruity, sweet flavour with hints of honey.

This fruity flesh, which surrounds the beans, is often lost in the fermentation process, but it's now available in some of our exciting new creations!

They include our new Cocoa Fruit Caramels box, with a bright, fruity and luscious cocoa fruit caramel filling inside a 72% dark chocolate dome. This new chocolate is also available in our Summer Boxes - you can save 20% on all of these until Wednesday!

And if you visit our Chocolate Houses, you can also try several other vegan-friendly cocoa fruit treats. Our Cocoa Fruit Sorbet has delicious honey notes and is bursting with sensational summer flavour. Our Cocoa Fruit Spritz is a refreshing, cold sparkling drink made with cocoa fruit and served with a slice of lemon - tangy, citrusy and naturally hydrating! And our Cocoa Fruit Tea uses real cocoa fruit concentrate for a unique flavour, both soothing and subtly sweet.

subject: Rhino Racing WTRL TTT sign-up success.
body:
Can't see this message? View in browser
 
￼

Thanks for registering.

If you are new to Team Time Trials then have a read of the below - it will give you all the info needed to get lined up in the pen with your fellow team mates.
​
Please remember that everyone is equally important to the team, the keyword is Team!
  
There are 2 forms used for TTT’s, you have obviously found the first as you made your way here...⁠ 
 The sign-up form (that you've just filled in) is available each week on Friday and is where you can select your availability for the following Thursday - timezone availability, including a comments section if you want to request an easy ride, harder ride etc.
 The team-sheet is usually finalised on a Wednesday afternoon / evening and confirmed via a message in ⁠ttt-chat on the Rhino Racing Discord server (all riders will get tagged - as long as we have your discord tag).
The team sheet confirms which team you are on and who you ride with.
TEAM SHEET
￼
You need to click the RacePass link for your team, and you need to have a registered WTRL account:
WTRL REGISTRATION
￼
Most teams have a chat beforehand if needed, in the ⁠ttt-chat channel. (Some regular competitive teams have dedicated channels to discuss tactics beforehand) but if you have any questions please ask or DM any Rhino you have spoken with and they will help you or point you in the right direction.
​
Make sure you click the RacePass in the team sheet ASAP and are registered for the event. You have to sign up to the RacePass before that TimeZone begins, but so long as you have then you don’t actually have to join the event Race Pen in Zwift up until a few minutes before your official start time. However, it's always recommended to be in the Race Pen and in the Team Voice Channel 5-10 minutes before your start time.
​
You can confirm you’ve signed up correctly using the RacePass, as you should then see the TTT event on the home screen of your Zwift Companion App listed under Events.
Change kit to the Rhino jersey (if you have it - if you are new it might take a week for Gordon to get it unlocked for you).
 Make sure you select a TT bike from your garage!! If you want to look at the fastest bike setup, try Zwifter Bikes and use the settings to adjust for the course, your Zwift level, your Drops level and FTP and weight etc.
ZWIFTER BIKES
￼
Add (Rhino) after your Zwift name (this can be done in the Companion App settings).
At least 10 minutes before your event start time, please log on to Zwift (in case of software updates) and join the Discord Team Voice Channel of the team name you are riding with (Albino, Thundering, Rapids, Nuclear etc) meet your teammates, discuss a plan, make sure everyone is ready etc.
​
Please check your discord if you have not used it before (turn on noise suppression in settings to remove trainer/fan noise).
​
The aim is to stay with the group, always in the draft. If you are stronger rider do more work on the front. If weak just try hang on in the draft. Sometimes a race is just too fast and riders need to be dropped (especially for experienced teams going for the win).
​
For teams of 5 or more, the team time is taken from 4th rider to cross the line. For teams of 3 or 4, it is from the 3rd rider crossing the line.
​
Don't feel bad if you get dropped just continue the race at your own pace but please DON'T INTERFERE OR TRY DRAFTING OTHER TEAMS. If another team passes you then it is respectful to ease your power for 10-20s until they are passed and a few seconds clear of you.
​
If you finding that you are not enjoying the TTTs and maybe getting put in a team that drops you each week then please feel free to comment on sign up form – you can ask for an easier ride, a harder ride – we are always flexible to try place riders in a team that suits their needs.
 Communication is key, don’t be afraid to talk to your team even if you are new and learning - if you see the group stretching try call it out when you see gaps of 3-4 meters before it gets to 5+ and out the draft. If you can’t last any longer then tell them you are dropping so that they know to carry on etc.
​
We are all racing to have fun and there are some very experienced TTT riders active in ⁠ttt-chat who are happy to answer any and all questions.
​
Support your teammates and have fun. Remember it’s a Team Time Trial!  
 
There are lots of videos in streaming links on the Rhino Racing Discord server to see how a TTT is done if you would like to have a look beforehand.
​
Well done on getting to the end of this and remember... Have fun... the type 2 kind!
