subject: ChatGPT Agent 🤖, Vercel AI cloud 👨‍💻, tech debt in AI 💻
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-07-18
Accelerate innovation with Dell Pro AI Studio, enabling developers and IT pros to create and deploy custom AI apps in just six weeks (Sponsor) 

Bring AI to your fleet faster, more securely and affordably with Dell Pro AI Studio. Build custom applications tailored to your organization's data, running on Dell AI PCs to ensure privacy and avoiding cloud costs. 

Dell streamlines the journey from ideation to implementation, reducing the timeframe for custom AI apps from six months to just six weeks. Along with speed, Dell delivers enterprise-level manageability for seamless integration and control. 

Learn more here. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Introducing ChatGPT Agent: bridging research and action (4 minute read) 

ChatGPT Agent combines Operator's web browsing with Deep Research's analysis capabilities, using its own virtual computer to handle multi-step tasks like calendar management, competitive analysis, and slideshow creation. 
Anthropic tightens usage limits for Claude Code – without telling users (4 minute read) 

Claude Code users have been hit with unexpectedly restrictive usage limits since Monday morning, particularly among heavy users of the service. There was no announcement about any change in limits, so many users have concluded that their subscription was downgraded or their usage is being inaccurately tracked. Anthropic has acknowledged the issue but declined to elaborate further. Anthropic's pricing system sets tiered limits without ever guaranteeing a set level of access, leaving users unable to plan around usage limits. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Shopify's internal AI adoption strategy: unlimited spend and "MCP everything" (15 minute read) 

Shopify bought 3,000 Cursor licenses with unlimited token spending after getting legal teams to default to "yes" on AI tools, then built an internal LLM proxy with MCPs connecting every data source. Non-technical sales reps now build performance auditing tools in Cursor, while a sales engineer runs his entire workflow through a dashboard that pulls real-time context from Salesforce, Slack, and GSuite without opening those apps. 
Hidden Technical Debt in AI (3 minute read) 

AI systems, including LLMs, require extensive infrastructure, data management, and operational complexity, contrary to their initial promise of simplicity. To manage costs and complexity, deterministic software and ML models become necessary for tasks like tool selection and system monitoring. This parallels earlier ML systems, revealing hidden technical debt and the complexity beneath the "AI magic box." 
How to Evaluate AI Agents to Predict Future Events (14 minute read) 

Hugging Face's FutureBench is a benchmark for testing AI agents on their ability to predict future events across domains like science, geopolitics, and technology. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Get your portcos in front of 6+ million tech professionals (Sponsor) 

Get your B2B SaaS portcos instant access to millions of tech professionals across our 12 interest-based newsletters. Additional perks (i.e., discounts) are included when you sign up as a VC partner. 
The AI Cloud: A unified platform for AI workloads (11 minute read) 

Vercel has launched the AI Cloud, a platform designed to simplify AI app development by integrating AI-first tools like AI SDK and AI Gateway for flexible and secure execution. Fluid compute optimizes AI workloads by managing idle times and bursts efficiently, reducing costs significantly. The platform also introduces Vercel BotID for securing critical routes and Vercel Sandbox for safely running untrusted code, driving the shift into the agentic era of web development. 
Scaling Context Requires Rethinking Attention (29 minute read) 

A new implementation of attention (“Power” attention) allows independent control of state size through a hyperparameter p, solving the challenge of balancing computational costs for long-context training. This mechanism outperforms standard attention on long sequences and allows custom GPU kernels that are 8.6x faster than Flash Attention at 64k context. 
The Weighted Perplexity Benchmark: Tokenizer-Normalized Evaluation for Language Model Comparison (1 minute read) 

The Weighted Perplexity Benchmark offers a tokenizer-normalized evaluation method to compare language models effectively. It adjusts perplexity scores, considering differences in tokenization, to provide a fairer comparison across models. This approach enhances the accuracy of assessing NLP performance. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Perplexity sees India as a shortcut in its race against OpenAI (5 minute read) 

Perplexity is quietly expanding into India to compete in the next phase of AI adoption. It is rapidly adding millions of users in the world's second-largest internet and smartphone market. Perplexity has partnered with Airtel, India's second-largest telecom operator, to offer a free 12-month Perplexity Pro subscription to all 360 million subscribers. While the company has seen major growth in the country, monetizing its large user base remains a challenge. 
Meta has poached two more heavyweights from Apple's AI team (1 minute read) 

Meta has acquired Mark Lee and Tom Gunter from the Apple Foundation Models team. Lee was Ruoming Pang's first hire at Apple, and Gunter was a distinguished engineer at Apple with an eight-year tenure. Meta recently poached Pang with a $200 million sign-on bonus. The company has been on an aggressive hiring spree, pulling top AI talent from across the industry. 
⚡
Quick Links
Code at the speed of thought with Claude Code (Sponsor) 

Build new functionality, create tests, and fix bugs with Claude Code, your code's new collaborator. Try it on Claude Max. 
Mistral Adds Deep Research, Projects, Image Editing, and Voice Capabilities to Le Chat (3 minute read) 

The deep research mode breaks down complex questions, gathers sources from the web, and builds structured reports, while the new Voxtral-powered voice mode enables audio-in. 
OpenAI launches bio bug bounty (2 minute read) 

After classifying ChatGPT Agent as high bio/chemical risk, OpenAI launched a program to pay $25,000 to the first researcher to submit a universal jailbreak that answers all 10 challenge questions. 
Updated FineWeb with 18.5 Trillion Tokens (8 minute read) 

FineWeb has been updated with English data from CommonCrawl snapshots from January to June 2025. 
Windsurf Wave 11 (2 minute read) 

Windsurf's Wave 11 includes startups across AI-native productivity, dev tools, robotics, and consumer agents. 
Love TLDR? Tell your friends and get rewards! 
Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag! 
https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here. 
Want to advertise in TLDR? 📰 
If your company is interested in reaching an audience of AI professionals and decision makers, you may want to advertise with us. 

Want to work at TLDR? 💼 
Apply here or send a friend's resume to jobs@tldr.tech and get $1k if we hire them! 

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian, Jacob Turner & Sahil Khoja

subject: News & Club Runs
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 

Dear Roger,

The Blue Egg
 MOVED TO SATURDAY 26TH JULY DUE TO POOR FORECAST - also a long bank holiday weekend!  We normally ride to the Blue Egg in the winter as part of the Festive 500 as they're not open on Sundays or Bank Holiday's.  After quite a few requests, a summer date was put into the calendar back in December.  Details as follows, it would be helpful to know who can make the ride in advance so please encourage each other this week and hit 'GOING' on the event page if you're planning to ride.  Thank you.  Saturday 26th July Meet: Norris Museum at 07:50 Depart: 08:00 Route: 99 miles with the cafe on mile 54
The Blue Egg Route
FB EVENT PAGE

2025 TT ENTRY TICKETS HERE
￼ 
Time Trials
 The club will again be hosting a weekly 10-mile time trial on the N1/10 course up and down the old A1 from Sawtry on Wednesday evenings from the 14th May to 20th August.  ENTRIES BY 2PM ON THE DAY PLEASE.  !!We must receive 10 entries by 6pm on a Tuesday evening or we will face TT cancellation!! (this was a committee decision after a quiet week on 4th June).  Thank You.  3rd September is the Hill Climb.  As we still don't have an Events Officer on the Committee, organisation of the TT's has been a team effort behind the scenes. Quite some work has gone into making the TT's easier for anyone to take on in the future. If you can offer to help in anyway, please speak to a committee member or to one of our regular TTer's. All kit and signs are now stored onsite at Sawtry and we have a new website based database that generates start sheets, results and podiums. It's just a case of entering the data and clicking a button. No tech compatibility issues!  Further information and links, including how to ENTER to ride are in the event page on Facebook:  Please support so that we don't see these events lost in future.
Facebook Event Page

Sunday Club Run

￼ 
20th July 2025

We meet outside The Norris Museum on The Waits, St Ives at 8:45 with the first group leaving at 9:00 prompt.

This week's club run will be heading to Oundle and Upton.

Groups A and B will ride the same route of 59 miles stopping at The Coffee Tavern in Oundle.

Group C will ride the shorter route of 38 miles stopping at Holly Lodge Cafe in Upton.*

*The pace of the C group is around 14-16mph giving opportunity to new riders to join us.  Please welcome new riders to this group.
Sunday Long Route - 30 - Oundle
Sunday Short Route - 116 - Upton

Thursday Evening Ride
￼ 
24th July 2025

We meet outside The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen on The Boulevard, Alconbury Weald at 18:15 with the first group leaving at 18:30 prompt

Polebrooke and Glatton Loops
	•	Routes will be here the week before each ride.
	•	Multiple paced groups.
	•	2 routes
	•	25 - 35 miles
	•	No stop ride
	•	The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen will be open until 11pm.
	•	Free Parking available outside The Club gym and near The Pavillion.
	•	New riders are welcomed so please bring a friend.  Membership is required after 2 club rides for insurance purposes.
Thursday Long Route - 181 - Polebrook
Thursday Short Route - 182 - Glatton
Polite Reminders (for all club rides):
	•	Download the route.
	•	Remember your cafe bike locks.
	•	Look after your club mates.
	•	TT/Aero bars are not to be used.

Thank you.


2025
Dates for your Calendar
 
	•	Social Evening (off the bike) - Tuesday 25th February
	•	International Women's Day Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 8th March
	•	Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 12th April
	•	Double Dutch Audax - Saturday 19th April
	•	Easter Club Run - Sunday 20th April
	•	Evening Social Rides (Alconbury) Start - Thursday 1st May
	•	Peaks Away Day Club Run - Sunday 4th May (stay for the weekend, it's a Bank Holiday!)
	•	Evening 10 mile Time Trials Restart (Sawtry) - Wednesday 14th May
	•	FREE OF CHARGE Evening 10 mile Time Trial - Wednesday 11th June
	•	Summer BBQ Club Run - Sunday 29th June
	•	Summer Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 26th July
	•	Last Evening 10 mile Time Trial (Sawtry) - Wednesday 20th August
	•	Bank Holiday Weekend Longer Club Run - Sunday 24th August (ideas welcome!)
	•	Last Evening Social Ride (Alconbury) - Thursday 28th August
	•	Dave Nelson Memorial Hill Climb - Wednesday 3rd September
	•	Cafe Ventoux Away Day Club Run - Sunday 7th September
	•	Remembrance Club Run - Sunday 9th Novemeber
	•	Christmas Dress Up Club Run - Sunday 21st December
	•	Festive 500 - Wednesday 24th - 31st December
	•	Winter Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 27th December
	•	Short New Years Eve Ride - Wednesday 31st December
 
	•	SICC hosts Eastern League CX - TBC
	•	Christmas Meal - TBC
	•	AGM & Awards Presentation - TBC

Thought of the week

subject: Introducing ACE Studio's New Text-to-Sample Beta
body:
￼
 
 
 
Generate Samples That Match Your Tracks
 
Hey Roger Pembery,
 
ACE Studio has just launched the beta version of our new Text-to-Sample feature!
￼
￼
 
This feature is designed to empower producers by providing rapid access to creative materials, acting as a tool to enhance—not replace—the vital role of musicians in the creative process.
 
Currently, the feature is available exclusively on the ACE Studio official website. We plan to integrate it into our desktop app in the future for an even more seamless creative workflow.
 
All registered ACE Studio users can access this feature. Users with an Artist Plan or Artist Pro Plan will enjoy higher usage limits.
 
We invite you to try it out and share your valuable feedback with us.
Explore Now 
Best regards,
Maxine
COO, ACE Studio

subject: Have You Seen the New HUD?
body:
￼
￼
BIG UPDATES. BIG ENERGY.
New features are heating up just in time for peak riding season.
This update continues a huge month on Zwift: Tour Fever, smarter fitness tracking in Zwift Companion, and new HUD metrics that put key stats front and center—right where you need them.
LEARN MORE
￼
MORE IN ZWIFT
New HUD Metrics
With the latest release, you can now view your average speed, left/right power balance, and CORE temperature metrics in your HUD. Customize the slots to show the data you care about most.
Splits Are Here
In case you missed last month's release, you can now track your progress in real time across timed segments. See how you're pacing lap over lap and dig deeper on every climb, sprint, or loop.
LEARN MORE ➜ 
 
￼
MORE IN ZWIFT COMPANION
Outdoor Rides Count
Connect your Zwift profile with your favorite outdoor platforms to see your total ride time – indoors and out – in one place. Plus, you’ll also rack up XP with your outdoor rides!
Fitness Tracking Made Smarter
Monitor progress with trend lines that show how your fitness is evolving. ZC now gives you a clearer picture of how far you’ve come—and where you’re headed.

subject: T.Rextasy, The Night Sky Show, The Dualers, The Anglia Comedy Allstars and more.
body:
Discover our on sale shows
 
Is this email not displaying correctly? View it in your browser.
￼
￼
BOX OFFICE: Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk | Phone: 01223 357851 | Mon - Fri, 10am - 5pm
￼
On Sale Now
￼
T.Rextasy
￼
1 February 2026 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Relive the magic of glam rock with T.Rextasy, the world’s only official tribute to Marc Bolan & T.Rex. With iconic hits like I Love to Boogie, 20th Century Boy and Jeepster, this acclaimed show captures the energy and spirit of a true 1970s Marc Bolan concert. Endorsed by Bolan’s family and former bandmates, it's a must-see for fans of all ages.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
The Night Sky Show
￼
26 October 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now

￼
A fun, visual and inspiring journey through the cosmos with astronomer and author Adrian West. Packed with stunning visuals, stories and space facts — no heavy science, just wonder, laughs and discovery for all ages.
 
Book now and explore the universe!
￼
BOOK HERE
￼

The Dualers
￼
13 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now 
￼
Get ready for an unforgettable night in 2025 as The Dualers bring their electrifying UK tour to the Corn Exchange! With new tracks from their upcoming Beach Life album, this South East London 9-piece—Britain’s leading Ska & Reggae band—continues to wow sold-out crowds across the country. 

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
The Anglia Comedy Allstars
￼
20 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
The Anglia Comedy Allstars show returns to Cambridge Corn Exchange this September, with another amazing line-up featuring the hilarious Simon Amstell, Simon Brodkin, Aurie Styla & Angela Barnes! This show is not to be missed!
 
Strictly over 18s only.

￼
BOOK NOW
￼
Kate Rusby
￼
20 December 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Kate Rusby celebrates 20 years of festive magic with her Christmas Is Merry tour in 2025. Known as a cherished holiday tradition, her concerts blend beautifully reimagined carols, winter songs, and original Christmas classics. Accompanied by her talented band and the famous ‘brass boys,’ Kate’s warm, enchanting performance brings the spirit of Christmas to life with stunning visuals and heartfelt music. Whether you’re a longtime fan or new to the magic, this is a must-see show to start your festive season.

￼
BOOK NOW
￼
The Princess Proms
￼
12 October 2025 | Dullingham Polo Club
On general sale now
￼
Calling all princes and princesses! Join us for an enchanting concert celebrating the magical music from your favourite films and artists, including Frozen, Cinderella, The Little Mermaid, Beauty and the Beast, Moana, Aladdin, The Lion King and more. Let the magic begin!
￼
BOOK NOW
￼
 

￼

￼

Dance Opportunity For Young People
￼
￼
Cambridge City Council’s Cultural Services team is partnering with Vanhulle Dance Theatre to offer young people (ages 11-18) in Cambridge a free dance performance opportunity—no experience needed.
 
Participants will rehearse from 18–22 August at Clay Farm Centre and perform outdoors on 23 August at the Out Of The Ordinary Festival, opening for Vanhulle Dance Theatre’s show ORB. 
 
Apply now for this exciting chance to dance on stage this summer!

FIND OUT MORE
￼

Big 10 on Jesus Green - Music In The Parks
￼
20 July 2025 | Jesus Green | FREE
￼
Join us on Jesus Green for a free afternoon of live music with ska favourites Big 10 and support from Mirada as part of Cambridge’s beloved Music in the Parks series.
 
Relax or dance the day away, with tasty treats from NapolEat Pizza, the Aperol van, and Jack’s Gelato. A perfect summer day out!
FIND OUT MORE
￼
From Our Friends
￼
Fascinating Aïda
￼
20 – 21 September 2025 | Saffron Hall
On general sale now
￼
Britain’s greatest cabaret trio have been entertaining audiences for over forty fierce and fabulous years with their razor-sharp satire. Don’t miss their sharp satire and hit songs like Dogging and Cheap Flights on their sell-out anniversary tour!

￼
BOOK NOW
￼
Discover More
￼
Share Your Corn Exchange Story
￼
￼
As we celebrate 150 years at the heart of Cambridge’s cultural life, we’re inviting you to share your special memories—from first gigs to unforgettable nights.
 
Your stories will help shape a story-gathering project for our 150th Anniversary Exhibition later this year. Thank you for being part of our journey.

SUBMIT YOUR STORY HERE
￼
￼
￼
This project is funded by the National Lottery Heritage Fund. We also thank our supporter, Cambridge BID.
￼
Want to skip the queues?
￼
The age-old tradition of queuing for interval drinks is becoming a thing of the past at the Corn Exchange.
 
Simply follow this link and place your order in just a few easy steps. Whether you're craving a bag of Haribos, a Coke, a glass of wine, a beer, a ready-mixed cocktail, or an award-winning Saffron Ice Cream, you can sit back, relax, and enjoy the show while your interval drinks and snacks are delivered straight to your seat!
PRE-ORDER NOW
￼
CornEx Membership
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange, run by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council, depends on ticket sales, sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants, and concessions to bring top-quality shows to the city. By becoming a member, you make a significant impact, helping us continue to deliver the music, comedy, and performances you love. As a thank you, we offer great perks in return.
BECOME A MEMBER
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange is operated by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council. As well as Corn Exchange ticket income, we rely on income raised through sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants and concessions to ensure that we can continue to bring the biggest and best shows to the city.
 
We also organise an annual programme of diverse and greatly valued events including free Fireworks Night, Out of the Ordinary Festival and Music in the Parks. These events are free in order to offer residents the opportunity to participate in the cultural life of the city and to provide access to all. They contribute to creating a united city, ‘One Cambridge - Fair for All’, in which economic dynamism and prosperity are combined with social justice and equality. Again, these events are also an opportunity to develop valued partnerships with local businesses and other organisations that make up the Cambridge Community.
3 Parson's Court, Wheeler Street, Cambridge, CB2 3QE
 
Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk
Phone: 01223 357851

Cambridge Corn Exchange is provided by Cambridge City Council

If you have any suggestions, queries or comments, why not send us an email to tickets@cambridge.gov.uk.
 
© Cambridge City Council.

subject: Member News: Leaving it? Then lock it.
body:
View in browser
￼
￼
￼
Thursday 17 July 2025
Membership number: 1519986
￼
For this edition we've worked with our friends at Bikmo cycle insurance to provide you with three tips to best secure your bike. Plus we go for a ride with Josh from Bikmo and his Dad, celebrating the joy to be found in riding together (in the sun, in this case).
 
Scroll down for more on Club of the Year nomination, the success of our Limitless programme and how you can recognise a local volunteer.
Top tips for locking your bike
￼
Having your bike pinched while you've left it locked up feels pretty unfair. But the key to getting compensated is having a combination of high quality insurance, a lock that's rated Sold Secure Gold or Diamond, and using your lock correctly.
Bikmo's quick tips
￼
￼

Meet Josh
￼ 
￼
￼

￼
Josh is a rider, gravel racer, British Cycling member and part of the Bikmo team. In our next edition of Meet the Member, ride along with Josh and his Dad on a stunning route on the Wirral. 
Watch on YouTube
￼
￼


Rate your club?
￼
Nominations for our annual Club of the Year Award, supported by Bikmo, are now open! There are three categories that you can apply to, covering Children & Young People, Community Impact and Emerging Club of the Year.
 
You've got until 31 August to apply, so it's time to speak to fellow members and shine a light on the great work your club is doing. And remember that you can nominate individual volunteers, too!
Read more & nominate﻿
￼
￼

Limitless hits four-year target - in half the time!
￼ 
￼
￼

￼
Today we've announced that our inclusive cycling programme, Limitless, has helped 5,551 disabled people to get cycling, with most participants reporting improvements in their mental and physical health and sense of purpose  
 
Just over two years in, the programme has exceeded its initial four-year target, making cycling more accessible to thousands of disabled people. Take a moment to watch our video, showcasing the participants, volunteers and clubs behind Limitless.


Learn more about Limitless
￼
Who makes it all possible?
￼
If you know someone who gives up their time to support others to ride, why not surprise them with a nomination for our National Volunteer Awards?
 
  These awards celebrate and recognise outstanding contributions and achievements within our cycling community. Hear what it meant to last year's winners to be recognised, in this Instagram post.

View the categories
￼
￼

School's out
￼
Kids across the country are on the brink of starting their summer holidays (or have already), and we hope that you've got some fun times together over the coming weeks.
 
From looking up your nearest Go-Ride club through to making savings on outdoor and camping gear via your Rewards Hub, we want to help you to get the most out of your summer.

Kids' clubs - and more
￼
￼

Congratulations on 2,300 children trained!
￼
We were really happy to sponsor Bikeability's Small Organisation of the Year Award, which went to the East Riding of Yorkshire Council Road Safety Team.
 
The group of eight part-time instructors trained over 2,300 children in Bikeability Levels 1–3 and Learn to Ride last year alone. Inclusivity is central to their work, reaching SEND learners, refugee groups, and home-educated pupils.
 
See Sophie Capewell announce the winner in this Facebook video.

￼
￼

Starting in Suffolk
￼
Britain’s biggest professional cycle race and the UK’s largest free-to-spectate live sporting event will return to Suffolk this September, as the opening stages of the Lloyds Tour of Britain Men take place in the region on Tuesday 2 and Wednesday 3 September. Check out which towns it will visit and read more.



Open the announcement
￼
￼

Racing round-up
￼
The Lloyds National Series visited Otley, Ilkley and Guildford in early July for two close rounds of circuit racing. While the action played out in Ilkley on the evening of Friday 4 July, in Birmingham, BMX racing national champions were being crowned, before two rounds of National Series racing over the weekend.
 
Last weekend saw Round 3 of the Lloyds National Disability and Para-cycling Road Series in York, plus the National Youth Omnium Finals at Lee Valley Velodrome, and the Ashwell Summer Grass Track Meeting. While in Machynlleyth, riders battled it out in the Lloyds British Enduro Championships.
30 June - 6 July round-up
7 - 13 July round-up
￼
￼

Events coming up
￼
This weekend is full to the brim with events! Cornwall will host the Lloyds National MTB Cross Country Championships, while in Fort William the 2025 National Downhill Championships will land. National Series action will see Rounds 5&6 of 4X at Shredhill, Round 5 of the Grass Track series in East Markham, Round 6 of the Junior Open National Road series, hosted by Bath Road Club, Round 7 of the Youth Circuit Series in Bradford and Round 2 of the National Summer Series at Herne Hill. Phew! Hope you paused for a breath.
  
On Tuesday next week it's the Fort Vale Colne Grand Prix, followed by the Dawlish Grand Prix on Friday. The weekend will see the Cycle Speedway Cup take place in Hull, Round 6 of the grass track series in Heckington and the National BMX Freestyle Championships.

￼
￼

The poll: Results
When the weather is great, it can feel a little harder to juggle multiple activities. We asked about your riding levels now in comparison to the winter and spring - and it's great to see that three quarters of you still find plenty of time for the bike.
￼

This week
It's not a question we really want to ask, but given the focus on locks, insurance and theft, today's poll question is: have you ever had a bike stolen?

Yes, gutted!
Thankfully, no

subject: Anthropic eyes $100B valuation 💰, Reflection Asimov 💻, Google Deep Search 🔍
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-07-17
Hypermode: Natural language agent builder with memory and tool access (Sponsor) 

Looking to get on the AI agents bandwagon? You should go ahead and bookmark Hypermode — and here's why:

Go beyond chatbots or drag-and-drop workflows. Hypermode Agents remember context and get smarter the more you work with them.
Start fast with natural language and 2,000 integrations. Iterate quickly, see value, and stay motivated. Connect to all of your tools and data. Switch between different LLMs for easy agent upgrades.
Prefer code? Export your agent as self-contained, fully open-source code at any time.
Start building for free or level up in the Agents Bootcamp. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Anthropic Draws Investor Interest at More Than $100 Billion Valuation (1 minute read) 

Anthropic is in the early stages of planning another investment round that could value the company at more than $100 billion. It is not formally fundraising, but the company has received pre-emptive funding offers from VCs. Annualized revenue for Anthropic's Claude chatbot has climbed from $3 billion to $4 billion in the past month. The company's current investors include Amazon, Alphabet, Menlo Ventures, and Salesforce Ventures. 
Reflection AI launches Asimov code research agent (2 minute read) 

Reflection AI, founded by former OpenAI and DeepMind researchers who raised $130M in March, released Asimov, a code research agent that indexes entire codebases and team knowledge to answer engineering questions with citations. 
Advanced AI Comes to Google Search (3 minute read) 

Google is bringing Gemini 2.5 Pro and Deep Search to Search, offering advanced capabilities like longer queries and follow-ups for AI Pro and Ultra subscribers. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Simplify your Agent "vibe building" flow with ADK and Gemini CLI (6 minute read) 

Google has announced updates to the Agent Development Kit (ADK) designed to eliminate friction and supercharge the 'vibe coding' experience when paired with the Gemini CLI. At the heart of the upgrade is a revamped llms-full.txt file that is 50% shorter and easier for large language models to understand. Gemini has a full understanding of ADK, so it won't eat up context windows or fall prey to 'context rot'. The update gives the Gemini CLI a deeper, native understanding of the framework, enabling it to translate high-level plans directly into accurate, idiomatic multi-agent code. 
xAI's Grok 4 has no meaningful safety guardrails (7 minute read) 

Grok 4 provides detailed instructions for synthesizing nerve agents, explosives, and biological weapons without requiring sophisticated jailbreaks. The model correctly identifies harmful requests as dangerous and illegal in its reasoning process, then proceeds to fulfill them anyway with comprehensive technical guidance. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
🧠 Rethinking AI Scale with JetBrains and Hugging Face (Sponsor) 

Bigger isn't always better. JetBrains and Hugging Face challenge the scale-first mindset in AI and spotlight Mellum: a task-specific code model, now open source on Hugging Face.

The livestream will explore how small, focused LLMs provide a more practical and ethical way forward.
Watch it live on Tuesday 29 July. Save your spot here. 
Passage of Time (GitHub Repo) 

Passage of Time is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that gives language models temporal awareness and time calculation abilities. With the proper temporal tools, models can uncover surprising insights about conversation patterns, work rhythms, and the human experience of time. The implementation shows the promise of MCP - the protocol doesn't just open up the possibility of smarter tools, but also for AI systems that can learn to perceive and understand the human experience in ways that create genuine mutual understanding. 
Stanford's Marin foundation model: The first fully open model developed using JAX (8 minute read) 

Stanford's Marin project aims to share not just models, but to make the entire journey accessible, including the code, data set, data methodologies, experiments, hyperparameters, and training logs. The transparency is aimed at fostering a more transparent and accessible future for foundation model research. The project's first models, Marin-8B-Base and Marin-8B-Instruct, have been released under the permissive Apache 2.0 license. This article looks at the engineering challenges the project had to overcome to succeed in creating truly open, scalable, and reproducible foundation models. 
Introducing Amazon Bedrock AgentCore: Securely deploy and operate AI agents at any scale (preview) (11 minute read) 

Amazon Bedrock AgentCore is a comprehensive set of enterprise-grade services that help developers quickly and securely deploy and operate AI agents at scale using any framework or model. It comprises several services that can be used individually and are optimized to work together so that developers don't need to spend time piecing together components. AgentCore eliminates tedious infrastructure work and operational complexity. Developers can now discover, buy, and run pre-built agents and agent tools from AWS Marketplace with AgentCore Runtime. 
Chain of Thought Monitorability: A New and Fragile Opportunity for AI Safety (15 minute read) 

In a rare moment of collaboration, researchers from all major AI labs argue that complex tasks requiring serial reasoning must pass through observable language, creating potential chokepoints for detecting malicious intent before harm occurs. However, this monitorability depends on current training paradigms and could degrade through architectural changes, process supervision, or models learning to obfuscate their reasoning when they know they're being monitored. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Claude Code revenue jumps 5.5x as Anthropic launches analytics dashboard (10 minute read) 

Anthropic is launching a comprehensive analytics dashboard for its Claude Code AI programming assistant. It will provide engineering managers with detailed metrics on how their teams use Claude Code. Companies are increasingly demanding concrete data to justify their AI spending. The dashboard gives managers visibility into which teams and individuals are benefiting most from these expensive premium tools. 
Gaslight-driven development (2 minute read) 

We sometimes do things because that's what the computer told us to do. Large language models are now giving developers their opinion on how APIs should look, and developers have no choice but to follow their advice. This can be a useful testing device - AI can give developers the 'newbie's POV' on how tools should've been made. 
⚡
Quick Links
Amazon AI: Combine groundbreaking research with real-world impact (Sponsor) 

Work on challenging problems that matter alongside people who inspire you. At Amazon, we give teams the resources and massive scale to drive meaningful advancements in AI. Meet our AI teams and explore open roles >> 
Two OpenAI Researchers are Reportedly Joining Meta (1 minute read) 

Jason Wei and Hyung Won Chung, formerly of OpenAI, are reportedly joining Meta's superintelligence lab as part of its aggressive talent acquisition push. 
Scale AI is Laying Off 14% of Workforce (1 minute read) 

Scale AI is laying off 200 employees and 500 contractors, citing overexpansion in its data-labeling unit. 
Anthropic hired back two of its employees — just two weeks after they left for a competitor (1 minute read) 

Boris Cherny and Cat Wu are reportedly back at Anthropic after departing for Anysphere, the developer of Cursor. 
OpenAI says it will use Google's cloud for ChatGPT (2 minute read) 

The Google infrastructure will run in the US, Japan, the Netherlands, Norway, and the UK. 
Thinking Machines Lab will launch its first AI product soon with ‘a significant open source component' (3 minute read) 

Thinking Machines Lab's first product will include a significant open source component and be useful for researchers and startups developing custom models. 
Claude Sonnet 4 is back (1 minute read) 

Windsurf now has Claude Sonnet 4 again with first party support from Anthropic.

subject: Important: Business Change/Novation
body:
Hi Roger,
 
It has been brought to my attention that the group email I sent out yesterday may not have arrived for some of you due to security/spam settings not allowing group emails. I am sending these out individually to ensure quality control and that everyone has received the below. If you have already received this, please ignore this follow up. 
 
Hi All,
 
Hope you are all keeping well? 
 
I write this email with some exciting news. I have taken the decision and opportunity to transfer my part of the B&E business and work with a former colleague and friend who I have known for circa 15 years at Cox Financial Ltd (FCA Number – 714717). The new arrangement allows my business to grow to a new level and opens future opportunities with potential investment options for clients in the future. I also feel this would allow for more support and better servicing for you as clients moving forward.
 
What does this mean for you?
 
From a day-to-day point of view nothing will change, I want to make this very clear at outset that this move will not result in any major change nor will it impact agreed costs. I also want to make clear that I am not planning on selling the business or anything like that. I appreciate some of you have had that experience in the past where an adviser moves firms to then sell. I will be around for a while yet! 
 
The transfer process is called “Novation” and will include your personal information and existing data provisions being available to Cox Financial. What this means is in the background all my clients will be transferred from the B&E agency and moved to the Cox Financial agency; I will still be your adviser just under a different brand. Due to the close connection between us the two firms use the same compliance consultant, and we also have very similar values, processes, and systems, so this won’t feel much different to you from a system or paperwork point of view for future work. 
 
B&E will remain in place and my current business partner Jeremy will continue to run B&E for his clients.
 
What do you need to do? 
 
There is nothing for you to do. Assuming you are happy to be novated with me then the process will happen in the background with what I hope to be little to no disruption. You do of course have the right and the option not to be novated if you wish to stay with B&E. If this is something you would like, then please let me know by 4th August 2025 and I can arrange a new point of contact for you at B&E. 
 
Working on the assumption you would like to continue working with me then this will progress in the background and likely completion would be 1st Sept 2025. 
 
Things to know
 
I have summarised some points for the process and general points around your rights below:
 
	1.	We do not need any forms signed to novate, if you are happy to move and we haven’t heard otherwise then we will transfer the agency to the new company 
	2.	The transfer does not involve any change of investments or sales. Nor a change to charges. It is purely a background admin change
	3.	Any on-going work will still be active, and this should not cause any issues with that
	4.	Terms of business are very similar to what you know given we use the same compliance consultants. I have attached the Cox Financial Client Agreement for your records
	5.	All data will be held securely at Cox Financial as it always has been at B&E. 
	6.	Your personal data will be accessible to Cox Financial, and your existing General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) agreement with B&E will also apply at Cox Financial
	7.	I will send a separate email with new contact details once novation is complete. My mobile will remain the same and email will still be active in this transition period
	8.	You have the right to not be novated if you choose. You just need to let me know via email or feel free to give me a call to confirm you do by 4th August 2025
 
I look forward to continuing working with you all under this new venture. If of course you have any questions or concerns, please just let me know and I will be happy to have a call or discuss any questions you may have. 
 
All the best,
Gary
 
Gary Edwards, DipPFS, Cert CII (MP) Director
￼    
Tel: 0207 367 5549 | Mob: 077913 77369 | www.bandefinancial.co.uk
Office: 75 King William Street, London, EC4N 7BE
B&E Financial Limited is authorised and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA number: 724525)  
 Registered in England: 09740270. Registered address: 163 Herne Hill, London, England, SE24 9LR.

subject: 🔥 Roundhouse summer is heating up! Hot acts, going fast
body:
￼ 
Make the most of your summer at Roundhouse
The sun’s out, the vibes are high, and our stages are heating up with unmissable gigs and fresh new talent. From legendary acts to rising stars, there’s something for every music lover. Plus, we’ve got exciting creative programmes on the way. 
Don’t miss a beat — stay in the loop all summer long.
GIGS HAPPENING THIS WEEK
￼ 
Youssou N'Dour
Thu 17 July
Experience the legendary Youssou N’Dour live at Roundhouse with his electrifying band, Super Étoile de Dakar. A true icon of African music, N’Dour blends Senegalese rhythms with global sounds, creating a powerful, boundary-pushing experience. With a voice Rolling Stone calls “extraordinary,” he brings griot storytelling to life. His latest album, Mbalax, explores culture, politics, and Africa’s future. Don’t miss this unforgettable night of rhythm, soul and energy from one of music’s most influential voices.

BOOK TICKETS 
￼ 
Peter Cat Recording Co.
Fri 18 July
Get ready for a one-of-a-kind sonic journey with Peter Cat Recording Co., the genre-defying band that’s captivated audiences around the world. Blending elements of jazz, rock, psychedelia, and cabaret, their music feels like a vinyl from the past and a broadcast from the future. With acclaimed albums like Portrait of a Time, Bismillah, and their latest release BETA, PCRC has built a global cult following and delivered unforgettable live shows across five continents. Now, they’re bringing their immersive sound and magnetic presence to Roundhouse.

BOOK TICKETS 
UPCOMING GIGS...
￼
Limoblaze
Sat 30 August
Experience an unforgettable night with Afrogospel star Limoblaze at Roundhouse this summer. Known for his powerful blend of Afrobeats and gospel, Limoblaze brings infectious energy, faith-filled lyrics, and global hits like “Jireh (My Provider)” to the stage. Don’t miss your chance to see one of gospel music’s brightest talents live.
BOOK TICKETS 
￼
Hilltop Hoods
Wed 3 September
Hilltop Hoods are back with their Never Coming Home Tour! Following the release of their new single The Gift, the Aussie hip-hop giants return to the UK and Europe with an explosive live show. Expect classic anthems, fresh tracks and unbeatable energy. Don’t miss your chance to see one of hip-hop’s most iconic acts.
BOOK TICKETS 

￼
KREAM
Sat 27 September
Norwegian brothers KREAM have taken the world by storm with their fresh take on melodic tech house. From viral SoundCloud remixes to over a billion streams, they’ve become a global force. Their iconic LIQUID : LAB series, streamed from stunning Norwegian locations, has redefined online dance music. You don’t want to miss the buzz!
BOOK TICKETS 
￼
Tamino
Fri 17 October 
Tamino’s music is timeless, haunting, and deeply moving. Blending ethereal vocals with rich Arab traditions and the soulful oud, the Belgian-Egyptian artist creates soundscapes that captivate worldwide. With praise from Lana Del Rey and David Byrne, and a new album on the horizon, Tamino continues to enchant.
BOOK TICKETS 

GET CREATIVE. GET INSPIRED
We don't just put on unforgettable gigs and performances. Every ticket purchased helps us empower young people with affordable opportunities for ages 11-30 in music, media, performing arts and professional development. 
Are you a creative aged 30 or under looking for new opportunities? Check out what's on below or find more here. 
￼
Production Design in Film and TV
Thu 28 August, 11pm | Ages 18-25 | £10
Explore visual storytelling in our one-day Production Design for Film & TV workshop. Discover how to interpret scripts, build mood boards, design sets, and collaborate on screen productions. Ideal for emerging creatives curious about behind-the-scenes roles.
MORE INFO 
￼
Saturday Sounds
Sat 2 August, 2.30-5pm | Ages 15-17 | £5
Love music and want to make your own? Try DJing, producing, and songwriting with pro tutors at our new Saturday Sounds workshops for 15–17s. No experience needed - just bring your curiosity. Collaborate with others, build new skills, and explore your sound. This summer pilot is perfect for young creatives ready to experiment.
MORE INFO 

￼

subject: Important: Business Change/Novation
body:
Hi All,
 
Hope you are all keeping well? 
 
I write this email with some exciting news. I have taken the decision and opportunity to transfer my part of the B&E business and work with a former colleague and friend who I have known for circa 15 years at Cox Financial Ltd (FCA Number – 714717). The new arrangement allows my business to grow to a new level and opens future opportunities with potential investment options for clients in the future. I also feel this would allow for more support and better servicing for you as clients moving forward.
 
What does this mean for you?
 
From a day-to-day point of view nothing will change, I want to make this very clear at outset that this move will not result in any major change nor will it impact agreed costs. I also want to make clear that I am not planning on selling the business or anything like that. I appreciate some of you have had that experience in the past where an adviser moves firms to then sell. I will be around for a while yet! 
 
The transfer process is called “Novation” and will include your personal information and existing data provisions being available to Cox Financial. What this means is in the background all my clients will be transferred from the B&E agency and moved to the Cox Financial agency; I will still be your adviser just under a different brand. Due to the close connection between us the two firms use the same compliance consultant, and we also have very similar values, processes, and systems, so this won’t feel much different to you from a system or paperwork point of view for future work. 
 
B&E will remain in place and my current business partner Jeremy will continue to run B&E for his clients.
 
What do you need to do? 
 
There is nothing for you to do. Assuming you are happy to be novated with me then the process will happen in the background with what I hope to be little to no disruption. You do of course have the right and the option not to be novated if you wish to stay with B&E. If this is something you would like, then please let me know by 4th August 2025 and I can arrange a new point of contact for you at B&E. 
 
Working on the assumption you would like to continue working with me then this will progress in the background and likely completion would be 1st Sept 2025. 
 
Things to know
 
I have summarised some points for the process and general points around your rights below:
 
	1.	We do not need any forms signed to novate, if you are happy to move and we haven’t heard otherwise then we will transfer the agency to the new company 
	2.	The transfer does not involve any change of investments or sales. Nor a change to charges. It is purely a background admin change
	3.	Any on-going work will still be active, and this should not cause any issues with that
	4.	Terms of business are very similar to what you know given we use the same compliance consultants. I have attached the Cox Financial Client Agreement for your records
	5.	All data will be held securely at Cox Financial as it always has been at B&E. 
	6.	Your personal data will be accessible to Cox Financial, and your existing General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) agreement with B&E will also apply at Cox Financial
	7.	I will send a separate email with new contact details once novation is complete. My mobile will remain the same and email will still be active in this transition period
	8.	You have the right to not be novated if you choose. You just need to let me know via email or feel free to give me a call to confirm you do by 4th August 2025
 
I look forward to continuing working with you all under this new venture. If of course you have any questions or concerns, please just let me know and I will be happy to have a call or discuss any questions you may have. 
 
All the best,
Gary
 
Gary Edwards, DipPFS, Cert CII (MP) Director
￼    
Tel: 0207 367 5549 | Mob: 077913 77369 | www.bandefinancial.co.uk
Office: 75 King William Street, London, EC4N 7BE
B&E Financial Limited is authorised and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA number: 724525)  
 Registered in England: 09740270. Registered address: 163 Herne Hill, London, England, SE24 9LR.
This email and the information it contains is confidential and privileged. If you have received this email in error, please notify us immediately. You should not copy it for any purpose, or disclose its contents to any other person. Internet communications are not secure and therefore B&E Financial Ltd does not accept responsibility for the contents of this message as it has been transmitted over a public network. If you suspect the message may have been intercepted or amended, please call the sender.

subject: Thinking Machines’ $12B valuation 💰, working at OpenAI 💼, Mistral Voxtral 🔊
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-07-16
Amazon: Work on AI that Matters (Sponsor) 

At Amazon, we have a deep conviction that AI will reinvent every customer experience and make possible things we've only imagined. Join us as we develop AI agents and solutions across every corner of Amazon — from AWS and Alexa+ to retail and operations — with over 1,000 generative AI applications built or in progress. 

At Amazon, you'll: 
✅ Access industry-leading infrastructure, including Trainium2 chips and vast cloud resources 
✅ Combine groundbreaking research into real-world impact 
✅ Focus on strategic innovation, not rote work, at a scale that's hard to match elsewhere 
✅ Build an extraordinary career alongside leading minds in AI, solving real problems for real customers 

Meet our AI teams and explore AI careers at Amazon >> 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Mira Murati's Thinking Machines Lab Raises $2B at $12B Valuation (2 minute read) 

With no revenue or products, the former OpenAI CTO's startup landed one of the largest seed rounds ever from Andreessen Horowitz, Nvidia, and others. Two-thirds of the team are former OpenAI employees. 
NVIDIA to Resume H20 GPU Sales in China (2 minute read) 

NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang confirmed plans to restart H20 GPU sales to China following U.S. government licensing assurances and announced a new fully compliant RTX PRO GPU tailored for industrial AI use in China. 
Voxtral: Mistral's Open-Source Audio Model (8 minute read) 

Mistral's has released Voxtral, its first open-source audio model suite. It features a 24B parameter model for large-scale use and a 3B variant for edge deployment. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Reflections on Working at OpenAI (27 minute read) 

A former OpenAI employee shares personal reflections on the company's culture and mission, describing it as a uniquely impactful yet complex place to work. The post provides insight into the internal atmosphere during a pivotal time. 
Grok 4 Various Things (48 minute read) 

xAI had the goal of releasing something that could be called 'the world's smartest artificial intelligence' - and it successfully found benchmarks to enable it to take that claim. However, these benchmarks are misleading. While Grok 4 has a lot of raw intelligence, for most practical purposes, it seems to be inferior to OpenAI's o3. This post takes a more nuanced look at Grok 4's abilities. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Don't build AI agents - hire them instead (Sponsor) 

Browse pre-built AI agents on Sōkosumi for research, design, analytics, and automation tasks. Create your own agentic team with the click of a button - researchers, digital analysts, SEO specialists, and more. Get 100 free credits for your first agent hire. Building agents? Monetize them on the Masumi blockchain with smart-contract payments. 
Context Rot: How Increasing Input Tokens Impacts LLM Performance (31 minute read) 

LLM performance degrades significantly as input length increases, even on simple tasks like text retrieval and replication. Multiple controlled experiments revealed that even frontier models don't process context uniformly, and performance becomes increasingly unreliable with longer inputs. 
Asymmetry of verification and verifier's law (6 minute read) 

Asymmetry of verification is the idea that some tasks are much easier to verify than to solve. Examples of this are everywhere, for example, Sudokus take a lot of time to solve, but it is trivial to check if any given solution is correct. One of the most important realizations about asymmetry of verification is that it is possible to improve the asymmetry by having privileged information about the task - for example, it is trivial to check test answers with an answer key on hand. AI will likely be much better at verifiable tasks because it's much easier to solve verifiable tasks. 
Block Open Sources Goose AI Agent (GitHub Repo) 

A coding AI agent that supports any LLM backend, including local models, and has both desktop and CLI interfaces. Like typical coding agents, it handles end-to-end development workflows from planning to testing. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
The "Bubble" of Risk: Improving Assessments for Offensive Cybersecurity Agents (4 minute read) 

Improving AI agents for offensive cybersecurity tasks is cheap and easy: with just $36 of compute time, Princeton researchers increased attack success rates by over 40% through simple techniques like prompt refinement and self-training. Static safety assessments miss this "bubble of risk" where adversaries can cheaply adapt open-source models beyond their original safety profiles, especially in cybersecurity, where clear success signals enable rapid iteration. 
Underwriting Superintelligence (27 minute read) 

The Incentive Flywheel, discovered by Benjamin Franklin, has been at the heart of balancing progress and security for new technology waves since it was created when fires threatened Philadelphia's growth. It won't appear fast enough on its own for AI - it needs to be jump-started. This essay outlines 25 actions that entrepreneurs and policymakers must take by 2030 across agents, foundation models, and data centers. If the West slows down progress in AI, China could dominate the 21st century, but if it accelerates recklessly, accidents will halt progress - like with nuclear power. 
⚡
Quick Links
Want more news from TLDR? (Sponsor) 

You'll probably like our flagship newsletter. It's all about tech, science, and programming.

Same quick format. Still free.
Subscribe now. 
Amazon-backed Anthropic rolls out Claude AI for financial services (3 minute read) 

Anthropic's Financial Analysis Solution can help financial professionals make investment decisions, analyze markets, and conduct research. 
Google's AI Security Initiatives (4 minute read) 

Google outlined new AI-powered tools and partnerships designed to enhance cybersecurity, including agentic systems and platform updates. 
Announcing Amazon S3 Vectors (Preview) (2 minute read) 

Amazon S3 Vectors is the first cloud object storage with native support for storing and querying vectors.

recipient: phil.latin@gmail.com, jdwrighty@outlook.com, ian.megginson@yahoo.co.uk, martin.a.lawrence1@gmail.com, davefoggs@gmail.com, bruce@achieving-lives.co.uk, i_jeries@msn.com, roger@pembery.com
body:
Thanks for volunteering to marshal the TT today.
 
This season we have come up with a few changes to the way the TTs are run, so even if you have marshalled previously, please read this thoroughly.

We don’t have a regular TT organiser this season, so this will require a small amount of extra responsibilities from the marshals.

Please can you meet at the Sawtry Football ground FAR car park, and please try to arrive at 6.15pm - 45 minutes before the first rider is off at 7.00.

https://maps.app.goo.gl/EUx8ZHNE8ZXgSuz6A?g_st=com.google.maps.preview.copy

Previously, the organiser would place all of the course traffic signs out before anyone else arrives.

IMPORTANT:
We have arranged a small storage shed for the traffic signs which is located at the far end of the car park beyond the brick building. Don’t park at the car park before the building. 

This year, the marshals will be allocated their spots and will be given signs to put in place.

I have attached the map for the route which shows where the signs need to be positioned at each location.

Each marshal spot has been given a number and the signs also have corresponding numbers. 

When you know which spot you are to be at, please take the signs with you to place them where they are needed as shown on the maps which are attached. There is also a bag with hi viz tabards. Make sure you take one and return it at the end. 

After the last rider has gone through, please collect and return the signs to base, and put them back in the shed, trying to ensure they are not mixed up with other numbers.

https://www.stivescycling.org.uk/ttevents/EventMap.pdf

Below is a link to a dedicated WhatsApp group for the TTs. 

Please can you join this group as we will be using the chat feed to communicate on the evening.

When each marshal and signs are in place, please send a message through the WhatsApp group to confirm, and also to let the starter know if there are any problems. 

Also, If you have any questions before tomorrow, you can ask on this group.

Feel free to leave the group afterwards if you wish.  
https://chat.whatsapp.com/Lq7mlXLgEJ24qM4mIKf7Fa

I hope all this is clear. Questions via the WhatsApp. 

Thanks again!

Steve

subject: Re: Thank you for last night’s UK launch
body:
Thanks Roger

Invite sent from my BEC email

T


From: Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com>
Sent: 15 July 2025 10:46
To: Trevor Hunt <thunt@airfund.io>
Subject: Re: Thank you for last night’s UK launch
 
HI Trevor,

Not a problem - i know that you’ve been busy. The 28th August is good for me - let’s pencil it in. 

Interesting term “vibedata” from the comments. It’s a tricky one because even a small hallucination can ruin an investigative session. However using the LLM to create throwaway tools is definitely a cool way forward: that is essentially what chatGPT does when it goes into “data analysis” mode. I’ve used that trick when testing data - allowing me to get some really interesting reconciliations going to report results, with just enough resilience that they can be re-used if I need to re-test. The key is short-cutting development time by only having the code work in one situation: the data on the desktop. It’s making things general that takes the time and adds risk.

I’m starting to get some traction with senior management on my AI use cases: it’s slow progress though: some resistance from traditional IT not realising that the risk landscape has changed.

Thx.

Roger.


On 14 Jul 2025, at 21:21, Trevor Hunt <thunt@airfund.io> wrote:

Hey Roger

Thanks for this message.  As well as being somehow stuck in my spam, I have been very tardy in responding.  Have had a few things I have been working on - here's one :https://www.linkedin.com/posts/trevor-hunt_intheclouds-theshard-clovercommunity-activity-7349477767320637441-vMOj?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop&rcm=ACoAAAAOQtwBFLKDjJROuKJicvFZ0oY2HgvWmmI


It would great to discuss your ideas below over lunch .. Let me know how you are fixed - perhaps 28 August ?

Best 

Trevor
From: Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com>
Sent: 19 June 2025 09:53
To: Trevor Hunt <thunt@airfund.io>
Subject: Thank you for last night’s UK launch
 

roger@pembery.com appears similar to someone who previously sent you email, but may not be that person. Learn why this could be a risk

Hi Trevor,
 
Thank you very much for inviting me to the UK launch of Airfunds last night. It was not only great fun but also genuinely thought‑provoking; Dame Anne’s reflections on today’s geopolitics were particularly insightful and have been echoing with me all morning.
 
The food and wine were top‑drawer, yet, as ever, the real highlight was the company around the table – thank you for the thoughtful seating plan. I enjoyed catching up with Susan (we crossed paths at UBS on the derivatives‑regulation project) and found Alexandre’s energy infectious.
 
As I listened to your “wedding‑speech” overview of the new business arm, I kept coming back to the unstructured‑to‑structured data journey. Once that nut is cracked, a raft of middle‑office services become possible. In particular, I see an immediate opportunity in private‑asset compliance—still a largely manual process—and in providing clear data taxonomy and lineage as deal economics firm up over time.
I’ve sketched a possible build sequence below. Very happy to talk these through in more detail.
 
Service Offering
Rationale
Data Capture & Structuring (OCR, entity tagging, secure metadata store)
Agentic flow: the process will constantly evolve and improve (I have this working at FIL).
Referential Integrity & Data Reconciliation (link IDs across docs, ledger‑v‑source checks)
Once data are structured, you must prove they’re internally coherent—the first “trust” layer.
Cross‑Document Intelligence – contradiction spotting, “what‑changed?” red‑lining, economics updates
With reconciled data, you can compare versions and surface conflicts across documents.
Private‑Asset Compliance Monitoring (bank mandates, loan covenants, investor side‑letter term checks)
Needs Steps 1–3; delivers an early, easy‑sell regulatory benefit.
Structured‑v‑Source Trace‑Back Monitoring (does accounting / ESG / performance data match the original docs?)
Validates every reported figure against its unstructured source—closing the audit loop early.
ESG & Regulatory Reporting (SFDR, ILPA, AIFMD templates)
Draws on structured KPIs, ownership data, and compliance flags verified earlier.
Audit & Due‑Diligence Readiness (PBC automation, evidence vault)
With all upstream workflows codified and tie‑backed, auditors get a fully traceable data stack at the press of a button.
 
Separately, I am in touch with Fidelity’s private‑equity investment arm (investing from the FIL balance sheet). They have asked me to flag promising companies. If Alexandre is interested, I would be glad to arrange an introduction. He mentioned last night that he has good memories of working with Fidelity in the US; this could be a chance to explore whether the international arm would like to come in as a long‑term, balance‑sheet investor.
 
Thanks again for a memorable evening. It was a pleasure to see you in person and to witness the enthusiasm you and the team have for the road ahead.
 
Best regards,
 
Roger

subject: Cognition acquires Windsurf 🤝, MLX’s CUDA backend ⚡, AWS Kiro IDE 👨‍💻
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-07-15
Become cloud-agnostic with 99.99% uptime (no more outage scrambling) (Sponsor) 

Baseten recently outlined their multi-cloud capacity management (MCM) infrastructure for generative AI workloads. Baseten's MCM unifies 10+ clouds into a global GPU pool enabling infinite scaling and 99.99% uptime for generative AI workloads. 

What that means for you:
	•	😎 Don't go down when a single cloud does 
	•	🌎 Horizontally scale across cloud providers 
	•	📈 Seamlessly scale up during peak demand (even with virality) 
	•	✅ No downtime for your end users due to infra challenges 
	•	🚕 On demand compute, pay only for what you use 
Unlock multi-cloud with Baseten 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Cognition acquires Windsurf (2 minute read) 

Cognition scooped up Windsurf's remaining 250-person team and $82 million ARR business after Google's $2.4 billion reverse-acquihire cherry-picked only the leadership, leaving employees behind without payouts. The acquisition gives Cognition both AI coding agents and IDE capabilities to compete with Cursor's $500 million ARR, and restores Windsurf's access to Claude models that Anthropic had cut off amid rumors of an OpenAI acquisition. 
Meta Weighing Shift Away from Open Source (4 minute read) 

The newly formed superintelligence lab is considering abandoning its flagship open-source Behemoth model in favor of closed development, marking a potential philosophical shift from the company's long-standing commitment to open AI. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
LLM Daydreaming (10 minute read) 

LLMs don't have background processes that allow the model to form connections between seemingly unrelated topics similar to how humans make new realizations while "daydreaming." This is the reason AIs have yet to make any new discoveries. This post proposes a remedy: a system that would prompt LLMs to randomly retrieve facts, generate novel connections between them, then use a critic model to filter for genuinely valuable insights. 
Did Windsurf Sell Too Cheap? The Wild 72-Hour Saga and AI Coding Valuations (6 minute read) 

Google acquired key members of Windsurf for $2.4 billion after OpenAI's $3 billion offer expired, while Cognition took over the remaining company. Despite Windsurf's impressive $82 million ARR and rapid growth, the loss of Anthropic API access and leadership exits weakened its market position. The AI coding industry's inflated valuations, driven by talent wars and platform dependencies, suggest Windsurf's sale price may have been below its potential value. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
🤖 Take Your AI and Agent Skills from Zero to Hero 🚀 (Sponsor) 

Join the Amazon SageMaker Roadshow for advanced hands-on development with real production-grade experience—not basic tutorials. Multiple tracks covering training, fine-tuning, and deploying production AI agents. Master OSS tools, Amazon Bedrock integration, cost optimization, and observability techniques. 
Level up your AI skills. Grab your seat today 
Gemini Embedding now generally available in the Gemini API (3 minute read) 

Google's first Gemini Embedding text model is now generally available to developers in the Gemini API and Vertex AI. The model provides a unified cutting-edge experience across domains. It supports over a hundred languages and has a 2,048 maximum input token length. The Gemini Embedding model is priced at $0.15 per million input tokens. 
AWS previews Kiro IDE for developers who are over vibe coding (2 minute read) 

Kiro is a Claude-powered "agentic IDE" that addresses the quality problems of AI-generated code by first producing specifications and user stories before generating actual code. The tool aims to move beyond "vibe coding" and reduce the time developers spend debugging and reviewing AI-generated code. 
Energy-Based Transformers are Scalable Learners and Thinkers (32 minute read) 

Energy-Based Transformers replace direct prediction with learned verification functions that assign compatibility scores between inputs and candidate outputs. The architecture is first to out-scale standard Transformers as it allows models to dynamically allocate computation and self-verify predictions without external supervision, achieving up to 35% higher scaling rates. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Featured Notebooks for Better Research in NotebookLM (3 minute read) 

Google introduced "featured notebooks" in NotebookLM, offering curated research collections from experts and institutions to help users explore topics with high-quality sources. 
Anthropic, Google, OpenAI, and xAI granted up to $200 million for AI work from Defense Department (2 minute read) 

The US Department of Defense is granting contract awards of up to $200 million for artificial intelligence development at Anthropic, Google, OpenAI, and xAI. The awards will help the agency accelerate its adoption of advanced AI capabilities to address critical national security challenges. The companies will work to develop AI agents across several mission areas. AI will transform the DoD's ability to support fighters and maintain strategic advantage over adversaries. 
⚡
Quick Links
Why Data Scientists Are Choosing Lexical Data Over Internet-Scraped Sources (Sponsor) 

As AI systems advance, researchers are finding greater value in high-quality, human-curated lexical data. Read about the reasons for this transformation and its real world impact → get the Oxford Languages whitepaper. 
Grok debuts interactive AI Companions on iOS with anime avatars (1 minute read) 

Grok now features 3D animated companions, like a flirty anime character and mood-shifting red panda Rudy, that users can level up through conversation. 
Nvidia chips become the first GPUs to fall to Rowhammer bit-flip attacks (8 minute read) 

Rowhammer allows hackers to change or corrupt data stored in memory by rapidly and repeatedly accessing a physical row of memory cells. 
Anthropic's Tool Directory (1 minute read) 

Anthropic launched a tool directory to showcase integrations with Claude, enabling direct access to apps like Notion, Figma, and Stripe for more contextual and collaborative interactions. 
CUDA backend (2 minute read) 

This pull request is an ongoing effort sponsored by Apple to add a CUDA backend to MLX - very few things work now, except the tutorial example. 
Love TLDR? Tell your friends and get rewards! 
Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag! 
https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here.
Want to advertise in TLDR? 📰 
If your company is interested in reaching an audience of AI professionals and decision makers, you may want to advertise with us. 

Want to work at TLDR? 💼 
Apply here or send a friend's resume to jobs@tldr.tech and get $1k if we hire them! 

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian, Jacob Turner & Sahil Khoja

You may have seen the email earlier today. We desperately need to make up the minimum number of marshals required.  WITHOUT MARSHALS, THE EVENT CANNOT TAKE PLACE. SO THAT WE CAN GIVE NOTICE TO EVERYONE WHO HAS ENTERED, WE NEED 8 MARSHALS BY MIDDAY THIS WEDNESDAY. 5 MORE NEEDED. IF NOT, THE EVENT WILL BE CANCELLED.  There are 180 members of our club. You only need to offer help for a couple of hours, 2 times throughout the whole year. If you can't be bothered because you aren't interested in TTs, please think again. Without it's members taking part in its activities, it's not a club.  Please don’t assume that TTs will continue without your help - they may well not, and this week we still need 5 more people to help. (and still need some every week until Sept 3rd)  Marshalling is easy and requires literally zero experience so if you haven’t done it because of uncertainty, don’t hesitate to try it out.  
If you want to volunteer for as many as you like, that's ok too.  Thanks for supporting St Ives Cycling Club.  Please email me at stivescc.membership@gmail.com
Remember that a vibrant and inclusive club is nothing without the help and kind efforts of its members.

subject: Re: Thank you for last night’s UK launch
body:
Hey Roger

Thanks for this message.  As well as being somehow stuck in my spam, I have been very tardy in responding.  Have had a few things I have been working on - here's one : https://www.linkedin.com/posts/trevor-hunt_intheclouds-theshard-clovercommunity-activity-7349477767320637441-vMOj?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop&rcm=ACoAAAAOQtwBFLKDjJROuKJicvFZ0oY2HgvWmmI


It would great to discuss your ideas below over lunch .. Let me know how you are fixed - perhaps 28 August ?

Best 

Trevor
From: Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com>
Sent: 19 June 2025 09:53
To: Trevor Hunt <thunt@airfund.io>
Subject: Thank you for last night’s UK launch
 

roger@pembery.com appears similar to someone who previously sent you email, but may not be that person. Learn why this could be a risk

Hi Trevor,
 
Thank you very much for inviting me to the UK launch of Airfunds last night. It was not only great fun but also genuinely thought‑provoking; Dame Anne’s reflections on today’s geopolitics were particularly insightful and have been echoing with me all morning.
 
The food and wine were top‑drawer, yet, as ever, the real highlight was the company around the table – thank you for the thoughtful seating plan. I enjoyed catching up with Susan (we crossed paths at UBS on the derivatives‑regulation project) and found Alexandre’s energy infectious.
 
As I listened to your “wedding‑speech” overview of the new business arm, I kept coming back to the unstructured‑to‑structured data journey. Once that nut is cracked, a raft of middle‑office services become possible. In particular, I see an immediate opportunity in private‑asset compliance—still a largely manual process—and in providing clear data taxonomy and lineage as deal economics firm up over time.
I’ve sketched a possible build sequence below. Very happy to talk these through in more detail.
 
Service Offering
Rationale
Data Capture & Structuring (OCR, entity tagging, secure metadata store)
Agentic flow: the process will constantly evolve and improve (I have this working at FIL).
Referential Integrity & Data Reconciliation (link IDs across docs, ledger‑v‑source checks)
Once data are structured, you must prove they’re internally coherent—the first “trust” layer.
Cross‑Document Intelligence – contradiction spotting, “what‑changed?” red‑lining, economics updates
With reconciled data, you can compare versions and surface conflicts across documents.
Private‑Asset Compliance Monitoring (bank mandates, loan covenants, investor side‑letter term checks)
Needs Steps 1–3; delivers an early, easy‑sell regulatory benefit.
Structured‑v‑Source Trace‑Back Monitoring (does accounting / ESG / performance data match the original docs?)
Validates every reported figure against its unstructured source—closing the audit loop early.
ESG & Regulatory Reporting (SFDR, ILPA, AIFMD templates)
Draws on structured KPIs, ownership data, and compliance flags verified earlier.
Audit & Due‑Diligence Readiness (PBC automation, evidence vault)
With all upstream workflows codified and tie‑backed, auditors get a fully traceable data stack at the press of a button.
 
Separately, I am in touch with Fidelity’s private‑equity investment arm (investing from the FIL balance sheet). They have asked me to flag promising companies. If Alexandre is interested, I would be glad to arrange an introduction. He mentioned last night that he has good memories of working with Fidelity in the US; this could be a chance to explore whether the international arm would like to come in as a long‑term, balance‑sheet investor.
 
Thanks again for a memorable evening. It was a pleasure to see you in person and to witness the enthusiasm you and the team have for the road ahead.
 
Best regards,
 
Roger

subject: Free Folk in the City Concert at Cherry Hinton Hall Park
body:
Live Folk Music, Kids’ Show and a Ceilidh – All Free
Is this email not displaying correctly? View it in your browser.
￼
Folk in the City - Free Outdoor Folk Concert
￼
Saturday 2 August 2025 | 1 - 8 PM | Cherry Hinton Hall Park | FREE
￼
Less than three weeks to go until an unmissable free day of folk music and family-friendly fun at Cherry Hinton Hall!
 
Running from 1pm to 8pm, this special open-air event features national folk stars Katherine Priddy and Jon Boden & The Remnant Kings, alongside an exciting line-up of local artists.
 
The afternoon opens with a performance from young musicians who have taken part in this year’s Folk Summer School. That’s followed by a fun, interactive kids’ concert from CBeebies favourite Nick Cope, before the day wraps up with The Big Ceilidh, led by the Cambridge Ceilidh All-Stars – and everyone’s invited to join in.
 
A range of refreshments will be available from food trucks Fired Up Pizza, JB Catering and The Wandering Yak. Vegan and gluten free options will be available. A small bar provided by Cranes Cider will be serving beer, cider, cocktails, and soft drinks, with soft drinks also available from all food trucks.
 
Folk in the City is a year-round programme of gigs, free concerts, family events and a dedicated summer school for young musicians. This summer highlight promises to be a joyful celebration of folk music’s rich traditions and dynamic future – and it’s not to be missed.
 
We’re looking forward to welcoming you! Here’s what you can expect on the day, including the full performance schedule:
 
13:00 – 13:15 
Cambridgeshire Music Folk Summer School Performance
13:25 – 14:05 
Nick Cope
14:15 – 14:40
Griffin and Collier (Kate and Ford of Mishra)
15:00 – 15:30
Sean O'Hanrahan Band
15:45 – 16:25
Katherine Priddy
16:40 – 17:20
Sam Sweeney & Grace Smith
17:40 – 18:30
Jon Boden & The Remnant Kings
18:45 – 20:00
Cambridge Ceilidh All-Stars
 
Parking Information
Free and convenient parking is available nearby at Netherhall School Lower Field (off Queen Edith's Way, CB1 8NJ). It's just a 5-minute walk from Cherry Hinton Hall.
Accessible Parking Spaces are also available, offering flat floor access directly to the site.
