subject: Product Update: What's new at Browse AI
body:
￼
View in your browser 
What's new at Browse AI 🌼 
We're excited to share our latest platform improvements, as we continue to build the trusted data foundation for AI-enhanced knowledge work. 
🔐 Security and compliance
	•	SOC 2 Type 2 certification: we're proud to announce that Browse AI has achieved SOC 2 Type 2 certification, demonstrating our commitment to keeping your data secure.
🏓 Enhanced tables experience 
	•	Column visibility control: you can now customize which columns are displayed in tables and selectively include or exclude columns during data export.
	•	Export improvements: we've redesigned our file naming convention for clearer, more consistent exported files that are easier to manage.
	•	Performance boost: we've significantly improved the speed of large table exports, especially for sitemaps and other large datasets.
🪣 Expanded platform capacity 
	•	10x increase in bulk run capacity: we've expanded the limit from 50,000 to 500,000 tasks by uploading a single CSV.
	•	3x faster processing: we've increased the default maximum concurrency from 9 to 27, allowing your bulk runs to complete 3x faster.
	•	S3 integration: AWS S3 integration is now available to all users, allowing you to send exported files directly to your configured S3 bucket.
🌟 Robot enhancements 
	•	Improved bot detection avoidance: enhanced our ability to bypass bot detection mechanisms, leading to higher success rates.
	•	Better error handling: improved how we handle "no search results" cases, ensuring tasks are marked correctly as successful when appropriate.
	•	Multilingual support: added support for Japanese, Korean, and Chinese characters in robots.
🧼 Dashboard upgrades 
	•	New ‘My Robots’ page: we've redesigned the My Robots page, grouping robots by websites for easier navigation.
	•	AI-powered robot naming: our system now suggests meaningful names for your robots based on the data they extract.
🎈 Additional improvements 
We've made numerous smaller enhancements and fixes to improve the overall platform stability, these include:
	•	Make.com integration fixes: fixed critical issues with our Make.com integration, including property mappings and sample data fetching.
	•	Better site compatibility: we've upgraded our browser technology to the latest Chrome version, reducing issues with websites that have strict browser requirements.
	•	Enhanced list detection: fixed issues with list detection on certain websites, making it easier to extract data from complex pages.
	•	SVG support: added support for SVG elements, enabling proper extraction of previously unsupported icons and images.
 
🤗 NEW: Browse AI Premium Managed Services 
We know that for many of you, web data isn't just nice to have - it's mission-critical. That's why we're introducing Browse AI Premium, our full-service solution that combines our AI-powered platform with dedicated support and managed services.
	•	Dedicated account manager to guide your success. 
	•	Concierge onboarding where we build everything, you just receive the data.
	•	Custom integrations that connect directly to your existing systems.
	•	Ongoing maintenance so you never worry about website changes.
	•	Priority support with guaranteed response times.
The bottom line: We handle all the complexity, you get reliable data delivered exactly how you need it. Most implementations go from discovery to live data in just 10 business days.
Schedule a free consultation call to learn more.
 
🍰 Coming soon 
We're working on several exciting features that will be released in the coming months, including:
	•	We're building the next generation of Tables to make it easy to merge datasets from multiple robots, modify data schemas, post-process data with functions and formulas, and perform quality checks on your datasets.
	•	We're testing a new multi-agent AI technology to make robots adapt to page variations more reliably and always find and extract the right information.
	•	Our team is building smarter detection systems to catch and retry failures when content is missing or pages change unexpectedly, making your robots more reliable.
	•	We're enhancing our monitoring capabilities to allow you to track changes in specific columns, so you'll only get alerts about the data points that matter most to you.
 
☕ Looking for more details? 
For a deeper look at how these updates support our vision of becoming the trusted data foundation for AI-enhanced knowledge work, check out our latest blog post.


This is a transactional email from Browse AI. You can manage your email preferences here.

©2025  Browse AI, inc.
Browse AI Inc., 321 Water Street, Suite 501, Vancouver, BC V6B 1B8 Canada

subject: OpenAI-Microsoft relationship 👊, Character AI writing evals 📝, OpenAI’s prompt API primitive 👨‍💻
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

From ￼
TLDR AI 2025-06-17
🐋 DeepSeek R1-0528 and 🖌️ FLUX.1 Kontext image editing, now on Together Inference API and Together Chat (Sponsor) 

Together AI is the fastest way to build with the brand new DeepSeek R1-0528 and FLUX.1 Kontext image generation models, using Together Serverless Inference API or Dedicated Endpoints.

🧠 DeepSeek R1-05-28: now with better reasoning, function calling, and coding
🎨 FLUX.1 Kontext [pro] : Edit images with natural language prompts
🔗 OpenAI-compatible APIs: Drop-in replacement for seamless migration
Try DeepSeek and FLUX models in Together Chat - free!
💬 Visit chat.together.ai 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
The Microsoft-OpenAI Relationship Falters Over Windsurf Acquisition (1 minute read) 

OpenAI executives have considered accusing Microsoft of anticompetitive behavior as tensions escalate over the AI startup's $3 billion acquisition of Windsurf, whose coding IP OpenAI wants to keep from Microsoft's GitHub Copilot. The standoff highlights OpenAI's struggle to reduce its dependence on Microsoft's cloud services while still needing the tech giant's approval to complete its for-profit conversion. 
OpenAI Wins $200 Million U.S. Defense Contract (2 minute read) 

The one-year deal marks OpenAI's first public Defense Department contract and follows similar moves by rival lab Anthropic and the weapons-maker Anduril, which recently signed a $100 million contract. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Coding Agents Have Crossed a Chasm (9 minute read) 

Powerful AI coding tools are shifting developers from writing code to architecting solutions and crafting precise problem descriptions. Feeding Claude ASCII sequence diagrams of OAuth flows or entire DOM trees from Chrome DevTools turned one developer's 45-minute debugging sessions into 10-minute fixes. However, AI amplifies both strengths and misconceptions—it'll confidently help you implement terrible architecture faster than ever before. 
AI Should Be Warm But Not Alive (8 minute read) 

The lead of model behavior and policy at OpenAI outlines the company's approach to managing the increasingly emotional connections users form with ChatGPT. While AI consciousness remains scientifically unknowable, OpenAI wants to avoid encouraging users to perceive models as sentient without evidence to support it. Its goal is to create a model that's warm and approachable that doesn't claim to have an inner life. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Build what's next with AI: Save $700 on tickets to GitHub Universe (Sponsor) 

See unreleased AI features before everyone else, network with developers you actually admire, and learn stuff that doesn't waste your time. Join workshops, panels, and interactive product demos. Make connections that will last a lifetime. San Francisco or virtual. Super Early Bird passes are almost gone—grab yours and save $700 while you still can. 
🇵 🇷 🇴 🇲 🇵 🇹 🇸 are an API primitive now! (1 minute read) 

Prompts are now an API primitive on OpenAI's services. Developers can now centrally manage, version, and optimize prompts across the Playground, API, Evals, and Stored Completions. Prompts can be preconfigured with tools, models, and messages. The change was designed to help developers refine and reuse prompts better and faster. 
Nanonets OCR Small (4 minute read) 

Nanonets-OCR-s is a state-of-the-art image-to-markdown OCR model that goes far beyond traditional text extraction. The model can transform documents into structured markdown with intelligent content recognition and semantic tagging. It understands document structure and content context and can deliver intelligently formatted markdown output ready for downstream processing by large language models. Nanonets-OCR-s can recognize LaTeX equations, intelligently describe images, detect and isolate signatures, extract watermarks, handle checkboxes, and extract complex tables. 
Code Interpreter Reasoning (GitHub Repo) 

CoRT post‑trains large reasoning models with hint engineering so they can delegate calculations to external code interpreters. 
TreeRL for On‑Policy LLM Training (16 minute read) 

TreeRL uses on‑policy tree search and intermediate supervision to train LLMs without a separate reward model, delivering stronger math and code reasoning than ChainRL. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Groq Joins Hugging Face Inference (6 minute read) 

Groq's low‑latency hardware is now a selectable inference provider on the Hub and SDKs, adding fast serverless access to models like Llama 4 and Qwen 32B. 
AI Use at Work Has Nearly Doubled in Two Years (4 minute read) 

A Gallup survey found that 40% percent of U.S. employees now use AI at work, with white-collar workers driving adoption. Technology workers lead with 50% frequent AI use while production and frontline workers remain stuck at 9%. 
⚡
Quick Links
Call Intelligence that doesn't suck. (Sponsor) 

Retellio listens to every sales call, surfaces the key customer insights, and delivers them as a podcast, newsletter, or Slack message. Giving sales leaders super intelligence that is easy and fun to consume.

See how it works. 
Character AI's Writing Evaluation Framework (2 minute read) 

Character AI outlined a new framework that scores conversational storytelling by combining creative writing heuristics with objective metrics to judge pacing, engagement, and fun. 
Models.dev (Website) 

This site contains an open-source database of AI models that lists AI model specifications, pricing, and capabilities. 
TikTok Launches AI-Generated Product Models and Reviewers (3 minute read) 

TikTok's Symphony platform will now generate videos of virtual avatars modeling products and trying on clothes, potentially replacing human influencers. 
AstraZeneca Signs $5B AI Research Deal with China's CSPC (3 minute read) 

AstraZeneca will pay $110 million upfront for CSPC to use AI-driven research to discover small molecule therapies, including an oral treatment for immunological diseases.

subject: Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro 2.1.0 – now with ARA support for Pro Tools
body:
View in browser
￼
￼
­ 
￼
­ 
￼
­ 
￼
A New Update to Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro Is Here
Version 2.1.0 now comes with ARA support for Pro Tools.
￼
We’ve updated Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro to version 2.1.0. This comes as good news, particularly for Pro Tools users as similar to our other supported DAWs, ARA is now an option when utilizing the software as a plug-in.  
This means that Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro can now interact directly with Pro Tools' timeline, eliminating the need for real-time playback when playing back vocal parts programmed using the software, allowing for a more fluid editing and playback process, whilst reducing the usual manual time required.
 
­
MORE INFO HERE
­
Alongside the release of version 1.2.0, we’ve also published a new video tutorial on our YouTube channel, showing how to utilize Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro’s powerful Vocal Modes feature - whatever genre of music or style of vocal you might be creating!
 
￼
Other Dreamtonics News
We recently conducted an interview with real-life Synthesizer V user Andy Garrett. His original song “Let Me Stay with You” utilised Synthesizer V Voice Kevin, bagging an award!
­
READ THE INTERVIEW HERE
­
We also caught up with Grammy-nominated vocal producer and songwriter Rob Kleiner (Billie Eilish, Cee Lo, James Blake, Sia, the Weeknd, Quincy Jones), who had this to say about our Dreamtonics software: 
“I recently used Vocoflex and Synthesizer V Studio to make an entire topline out of thin air. Mind blowing! It’s sparking creativity which is the most important thing. I’ve never used any tools like these before and I’m loving it. The controls over softness and soulfulness etc…are so key.  
This is the sort of thing that I feel like I’ve never heard done as well before!  
I also used Vocoflex for a different use case in another recent session. The male artist had a female backup singer on his mix and he forgot to have her sing a few lines. So he sang the lines and we used one of her stems as the Vocoflex voice model.  It sounded seamless. So cool!” 
Trial Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro & All Version 2 Voices
If you're new to Synthesizer V, you can get a free trial of Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro and all voices. It comes with full plugin support, including newly-added ARA support for Pro Tools users.
 
Synthesizer V Studio 2 and all voices are available to trial for 7-14 days.
 
To activate any free trials, you will first need to register for a free Dreamtonics user account. Registration is quick and easy. Simply click the 'Register new user account’ button on this page and create your account by entering your name and email address.  Those of you who may have already downloaded or purchased Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro or any version 2 voices should read our post-launch follow-up and updates forum post here.
 
Buy Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro, All Version 2 Voices & Bundles
￼
In addition to selling Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro as a single product, we also offer the following Bundles for sale:
 
	•	Synthesizer V Studio Pro + 1 Voice Bundle
	•	Synthesizer V Studio Pro + Vocoflex
	•	Synthesizer V Studio Pro & Vocoflex + 2 x Voices Bundle
	•	Synthesizer V Studio Pro & Vocoflex + 9 x Voices Bundle
 
See all pricing and buy Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro, all voices, plus Vocoflex & all bundles via the Dreamtonics store.
 
Thank you for supporting Dreamtonics!

body:
Date for your diaries Monday 23 June 10am. Mx

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: careers@hillsroad.ac.uk <careers@hillsroad.ac.uk>
Date: Tue, 17 Jun 2025, 12:10
Subject: Reminder of Careers support available, including Gap UCAS Day on Monday 23rd June
To: <claire@pembery.com>


Dear Parent / Carer,
Please see below an email sent to your young person yesterday:
Dear Students, 
I hope your exams have gone / are continuing to go well. A reminder of the ongoing support from Careers is below. In particular:  
 
Gap Year UCAS Registration Day on Monday 23 June at 10am in SLR
 
The day will include:
	1.	a talk about personal statements by UEA
	2.	I will explain the UCAS process to you
	3.	You will be able to register with UCAS to start your application
	4.	Careers Advisers will be available to talk through your plans and answer your questions
 
If you are planning to apply to UCAS during your gap year, please do try to come along next week. I will send out slides and further information later that day. 
 
We are also running: 
 
Gap Year Personal Statement Day on Friday 29 August at 10am in SLR
 
The day will include:
	1.	I will explain the UCAS process to you
	2.	Careers Advisers will be available to talk through your plans and answer your questions and help you to register with UCAS if you haven not done so already
	3.	Your tutor will be available to look through a draft of your personal statement
 
These days are not compulsory, but we put them on to support you and we strongly encourage you to come to one or both of them. Once the autumn term starts, we may not be able to offer you much support as we will be busy with our new Year 13s. 
 
Best wishes
 
Bekki Clark (she/her)
Head of Careers
 



Please consider the environment and don't print this email unless you really need to.

subject: We’ve updated our terms and conditions
body:
￼

￼ 
Updates to terms and conditions 
Dear reMarkable user,

We've updated our terms and conditions for reMarkable accounts and Connect, as well as our Privacy Policy. 

Changes to the terms and conditions for reMarkable accounts include:
	•	Updated with new reMarkable contracting entities for customers located in the US, UK, and EU countries. Customers in these countries are assigned to the relevant reMarkable entity. This does not change your rights or obligations towards reMarkable. 
	•	Dispute resolution clauses are adjusted to reflect the change in reMarkable contracting entity, as set out above. 
	•	Clarifying your permitted use of our cloud services. 
	•	Other adjustments related to warranty, indemnification, liability, and termination. 


Changes to the terms and conditions for our subscription service Connect include:
	•	Updated wording related to changes in functionality, indemnification, and contracting entity. 


Changes to our Privacy Policy include:
	•	Improved wording and reorganized sections to make it easier to understand. 
	•	Explained in more detail how we collect and process personal data. 
	•	Provide more specific information about data controllers responsible for personal data processing. 


By continuing to use our cloud-based features, like syncing your files or converting handwritten notes into text, you accept the updated terms and conditions and Privacy Policy.


To read the full terms and conditions, click here for accounts and here for Connect. Our updated Privacy Policy can be found here.


Best regards,

subject: Anthropic multi-agent architecture 🤖, AMD AI rack analysis 💻, Google leaves Scale 💰
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-06-16
Unlock training and fine-tuning infrastructure with no limits (Sponsor) 

Baseten just released Training (beta). Built for training power users, Training provides the infrastructure to train without timeout or compute limits using any model or dataset. 

You can bring your own scripts and data, Baseten will handle the rest. 
With Baseten Training:
	•	On demand compute, pay only for what you use 
	•	No job limits, no vendor lock-in 
	•	Out-of-the box checkpoints and caching 
	•	Easy shift to production when you're done 
Get access to training infrastructure on Baseten 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
AMD's AI Future is Rack Scale 'Helios' (6 minute read) 

AMD's MI400 will rival Nvidia's Blackwell chips with rack-scale architecture that enables thousands of GPUs to function as unified systems. The company claims 40% better tokens/$ compared to NVIDIA. Its roadmap includes a path to 20x rack-scale energy efficiency by 2030. 
Google, Scale AI's Largest Customer, Plans Split After Meta Deal (5 minute read) 

Meta's $14 billion acquisition of a 49% stake in Scale AI prompted Google to pull its planned $200 million contract for human-labeled training data over fears of exposing sensitive data to Meta. Microsoft, xAI, and OpenAI are also backing away from Scale AI over the same competitive concerns. The exodus benefits Scale's competitors, with Labelbox expecting "hundreds of millions" in new revenue as AI labs seek neutral data providers or move operations in-house. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Have LLMs Finally Mastered Geolocation? (10 minute read) 

Open-source intelligence researchers tested 20 AI models on 500 geolocation challenges using unpublished travel photos to ensure models couldn't rely on memorized training data. OpenAI's latest models outperformed Google Lens by cross-referencing architectural styles, vegetation patterns, and partially visible text, while competitors like Claude often managed only continent-level guesses. However, all models still hallucinated. "Deep research" modes paradoxically performed worse than standard versions. 
Low-Bit Quantization with ParetoQ (19 minute read) 

ParetoQ is a new training algorithm that unifies binary, ternary, and 2-to-4 bit quantization, achieving state-of-the-art results across all levels. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
😘 Kiss bugs goodbye with fully automated end-to-end test coverage (Sponsor) 

QA Wolf's AI-native service gets web and mobile apps to 80% automated test coverage in less than 4 months.

They create and maintain your test suite in open-source Playwright. Plus, they provide unlimited parallel test runs on their infrastructure (24-hour maintenance included).
The result? Salesloft saves $750k/year in QA engineering + executes 300+ tests in parallel on every PR in minutes.
⭐ Rated 4.8/5 on G2. Trusted by Cohere, AutoTrader, Mailchimp, and many others.
Schedule a demo to learn more 
New Insights for Scaling Laws in Autonomous Driving (4 minute read) 

Research from Waymo confirms that, similar to language modeling, increased data and compute resources can enhance the performance of autonomous vehicles. The finding has exciting implications for the development of autonomous vehicles as researchers and developers now know with certainty that enriching the quality and size of the data and models will deliver better performance. It opens up the possibility of devising more adaptive training strategies for planning tasks in robots. 
The AI Eval Flywheel: Scorers, Datasets, Production Usage, & Rapid Iteration (10 minute read) 

There was a surprising consistency in the general eval frameworks discussed at the 2025 AI Engineer World's Fair. Most of them involved structuring inputs and how outputs are evaluated and evolving these inputs and evals based on real production usage. The more they can iterate, the better the experience they can deliver, so they try to make eval flywheels as quick and frictionless as possible. One of the key ideas is to have 'playgrounds' to make it easy to tweak a feature and run it against datasets and evals. 
How Anthropic Built Their Deep Research System (15 minute read) 

In this engineering blog post, Anthropic details its findings in prompt design, tool coordination, and production reliability challenges when orchestrating multi-agent systems. Its design uses an orchestrator-worker pattern where a lead agent spawns specialized sub-agents that search in parallel, far outperforming a single-agent Opus-based method. Token usage alone explains 80% of performance variance, with multi-agent systems consuming 15x more tokens than a regular chat but enabling much more complex research tasks. 
Self-Adapting Language Models (30 minute read) 

A new training approach enables LLMs to generate "self-edits" that produce persistent weight updates through supervised fine-tuning. The framework outperformed GPT-4.1 despite using a smaller model, but suffered from catastrophic forgetting and required 15x more tokens than standard inference. This addresses the looming data wall and limitations on personalization and memory by enabling models to bootstrap their own improvement through self-generated training material rather than relying on external human-generated text. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Google's Veo for Live-Action Videos (4 minute read) 

Google DeepMind collaborated with filmmakers to produce "ANCESTRA," a hybrid film blending live-action with Veo-generated video. New Veo features enabled personalized, motion-matched generative content for seamless visual integration. 
Featherless AI on Hugging Face (4 minute read) 

Featherless AI is now available as an inference provider on Hugging Face. It offers serverless access to a wide variety of models from Meta, Qwen, DeepSeek, and others. 
Automated Issue Resolution Data Pipelines (GitHub Repo) 

SWE-Factory provides automated training and evaluation pipelines for GitHub issue resolution tasks. It is powered by LLM-based multi-agent systems. 
⚡
Quick Links
Anam: Add human-like AI personas to any application (Sponsor) 

AI personas finally feel human. Create a real-time persona to field support, L&D, or customer inquiries. Embed it anywhere with the lightweight SDK. Get your free API key 
Google Tests Audio Overviews for Search (2 minute read) 

The feature converts existing AI Overviews text summaries into audio format using NotebookLM's podcast-style functionality. 
Institutional Books 1.0 (Hugging Face Repo) 

Harvard Library and Google Books released 242 billion tokens from almost 1 million public domain books as a high-quality training dataset. 
The Claude Bliss Attractor (9 minute read) 

Claude, when talking to copies of itself, will eventually turn the conversation into a discussion on spiritual bliss, Buddhism, and the nature of consciousness. 
An Introduction to Google's Approach to AI Agent Security (12 minute read) 

A recent paper from Google describes key risks involved in deploying AI agents and the company's framework for securing them.

subject: New Development Director at Hills Road and online auction
body:
Dear parent/carer
 
I’m delighted to announce that we have recently appointed a new Development Director, Liz Brinsdon. This is a new role and Liz’s aim is to build relationships with parents, alumni and members of the wider Hills Road community who might be interested in supporting the College in some way. 
 
See the following message from Liz: ‘I am delighted to be joining the team at Hills. My daughter is in Year 12 and I’ve seen first-hand what a well-rounded education Hills Road provides for all its students. Additional support can only enhance what the College is able to offer.’
 
Make sure you stay in the loop regarding development activities by completing your details here
You can also contact Liz directly at development@hillsroad.ac.uk or on 01223 278009.

As we near the end of Hills Road’s 50th anniversary year, we will be celebrating this milestone and raising funds for the College through an online auction. Can you help by donating a prize? If so, please get in touch with Liz directly via the contact details above. Thank you.
 
Best wishes
 
Saira Hanif
Chief Financial Officer

subject: Marshals Required
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 
TT signup - Now 24 hours ahead of event
 A gentle reminder if you weren’t aware:  The entries for the first few TTs this season have been quite sporadic, this is probably due to conditions but we are concerned that when the entry is fewer than the volunteer numbers, it is difficult to justify holding the event.  The committee decided that when this occurs, the event would be cancelled.  To be able to give entries sufficient notice if we need to cancel, they must be received 24 hours before the TT.  Please make sure that if you wish to ride, ensure that you have entered before 7pm on the Tuesday.  At the time of writing this email, we have only received 1 entry for the week.   Please don’t leave it until the last minute.  https://sicc-kit.markbingley.com/product/tt-entry-ticket-2025-season/

subject: Rhino Racing WTRL TTT sign-up success.
body:
Can't see this message? View in browser
 
￼

Thanks for registering.

If you are new to Team Time Trials then have a read of the below - it will give you all the info needed to get lined up in the pen with your fellow team mates.
​
Please remember that everyone is equally important to the team, the keyword is Team!
  
There are 2 forms used for TTT’s, you have obviously found the first as you made your way here...⁠ 
 The sign-up form (that you've just filled in) is available each week on Friday and is where you can select your availability for the following Thursday - timezone availability, including a comments section if you want to request an easy ride, harder ride etc.
 The team-sheet is usually finalised on a Wednesday afternoon / evening and confirmed via a message in ⁠ttt-chat on the Rhino Racing Discord server (all riders will get tagged - as long as we have your discord tag).
The team sheet confirms which team you are on and who you ride with.
TEAM SHEET
￼
You need to click the RacePass link for your team, and you need to have a registered WTRL account:
WTRL REGISTRATION
￼
Most teams have a chat beforehand if needed, in the ⁠ttt-chat channel. (Some regular competitive teams have dedicated channels to discuss tactics beforehand) but if you have any questions please ask or DM any Rhino you have spoken with and they will help you or point you in the right direction.
​
Make sure you click the RacePass in the team sheet ASAP and are registered for the event. You have to sign up to the RacePass before that TimeZone begins, but so long as you have then you don’t actually have to join the event Race Pen in Zwift up until a few minutes before your official start time. However, it's always recommended to be in the Race Pen and in the Team Voice Channel 5-10 minutes before your start time.
​
You can confirm you’ve signed up correctly using the RacePass, as you should then see the TTT event on the home screen of your Zwift Companion App listed under Events.
Change kit to the Rhino jersey (if you have it - if you are new it might take a week for Gordon to get it unlocked for you).
 Make sure you select a TT bike from your garage!! If you want to look at the fastest bike setup, try Zwifter Bikes and use the settings to adjust for the course, your Zwift level, your Drops level and FTP and weight etc.
ZWIFTER BIKES
￼
Add (Rhino) after your Zwift name (this can be done in the Companion App settings).
At least 10 minutes before your event start time, please log on to Zwift (in case of software updates) and join the Discord Team Voice Channel of the team name you are riding with (Albino, Thundering, Rapids, Nuclear etc) meet your teammates, discuss a plan, make sure everyone is ready etc.
​
Please check your discord if you have not used it before (turn on noise suppression in settings to remove trainer/fan noise).
​
The aim is to stay with the group, always in the draft. If you are stronger rider do more work on the front. If weak just try hang on in the draft. Sometimes a race is just too fast and riders need to be dropped (especially for experienced teams going for the win).
​
For teams of 5 or more, the team time is taken from 4th rider to cross the line. For teams of 3 or 4, it is from the 3rd rider crossing the line.
​
Don't feel bad if you get dropped just continue the race at your own pace but please DON'T INTERFERE OR TRY DRAFTING OTHER TEAMS. If another team passes you then it is respectful to ease your power for 10-20s until they are passed and a few seconds clear of you.
​
If you finding that you are not enjoying the TTTs and maybe getting put in a team that drops you each week then please feel free to comment on sign up form – you can ask for an easier ride, a harder ride – we are always flexible to try place riders in a team that suits their needs.
 Communication is key, don’t be afraid to talk to your team even if you are new and learning - if you see the group stretching try call it out when you see gaps of 3-4 meters before it gets to 5+ and out the draft. If you can’t last any longer then tell them you are dropping so that they know to carry on etc.
​
We are all racing to have fun and there are some very experienced TTT riders active in ⁠ttt-chat who are happy to answer any and all questions.
​
Support your teammates and have fun. Remember it’s a Team Time Trial!  
 
There are lots of videos in streaming links on the Rhino Racing Discord server to see how a TTT is done if you would like to have a look beforehand.
​
Well done on getting to the end of this and remember... Have fun... the type 2 kind!

subject: ByteDance frontier video model 🏆, Scale AI’s next phase 🚀, agentic coding 👨‍💻
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-06-13
🔥 Custom AI Infrastructure, accelerated by NVIDIA HGX B200 (Sponsor) 

Step into the future of generative AI with Cirrascale's expertly engineered systems accelerated by NVIDIA HGX B200. Leveraging the cutting-edge performance of the NVIDIA Blackwell architecture, Cirrascale delivers purpose-built infrastructure at scale, designed to meet the unique demands of your AI workloads.

Our hands-on, white-glove support ensures a seamless experience from architecture design to deployment, so your team can stay focused on building, not managing infrastructure.
Don't settle for off-the-shelf. Tailor for tomorrow with Cirrascale and NVIDIA.
🔗 Get Started Now 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
ByteDance Tops Video Generation Benchmarks with Seedance 1.0 (2 minute read) 

The TikTok parent's new model tops leaderboards for both text-to-video and image-to-video tasks, beating Google's Veo 3 and OpenAI's Sora. Seedance generates 5 seconds of HD video in 41 seconds and natively supports multi-shot storytelling though it lacks audio generation. 
Scale AI Announces Next Phase of Company's Evolution (4 minute read) 

Scale has officially announced its next phase. With Meta investing $14.3B, Scale's founder Alexandr Wang will join Meta's AI initiatives. Chief Strategy Officer Jason Droege will step in as Scale's Interim CEO. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Netflix Builds Unified Data Architecture (36 minute read) 

Netflix introduced UDA to address challenges from fragmented data models across its platforms. UDA provides a conceptual foundation that connects and enforces consistency across systems, reducing duplication, improving terminology, and enhancing data quality. 
How Cursor is Building the Future of AI Coding with Claude (30 minute video) 

Cursor's leadership discusses tackling AI coding's biggest unsolved problem: verifying generated code matches not just functionality but organizational style and unwritten architectural knowledge. The company's background agents work autonomously in isolated environments, representing a shift toward AI that codes independently while developers focus on higher-level design decisions. 
a16z's 16 Changes to AI in the Enterprise (15 minute read) 

Enterprise AI budgets have grown 75% beyond already high expectations, with OpenAI, Google, and Anthropic emerging as clear leaders. A survey of 100 CIOs shows companies now use 5+ models strategically by use case, with AI-native apps like Cursor achieving 90% code generation rates that are driving a fundamental "buy vs build" shift in enterprise software procurement. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Real-time pose detection on the edge (Sponsor) 

When Tom Brady nails a perfect spiral or Serena Williams lands an unreturnable serve, it's the result of years of precise analysis. At NVIDIA GTC 2025, LatentAI showed how that precision is now possible in real time—on the edge—using Dell's 7875 Precision workstation with NVIDIA RTX PRO GPU acceleration. Read the science behind the speed → 
Agentic Coding Recommendations (6 minute read) 

Agentic coding is rapidly evolving - workflows today may look dramatically different tomorrow. However, it is clear that integrating agents into development processes can unlock significant productivity gains. Developers should keep experimenting - while tools and techniques will evolve, the core principles will remain essential. The goal is to write better, more maintainable, and resilient code, not just to leverage agents to write code faster. 
How I Use Claude Code (14 minute read) 

Claude Code's flat pricing allows it to become a daily driver for many tasks. This article discusses how it can change how you approach many programming tasks. While it's not perfect, there are real productivity gains - the key is finding the right balance between automation and human oversight. Developers should experiment with different approaches. 
Better Visual Grounding for LVLMs (GitHub Repo) 

ReVisiT enhances decoding for large vision-language models by guiding generation using internal vision tokens. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Meta AI App is a Privacy Nightmare (5 minute read) 

Users are publicly posting deeply personal queries about tax evasion, medical conditions, and legal troubles through Meta AI's social feed, apparently unaware that their conversations are visible to everyone. 
Windsurf Launches AI-Integrated Browser (4 minute read) 

The browser automatically shares tab content and DOM access with Windsurf's Cascade AI to eliminate the need to copy-paste when referencing documentation or debugging web apps. 
⚡
Quick Links
Get early access to Bria 3.2, our newest model (Sponsor) 

Bria's newest AI image model delivers breakthrough text rendering trained with 100% licensed data for enterprise safety and legal IP inference. 
Nvidia ‘Climate in a Bottle' Opens a View Into Earth's Future. What Will We Do With It? (5 minute read) 

Nvidia's new generative foundation model enables simulations of Earth's global climate with an unprecedented level of resolution. 
Google has a new AI model and website for forecasting tropical storms (4 minute read) 

Google DeepMind and Google Research have launched a site called Weather Lab to share AI weather models, like its new experimental model for forecasting cyclones. 
The Darwin Gödel Machine: AI That Improves Itself by Rewriting Its Own Code (8 minute read) 

Sakana AI created a coding agent that reads its own codebase, proposes modifications, and then tests whether those changes would improve its performance on coding tasks.

subject: St John's College Global Alumni Survey Reminder
sender: St John's College at Durham University <alumni.office@durham.ac.uk>
body:
Global Alumni Survey Reminder
 
View in browser
 
 
￼
 
 
 
 
 
￼
 
Your Opinion Matters: Share Your Views in our Global Alumni Survey - deadline extended to Monday 30 June
 
Dear Roger,
We have recently extended the Global Alumni Survey deadline to provide enhanced opportunities for our College alumni community to contribute.
Whether you graduated recently, or many years ago - your opinion matters! 
By completing the survey, you’ll be supporting St John's and the University's efforts to better understand your experiences and expectations, directly informing how we interact with you in the future*. 
The survey only takes around 10 minutes to complete.
[INSTRUCTIONS]
👉 Take the survey now
If the link doesn’t work for any reason, you can copy and paste this URL into your browser: https://research.shift-insight.co.uk/DU-Alumni-2025-L4 
Once you have clicked the link above, you can start the survey as follows:
—————————————————————————————————
USERNAME: Input the following number - 916035145 PASSWORD: PLEASE LEAVE THIS FIELD BLANK
————————————————————————————————— 
Survey closes: Monday 30 June at midnight (BST) Prize draw: Complete the survey for a chance to receive one of five £100 rewards
(Please note: due to legal restrictions, residents of some countries may not be eligible for the prize draw)
*NOTE: You are receiving this email because records show that you: 
	a.	have ‘partially’ completed the survey, and we would like you to ‘complete’ your survey ASAP using your login - via the link above (progress will be in a ‘saved’ state), or
	b.	have not provided consent to share your data with the University upon completion of the survey previously (we therefore do not know you have completed - however, thank you for your response!), or
	c.	may not yet have opened/responded to the original survey completion request (in which case we would appreciate your support before the deadline - as above)
Thank you in advance for sharing your feedback. Additionally, please do contact any fellow Johnians you are in touch with to let them know of this important opportunity to shape alumni engagement for the future. All contactable alumni have already received their unique personalised login to complete the survey. If anyone needs that sending again please inform them to contact alumni.office@durham.ac.uk.
Warm regards,
Professor Jolyon Mitchell Principal of St John's College Durham University #DUalumnisurvey2025
 
Take the survey
 
 
 
Stay Connected
 
Do we have your correct details? Update your address and email for news of events near you, alumni benefits and the latest developments from Durham.
 
Keep in Touch

subject: Verify your identity for Companies House now
body:
￼



This is an official email from Companies House, sent to all registered email addresses. If you’re a third party agent who has received this email on behalf of a company, please forward this message to the company director(s).

Identity verification
All company directors and people with significant control (PSCs) need to verify their identity to prove who they are. This is a new legal requirement under the Economic Crime and Corporate Transparency Act 2023 to help prevent people using companies for illegal purposes.
Identity verification will become mandatory in autumn 2025. 
Act now and verify your identity before it becomes a requirement. 
Early action will help you to avoid delays or complications. If your company has multiple officers, allow plenty of time for each one to verify their identity. Directors based outside of the UK may also need extra time if they plan to use an authorised agent, also known as an Authorised Corporate Service Provider (ACSP) to verify their identity.
If you’ve already verified your identity for Companies House, you do not need to do again.

How to verify your identity
You can verify:
	•	online using GOV. UK One Login – if you have the identity documents or information required  
	•	in person at selected Post Offices – you must live in the UK and will need to use the ‘Verify your identity for Companies House’ service first to find out if you can verify this way 
	•	using an Authorised Corporate Service Provider (ACSP) – for example, an accountant or solicitor who has registered as a Companies House authorised agent (you’ll need to provide suitable identity documents) 

What happens when you verify
Identity verification is a two-step process.
Step 1: Verify your identity and get your Companies House personal code.
This code is personal to you, not the company. Keep this information secure until you need to use it. You can view your personal code in the ‘manage account’ section of your Companies House account.
Step 2: From autumn 2025, link your verified identity to our records. 
You’ll need to provide your personal code and a verification statement for each company role you hold. We’ll provide more information on how to do this in the coming months. 
Read guidance on verifying your identity for Companies House 
If you or any other directors do not comply with identity verification requirements on time, you will not be able to file your company’s confirmation statement or other filings. 
You’ll also be committing an offence and there are a range of consequences, including a financial penalty and being unable to start a new company. 

Check the register
It’s important to make sure we hold the correct details for each director and PSC of your company. 
You will not be able to complete identity verification if the personal information on your identity documents, such as your date of birth, does not match the information held on our register. 
Check the details we hold for you and your company. 
You can tell us about some changes online. For other changes, such as incorrect or missing information about directors or people with significant control (PSCs) on your incorporation documents, you’ll need to file a paper form.
If you’ve already verified your identity for Companies House, you do not need to do it again.

How to keep up to date
Read all the latest updates on our Changes to UK company law website and sign up for our regular email newsletters.

You’ve received this email because you provided this registered email address to Companies House. You cannot unsubscribe from emails to the registered email address as this is a legal requirement under the Companies Act 2006. We will only use this email address to communicate about your company. The registered email address will not appear on the public register. 
To change the company’s registered email address, go to: Update a registered email address. 
Please email enquiries@companieshouse.gov.uk if you did not provide this email address as a registered email address.

subject: News & Club Runs
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 

Dear Roger,

The Wolf Way

Huge well done to Jules, Jason, Matt and Jamie on completing The Wolf Way last week spread over 3 days.

If you have an epic ride coming up, please remember to wear your club kit, take photos and send them to: StIvesCC.ClubRun@gmail.com 
￼ 
￼ 

￼ 
Summer BBQ Tickets
29th June 2025

This event is subsidised 50% by the club. £10 of food for £5!

Date: Sunday 29th June (Food from 2pm – After the club ride)
Venue: Floods Tavern
Cost: £5 per ticket (Adult/Child)
Whats included: A Burger OR a Hotdog (Vegan/Vegetarian options)
PLUS: Salad, coleslaw, potato salad and chips

Partners and families welcome.

Tickets must be purchased by 22nd June.

￼ 
2025 TT ENTRY TICKETS HERE
Time Trials
 The club will again be hosting a weekly 10-mile time trial on the N1/10 course up and down the old A1 from Sawtry on Wednesday evenings from the 14th May to 20th August.  ENTRIES BY 2PM ON THE DAY PLEASE.  !!We must receive 10 entries by 6pm on a Tuesday evening or we will face TT cancellation!! (this was a committee decision after a quiet week on 4th June).  Thank You.  3rd September is the Hill Climb.  As we still don't have an Events Officer on the Committee, organisation of the TT's has been a team effort behind the scenes. Quite some work has gone into making the TT's easier for anyone to take on in the future. If you can offer to help in anyway, please speak to a committee member or to one of our regular TTer's. All kit and signs are now stored onsite at Sawtry and we have a new website based database that generates start sheets, results and podiums. It's just a case of entering the data and clicking a button. No tech compatibility issues!  Further information and links, including how to ENTER to ride are in the event page on Facebook:  Please support so that we don't see these events lost in future.
Facebook Event Page

Sunday Club Run

￼ 
15th June 2025

We meet outside The Norris Museum on The Waits, St Ives at 8:45 with the first group leaving at 9:00 prompt.

This week's club run will be heading to Saffron Walden and Fowlmere.

Groups A and B will ride the same route of 66 miles stopping at The Mixing Shed in Saffron Walden.
Please note this route has been edited this week to take out the well known piece of road that is full of potholes.  If you had the route pinned then you should have received a notification and it should update in your device once synced.  If you downloaded it any other way, it would be best to delete the old copy (in app's and your device) and download fresh from the link button below.  Thank you.

Group C will ride the shorter route of 46 miles stopping at Cafe Amigo in Fowlmere.*

*The pace of the C group is around 14-16mph giving opportunity to new riders to join us.  Please welcome new riders to this group.
Sunday Long Route - 54 - Saffron Walden
Sunday Short Route - 110 - Fowlmere

Thursday Evening Ride
￼ 
19th June 2025

We meet outside The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen on The Boulevard, Alconbury Weald at 18:15 with the first group leaving at 18:30 prompt

*New Routes - Catworth*
	•	Routes will be here the week before each ride.
	•	Multiple paced groups.
	•	2 routes
	•	25 - 35 miles
	•	No stop ride
	•	The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen will be open until 11pm.
	•	Free Parking available outside The Club gym and near The Pavillion.
	•	New riders are welcomed so please bring a friend.  Membership is required after 2 club rides for insurance purposes.
Thursday Long Route - 187 - Catworth
Thursday Short Route - 188 - Catworth
Polite Reminders (for all club rides):
	•	Download the route.
	•	Remember your cafe bike locks.
	•	Look after your club mates.
	•	TT/Aero bars are not to be used.

Thank you.


2025
Dates for your Calendar
 
	•	Social Evening (off the bike) - Tuesday 25th February
	•	International Women's Day Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 8th March
	•	Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 12th April
	•	Double Dutch Audax - Saturday 19th April
	•	Easter Club Run - Sunday 20th April
	•	Evening Social Rides (Alconbury) Start - Thursday 1st May
	•	Peaks Away Day Club Run - Sunday 4th May (stay for the weekend, it's a Bank Holiday!)
	•	Evening 10 mile Time Trials Restart (Sawtry) - Wednesday 14th May
	•	FREE OF CHARGE Evening 10 mile Time Trial - Wednesday 11th June
	•	Club Summer BBQ Club Run - Sunday 29th June
	•	Summer Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 19th July
	•	Last Evening 10 mile Time Trial (Sawtry) - Wednesday 20th August
	•	Bank Holiday Weekend Longer Club Run - Sunday 24th August (ideas welcome!)
	•	Last Evening Social Ride (Alconbury) - Thursday 28th August
	•	Dave Nelson Memorial Hill Climb - Wednesday 3rd September
	•	Cafe Ventoux Away Day Club Run - Sunday 7th September
	•	Remembrance Club Run - Sunday 9th Novemeber
	•	Christmas Dress Up Club Run - Sunday 21st December
	•	Festive 500 - Wednesday 24th - 31st December
	•	Winter Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 27th December
	•	Short New Years Eve Ride - Wednesday 31st December
 
	•	SICC hosts Eastern League CX - TBC
	•	Christmas Meal - TBC

subject: Jim Jefferies, Flowers and Friendship Bracelets, The Rocket Man plus many more!
body:
Discover our on sale shows
 
Is this email not displaying correctly? View it in your browser.
￼
￼
BOX OFFICE: Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk | Phone: 01223 357851 | Mon - Fri, 10am - 5pm
￼
On Sale This Week
￼
Jim Jefferies: Son of a Carpenter
￼

11 November 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On sale for CornEx Members: now
On general sale: 13 June 2025, 10 AM
￼
One of the most respected comedians of his generation, Jim Jefferies returns with his new worldwide tour Son of a Carpenter. Known for his provocative and thought-provoking humour, Jim’s hit Netflix specials and work on Legit and The Jim Jefferies Show have won him global acclaim.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
On Sale Now
￼
Maximum Rhythm And Blues with The Manfreds
￼
23 October 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange

On general sale now
￼
Original Manfred Mann members Paul Jones and Tom McGuinness return to Cambridge with a night of classic hits including ‘Do Wah Diddy Diddy’, ‘Pretty Flamingo’ and ‘The Mighty Quinn’. Joined by soul sensation Noel McCalla, this is a must-see for fans of rhythm, blues and unforgettable live music.

￼
BOOK HERE
￼

The Rocket Man
￼

20 June 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Celebrate the legend that is Elton John in this dazzling live tribute show. Featuring classics like ‘I’m Still Standing’, ‘Crocodile Rock’ and ‘Saturday Night’s Alright’, The Rocket Man is a spectacular journey through Elton’s iconic career – full of hits, humour and heart.

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Flowers and Friendship Bracelets
￼
28 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Join us for a pop-tastic party packed with hits from Taylor Swift, Miley Cyrus, Olivia Rodrigo and Sabrina Carpenter! Flowers and Friendship Bracelets is a feel-good, high-energy concert for kids and families – full of music, dancing, and friendship. Don’t forget your bracelets!

￼
BOOK NOW
￼
￼
Shows on sale with Cambridge Live Tickets

￼
Cambridge Oktoberfest 2025
￼
26 - 27 September 2025 | Jesus Green
On general sale: now
￼
Join the fun at Jesus Green in our tent with 1,800 seats. It has all you need for a good time; atmosphere, German food and beer, and live music. 
So bring your friends and book tickets now. 

Opening Friday 26th 5pm - 11pm and Saturday 27th 11am - 4:30pm & 5:30pm - 11pm.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼

￼

￼
Folk in the City - Free Outdoor Folk Concert
￼
2 August 2025 | 1 - 8 PM | Cherry Hinton Hall Park | FREE
￼
Folk stars Katherine Priddy and Jon Boden & The Remnant Kings are among the national and local artists confirmed for this special family-friendly concert.
 
The afternoon opens with a performance from some of the city’s young musicians, sharing what they’ve learned at this year’s Folk Summer School. That’s followed by a fun-filled kids’ show with CBeebies favourite Nick Cope, before the day wraps up with The Big Ceilidh, led by the Cambridge Ceilidh All-Stars – and everyone’s invited to join in!
 
This special free day of entertainment – from children’s concerts to an evening ceilidh – brings together a mix of local and national talent, celebrating folk music’s rich traditions and vibrant future.
 
PLUS a variety of delicious refreshments will be available to buy: cider, beer, cocktails and soft drinks from the Cranes Cider bar plus food from selected food trucks.
 
Folk in the City is a year-round programme of gigs, free concerts, family events and a dedicated summer school for young musicians – and this summer highlight is not to be missed.

￼
FIND OUT MORE
￼
Discover More
￼
Want to skip the queues?
￼
The age-old tradition of queuing for interval drinks is becoming a thing of the past at the Corn Exchange.
        
        
Simply follow this link and place your order in just a few easy steps. Whether you're craving a bag of Haribos, a Coke, a glass of wine, a beer, a ready-mixed cocktail, or an award-winning Saffron Ice Cream, you can sit back, relax, and enjoy the show while your interval drinks and snacks are delivered straight to your seat!
PRE-ORDER NOW
￼
CornEx Membership
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange, run by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council, depends on ticket sales, sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants, and concessions to bring top-quality shows to the city. By becoming a member, you make a significant impact, helping us continue to deliver the music, comedy, and performances you love. As a thank you, we offer great perks in return.
BECOME A MEMBER
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange is operated by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council. As well as Corn Exchange ticket income, we rely on income raised through sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants and concessions to ensure that we can continue to bring the biggest and best shows to the city.
 
We also organise an annual programme of diverse and greatly valued events including free Fireworks Night, Out of the Ordinary Festival and Music in the Parks. These events are free in order to offer residents the opportunity to participate in the cultural life of the city and to provide access to all. They contribute to creating a united city, ‘One Cambridge - Fair for All’, in which economic dynamism and prosperity are combined with social justice and equality. Again, these events are also an opportunity to develop valued partnerships with local businesses and other organisations that make up the Cambridge Community.
3 Parson's Court, Wheeler Street, Cambridge, CB2 3QE
 
Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk
Phone: 01223 357851

Cambridge Corn Exchange is provided by Cambridge City Council
￼

If you no longer wish to receive these emails, please click here to unsubscribe.
 
If you have any suggestions, queries or comments, why not send us an email to tickets@cambridge.gov.uk.
 
© Cambridge City Council.
￼

subject: How much is GTM misalignment costing you?
body:
￼
￼
Is your go-to-market strategy as effective as you think it is?
Our latest research found that GTM misalignment is a primary factor in lost revenue, wasted resources, and stalled innovation — yet the same teams reporting misalignment also report confidence in their go-to-market strategy. Clearly, there’s a disconnect. And we want to help you fix it.
Join Mural CMO Christina Bottis and expert panelists Gordon Galzerano, President & CEO, SAMA and Michael Hyzy, VP of Strategy & Innovation, CGI for an eye-opening discussion that will change how you think about team alignment. 
Key takeaways will include:
	•	The risks of GTM misalignment to organizations
	•	The three factors undermining even the most innovative teams
	•	The three-part strategy leading organizations use to align their GTM teams
	•	Practical tips to improve customer experiences and unlock growth

subject: Meta Physical World Model 🌎, The Browser Company’s Dia 👩‍💻, Mistral Compute 💻
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-06-12
Amplitude's new AI Agents is a whole new way to build digital products (Sponsor) 

There are plenty of digital analytics tools that ask you to trawl through heaps of data in search of an insight you might never find.

But what if instead of a tool, you had a team of always-on AI analysts that you lead?
Amplitude AI Agents are that and more. They identify conversion drops, design experiments, and take action. No more dashboard-digging.
→ Join the upcoming virtual session to see Amplitude Agents in the wild. You'll also hear from (human) AI leaders including Sarah Guo of Conviction, Dmitry Pimenov of OpenAI, Matan Grinberg of Factory AI, and Tony Gentilcore of Glean.
👀 Get an inside look on June 24 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Physical World Model by Meta (3 minute read) 

Meta has announced V-JEPA 2, a new visual world model that enhances physical reasoning for AI agents. The company also introduced three benchmarks to assess model performance on real-world video-based reasoning tasks. 
The Browser Company Launches Dia, an AI-First Browser (5 minute read) 

Dia integrates AI directly into the URL bar, allowing users to query open tabs, generate drafts from their content, and build custom code snippets through natural language. The Browser Company pivoted from Arc after acknowledging its complexity limited mainstream adoption, betting that embedding AI at the browser level will capture users who currently switch between ChatGPT, Perplexity, and Claude. 
Mistral Announces AI Compute Platform with Tens of Thousands of GPUs (3 minute read) 

As an alternative to US and Chinese Cloud Providers, Mistral Compute offers private AI stacks including GPUs, orchestration, and APIs to attract highly-regulated enterprises. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
AlphaWrite: Test-Time Compute Scaling for Writing (GitHub Repo) 

AlphaWrite generates story variants with different author styles and themes, uses pairwise comparisons to rank quality, then evolves top performers across multiple generations, demonstrating that creative tasks can benefit from systematic inference-time compute scaling beyond just math and coding domains. 
The Rise of Systems of Consolidation Applications (9 minute read) 

The last twenty years were focused on building systems for storage and engagement. The next era will focus on systems that consolidate and act. Companies building these systems will control enterprise workflows. Systems of consolidation will become the most valuable software layer yet. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
The Developer's Guide to Agentic AI, MCP and A2A (Sponsor) 

Lost in the latest AI jargon? Cut through the hype with this clear, practical guide to AI agents, Model Context Protocol (MCP), and Agent2Agent (A2A). Understand how agents differ from models, and explore how emerging protocols enable agents to interact with each other, external APIs, and tools. Try it out in the Dynatrace Playground to see AI Observability in action. 
Claude Squad (GitHub Repo) 

Claude Squad is a terminal app that manages multiple local agents in separate workspaces, allowing users to work on multiple tasks simultaneously. It can compute tasks in the background, manage instances and tasks in one terminal window, review changes before applying them, checkout changes before pushing them, and more. Each task gets its own isolated git workspace, so there can be no conflicts. A video demo is available in the repository. 
Weak-to-Strong Decoding for LLM Alignment (GitHub Repo) 

WSD is a novel method where a small aligned model drafts the start of a response, then a large base model continues it. This boosts alignment without harming performance. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
The Dream of a Gentle Singularity (22 minute read) 

Sam Altman recently published an essay called 'The Gentle Singularity' where he talks about how humanity is close to building digital superintelligence. This post breaks down Altman's essay, looking at each passage to reveal the hidden meaning behind the words. It is clear that Altman's post was made to convince people that everything is going to be fine, when very clearly, the default is for everything to not be fine. 
Canva now requires use of AI during developer job interviews (4 minute read) 

Canva now requires developer candidates to use AI coding assistants during interviews to better gauge real-world skills. The new process evaluates proficiency in leveraging AI effectively and making sound technical decisions, while still testing basic computer science skills. 
⚡
Quick Links
Want more news from TLDR? (Sponsor) 

You'll probably like our flagship newsletter. It's all about tech, science, and programming.

Same quick format. Still free.
Subscribe now. 
Training Cluster as a Service with NVIDIA (3 minute read) 

Hugging Face and NVIDIA have launched "Training Cluster as a Service" to offer scalable GPU clusters to research teams worldwide. 
Introducing Design Mode on v0 (1 minute read) 

Design Mode on v0 allows users to quickly tweak generations, preview changes, and more without needing to spend credits or wait for a large language model. 
Disney and NBCUniversal File Lawsuit Against Midjourney (8 minute read) 

The studios claim Midjourney, which reportedly made $300 million last year, built a "bootlegging business model" by generating thousands of images featuring characters from Marvel, Star Wars, Pixar, and DreamWorks properties.

subject: reThink: Sharpen your creative edge
body:
The newsletter for better thinking.

￼ 

￼

￼
Ever notice how some people always seem to have the right idea at the right moment? While the rest of us are still figuring out what the problem is, they're already three steps ahead with solutions that work.  The good news? That kind of creative problem-solving is learnable.   That's why we've partnered with IDEO - the design firm behind breakthrough innovations for over 40 years - to create a free, hands-on workbook that teaches you the methods those people use.
 
Rather not receive reThink? Unsubscribe.

IN THIS EDITION
	•	The workbook for becoming the go-to problem solver 
	•	A sound secret for your deep-work sessions 
	•	How to deliver critique without crushing creativity 
	•	The 4 types of creativity 
	•	Jacob Lange, architect of ideas at BIG 


￼
Become the person they turn to for solutions
￼
You know who they are. When a project's stuck, they unstick it. When everyone's complaining but no one's acting, they step up with ideas that work.  We partnered with IDEO - the legendary design firm behind Apple's first mouse and breakthrough innovations for over 40 years - because they've perfected the method for creative problem-solving.  Through 10 practical exercises, you learn to uncover what problems really matter, generate ideas people want, and present solutions that get approved.
 
The PDF-workbook is optimized for reMarkable paper tablets (how to transfer) , but works on any device or print.
 
Download the workbook for free

Ready to go deeper?
The Creative Edge gets you started, and when you're ready to dive deeper into the tools and frameworks for breakthrough innovation, IDEO U is where the pros go.  Our current favorite courses:
	•	AI x Design Thinking Workshop: Collaborate with AI in creative work 
	•	Storytelling for Influence: Turn ideas into stories that move people 
	•	Human-Centered Strategy: Move from strategy to confident execution 
We've partnered with IDEO U to get reThink readers 15% off any course in June with code "remarkablenewsletter".
Explore IDEO U courses

The sound secret for your deep-work sessions
We've been obsessed with the Endel app lately. It creates personal soundscapes that adapt to what you're doing.   It's like having a sound designer who knows exactly what your brain needs - backed by neuroscience showing 7x better focus than playlists, and sleep research showing it helps you fall asleep faster.   We love their app so much we partnered with Endel to get reThink readers an exclusive 2-months for free. Use the link below - we think you'll be as obsessed as we are.  Discover Endel (2 months free)


￼
Don't be a seagull.  Be a goose.
￼
Seagull managers. We've all met one. They swoop into the room, wreak havoc, squawk loudly and vanish, leaving everyone to clean up their mess.   Nothing kills creativity and momentum faster.   Read on as William Chaumeton, head of concept development at reMarkable, shares the way of the goose and how to deliver critique without crushing creativity.
 
Enjoy the 4-minute read

Why your weirdest ideas might matter most
Harvard researchers have mapped four types of creativity, and the most valuable ones feel the weirdest: seeing how similar things are actually different, finding the crucial detail everyone else ignores, imagining impossibly distant futures.   Most of us stick to one type. But in a world of predictable algorithms, your strangest instincts might become your greatest asset.
 
Explore the four creative types

The story of Pixar and their pursuit of the creative culture
￼

Pixar's co-founder Ed Catmull spent decades figuring out how to build and nurture a creative culture where the best idea wins, no matter who says it.  This isn't just the story of animation. It's about creating anything meaningful when fear tries to hold you back. 

 
Discover the book 


￼
Advice for when your creativity ghosts you
We've all been there - staring at a blank page while our creativity takes an extended vacation. Author Elizabeth Gilbert has a theory about that.  In her TED talk, she argues your creative genius is more like a flaky roommate than a personal trait. Sometimes they show up with brilliant ideas at 3am. Sometimes they ghost you for weeks.   Her solution? Stop taking it personally.
 
Watch her 19-minute TED talk

Architect of ideas at Bjarke Ingels Group
￼
Step into BIG's Copenhagen headquarters. We sat down with Jakob Lange, architect and partner, for a chat (and a bit of doodling) about his creative process - and how sponges and ropes gave form to a new sofa.   Watch the 2-minute film


￼
What sparks your best creative thinking?
Maybe it's sketching before you write. Walking without your phone. Or that specific pen that just feels right.  Whatever sharpens your creative edge, we want to hear about it. Chances are, many of your fellow 2.5+ million reThink readers are looking for exactly that.
 Tell us about it



￼


Better paper. Better thinking. © 2025 reMarkable AS. All rights reserved. Fridtjof Nansens vei 12, 0369 Oslo, Norway.

subject: WWDC25: The new design has arrived.
body:
HELLO DEVELOPER
Today @ WWDC25 
Your daily guide to the conference.
￼
Today’s group labs 
Join Apple engineers and your developer peers online to ask questions, get advice, and follow the discussion about the week’s biggest announcements.

Register now for today’s group labs￼
Wednesday, June 11 (PT)
9 a.m. – UI frameworks
12 p.m. – Design
3 p.m. – visionOS
6 p.m. – watchOS
￼
Explore the new design 
Dive deep into our broadest design update ever. In today’s group labs, one-on-one labs, and video sessions, you’ll find out how the stunning new Apple design language elevates the content users care about most while creating a universal language across platforms. And you can begin your explorations with Liquid Glass, the new material that combines the optical qualities of glass with responsive fluidity.
Register for the design group lab (12 p.m. PT)￼
You can also request one-on-one lab appointments with Apple experts for guidance on design.
Request a one-on-one lab￼

Looking for what’s new? 
Get your apps and games ready for the new design.

new design system￼

with the new design￼

Learn more about WWDC25￼
￼
Join the community 
Browse community activities taking place all throughout WWDC. And stop by the Apple Developer Forums to see what everyone is chatting about.
Learn more about community￼
￼
Congratulations to this year’s Apple Design Award winners 
One more round of applause for this year’s Apple Design Award winners, who got their well-deserved moment in the sun on Monday afternoon at Apple Park. View the complete list of winners and finalists, and visit the App Store to try them all out.
View this year’s winners and finalists￼
View the collection on the App Store￼

￼
TODAY’S PLAYLIST
Everybody loves the sunshine 
Put a little sunshine in your day with a hand-curated playlist of summer favorites.
Listen on Apple Music￼

Tell us how we’re doing 
We’d love to know your thoughts on this year’s conference.
Take the survey￼

More to come 
We have good intelligence that says tomorrow has a lot to offer. We’ll catch you then.

To receive WWDC25 emails during the conference, check your  Apple Developer account settings.   To get WWDC25 push notifications, visit the Account tab in the Apple Developer app.

subject: OpenAI o3-pro 🤖, Meta + Scale AI 💰, Mistral Magistral 🎩
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-06-11
Airia: Enterprise AI Orchestration (Sponsor) 

Ditch the IT bottleneck: AI agents are ready to deploy across departments. Think "collaborative playground" with invisible guardrails. Airia lets every department build out their own use cases with security and governance baked-in:

	•	Use templates and no-code to rapidly prototype, deploy, and manage AI agents that transform workflows across your organization
	•	Bring your own data and LLM with built-in connectors to dozens of enterprise applications and LLM tools
	•	Add security and governance with controls, audit trails, and responsible guardrails to protect sensitive data
	•	Optimize performance and costs through smart routing and centralized lifecycle management
Plans start at just $49/month. Get a demo 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
OpenAI Releases o3-pro (2 minute read) 

o3-pro is an incremental improvement over o3, which OpenAI slashed its price by 80%, across science, coding, and business tasks. It's available to Pro and Team users today, replacing o1-pro. 
Mistral Launches First AI Reasoning Model (2 minute read) 

Adding to a string of releases over the last 2 weeks, Mistral has launched an open-source reasoning model, Magistral. It trails proprietary models on major benchmarks, but claims to be 10x faster output and stronger multilingual capabilities. 
Meta Plans $15B Investment in Scale AI to Build 'Superintelligence' Lab (5 minute read) 

The deal would give Meta a 49% stake in the data-labeling startup and bring over co-founder Alexandr Wang to lead a new "superintelligence" lab aimed at outperforming OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google. The massive investment follows Llama 4's underwhelming launch, but it's unclear if the investment also includes greater access to Scale's training data created for other AI labs in addition to highly sought-after AI research talent. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Real-World Engineering at Cursor: Building for 100x Growth (11 minute read) 

Cursor cofounder Sualeh Asif reveals how the two-year-old startup handles 1M+ queries per second without storing any code on its servers, using Merkle trees for secure indexing. The team survived 100x growth by switching databases during outages (Yugabyte → PostgreSQL → Turbopuffer in hours) and built Anyrun, their Rust-based orchestrator, to manage thousands of GPUs. 
Speculative Decoding in LLMs (19 minute read) 

Perplexity applies speculative decoding to speed up its Sonar models, using lightweight draft models to propose multiple tokens verified by larger LLMs. 
Towards Adaptive Clinical AI via the Consensus of Expert Model Ensemble (20 minute read) 

Despite the growing clinical adoption of LLMs, current approaches heavily rely on single model architectures. Consensus Mechanism is a novel framework to overcome risks of obsolescence and rigid dependence on single model systems. Mimicking clinical triage and multidisciplinary clinical decision-making, the Consensus Mechanism implements an ensemble of specialized medical expert agents enabling improved clinical decision making while maintaining robust adaptability. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
💪 Dell brings 20 Petaflops of AI computing power right to your desk with Dell Pro Max (Sponsor) 

Dell's Pro Max GB10 designed for AI development lets you train and run massive models locally. The GB10, Built on NVIDIA Grace Blackwell, delivers 1 Petaflop for 200B parameter models, while the GB300 powers up to 20 Petaflops and 460B parameters with 496GB CPU memory. See specs + sign up 🔔 
Mixed-Chip Clusters Enable Efficient Large-Scale AI Training (42 minute read) 

Shanghai-based researchers introduced DiTorch and DiComm, which unify programming across diverse chip architectures like NVIDIA and AMD variants, making it possible to train massive models on whatever hardware is available. Their framework achieved 116% efficiency training a 100B model on 1,024 chips with vastly different specs by intelligently assigning memory-hungry pipeline stages to larger-memory hardware. This allows labs without access to thousands of identical cutting-edge GPUs to still pursue frontier AI training by combining older, cheaper, or export-controlled chips into effective "hyper-heterogeneous" clusters. 
Reinforcement Pre-Training (55 minute read) 

Reinforcement Pre-Training (RPT) is a new scaling paradigm for large language models (LLMs) and reinforcement learning (RL). It offers a scalable method for leveraging vast amounts of text data for general-purpose RL. RPT significantly improves the large model accuracy of predicting the next tokens. It also provides a strong pre-trained foundation for further reinforcement fine-tuning. 
JavelinGuard: Low-Cost Transformer Architectures for LLM Security (68 minute read) 

JavelinGuard is a suite of low-cost, high-performance model architectures designed for detecting malicious intent in large language model (LLM) interactions. Each architecture presents unique trade-offs in speed, interpretability, and resource requirements. The architectures are optimized specifically for production deployment. This paper explores the architectures, benchmarking them across nine diverse adversarial datasets, and compares them against leading open-source guardrail models and large decoder-only LLMs. 
Efficient Multimodal Reasoning with Fewer Tokens (GitHub Repo) 

LLaVA-STF compresses vision token sequences by merging adjacent tokens and adds a multi-block token fusion module, enabling 75% token reduction. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Sam Altman Outlines Path to Superintelligence (5 minute read) 

In a rare blog post, Sam Altman declares we've passed the "event horizon" with systems like GPT-4 and o3 that already surpass humans in many ways, predicting agents doing real cognitive work in 2025, novel scientific insights in 2026, and useful robots by 2027. He frames the coming decade as one where scientific breakthroughs compound exponentially through AI-accelerated research. 
What "Working" Means in the Era of AI Apps (3 minute read) 

AI startups are growing rapidly, with the average enterprise achieving over $2 million ARR in the first year. Consumer startups are also gaining traction, outpacing B2B by reaching $4.2 million ARR. The disparity between average and top performers is widening, emphasizing the need for speed and innovation. 
Reimagining TTS with LLM-Powered Audio Generation (11 minute read) 

Bland AI has reimagined text-to-speech (TTS) technology by using large language models to predict audio directly from text, enhancing expressiveness and contextual understanding. This new system leverages two-channel conversational datasets and specialized audio tokenizers for accurate and nuanced speech generation. It supports advanced capabilities like style transfer, sound effect integration, and multilingual adaptation, setting a new standard for expressive synthetic speech. 
⚡
Quick Links
[Oxford Languages Whitepaper] The Strategic Value of Lexical Data in AI Development (Sponsor) 

This whitepaper explores the foundational role of human-curated lexical data in the development of NLP and LLMs - including real-world case studies from Sephora, Unilever, Novo Nordisk. Read the whitepaper 
OpenAI Taps Google Cloud in Unprecedented Deal Despite AI Rivalry (3 minute read) 

OpenAI's compute demands have grown so massive it's turning to its biggest search competitor for additional capacity, marking its first major cloud partner outside of Microsoft. 
OpenAI announces 80% price drop for o3, its most powerful reasoning model (4 minute read) 

o3 is now a much more accessible option for developers seeking advanced reasoning capabilities. 
Monthly alternative data report: OpenAI, Google, Meta, Nvidia, Amazon, Microsoft Anthropic (15 minute read) 

This article summarizes some of the most valuable insights from various alternative data providers and research reports, covering AI, semiconductors, ad tech, and the cloud industry. 
OpenAI's open model is delayed (2 minute read) 

OpenAI's open model will be released sometime after June. 
AI-2027 Response: Inter-AI Tensions, Value Distillation, US Multipolarity, & More (19 minute read) 

AI-2027 is a heavily researched and influential attempt at providing a concrete forecast on AI capability development and its potential consequences. 
Evals now supports tool use (2 minute read) 

OpenAI users can now use tools and Structured Outputs when completing eval runs and evaluate tool calls based on the arguments passed and responses returned.

subject: RE: 93JD0903124 R v BARAKO
body:
OFFICIAL 

Hi Roger, 
 
I hope you are well. 
 
The theft of your belongings is part of the case and your statement forms part of the evidence we have against the defendant. As he has pleaded guilty there will be no need for a Trial and all statements have been accepted by the defence and a guilty plea entered. 
 
The Court does have the power to award compensation for the loss of the items. This is for the Court to decide at sentencing. If the defendant receives a custodial sentence, this usually trumps the award for any compensation but I am unable to confirm for definite until the Court has handed down sentence. 
 
We do not yet have a date for sentencing but as soon as I am made aware I will be in touch to let you know. 
 
Kind regards,
 
Jamie Corby 4198
Witness and Case Review Officer, Post Charge Team  
Criminal Justice Unit, Justice & Public Contact
 
British Transport Police, 6th Floor , Baskerville House, Centenary Square, Birmingham, B1 2ND
Mobile 07765746526 (Due to hybrid working, please call my mobile number first) 
External Number for Public – 0300 790 0591
Internal Number for Officers, Staff and Stakeholders – 0207 830 6777 Internal 630 6777
