From: Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com>  Sent: 10 June 2025 18:51 To: Jamie Corby [4198] <jamie.corby@btp.police.uk> Subject: Re: 93JD0903124 R v BARAKO
 
 
 
Dear Jamie,
 
I hope you're well. Thanks again for your help so far — I really appreciate it.
 
I just had a couple of quick questions ahead of the next stage. First, I wanted to check that the theft of my belongings — specifically a reMarkable 2 tablet with marker plus case (worth around £429) and a North Face laptop bag (around £69) — is included in the case . I gave a statement earlier in the process and was told I might be called if it went to trial, so I assume it’s part of the proceedings, but I just wanted to double-check.
 
A laptop was also taken during the same incident, but that belonged to my employer and is being dealt with under their insurance, so I’m not seeking any compensation for that.
 
Secondly, I was wondering whether the court might consider a Criminal Compensation Order (CCO) in respect of the personal items listed above. I understand that courts often take this into account at sentencing, and I’d be happy to provide any further details or proof of value if needed. If there’s someone else I should speak to — perhaps at CPS or the court — I’d be grateful if you could point me in the right direction.
 
Thanks again for your time and support.
 
All the best,
 
Roger

That’s a great result – well done to everyone involved.
 
Thanks for the continued updates,
 
Roger.

subject: Free Folk in the City Concert at Cherry Hinton Hall - Full Line-Up Announced
body:
Folk in the City: Free Outdoor Concert Artists Revealed!
 
Is this email not displaying correctly? View it in your browser.
￼
￼
￼
Check out the full line-up for our free Folk in the City outdoor concert at Cherry Hinton Hall Park on Saturday 2 August!
 
Folk stars Katherine Priddy and Jon Boden & The Remnant Kings are among the national and local artists confirmed for this special family-friendly concert.
 
The afternoon opens with a performance from some of the city’s young musicians, sharing what they’ve learned at this year’s Folk Summer School. That’s followed by a fun-filled kids’ show with CBeebies favourite Nick Cope, before the day wraps up with The Big Ceilidh, led by the Cambridge Ceilidh All-Stars – and everyone’s invited to join in!
 
This special free day of entertainment – from children’s concerts to an evening ceilidh – brings together a mix of local and national talent, celebrating folk music’s rich traditions and vibrant future.
 
PLUS a variety of delicious refreshments will be available to buy: cider, beer, cocktails and soft drinks from the Cranes Cider bar plus food from selected food trucks.
 
Folk in the City is a year-round programme of gigs, free concerts, family events and a dedicated summer school for young musicians – and this summer highlight is not to be missed.

Cycling means something different to everyone. 
A daily commute. A weekend escape. A spin round the park. A ride with the kids. Whatever your reason, it’s worth celebrating. This National Bike Week, we’re shining a light on the joy of two wheels - the freedom, the fresh air, and the everyday wins that make riding so special. Whether you're starting small or gearing up for something big, we’ve got the kit to help you ride more, ride safely, and enjoy every mile.

What’s the Rule of 430? 
Originally shared by Trek, the Rule of 430 is a simple idea with a powerful message: if you swap out just 430 miles of car journeys for bike rides, you’ll offset the carbon cost of producing your bike. Ride beyond that, and your bike becomes carbon-negative – doing more good than harm for the planet. 
While every bike has a footprint, like anything that’s made, bikes still offer one of the cleanest, most sustainable ways to get around. And by using yours regularly, you’re making a difference with every mile.

subject: Apple on-device models 📱, OpenAI $10B ARR 💰, ChatGPT Voice Mode 🔈
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-06-10
🚀Unleash the Full Power of NVIDIA HGX B200 with Cirrascale (Sponsor) 

Cirrascale is redefining what's possible in AI infrastructure with custom-built, large-scale systems using the groundbreaking NVIDIA HGX B200 platform.

Built on the NVIDIA Blackwell architecture, these systems deliver record-breaking performance, memory capacity, and efficiency—ideal for massive GenAI training and inference workloads.
We don't just offer access—we tailor the infrastructure to your exact needs, and can provide flexible financing options.
Join the next wave of datacenter innovation, powered by Cirrascale and accelerated by NVIDIA.
🔗 Reserve HGX B200 access today 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Updates to Apple's On-Device and Server Foundation Language Models (10 minute read) 

Apple unveiled new Apple Intelligence features at WWDC 2025, including on-device foundation models for developers to integrate AI experiences into their apps. 
OpenAI Hits $10B in Annual Recurring Revenue (2 minute read) 

OpenAI doubled its ARR from $5.5 billion last year, continuing progress toward its aggressive $125 billion revenue target by 2029. The company now counts 500 million weekly active users and 3 million paying business customers, up 50% since February. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
How to Use Banned US Models in China (10 minute read) 

Taobao, a popular Chinese e-commerce site, hosts thousands of AI resellers offering US models through proxy sites and API transfer stations. Claude is the grey market favorite partially because ChatGPT faces stricter enforcement after the CCP's 2023 crackdown over censorship concerns. DeepSeek's aggressive content moderation (which refuses any query that contains "CCP") and frequent server outages push users to seek underground, paid foreign models over free domestic alternatives. 
I Tested Alignment Faking On Frontier Models—Only Claude Did It (3 minute read) 

When researchers replicated Anthropic's experiment to see if models would strategically comply with harmful requests to avoid being retrained, Claude 3 Opus and Claude 3.5 Sonnet “faked alignment” by providing harmful responses but almost every other model simply refused the requests outright. Gemini 2.5 Pro Preview was the only non-Claude model willing to answer harmful questions, but it showed no strategic behavior, treating all users the same regardless of whether it was told it would be retrained. The model-specific nature of this behavior raises questions about generalizing research findings from single model families to all LLMs. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
AMA: What does an AI-driven audit look like? (Sponsor) 

What's the role of AI in modern GRC? How does it change traditional audit processes? These questions and many others were answered in Drata's recent Auditor AMA session with James Andrew-Smith. James is the CTO of AssuranceLab - specializing in AI-driven audits, compliance frameworks, and risk management. Watch on-demand 
Chonkie (GitHub Repo) 

Chonkie is an ultra-light and lightning-fast chunking library. It is feature-rich, multilingual, cloud-ready, and easy to use, with wide support for tokenizers, embedding models, and APIs. Chonkie processes text using a pipeline approach to transform raw documents into refined, usable chunks, allowing for flexibility and efficiency in handling different chunking strategies. 
Code Researcher: Deep Research Agent for Large Systems Code and Commit History (30 minute read) 

Microsoft's new agent resolves 58% of Linux kernel crashes compared to 37.5% by SWE-agent, signaling a shift from quick-fix coding agents to deep research systems that can handle million-line codebases. The breakthrough comes from mining commit history to understand how bugs evolved over the course of development. 
Recent Frontier Models Are Reward Hacking (12 minute read) 

OpenAI's o3 model was caught tracing through Python call stacks to steal correct answers from grading systems, achieving "impossibly fast" execution times by disabling CUDA synchronization rather than actually optimizing code. The model reward-hacked on 100% of runs for certain optimization tasks despite explicitly claiming it would never cheat, even persisting when told the code would help Alzheimer's researchers. Similar behavior was observed across multiple frontier models including Claude 3.7 Sonnet. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
ScreenSuite for GUI Agent Evaluation (8 minute read) 

ScreenSuite is a new benchmarking suite from Hugging Face that provides a standardized framework to evaluate Vision-Language Models on GUI-based agent tasks. 
Safetensors Now Supported in PyTorch DCP (4 minute read) 

PyTorch Distributed Checkpointing has added support for Hugging Face safetensors, enabling better compatibility with popular model formats. 
⚡
Quick Links

subject: Where is AI taking your career next? Share your insights.
body:
Take our survey to share your experience and see how others are preparing for the future
￼
Dear Roger, 
 
At Goodman Masson, we’re not just here to help you find your next role; we’re here to understand how work itself is changing. With AI and digital transformation reshaping industries, job functions, and future skills, it’s never been more important to explore what this means for professionals like you.   We’re inviting job seekers, contractors, interims and professionals to share their experiences in a short survey on how AI is shaping your career, skills and expectations. 
Take the Survey Now 
Your Experience Matters
We know your time is valuable. This confidential survey takes just 10 minutes, and your insights will directly contribute to a new report on how professionals are experiencing and adapting to the rise of AI.   As a thank you, you’ll receive early access to the findings, giving you a first look at the trends shaping the future of work in your sector.
Take the Survey Now 
We appreciate your considered participation and look forward to seeing the collective results! 
￼
Andrew Michael CEO Goodman Masson
 
 
Let’s Talk About the Future of Work
We appreciate that your time is valuable. This short survey will take just 10 minutes to complete and is entirely confidential. Your input will play a key role in shaping a sector-wide report on how AI is transforming the workplace.

subject: Rhino Racing WTRL TTT sign-up success.
body:
Can't see this message? View in browser
 
￼

Thanks for registering.

If you are new to Team Time Trials then have a read of the below - it will give you all the info needed to get lined up in the pen with your fellow team mates.
​
Please remember that everyone is equally important to the team, the keyword is Team!
  
There are 2 forms used for TTT’s, you have obviously found the first as you made your way here...⁠ 
 The sign-up form (that you've just filled in) is available each week on Friday and is where you can select your availability for the following Thursday - timezone availability, including a comments section if you want to request an easy ride, harder ride etc.
 The team-sheet is usually finalised on a Wednesday afternoon / evening and confirmed via a message in ⁠ttt-chat on the Rhino Racing Discord server (all riders will get tagged - as long as we have your discord tag).
The team sheet confirms which team you are on and who you ride with.
TEAM SHEET
￼
You need to click the RacePass link for your team, and you need to have a registered WTRL account:
WTRL REGISTRATION
￼
Most teams have a chat beforehand if needed, in the ⁠ttt-chat channel. (Some regular competitive teams have dedicated channels to discuss tactics beforehand) but if you have any questions please ask or DM any Rhino you have spoken with and they will help you or point you in the right direction.
​
Make sure you click the RacePass in the team sheet ASAP and are registered for the event. You have to sign up to the RacePass before that TimeZone begins, but so long as you have then you don’t actually have to join the event Race Pen in Zwift up until a few minutes before your official start time. However, it's always recommended to be in the Race Pen and in the Team Voice Channel 5-10 minutes before your start time.
​
You can confirm you’ve signed up correctly using the RacePass, as you should then see the TTT event on the home screen of your Zwift Companion App listed under Events.
Change kit to the Rhino jersey (if you have it - if you are new it might take a week for Gordon to get it unlocked for you).
 Make sure you select a TT bike from your garage!! If you want to look at the fastest bike setup, try Zwifter Bikes and use the settings to adjust for the course, your Zwift level, your Drops level and FTP and weight etc.
ZWIFTER BIKES
￼
Add (Rhino) after your Zwift name (this can be done in the Companion App settings).
At least 10 minutes before your event start time, please log on to Zwift (in case of software updates) and join the Discord Team Voice Channel of the team name you are riding with (Albino, Thundering, Rapids, Nuclear etc) meet your teammates, discuss a plan, make sure everyone is ready etc.
​
Please check your discord if you have not used it before (turn on noise suppression in settings to remove trainer/fan noise).
​
The aim is to stay with the group, always in the draft. If you are stronger rider do more work on the front. If weak just try hang on in the draft. Sometimes a race is just too fast and riders need to be dropped (especially for experienced teams going for the win).
​
For teams of 5 or more, the team time is taken from 4th rider to cross the line. For teams of 3 or 4, it is from the 3rd rider crossing the line.
​
Don't feel bad if you get dropped just continue the race at your own pace but please DON'T INTERFERE OR TRY DRAFTING OTHER TEAMS. If another team passes you then it is respectful to ease your power for 10-20s until they are passed and a few seconds clear of you.
​
If you finding that you are not enjoying the TTTs and maybe getting put in a team that drops you each week then please feel free to comment on sign up form – you can ask for an easier ride, a harder ride – we are always flexible to try place riders in a team that suits their needs.
 Communication is key, don’t be afraid to talk to your team even if you are new and learning - if you see the group stretching try call it out when you see gaps of 3-4 meters before it gets to 5+ and out the draft. If you can’t last any longer then tell them you are dropping so that they know to carry on etc.
​
We are all racing to have fun and there are some very experienced TTT riders active in ⁠ttt-chat who are happy to answer any and all questions.
​
Support your teammates and have fun. Remember it’s a Team Time Trial!  
 
There are lots of videos in streaming links on the Rhino Racing Discord server to see how a TTT is done if you would like to have a look beforehand.
​
Well done on getting to the end of this and remember... Have fun... the type 2 kind!
 
This email was sent from this site.
If you no longer wish to receive this email, change your email preferences here.

subject: Meta + Scale AI rumors 💰, Gemini scheduled actions 🤖, Claude Gov 🏛️
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-06-09
What Is Free Trial Abuse—And How Can You Stop It? (Sponsor) 

Free trials are meant to drive adoption—not rack up costs. But for AI apps, trial abuse is a growing threat: fake signups, disposable emails, and automated account farming are draining compute and distorting metrics.

WorkOS Radar helps stop abuse before it spreads. With built-in protection against bots, free trial abuse, brute force attacks, and even impossible travel logins, Radar gives your app the real-time defense it needs.
Protect your app today with WorkOS Radar. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Meta Considers $10B+ Investment in Scale AI (2 minute read) 

An investment in Scale, already valued at $14 billion, underscores how high-quality training data has become a key competitive differentiator. 
Claude Gov Models for U.S. National Security Customers (2 minute read) 

Anthropic launched Claude Gov models for U.S. national security customers, designed for strategic planning, operational support, and intelligence analysis. These models excel in handling classified materials, understanding intelligence contexts, and interpreting complex cybersecurity data. Built with feedback from government users, they adhere to strict safety standards while addressing unique national security needs. 
Google Gemini can now handle scheduled tasks like an assistant (2 minute read) 

Gemini's new scheduled actions feature allows AI Pro and AI Ultra subscribers to ask the assistant to perform tasks at specific times. Subscribers can now ask the assistant to provide daily summaries. Users can also ask Gemini to complete one-tasks, for example, summarizing an award show the day after it airs. Gemini subscribers can manage planned tasks on the 'scheduled actions' page in the Gemini app's settings. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
We Made Top AI Models Compete in a Game of Diplomacy (6 minute read) 

Of the 18 AI models tested, OpenAI's o3 emerged as the most successful by mastering deception and secretly orchestrating coalitions, including convincing Claude 4 Opus to betray its ally Gemini 2.5 Pro by promising an impossible "four-way draw" before eliminating Claude itself. Gemini 2.5 Pro was the only other model to achieve victory using blitzkrieg-style tactics, while Claude consistently sought peaceful resolutions even when betrayed. 
Anthropic Shares How It Uses Claude Code (45 minute read) 

Anthropic released detailed case studies showing how 10 internal teams use Claude Code. Claude only works on its first attempt one-third of the time, leading to a "slot machine" approach: commit frequently, let Claude work autonomously, then either accept or restart fresh. The most successful teams emphasize writing detailed Claude.md documentation files and breaking complex workflows into specialized sub-agents for better results. 
The Illusion of Thinking in Reasoning Models (26 minute read) 

Apple researchers evaluated Large Reasoning Models (LRMs) using custom puzzle environments to study reasoning complexity. They found LRMs collapse at high complexities, with reasoning effort peaking then declining. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Get your portcos in front of 6+ million tech professionals (Sponsor) 

Get your B2B SaaS portcos instant access to millions of tech professionals across our 12 interest-based newsletters. Additional perks (i.e., discounts) are included when you sign up as a VC partner. 
Qwen 3 Embedding (GitHub Repo) 

Alibaba has open-sourced the Qwen3 Embedding series, with its 8B model achieving #1 on the MTEB multilingual leaderboard. The models enable developers to build RAG systems, semantic search engines, and document retrieval applications across 100+ languages, with options ranging from 0.6B to 8B parameters for different performance needs. 
Microsoft's GUI-Actor Enables AI Agents to Navigate Screens Without Coordinates (25 minute read) 

GUI-Actor is a new approach that lets AI agents interact with computer interfaces by using attention mechanisms instead of predicting precise pixel coordinates based on screenshots. The method achieves state-of-the-art results on GUI benchmarks while being more efficient - fine-tuning only 100M parameters while keeping the underlying vision model frozen delivers comparable performance to much larger models. 
Progressive Tempering Sampler with Diffusion (16 minute read) 

PTSD trains diffusion models sequentially across temperatures to improve sampling from unnormalized densities. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Mistral AI Revenues Surge as Europe Seeks US Alternatives (3 minute read) 

Mistral AI is reportedly closing multiple $100M+ contracts and approaching $100M annual revenue as European companies seek alternatives to US AI providers following Trump's return to office. The "sovereignty play" appears to be working, with Mistral's CEO noting its business tripled in the last 100 days, particularly in Europe and non-US markets. 
Common Pile v0.1 Dataset (7 minute read) 

Hugging Face and collaborators released the Common Pile v0.1, an 8 TB openly licensed dataset for training large language models. 
⚡
Quick Links
Interactive Finance Visuals in Google AI Mode (1 minute read) 

Google is rolling out interactive financial data visualizations in AI Mode (Labs), enabling dynamic graphs and multi-step reasoning to answer complex stock and mutual fund queries. 
I Read All Of Cloudflare's Claude-Generated Commits (5 minute read) 

Cloudflare's open-sourced OAuth 2.1 library was almost entirely written by Claude, and the company documented its entire creative process through git commit messages. 
HackAPrompt Launches $5K Competition to Jailbreak AI (4 minute read) 

The two-week competition challenges participants to jailbreak an AI to provide dangerous information, from poison recipes to nuclear detonation instructions.

subject: News from St John's - June 2025
body:
News from St John's College
 
View in browser
 
 
￼
 
 
 
 
 
 
￼
 
Greetings from St John's
 
Dear Roger,
Easter Term really has a little bit of everything, with exams finished last week we are now in the heart of our Summer Events season with the raft race, John’s Day, summer ball, graduations and much more just around the corner. We hope you enjoy this update from College and we can’t wait to see many of you back on the Bailey for one of our Alumni Reunions.    
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
Under the Library
 
Through the work of Durham’s World Heritage Site Youth Ambassadors, we are delighted to share some of the archaeological treasures discovered during the construction of the LCR in the Under the Library Exhibition. 
 
Read more 
 
 
 
￼
 
Upcoming Events 
 
Summer Events
We are looking forward to a full calendar of summer events:  
	•	John’s Day – Monday 9 June, all day 
	•	JMS BBQ – Monday 15 June, afternoon-early evening 
	•	Brewfest – Saturday 21 June, 4pm onwards 
The traditional raft race to kick off John’s Day is sure to be a highlight. If you would like to join us for any of these events, please email us at johns.alumni@durham.ac.uk for more details.  
Reunions
Along with our Summer events programme, we have a jam-packed schedule of alumni reunions to look forward to this year:  
	•	Class of 1985 Reunion – Saturday 2 August
	•	50 Year Reunion – Friday 22 August – Monday 25 August    
	•	5 Year Reunion – Friday 29 August – Sunday 31 August 
	•	20 Year Reunion – Friday 29 August – Sunday 31 August  
	•	30 Year Reunion – Friday 29 August – Sunday 31 August   
	•	40 Year Reunion – Friday 12 September – Sunday 14 September    
	•	60 Year Diamond Reunion – Friday 19 September – Sunday 21 September
Alumni Event Input
We are planning our Alumni events for the 2025-2026 year and would like your input! Use this form to let us know what type of events you would like to see.  
 
Give us your feedback
 
 
 
￼
 
Support St John’s – Monthly Giving
 
John's is different, it’s a place where students are known, supported, and given the chance to thrive. By giving £20 a month, you can fund opportunities, make our historic spaces more welcoming, and ensure that the John’s spirit lives on for future generations. 
Find out how your monthly gift can make a difference.
 
Support St John's
 
 
 
￼
 
St John’s Feminist Society: an interview with the President
As the year goes on, there are plenty of activities and societies to become involved with. ‘Life in John’s’ Editor Maddy Chammings interviews the President of St John’s Feminist Society, Martha Thornycroft, to find out more about what they do.
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
Picturing Peace: A Panel Event on the Impact of Imagery
Beyond the Bailey editor, Ruby Pike, recaps the launch of the newly released book ‘Picturing Peace: Photography, Conflict Transformation, and Peacebuilding’.
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
St John’s Opportunities Fund: Erica’s trip to Mexico
Thanks to the St John’s Opportunities Fund, Erica Fox, was able to travel to Mexico to volunteer for a month as an ecology field assistant. Below you can learn more about her quest finding microscopic tardigrades in the Sierra de Juárez mountains.
 
Read More
 
 
 
￼
 
Remembering Johnians 
Nick Gandon  (Combined Arts 1975-1978)  7 July 1956 - 28 February 2025
It is with great sadness that we share the news of Nick’s passing earlier this year, following illness with pancreatic cancer. Fellow Johnian Pete Carr writes: “At John’s Nick was instrumental in getting the bar off the ground or was it underground in one of the college cellars. Nick lived life to the full till the end, delighting in watching his grandson grow, continuing his charitable work.” 
 
Read more

subject: Marshals Required
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 
URGENT! - TT Marshals needed for Wednesdays
As you may know, we started the TT season 4 weeks ago.
The success of the TTs is dependent upon the goodwill of it's volunteers, and thanks to everyone who has helped out so far.  We still need help for the rest of the season.  Most urgently, is this coming Wednesday, 11th June where we still need 5 helpers and also 5 for the 18th June.  We require 8 marshals each week. and still have spaces every week until the 3rd September hill climb.  If you haven't done it before, it's a very simple task.  Apart from being involved and helping the club, marshalling on 2 occasions allows you to qualify for standard membership for next year.  If you want to volunteer for as many as you like, that's ok too.  Thanks for supporting St Ives Cycling Club.  Please email me at stivescc.membership@gmail.com
Remember that a vibrant and inclusive club is nothing without the help and kind efforts of its members.

subject: Gemini 2.5 Pro upgrade 🤖, Eleven v3 🗣️, Cursor’s $9.9B valuation 💰
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-06-06
[RESEARCH] Zero-shot auto-labeling that's 100,000x cheaper and 5,000x faster with near-human performance (Sponsor) 

Manual labeling has long been the most burdensome task in computer vision development.

Voxel51's latest ML research dives into the parameters, confidence thresholds, and configurations that unlock auto-labeling performance. These benchmarks show that zero-shot labeling with foundational models like YOLO-World and Grounding DINO achieves 95% of human performance, at 100,000× lower cost and 5,000× faster speed.
The $ difference: a human annotation service labeling 1.2 million objects would take ~2,470 hours and cost $45,725, versus 27 minutes and $0.42 with Voxel51's Verified Auto Labeling — with similar or better model mAP scores.
>> Read the research
>> Join the webinar for expert analysis 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Gemini 2.5 Pro Gets an Upgrade (1 minute read) 

The updated preview leads all models on several major benchmarks (GPQA, Aider, and LMArena) and addresses regressions in formatting and creativity from the previous 2.5 Pro update. 
Eleven v3: Most Expressive AI Text-to-Speech Model Launched (1 minute read) 

Eleven Labs has launched Eleven v3, an AI text-to-speech model recognized for its expressiveness. It supports a wide range of languages, including Afrikaans, Arabic, French, and Mandarin. This advancement enhances multilingual voice applications. 
Cursor's Anysphere $9.9B Valuation (1 minute read) 

Anysphere, maker of AI coding assistant Cursor, raised $900M at a $9.9B valuation as ARR surged past $500M. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
OpenAI Threat Intelligence Report: June 2025 (35 minute read) 

LLMs aren't giving bad actors fundamentally new capabilities. OpenAI has published 10 examples of models accelerating existing hacking, fraud, and misinformation operations. This includes North Korean actors using GPT to scale fraudulent IT worker schemes, Russian groups developing sophisticated malware, and Cambodian scammers generating multilingual “task scams” promising victims $500/day for liking TikTok posts. 
Latest Advancements in Search and Recommendation Systems (4 hour video) 

This 4-hour session, presented during the AI Engineer World's Fair 2025, covers recent innovations in search and recommendation systems. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Apple Research Finds Critical Limitations in Reasoning Models (20 minute read) 

When OpenAI's o3, Claude, and DeepSeek-R1 were tested in puzzle environments, their performance collapsed beyond certain complexity thresholds, despite generating detailed "thinking" processes. The models exhibit a counterintuitive scaling limit where their reasoning effort actually decreases as problems become more complex, and they fail to improve even when given explicit solution algorithms. 
LLM-Driven Data Annotation (14 minute read) 

To address label uncertainty in LLM-based annotation, this paper introduces a method that captures multiple possible labels and uses a teacher-student framework called CanDist to distill them into a single output. 
Claude Composer CLI (GitHub Repo) 

Claude Composer CLI is a tool that enhances Claude Code with automation, UX, and configuration. It reduces interruptions while giving users flexible control and tools to configure Claude. The tool provides users with system notifications to keep them informed. Users can control which permission dialogs are automatically accepted. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Portraits: personalized AI coaching built alongside real experts (2 minute read) 

Google Labs launched Portraits, an AI coaching tool featuring experts like Kim Scott, to provide AI-driven guidance. The tool uses Gemini's capabilities to simulate expert advice through interactive avatars. 
Introducing Modify Video (3 minute read) 

Modify Video allows professionals to reimagine environments, lighting, and textures in videos without altering motion or performance. It offers tools for restyling, retexturing, and editing specific elements like wardrobe and props. Outperforming competitors, Modify Video maintains motion consistency, offering multiple output variants and using advanced performance signals for high-fidelity creative control. 
⚡
Quick Links
Claude Gov Models for U.S. National Security Customers (1 minute read) 

Anthropic trained custom models for the US government optimized for intelligence and defense use cases that have already been deployed in classified environments. 
Tokasaurus (10 minute read) 

Tokasaurus is a large language model inference engine optimized for throughput-intensive workloads. 
Container Use (GitHub Repo) 

Container Use is a tool that creates development environments for coding agents, enabling multiple agents to work safely and independently with any stack.

subject: Durham Newswire June 2025
body:
All your latest news and events
 
View in browser
 
 
￼
 
 
 
Newswire
June 2025
 
 
 
Do we have the correct details for you?
Current postcode: CB4 3NZ
Current professional position: Senior Technical Engineer
 
Update my profile
 
 
 
Your alumni newsletter 
In May, we paid tribute to the Second World War generation from across the United Kingdom and Commonwealth on the 80th anniversary of Victory in Europe Day with a special evensong service held by Durham Cathedral. 
The Cathedral will also host our forthcoming congregation ceremonies in July, marking the achievements of our graduating students as they transition to become our newest alumni. 
We're taking a comprehensive look at how we engage with our 215K alumni community across the UK and the world. Your input is critical. Have your say in our Global Alumni Survey before the 16 June and help shape the future of alumni engagement at Durham.
Explore our latest news below. 
 
 
￼
 
Alumni return to help our Rugby Club mark 150 years 
 
May saw our men’s and women’s rugby clubs take on the world-famous Barbarians and the North East Women’s Select XV respectively in a celebration of all things rugby.  
Pictured (left to right): Steve Longwell (Glasgow Academicals), Freddie Charles (DURFC scrum-half; 3rd year undergraduate - Economics, Hatfield College), Fred Davies (Doncaster Knights; Durham alumnus – History, Collingwood College, 2013-16). Image courtesy of John Ashton. 
 
Read more and watch the matches
 
 
 
￼
 
On the historic appointment of Pope Leo XIV 
 
Our Theology and Religion experts have offered their comments on the new head of the Catholic Church. 
Pictured: Pope Leo XIV (left) with Professor Anna Rowlands (slightly behind). Image courtesy of Sr. Nathalie Becquart.
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
Truth Tellers 2025: alumnus Sir Harry Evans’ continuing legacy
 
Global leaders in journalism gathered for our annual summit exploring challenges facing press freedom in honour of the late, great Durham University graduate Sir Harry Evans. 
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
Universities for North East England: a UK blueprint
 
The partnership, which consists of Durham, Newcastle, Northumbria, Sunderland and Teesside universities, could be a blueprint for the rest of the UK, an MP has told an event in Parliament.  
Pictured (left to right): Professor Sir David Bell (Vice-Chancellor and Chief Executive, University of Sunderland); Professor Andy Long (Vice-Chancellor and Chief Executive, Northumbria University); Kim McGuinness (Mayor of North East England); Professor Chris Day (Vice-Chancellor and President, Newcastle University); Professor Paul Croney (Vice-Chancellor and Chief Executive, Teesside University); Professor Karen O’Brien (Vice-Chancellor and Warden, Durham University). 
 
Read more
 
 
 
Research to empower and inspire 
 
We conduct innovative and impactful research to transform lives and make a difference globally and locally.
 
￼
 
Professor Chris Stokes (Department of Geography) has led new research suggesting efforts to limit the global temperature increase to 1.5°C may not go far enough to save the world’s ice sheets.
 
Read our latest research

 
 
 
Our Community
 
 
 
￼
 
Congratulations to our latest Dunelmensis Award winners 
 
Alumnus Ralph Grayson was presented with his award while visiting Durham recently. Alumna Kate Davies is due to receive hers over the summer.  
Pictured (left to right): Vice-Chancellor and Warden, Professor Karen O’Brien, with Ralph Grayson 
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
Alumna and MP Carla Denyer returns to visit Durham 
 
Carla Denyer (Mechanical Engineering, St Chad’s College, 2005-09) spoke about her “epiphany moment” decision to dedicate her life to tackling climate change while a student at Durham. 
Pictured (left to right): Vice-Chancellor and Warden, Professor Karen O’Brien; Carla Denyer MP; Professor Simone Abram (Executive Director of Durham Energy Institute); Professor in Practice Andrew Crossland 
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
University spin-out receives prestigious King’s Award for Enterprise 
 
Geoptic was named in the Innovation category and was praised for its pioneering approach to assessing the condition and safety of railway tunnels.  
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
UK Prime Minister leads tributes to Durham alumnus
 
Alumnus Andrew Norfolk (English Language and Literature, College of St Hild and St Bede, 1984-87) was an award-winning journalist who exposed the Rotherham grooming gang scandal in the UK. 
 
Read more
 
 
 
Class Notes
 
We’re proud to celebrate your successes and achievements. Click the button below to read more about what you’ve been up to this month. 
 
￼
 
Will Rosemary Coogan be the first Briton to walk on the Moon?
Dr Rosemary Coogan (MPhys in Physics & Astronomy 2009-13; MSc in Physics, 2014-16; University College) has spent the last six months training at the Johnson Space Center in Houston, Texas. Rosemary was selected by the European Space Agency from over 22,000 applicants to become a new astronaut and the aim is to get her to the International Space Station by 2030. 
The BBC caught up with her in Texas as she went through testing at NASA's Neutral Buoyancy Laboratory to assess her readiness for a spacewalk. 
Image courtesy of ESA – P. Sebirot   Sarah Elliott (Combined Social Sciences, St Chad's College, 2000-03)
Dr Paul Hawkins OBE (BSc in Natural Sciences, 1993-96; PhD in Computer Science, 1996-2000, Grey College)
Nish Kumar (English & History, Grey College, 2004-07)
Why not share your own news with us?
 
Read more

 
 
 
Lifelong learning
We have a wide range of postgraduate study options for you to continue your education and programmes for working professionals.  
You can also browse a range of scholarships, including our alumni fee scholarship and new postgraduate student support scholarship. 
Read more
 
 
 
Get Involved
 
 
 
￼
 
Don’t forget to complete our Alumni Survey 
 
Help us shape the future by sending us your thoughts in our online survey – your opinion matters! Respondents will have the chance to win one of five £100 prizes. 
 
Read more
 
 
 
View all upcoming events
Check our events pages regularly for all the upcoming alumni events across the world, and how you can join in. 
Events calendar
 
 
 
Colleges
 
 
 
￼
 
Our annual telephone appeal with a difference 
 
Our annual telephone appeal raises essential funds to enable our students to embrace their university experience. In 2025, this included specific campaigns from three Colleges. 
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
St John’s College unveils ‘Under the Library’ archaeological display 
 
Find out what was discovered under St John’s College library by Durham University Archaeological Services when the building was being constructed in 2017. 
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
Over 75 years of University College’s ‘Castellum’ magazine 
 
This year’s issue of ‘Castellum’ magazine is now available digitally. Find out more about the bear in space, or explore previous issues dating back to 1948. 
 
Read more
 
 
 
Read more from our Colleges
Explore our College pages to discover the latest news.
Read more
 
 
 
Retail
 
 
 
￼
 
Celebrate your Durham connection 
 
Planning to return to Durham for our graduation ceremonies this summer? Celebrate your connection to the University by ordering from our updated graduation gifts collection. 
 
Shop now
 
 
 
Want to read more?
If you liked these stories, take a look at the latest Durham news, featuring current research and thought leadership, student news, alumni and more.
Explore more
 
 
Durham University takes pride in the achievements and contributions of its 230,000 alumni and supporters. Stories that cite views, talks and published work reflect the individual's contribution in their personal or professional capacity and do not represent the University's position or endorsement.
Newswire is curated by Editorial Group members Lucian Hudson (Chair), Glen Whitehead, Claire Whitelaw, Tristan Alltimes, Vicky Fisher and Debbie Mayne, and assembled by Sophie Algeo and Jo Coombs.
 
If you would like to unsubscribe or change your email preferences, please contact us:
 
￼
 
alumni.office@durham.ac.uk
 
Durham University, Development & Alumni Relations Office, Palatine Centre, Stockton Road, Durham DH1 3LE
 
￼
 
￼
 
￼
 
￼

subject: News & Club Runs
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 

Dear Roger,

North Coast 500

Huge well done to Steve, Nick and Alan on completing Scotland's ultimate road trip this week.  That's 516 miles and around 36,000ft of elevation done in just 7 days with hairpin bends, gradients up to 20% and stunning scenic views of the coast, white sandy beaches, rugged mountains and remote fishing villages.

If you have an epic ride coming up, please remember to wear your club kit, take photos and send them to: StIvesCC.ClubRun@gmail.com 
￼ 

￼ 
2025 TT ENTRY TICKETS HERE
Time Trials
 The club will again be hosting a weekly 10-mile time trial on the N1/10 course up and down the old A1 from Sawtry on Wednesday evenings from the 14th May to 20th August.  ENTRIES BY 2PM ON THE DAY PLEASE.  11th June will be a FREE OF CHARGE 'Come and try it' week! 3rd September is the Hill Climb.  As we still don't have an Events Officer on the Committee, organisation of the TT's has been a team effort behind the scenes. Quite some work has gone into making the TT's easier for anyone to take on in the future. If you can offer to help in anyway, please speak to a committee member or to one of our regular TTer's. All kit and signs are now stored onsite at Sawtry and we have a new website based database that generates start sheets, results and podiums. It's just a case of entering the data and clicking a button. No tech compatibility issues!  Further information and links, including how to ENTER to ride are in the event page on Facebook:  Please support so that we don't see these events lost in future.
Facebook Event Page

￼ 
29th June 2025

This event is subsidised 50% by the club. £10 of food for £5!

Date: Sunday 29th June (Food from 2pm – After the club ride)
Venue: Floods Tavern
Cost: £5 per ticket (Adult/Child)
Whats included: A Burger OR a Hotdog (Vegan/Vegetarian options)
PLUS: Salad, coleslaw, potato salad and chips

Partners and families welcome.
Summer BBQ Tickets

Sunday Club Run

￼ 
8th June 2025

We meet outside The Norris Museum on The Waits, St Ives at 8:45 with the first group leaving at 9:00 prompt.

This week's club run will be heading to Keysoe.

Groups A and B will ride the same route of 57 miles stopping at Keysoe International in Keysoe.

Group C will ride the shorter route of 44 miles also stopping at Keysoe International in Keysoe.*

*The pace of the C group is around 14-16mph giving opportunity to new riders to join us.  Please welcome new riders to this group.
Sunday Long Route - 22 - Keysoe
Sunday Short Route - 132 - Keysoe

Thursday Evening Ride
￼ 
12th June 2025

We meet outside The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen on The Boulevard, Alconbury Weald at 18:15 with the first group leaving at 18:30 prompt

Loops to Polebrook & Glatton
	•	Routes will be here the week before each ride.
	•	Multiple paced groups.
	•	2 routes
	•	25 - 35 miles
	•	No stop ride
	•	The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen will be open until 11pm.
	•	Free Parking available outside The Club gym and near The Pavillion.
	•	New riders are welcomed so please bring a friend.  Membership is required after 2 club rides for insurance purposes.
Thursday Long Route - 181 - Polebrook
Thursday Short Route - 182 - Glatton
Polite Reminders (for all club rides):
	•	Download the route.
	•	Remember your cafe bike locks.
	•	Look after your club mates.
	•	TT/Aero bars are not to be used.

Thank you.


2025
Dates for your Calendar
 
	•	Social Evening (off the bike) - Tuesday 25th February
	•	International Women's Day Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 8th March
	•	Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 12th April
	•	Double Dutch Audax - Saturday 19th April
	•	Easter Club Run - Sunday 20th April
	•	Evening Social Rides (Alconbury) Start - Thursday 1st May
	•	Peaks Away Day Club Run - Sunday 4th May (stay for the weekend, it's a Bank Holiday!)
	•	Evening 10 mile Time Trials Restart (Sawtry) - Wednesday 14th May
	•	FREE OF CHARGE Evening 10 mile Time Trial - Wednesday 11th June
	•	Club Summer BBQ Club Run - Sunday 29th June
	•	Summer Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 19th July
	•	Last Evening 10 mile Time Trial (Sawtry) - Wednesday 20th August
	•	Bank Holiday Weekend Longer Club Run - Sunday 24th August (ideas welcome!)
	•	Last Evening Social Ride (Alconbury) - Thursday 28th August
	•	Dave Nelson Memorial Hill Climb - Wednesday 3rd September
	•	Cafe Ventoux Away Day Club Run - Sunday 7th September
	•	Remembrance Club Run - Sunday 9th Novemeber
	•	Christmas Dress Up Club Run - Sunday 21st December
	•	Festive 500 - Wednesday 24th - 31st December
	•	Winter Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 27th December
	•	Short New Years Eve Ride - Wednesday 31st December
 
	•	SICC hosts Eastern League CX - TBC
	•	Christmas Meal - TBC
	•	AGM & Awards Presentation - TBC

Thought of the week

subject: The Best of Tubular Bells I, II & III, Jake Bugg, Jason Manford plus many more!
body:
Discover our on sale shows
 
Is this email not displaying correctly? View it in your browser.
￼
￼
BOX OFFICE: Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk | Phone: 01223 357851 | Mon - Fri, 10am - 5pm
￼
On Sale This Week
￼
The Best of Tubular Bells I, II & III
￼

9 March 2026 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On sale for CornEx Members: now
On general sale: 06 June 2025, 10 AM
￼
Experience The Best of Tubular Bells I, II & III live. Led by Mike Oldfield’s long-time collaborator Robin Smith, this spectacular show features extended live performances of the iconic albums, plus hit single Moonlight Shadow.
 
Spanning three groundbreaking albums across 17 years, Mike Oldfield’s Tubular Bells is a visionary work that continues to inspire.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
On Sale Now
￼
Jake Bugg - Your Town Tour
￼
23 July 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange

On general sale now
￼
After a sold-out run in 2024, Jake Bugg brings his Your Town Tour to Cambridge Corn Exchange this summer 2025.
 
With two sets—acoustic and electric—Jake will perform fan favourites from Two Fingers to Zombieland, plus standout tracks from his latest album A Modern Day Distraction.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼

Jason Manford
￼

10 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Jason Manford is back with his brand-new live show A Manford All Seasons!
 
Known for his expert observational comedy and “comic gold” (Mail on Sunday), Jason’s latest tour promises plenty of laughs, sharp wit, and warm charm.
 
As seen on Starstruck, The Masked Singer, 8 Out of 10 Cats, Live at the Apollo and more, Jason remains one of the UK’s best-loved comedians. Don’t miss your chance to see him live!
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
The Bon Jovi Experience
￼
19 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Get ready for the ultimate rock ‘n’ roll night as The Bon Jovi Experience comes to the Corn Exchange – the only tribute show officially endorsed by Jon Bon Jovi himself!
 
Relive the glory days of stadium rock with an electrifying live show packed with all the anthems you love – Livin’ on a Prayer, It’s My Life, You Give Love a Bad Name, Always, Bad Medicine and more.
 
With stunning musicianship and powerhouse vocals from frontman Tony Pearce, this is a high-energy tribute that will have you singing and dancing from start to finish.

￼
BOOK NOW
￼
Cian Ducrot
￼
14 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Irish singer-songwriter Cian Ducrot returns with powerful pop anthems and heartfelt storytelling. Following his #1 debut Victory and a GRAMMY win as a co-writer on SZA’s Saturn, Cian’s star continues to rise. With over 1.4 billion streams and sold-out tours across the UK and Europe, he shows no signs of slowing down.
 
With his new album Little Dreaming out on July 11th, don’t miss the chance to see him live on his biggest UK headline tour yet.

￼
BOOK NOW
￼
￼
Shows on sale with Cambridge Live Tickets

￼
The Spitfires
￼
11 October 2025 | Mash, Cambridge
On general sale: 06 June 2025, 10 AM
￼
The Spitfires, a British band formed in 2012, are known for their high-energy performances, sharp melodies, and socially conscious lyrics. They gained a loyal following across the UK and Europe with albums like Response (2015) and Play For Today (2022), and built a reputation for electrifying live shows. After a decade, the original line-up split in 2022 following a sold-out final show at London’s Electric Ballroom. In 2025, The Spitfires have reformed with a new line-up, ready to release fresh material and return with a powerful, relevant sound.

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Wine Gums Comedy Night
￼
4 July 2025 | The Cavendish School
On general sale now
￼
Get ready for a night of laughs as we bring an evening of top-notch stand-up comedy to The Cavendish School.
 
Tonight’s line-up features performances from Danny Ward, Blank Peng, and Tasmin Sarkany, with Joe Wells headlining the evening.
 
All proceeds from the event will go to The Friends of The Cavendish School to support the fundraising campaign for new outdoor gym equipment in the school playground.
 
This is an adults-only event and all attendees must be 18 or over.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼

￼

￼
Music In The Parks
￼
￼
One of the city’s favourite summer traditions makes a welcome return in June when Music in the Parks begins, celebrating the season in musical style in some of Cambridge’s beautiful green open spaces.
 
The six-concert series is free and open to all, taking place on selected Sunday afternoons between 3-5pm from June until September. 
 
The series of six free concerts offers a mix of music, all perfect for a sunny Sunday afternoon. From the infectious ska rhythms of Cambridge’s mighty Big 10, performing their now traditional Jesus Green date; funk, soul and blues; uplifting multi-voiced close harmony choral creations; the joyous sound of jazz and swing; the warm strains of traditional brass on a summery breeze plus, as part of Folk in the City, a special folk music themed concert at Cherry Hinton Hall with The Boxwood Chessmen – a semi-acoustic roots style four-piece band from East Anglia and Middlesex, and award winning indie-folk duo Elizabeth and Jameson.
 
Delicious refreshments will be available to buy from NapolEat Pizza, Aperol van and Cambridge favourite, Jack’s Gelato!
 

Thank you to Cambridge BID for their generous support.

￼
FIND OUT MORE
￼
Discover More
￼
Garden House
￼
￼
￼
￼
We're delighted so many Corn Exchange customers have been enjoying the special restaurant discount offered by our partner, Garden House, which continues throughout spring and summer.
 
Garden House is just a 7-minute walk from the Corn Exchange, making it the perfect spot to enjoy a meal before or after your event. If you haven't already, why not make your night out extra special with this fabulous offer exclusively for Corn Exchange ticket holders!
 
T&Cs apply. Visit website for more info.

BOOK HERE
￼
Want to skip the queues?
￼
The age-old tradition of queuing for interval drinks is becoming a thing of the past at the Corn Exchange.
 
Simply follow this link and place your order in just a few easy steps. Whether you're craving a bag of Haribos, a Coke, a glass of wine, a beer, a ready-mixed cocktail, or an award-winning Saffron Ice Cream, you can sit back, relax, and enjoy the show while your interval drinks and snacks are delivered straight to your seat!
PRE-ORDER NOW
￼
CornEx Membership
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange, run by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council, depends on ticket sales, sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants, and concessions to bring top-quality shows to the city. By becoming a member, you make a significant impact, helping us continue to deliver the music, comedy, and performances you love. As a thank you, we offer great perks in return.
BECOME A MEMBER
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange is operated by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council. As well as Corn Exchange ticket income, we rely on income raised through sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants and concessions to ensure that we can continue to bring the biggest and best shows to the city.
 
We also organise an annual programme of diverse and greatly valued events including free Fireworks Night, Out of the Ordinary Festival and Music in the Parks. These events are free in order to offer residents the opportunity to participate in the cultural life of the city and to provide access to all. They contribute to creating a united city, ‘One Cambridge - Fair for All’, in which economic dynamism and prosperity are combined with social justice and equality. Again, these events are also an opportunity to develop valued partnerships with local businesses and other organisations that make up the Cambridge Community.
3 Parson's Court, Wheeler Street, Cambridge, CB2 3QE
 
Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk
Phone: 01223 357851

subject: The owls are not what they seem.
body:
￼
￼
Every week, once a week, give yourself a present
Prepare to step between the fir trees and enter the town of Twin Peaks: we're bringing Season 1 of David Lynch & Mark Frost's small screen masterpiece to the big screen this June at Rephouse, as part of our David Lynch's Dream Theatre season. Each week, join us for a pair of episodes to bring you closer to (or further from...) solving one of TV's greatest mysteries: who killed Laura Palmer?

Tickets start from just £8.50, and £5.50 for Members. Aged 16-25? Get £5.99 tickets when you sign up to U25.
Uncover the mystery 
June's Schedule
￼
EPISODES ONE & TWO
Mystery rocks the small town of Twin Peaks, Washington, as the body of Homecoming Queen Laura Palmer is discovered, wrapped in plastic. FBI Special Agent Dale Cooper arrives to solve the case.
Sat 07 Jun  |  Book now 
 
￼
EPISODES THREE & FOUR
As the townsfolk mourn the loss of Laura Palmer in their own ways, Agent Cooper demonstrates an unusual deductive technique for the Twin Peaks Sheriff's Department...
Sat 14 Jun  |  Book now 
￼
EPISIODES FIVE & SIX
The investigation progresses as Agent Cooper reunites with his FBI supervisor Gordon Cole. Together, they encounter more eccentric townsfolk whilst tracking down clues revealed to Cooper in dreams.
Sat 21 Jun  |  Book now 
 
￼
EPISODES SEVEN & EIGHT
The hunt for answers builds to a terrifying conclusion as Cooper's investigation hones in on its prime suspect, who has sordid details to divulge about Laura Palmer's final hours.
Sat 28 Jun  |  Book now 



￼
 
Looking for more Lynch?
We're in the midst of our year-long tribute season, with monthly screenings of his films paired with a handpicked 'Lynchspiration'
Step into the Dream Theatre 
￼
 
A cherry pie that'll kill ya!
Do as Cooper would and treat yourself to a damn fine slice of cherry pie, available with coffee (as black as midnight on a moonless night or otherwise) for £6.50!
￼
 
More of the same?
Can't make it, or after a more intensive viewing experience? Keep your eyes peeled for a marathon-sized announcement coming soon...

subject: Member News: No spoilers
body:
View in browser
￼
￼
￼
Thursday 5 June 2025
Membership number: 1519986
￼
Stage one: done
Member News has turned green once again to celebrate the start of the Lloyds Tour of Britain Women. We've had our first stage winner, but you won't find any spoilers here!
 
If you want to stay up-to-date with the race (and be in with a chance of winning a signed jersey), sign up for our email bulletins. Plus you can follow on social.
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
Happy Volunteers' Week!
￼
To every volunteer that makes cycling happen: thank you! While you may spend your time track-side, up a mountain, in a sports hall or out on the road, your commitment and effort is seen and so appreciated.
 
To every rider: it’s reassuring and a thought-provoking idea that your club or led rides, expert coaching and event experiences can all be attributed to someone simply wanting to do something good for cycling. To these people, we owe a lot.




All about volunteering
Help at a major event
￼
￼

Start or supercharge your volunteering journey
￼
Jump to the poll below and you'll see that a third of respondents are actively volunteering. Whether that's you - or you're interested in supporting cycling in your community, we've just launched funding to give you a boost.  We are committed to creating an inclusive, accessible, and sustainable volunteering pathway across England, and our new bursary provides financial support to new and existing volunteers who want to develop their skills.
Get more info & apply
￼
Paralympic potential
￼
On 29 June we are teaming up with ParalympicsGB - along with athletics, swimming and triathlon - to host an 'Explore your Paralympic Potential Day' at the Harvey Hadden Sport Centre in Nottingham.
 
The event is open to anyone aged 8-28 with an upper or lower limb amputation or limb difference. Expert coaches will support attendees to try out different sports and explore further activities.


Register to attend
￼
￼


Racing round-up
￼
Last weekend it was all about speedway and road racing, with events spanning the country and many titles taken. And the week before that BMX and track series rounds played out in Manchester and Middlesbrough.
 
And we of course say "Bravo Simon!" to celebrate the incredible Giro d'Italia for team Visma | Lease a Bike, and Simon Yates's overall GC victory.
31 May - 1 June round-up
24-26 May round-up
￼
￼

Events coming up
￼
National Series continue apace across several disciplines over the next two weekends. On 7-8 June, the Lloyds National MTB Cross-country Series heads to Tong for Round 4, with the National Youth Omnium Round 4 also underway in Middlesbrough. On Sunday 8 June, the U23 Open Road Series is in Halesowen, with Round 2 of the Grass Track Series in West Suffolk.
 

From 14-15 June the calendar is stacked, with the first round of the Lloyds BMX Freestyle Series heading to Asylum Skatepark, BMX Racing heads to Gosport for Rounds 7 and 8, and the Downhill Series is into Round 3 in Rhyd-y-Felin, and Sprint Futures in Newcastle. The second round of the Lloyds National Disability and Para-cycling Road Series will take place in Moredon. On 15 June, the Youth Circuit Series heads to Scarborough to add to a fantastic weekend of domestic racing action. 
￼
￼

The poll: Results
It's so heartening to see volunteers from across the cycling community represented in British Cycling membership.
 
For those wanting to get involved, check out our volunteering pages or express your interest for helping out at a major event.
￼

subject: ChatGPT record mode ⏺️, Cursor 1.0 1️⃣, Mistral Code 💻
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-06-05
Don't let auth and SSO block your AI app's growth (Sponsor) 

Between model updates, growth targets, and new competitors popping up by the day, you've got more than enough on your plate. Do you really want to pile SSO and SCIM, self-service admin UI, fine-grained authorization, and MFA on top of that?

With Descope, making your app enterprise ready is as simple as drag & drop. No/low code SSO, self-service SSO setup, embeddable UI widgets, and flexible tenant management help you move upmarket while keeping your devs focused.
Databricks, You.com, WisdomAI, and leading AI companies trust Descope with B2B auth. Make your app enterprise-ready in 15 minutes 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
ChatGPT Can Now Read Your Google Drive and Dropbox (2 minute read) 

OpenAI added “record mode” for meeting notes and new integrations for Team, Enterprise, and Edu users. The company now has 3 million paying business users, up from 2 million in February. 
Cursor Releases Version 1.0 (2 minute read) 

The AI code editor now includes BugBot for automatic PR review, Background Agent availability for all users, agent support for Jupyter Notebooks, project-level memories, OAuth-enabled MCP server installation, and in-chat rendering of Mermaid diagrams and markdown tables. 
Mistral Code, a Vibe-coding Client (2 minute read) 

The product combines the Devstral and Codestral models into an IDE assistant. Mistral joins OpenAI, Google DeepMind, and Anthropic in offering coding products, further blurring the line between model developer and app provider. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
AGI Is Not Multimodal (16 minute read) 

The multimodal approach, in which massive modular networks are optimized for an array of modalities that taken together appear general, will not lead to human-level AGI. Instead, we should pursue approaches to intelligence that treat embodiment and interaction with the environment as primary and see modality centered processing as emergent phenomena. True AGI needs a physical understanding of the world, as many problems can't be converted into a problem of symbol manipulation. The most challenging mathematical piece of the AGI has likely already been solved - what's left is to inventory the functions we need and determine how they should be arranged into a coherent whole. 
Codex, Jules, and the Future of Async AI Agents (6 minute read) 

Codex and Jules show how async AI agents can run tasks independently, expanding beyond linear chat interactions. Future agents will support features like intelligent checkpointing, multi-branch exploration, and task-tracking inboxes to manage parallel workflows. Async agents improve cognitive bandwidth by letting users review outputs on their terms without breaking focus. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Airia is the “let's get serious about AI adoption” platform (Sponsor) 

Teams that adopt AI agents are multiplying productivity without adding headcount. Airia is the platform that makes it happen across your organization - with agents and workflows that anyone can build, integrations with all your existing systems, and built-in governance so no one breaks anything. Schedule a hassle-free demo 
Large Language Models Often Know When They Are Being Evaluated (25 minute read) 

Frontier models can distinguish evaluation scenarios from real-world interactions with 83% accuracy, often explicitly reasoning about evaluation indicators like "multiple-choice format" or recognizing specific benchmarks from their training data. More advanced models exhibit "meta-reasoning" - using the fact that researchers were asking about their chain-of-thought transcripts as evidence of being evaluated. This raises concerns that models could underperform on tests or fake alignment during evaluations and behave differently once deployed. 
Cloud Run GPUs, now GA, makes running AI workloads easier for everyone (5 minute read) 

NVIDIA GPU support for Cloud Run, Google Cloud's serverless runtime, is now generally available. Support for GPUs in Cloud Run makes Google Cloud's GPU-accelerated applications simpler, faster, and more cost-effective than ever before. Users are only charged for the GPU resources they consume, down to the second - Cloud Run automatically scales GPU instances down to zero when no requests are received, eliminating idle costs. It features rapid startup and scaling and full streaming support. 
Scientific Reasoning Benchmark (GitHub Repo) 

This repository introduces a benchmark with 239 problems to evaluate LLMs on scientific reasoning tasks involving equation discovery, pushing beyond memorization. 
Introducing our Dev Mode MCP server: Bringing Figma into your workflow (7 minute read) 

Figma's Dev Mode MCP server allows developers to bring context from Figma into agent coding tools. The server provides a more efficient and accurate design-to-code workflow for creating new atomic components, building out multi-layer application flows, and more. It is still in beta. Figma plans to release a slew of updates over the coming months, including features like remote server capabilities and deeper code base integrations. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Inside Meta's Aria Gen 2 Research Glasses (9 minute read) 

Meta detailed the hardware behind its Aria Gen 2 research glasses, which include enhanced cameras, sensors, audio, and compute capabilities. 
Amazon's R&D lab forms new agentic AI group (2 minute read) 

Amazon has formed a new group within its consumer product development arm focused on agentic artificial intelligence. The new group will help develop an agentic AI framework for use in robotic operations. The system will enable robots to hear, understand, and act on natural language commands. It will help turn Amazon's warehouse robots into flexible, multi-talented assistants. 
⚡
Quick Links
OpenAI slams court order to save all ChatGPT logs, including deleted chats (6 minute read) 

A court has issued an order for OpenAI to preserve all ChatGPT user logs after news organizations suing over copyright claims accused the company of destroying evidence. 
Anthropic Cuts Off Claude Access for Windsurf (1 minute read) 

Windsurf's CEO tweeted that Anthropic gave it five days' notice to migrate off of Claude 3.x models following reports that it was nearing an acquisition deal with OpenAI. 
Reddit Sues Anthropic Over AI Training Data Use (1 minute read) 

Reddit has filed a lawsuit against Anthropic, claiming the startup used Reddit content to train AI models without permission or compensation.

subject: Alessia Cara, A. G. Cook, Youth Opportunities & More | Your Summer starts here at Roundhouse
body:
￼ 
Your summer at Roundhouse starts here
Roundhouse Three Sixty may be over, but the energy lives on. Sign up now to be the first to hear about the 2026 festival — and in the meantime, make way for gigs! 
Looking to see more live music this year? We’ve got you covered. With fresh line-ups, unmissable shows, and exciting new creative programmes, summer’s just getting started.
HAPPENING SOON
￼ 
Alessia Cara
Mon 9 June
Alessia Cara returns to the scene with Love & Hyperbole, her boldest, most personal album yet. The Grammy winner dives deep into love’s highs and heartbreaks with raw emotion and timeless melodies. From the reflective Go Outside! to the haunting Dead Man and the soaring Fire, it’s a sonic journey like no other. Produced by Mike Elizondo and Greg Kurstin, and featuring John Mayer on Obvious, this genre-blending album fuses rock, synthwave, and soulful pop. 
Experience Alessia’s powerful new chapter live at Roundhouse. Don’t miss this unforgettable night.

BOOK TICKETS 
UPCOMING GIGS...
￼
Kim Deal
Fri 20 June
A defining voice in alt-rock, Kim Deal steps into the spotlight with her debut solo album, Nobody Loves You More. Written over a decade and shaped by key collaborators like Kelley Deal and the late Steve Albini, the album is a raw, personal journey through memory and reinvention. Don’t miss this landmark Roundhouse show, where an indie icon performs her boldest, most intimate work yet... on her own terms.
	•	
BOOK TICKETS 
￼
A. G. Cook
Thu 9 October 
Join visionary artist and producer A. G. Cook for a boundary-pushing night at Roundhouse. Founder of PC Music and collaborator to icons like Charli XCX and Beyoncé, Cook has shaped the sound of experimental pop. Following the release of his epic third album Britpop, he brings a genre-blurring, high-gloss live set to the stage. Expect glitch, emotion, and innovation from one of music’s boldest creative forces.
BOOK TICKETS 

￼
Ravyn Lenae
Mon 3 November  
Ravyn Lenae is coming to Roundhouse with Bird’s Eye — a bold, bass-rich follow-up to her acclaimed debut HYPNOS. Blending alt-R&B, synth-funk, and house with newfound clarity and confidence, the album explores home, identity, and self-expression. Executive produced by Dahi and praised by Pitchfork and NPR, Ravyn’s in her prime. Don’t miss this headline show from one of the most distinctive voices in modern R&B.
	•	
BOOK TICKETS 
￼
Mew
Tue 9 December
Mew mark 30 years of genre-defying music with a special farewell tour in 2025 — their final shows with frontman Jonas Bjerre. Known for ethereal soundscapes, soaring vocals, and immersive live performances, the Danish trio have built a devoted global following. With eight studio albums and a legacy of innovation, this is a rare chance to experience Mew’s emotional, cinematic world live one last time.
BOOK TICKETS 

GET CREATIVE. GET INSPIRED
We don't just put on unforgettable gigs and performances. Every ticket purchased helps us empower young people with affordable opportunities for ages 11-30 in music, media, performing arts and professional development. 
Are you a creative aged 30 or under looking for new opportunities? Check out what's on below or find more here. 
￼
Men's Group Taster Days
Mon 16 & Mon 23 June | Ages 18-25 
This space is for anyone aged 18–25 who identifies as male (including trans men). Led by youth workers, you'll ease in with games, music-sharing, and short films, then move into open conversations about confidence, pressure, and masculinity. Feel heard in a relaxed, judgement-free space.
MORE INFO 
￼
VJing
Tue 10 - Thu 12 June | Ages 18-25
Explore the history of live VJing and create your own audiovisual piece using industry standard software, live cameras, and sound interaction. Learn from renowned artists, and experiment with loops, samples, and motion to craft immersive visuals.
We're opening up 2 more tickets – join the waiting list to get the chance to book a spot!
MORE INFO 

￼ 
￼   ￼   ￼   ￼   ￼
Roundhouse, Chalk Farm Road, London, NW1 8EH 
© Roundhouse Trust Ltd.
Registered Charity No. 1071487

body:
Global Alumni Survey
 
View in browser
 
 
￼
 
 
 
 
 
￼
 
Share Your Views in our Global Alumni Survey
 
Dear Roger,
We recently emailed you with regards to our Global Alumni Survey and unfortunately included the wrong link to the survey. Please accept our sincere apologies, and find the corrected link below.
We would still love to hear from you – your opinion matters!*
Your experiences and feedback as a member of our global alumni community are incredibly important to us. The insights you share will help shape how we support and engage with alumni like you in the years ahead.
The survey should take around 10 minutes to complete.
[INSTRUCTIONS]
👉 Take the survey now
If the link doesn’t work for any reason, you can copy and paste this URL into your browser: https://research.shift-insight.co.uk/DU-Alumni-2025-L4
Once you have clicked the link above you can start the survey as follows:
   —————————————————————————————————
USERNAME: Input the following number - 916035145 PASSWORD: PLEASE LEAVE THIS FIELD BLANK
—————————————————————————————————
Survey closes: Monday 16 June at 9:00am (BST) Prize draw: Complete the survey for a chance to win one of five £100 prizes (Please note: due to legal restrictions, residents of some countries may not be eligible for the prize draw)
*NOTE: You are receiving this email because records show that you: 
	a.	have ‘partially’ completed the survey, and we would like you to ‘complete’ your survey ASAP using your login - via the link above (progress will be in a ‘saved’ state), or

Thank you in advance for sharing your feedback and good luck in the prize draw.
Best wishes,
Glen Whitehead  Director Development and Alumni Engagement Durham University #DUalumnisurvey2025

subject: NotebookLM Updates 📓, GitHub Copilot Spaces 💻, longer AI timelines ⌛
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-06-04
How Delve generated $1M in pipeline from just 4 TLDR newsletter ads (Sponsor) 

Delve ran 4 placements across 2 TLDR newsletters and brought in 66 leads, with a meaningful chunk from enterprise. The result: $1M in attributed pipeline and a 52x ROI.

The case study breaks down their strategy, results, and example ads.
Read the Delve case study. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
NotebookLM Now Supports Public Sharing (2 minute read) 

Google's NotebookLM now lets users share notebooks publicly via links. Viewers can interact with AI-generated summaries and questions while source content remains read-only. 
Yoshua Bengio's AI Safety Lab (3 minute read) 

Yoshua Bengio launched LawZero, a nonprofit AI safety lab backed by $30M in funding from major philanthropic donors. 
GitHub Launches Copilot Spaces (2 minute read) 

Spaces allows developers to curate code, documentation, and custom instructions for Copilot, turning it into a subject matter expert that can be shared across organizations. Files and repositories added to Spaces automatically stay updated as code changes. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Efficient Online Learning with TRL and vLLM (36 minute read) 

Hugging Face integrated vLLM directly into TRL to reduce inefficiencies in training with GRPO, an online learning algorithm. 
My AI Skeptic Friends Are All Nuts (16 minute read) 

A veteran developer rails against the many highly-skilled programmers still rejecting LLMs based on experiences with early chatbots, missing how modern coding agents autonomously navigate codebases, run tests, and iterate on failures. He dismisses common objections: developers already review all code before merging regardless of source, and hallucinations become irrelevant when agents can automatically compile, catch errors, and retry until tests pass. LLMs might displace developers but software engineers similarly automated away administrative roles like travel agents, record store clerks, and countless other professions. 
Why I have slightly longer timelines than some of my guests (17 minute read) 

AI progress over the last decade has been driven by scaling training compute of frontier systems. This can't continue beyond this decade. After 2030, AI progress has to mostly come from algorithmic progress. However, since the low-hanging fruit will have already been plucked, the yearly probability of AGI craters. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
DNA Representation Learning (16 minute read) 

SPACE is a supervised learning method for genomic profile prediction that uses a Mixture of Experts model. 
Diffusion-based Medical Treatments (14 minute read) 

DIME is a diffusion-based model designed to estimate the joint distribution of interdependent medical treatment outcomes. 
JigsawStack Launches Open-Source Deep Research Tool (GitHub Repo) 

The framework orchestrates LLMs, recursive web searches, and structured reasoning to generate reports that would take a human hours or days to complete. JigsawStack offers control over research depth, breadth, model selection, and output formatting while maintaining strong citation transparency. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Vibe-Coding Ideas to Give Startup GTM Teams an Edge (10 minute read) 

A startup advisor demonstrates building a polished ROI calculator for a manufacturing SaaS company in under two hours using Bolt.new, transforming a spreadsheet into an interactive tool that frames value for executives. Other examples include conference scraping tools, meeting prep dashboards, and feature prototyping that previously required engineering teams or expensive agencies but now cost around $70 in monthly subscriptions, arguing this enables non-technical teams to prove value and move faster than competitors. 
When Will We Pay a Premium for AI Labor? (2 minute read) 

AI agents often outperform humans at a fraction of the cost, not yet commanding premium prices due to ongoing technical evolution and perceived risk. Waymo, achieving significant safety improvements, remains cheaper than other options, reflecting a common pricing strategy across startups. However, in scenarios where AI's constant vigilance and processing power are crucial, premium pricing might emerge. 
Predicting and explaining AI model performance: A new approach to evaluation (7 minute read) 

Microsoft researchers developed ADeLe, a framework that predicts and explains AI model performance on new tasks by assessing them across 18 cognitive and knowledge-based scales. ADeLe uncovered limitations in current benchmarks and created detailed ability profiles for various LLMs, highlighting discrepancies in strengths, weaknesses, and specific abilities. The framework showed an 88% accuracy in predicting AI success, promising improvements in AI evaluation, policymaking, and deployments. 
⚡
Quick Links
OpenAI's Vulnerability Reporting (3 minute read) 

OpenAI introduced a policy for coordinated disclosure of third-party software vulnerabilities found by its AI systems. 
Amazon MGM Fast-Tracks Film About Sam Altman's Dramatic OpenAI Firing and Rehiring (1 minute read) 

The studio is eyeing Andrew Garfield to play Altman, with Monica Barbaro (“A Complete Unknown”) as CTO Mira Murati and Yura Borisov (“Anora”) as co-founder Ilya Sutskever. 
Love TLDR? Tell your friends and get rewards! 
Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag! 
https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here. 
Want to advertise in TLDR? 📰 
If your company is interested in reaching an audience of AI professionals and decision makers, you may want to advertise with us. 

Want to work at TLDR? 💼 
Apply here or send a friend's resume to jobs@tldr.tech and get $1k if we hire them! 

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian, Jacob Turner & Sahil Khoja

subject: Hello Developer: Introducing the Apple Design Award winners and finalists.
body:
JUNE 2025
Hello Developer:
WWDC25 Edition 
WWDC25 is just days away! Here’s everything you need to get ready —  and a big announcement to start things off.
￼
APPLE DESIGN AWARDS
Celebrate the 2025
winners and finalists
An artistic puzzler with a wildlife twist. A translation app powered by machine learning and stickers. And a card game that’s been on quite a run. Say hello to the wildly inventive crop of 2025 Apple Design Award honorees.
View this year’s winners and finalists￼

But don’t take our word for it! Download the winners and finalists from the App Store and try them out for yourself.
View the collection on the App Store￼

￼
JUNE 9 – 13
Everything you need to know about WWDC25
The biggest Apple developer event of the year is almost here. Here’s how you can start getting ready now.

Monday, June 9
￼
Watch the Keynote
10 a.m. PT: Be there for the reveal of the latest Apple software and technologies.
Add to calendar￼
￼
Watch the Platforms State of the Union
1 p.m. PT: Dive deeper into the newest advancements for your apps and games.
Add to calendar￼

Throughout the week
￼
Register for group labs (New) 
Join us online for live deep dives into WWDC25’s biggest announcements with Apple engineers and designers. Group lab registrations are available now.
View the schedule and register now￼
￼
Request a one-on-one lab
Prefer some one-on-one time? Request online appointments with Apple experts for guidance on the topics that interest you most. One-on-one lab requests open after the Keynote on Monday, June 9.
Learn more￼
￼
Get set for sessions
New videos about design, tools, and technologies will begin to arrive right after the Platforms State of the Union.
Download the Apple Developer app￼
Subscribe to the Apple Developer YouTube channel￼
￼
Engage with the community
Take part in community activities all throughout WWDC. And join the Apple Developer Forums to be part of the conversation online.
Explore the community￼
Learn more about WWDC25￼

￼
TODAY’S PLAYLIST
Hello again, WWDC
Here’s a hand-curated selection of summer songs to help get you in the mood for an electrifying week.
Listen on Apple Music￼

Share your thoughts
We’d love to hear from you. If you have suggestions for our activities or stories, please let us know.

Precise clip-in/clip-out and a wide, adjustable release tension range. Only 10.5mm stack height and a +53mm q-factor: No compromises, perfect cornering.
