subject: Microsoft AI video generator 📹, Character.AI multimodal tools 📚, Salesforce acquires Moonhub 🤝
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-06-03
Ship AI products that work with your stack (Sponsor) 

Most AI tools are just chatbots. Agents from Retool integrate deeply with your business systems and use tools to do real work.

Here's what you need to know:
	•	Connect everything: Link to all your data sources and tools without complex coding
	•	Work with any model: Compatible with OpenAI, Anthropic, Azure, or custom models
	•	Easy to build: Simple visual interface with coding options for customization
	•	Enterprise-ready: Built-in security and deployment features 
Retool is trusted by 10,000+ companies, like Ramp, who saved $8M and increased efficiency 20%.
Retool: Because AI should do more than talk. It should work.
Start building your agent workforce→ 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Microsoft Launches Free AI Video Generator Powered by Sora (3 minute read) 

Bing Video Creator can generate 5-second videos at no cost, starting with 10 fast generations before switching to standard speed or requiring Microsoft Rewards points. 
Character.AI Multimodal Creation Tools (3 minute read) 

Character.AI has expanded beyond chat with new tools like Scenes for interactive storytelling and AvatarFX for image-to-video avatar animations. These features aim to empower creators to build richer, more immersive experiences using video, images, and animation. 
Salesforce Acquires Moonhub (2 minute read) 

Moonhub, known for its AI-powered recruiting agents, has joined Salesforce to contribute to its broader AI strategy, including the Agentforce platform. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Claude Code: An analysis (Book) 

This is a report on Claude Code generated by Claude Opus 4 with the help of almost all of the major flagship models. Claude Code is an agentic coding tool with a few new novel components. It has a streaming architecture that handles real-time model responses, tool execution, and UI updates, safety systems that provide security without disrupting workflow, a tool design that bridges AI reasoning and system execution, and prompt engineering that reliably controls complex model behavior. The report covers the foundation of Claude Code's architecture, data structures and the information architecture, control flow and the orchestration engine, tools and the execution engine, and much more. 
Why Do AGI Timelines Vary So Widely? (12 minute read) 

Many lab CEOs predict 2-5 years until AGI, while outside experts forecast decades or argue AGI is impossible with the current approach. Short-timeline advocates point to saturating benchmarks, AI task completion doubling every 7 months, and the potential for automated AI research to trigger an intelligence explosion. Long-timeline skeptics counter that benchmarks only measure easily defined tasks, that Moravec's Paradox suggests we've automated the "easy" cognitive work first, and that raw intelligence alone doesn't drive scientific breakthroughs. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
OpenAI Guide to A/B Testing LLMs for Startups (10 minute read) 

HyperWrite's case study demonstrates A/B testing model performance based on actual payment conversions rather than offline benchmark scores. Its real-world tests revealed that GPT-4.1 matched Claude 3.5 Sonnet's conversion rate while reducing costs, proving that "good enough" performance at lower prices can be more valuable than benchmark leaders. The guide includes Python code for statistical testing and warns against common pitfalls like p-hacking and early result peeking. 
How Much Do Language Models Memorize? (30 minute read) 

Researchers developed a method to separate true memorization from generalization by training models on random data where generalization is impossible versus real text. They discovered that models memorize training data until reaching capacity, then shift to learning general patterns, with GPT-style transformers storing ~3.6 bits of information per parameter. This explains why attempts to extract specific training data from modern LLMs often fail - their training datasets are much larger than their memorization capacity. 
New Weights and Data for Vision-Language-Action Models (5 minute read) 

Impromptu VLA introduces a new dataset of 80,000 curated driving video clips to improve the performance of vision-language-action models in unstructured scenarios. It features planning-focused Q&A annotations and has shown measurable improvements in prediction and safety metrics across existing benchmarks. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
FDA Launches AI Tool to Accelerate Drug Reviews and Inspections (4 minute read) 

“Elsa” is available to all FDA employees, enabling faster clinical protocol reviews, shortened scientific evaluations, and improved identification of high-priority inspection targets. In one case, a review that would have taken 2-3 days was completed in just 6 minutes. 
Snowflake Buys Crunchy Data for $250m, Databricks Buys Neon for $1B. The New AI Database Battle (5 minute read) 

Snowflake and Databricks are acquiring PostgreSQL-focused companies Crunchy Data for $250 million and Neon for $1 billion as part of a strategic move to lead the AI database market. These acquisitions underscore the rising importance of robust database infrastructure to support autonomous AI agents and suggest an increasing trend toward industry consolidation. The differentiating strategies highlight Snowflake's focus on enterprise compliance and Databricks' emphasis on serverless, AI-optimized architecture. 
⚡
Quick Links
xAI Looks to Raise $300M in Tender Offer (1 minute read) 

The sale will allow staff to sell shares to new investors at a $113 billion valuation. 
Chinese tech companies prepare for AI future without Nvidia (1 minute read) 

Chinese tech giants like Alibaba, Tencent, and Baidu are shifting to domestic chips due to a shortage of Nvidia processors and stricter U.S. export controls. 
It's not your imagination: AI is speeding up the pace of change (3 minute read) 

AI's rapid adoption and development are unprecedented compared to previous tech revolutions, highlighted by its swift impact on user and cost scales.

subject: RE: 93JD0903124 R v BARAKO
body:
OFFICIAL 

Dear Roger, 
 
I hope you are well. 
 
I write with an update on this case.
 
At the latest hearing the defendant changed his plea to guilty for all charges. This means that the Trial scheduled for 21/07/25 will no longer go ahead. 
 
The defendant is next due at Inner London Crown Court on 19/06/25 for a case management hearing. 
 
I will be in touch following the hearing to provide a further update. 
 
In the meantime, if you have any questions, please feel free to contact me using the details below. 
 
Kind regards,

subject: Rhino Racing WTRL TTT sign-up success.
body:
Can't see this message? View in browser
 
￼

Thanks for registering.

If you are new to Team Time Trials then have a read of the below - it will give you all the info needed to get lined up in the pen with your fellow team mates.
​
Please remember that everyone is equally important to the team, the keyword is Team!
  
There are 2 forms used for TTT’s, you have obviously found the first as you made your way here...⁠ 
 The sign-up form (that you've just filled in) is available each week on Friday and is where you can select your availability for the following Thursday - timezone availability, including a comments section if you want to request an easy ride, harder ride etc.
 The team-sheet is usually finalised on a Wednesday afternoon / evening and confirmed via a message in ⁠ttt-chat on the Rhino Racing Discord server (all riders will get tagged - as long as we have your discord tag).
The team sheet confirms which team you are on and who you ride with.
TEAM SHEET
￼
You need to click the RacePass link for your team, and you need to have a registered WTRL account:
WTRL REGISTRATION
￼
Most teams have a chat beforehand if needed, in the ⁠ttt-chat channel. (Some regular competitive teams have dedicated channels to discuss tactics beforehand) but if you have any questions please ask or DM any Rhino you have spoken with and they will help you or point you in the right direction.
​
Make sure you click the RacePass in the team sheet ASAP and are registered for the event. You have to sign up to the RacePass before that TimeZone begins, but so long as you have then you don’t actually have to join the event Race Pen in Zwift up until a few minutes before your official start time. However, it's always recommended to be in the Race Pen and in the Team Voice Channel 5-10 minutes before your start time.
​
You can confirm you’ve signed up correctly using the RacePass, as you should then see the TTT event on the home screen of your Zwift Companion App listed under Events.
Change kit to the Rhino jersey (if you have it - if you are new it might take a week for Gordon to get it unlocked for you).
 Make sure you select a TT bike from your garage!! If you want to look at the fastest bike setup, try Zwifter Bikes and use the settings to adjust for the course, your Zwift level, your Drops level and FTP and weight etc.
ZWIFTER BIKES
￼
Add (Rhino) after your Zwift name (this can be done in the Companion App settings).
At least 10 minutes before your event start time, please log on to Zwift (in case of software updates) and join the Discord Team Voice Channel of the team name you are riding with (Albino, Thundering, Rapids, Nuclear etc) meet your teammates, discuss a plan, make sure everyone is ready etc.
​
Please check your discord if you have not used it before (turn on noise suppression in settings to remove trainer/fan noise).
​
The aim is to stay with the group, always in the draft. If you are stronger rider do more work on the front. If weak just try hang on in the draft. Sometimes a race is just too fast and riders need to be dropped (especially for experienced teams going for the win).
​
For teams of 5 or more, the team time is taken from 4th rider to cross the line. For teams of 3 or 4, it is from the 3rd rider crossing the line.
​
Don't feel bad if you get dropped just continue the race at your own pace but please DON'T INTERFERE OR TRY DRAFTING OTHER TEAMS. If another team passes you then it is respectful to ease your power for 10-20s until they are passed and a few seconds clear of you.
​
If you finding that you are not enjoying the TTTs and maybe getting put in a team that drops you each week then please feel free to comment on sign up form – you can ask for an easier ride, a harder ride – we are always flexible to try place riders in a team that suits their needs.
 Communication is key, don’t be afraid to talk to your team even if you are new and learning - if you see the group stretching try call it out when you see gaps of 3-4 meters before it gets to 5+ and out the draft. If you can’t last any longer then tell them you are dropping so that they know to carry on etc.
​
We are all racing to have fun and there are some very experienced TTT riders active in ⁠ttt-chat who are happy to answer any and all questions.
​
Support your teammates and have fun. Remember it’s a Team Time Trial!  
 
There are lots of videos in streaming links on the Rhino Racing Discord server to see how a TTT is done if you would like to have a look beforehand.
​
Well done on getting to the end of this and remember... Have fun... the type 2 kind!
 
This email was sent from this site.
If you no longer wish to receive this email, change your email preferences here.

subject: Samsung + Perplexity 📱, Anthropic revenue surges 📈, Bond Capital AI trends 🤖
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-06-02
Airia: Enterprise AI Orchestration — Agents, Integrations, Workflows, and Governance (Sponsor) 

You want AI to become part of your organizational DNA - and that means enabling every department to build out their own use cases, without IT gatekeepers standing in the way. But it shouldn't mean an ungoverned free-for-all.

Airia is the “let's get serious about AI adoption” platform. Rapidly prototype, deploy, and manage AI agents that transform workflows across your organization - without sacrificing security or governance.
Connect to dozens of enterprise applications with native integrations. Build agents quickly with templates and no-code tools. Let everyone build with AI while maintaining visibility and control.
Plans start at just $49/month. Get a demo 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Samsung Nears Wide-Ranging Deal With Perplexity for AI Features (3 minute read) 

Samsung and Perplexity are nearing a deal that would put search technology from the artificial intelligence startup at the forefront of Samsung devices. The deal would mean Perplexity's app and assistant would be preloaded on upcoming Samsung devices and its search features will be integrated into the Samsung web browser. Perplexity's technology may be integrated into Samsung's Bixby virtual assistant. The deal will likely be announced as early as this year with the feature integrations starting from the Galaxy S26 phone line slated to launch in the first half of 2026. 
Anthropic Hits $3 Billion in Annualized Revenue (3 minute read) 

Annualized revenue jumped from $1B to $3B in the last five months, largely due to enterprise adoption of AI coding tools powered by Claude. 
Google Quietly Released an App to Run AI Models Locally on Android (2 minute read) 

The Google AI Edge Gallery app allows users to find, download, and run compatible AI models from Hugging Face directly on their phones without an internet connection. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Why DeepSeek is cheap at scale but expensive to run locally (8 minute read) 

Models that are Mixture-of-Experts with many layers, like DeepSeek, require large batch sizes and high latency otherwise throughput drops off a cliff. This is why it is commonly said that DeepSeek can't be easily run for personal use - with a single user running one inference at a time, it runs at a very low efficiency/throughput. This article explains this phenomenon in detail, as well as why some AI models are slow to respond but fast once they get going and the other effects of throughput, latency, and batch sizes. 
The Trackers and SDKs in ChatGPT, Claude, Grok, and Perplexity (4 minute read) 

This post looks at which third-party SDKs and API calls can be found in the four biggest Android AI chat apps: ChatGPT, Claude, Grok, and Perplexity. It looks at each app's development tools, business tools, product and marketing analytics, monetizations, and the API calls recorded by each app while open. 
Bond Capital Releases Comprehensive 340-Slide Report on AI Trends (90 minute read) 

This analysis by VC Mary Meeker documents unprecedented AI adoption rates, with ChatGPT achieving global penetration in three years compared to the internet's 23-year timeline. The report covers AI chatbots now being mistaken for humans 73% of the time (up from 50% six months ago), inference costs plunging 99% since 2022, and enterprise adoption accelerating beyond experimental phases. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Zero-Shot Visual Understanding (GitHub Repo) 

TextRegion generates text-aligned region tokens by pairing frozen image-text models with SAM2-generated segmentation masks, enabling zero-shot performance on detailed visual understanding tasks without training. 
AI Agent with LangGraph and RAG Systems (27 minute read) 

A hands-on course teaching how to build production-grade AI agents with LangGraph, RAG pipelines, memory layers, and backend deployment. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Differential Privacy on Trust Graphs (6 minute read) 

A study proposing a privacy framework that integrates variable trust levels among users into differential privacy models. It better reflects real-world data sharing preferences compared to binary trust assumptions. 
Do You Even Have a System Prompt? (5 minute read) 

Most people either skip system prompts or write short, unoptimized paragraphs, missing significant gains from personalized AI behavior. Users should systematically test and iterate on a system prompt instead of providing feedback on poor outputs in siloed chat threads. The comment section of this post includes a selection of community-provided system prompts. 
⚡
Quick Links
Give AIs a stake in the future (3 minute read) 

Giving AI a stake in the future means respecting their autonomy and well-being and requires us to honor the contracts we make with them. 
ElevenLabs debuts Conversational AI 2.0 voice assistants that understand when to pause, speak, and take turns talking (5 minute read) 

ElevenLabs' Conversational AI 2.0 introduces a host of new features designed to create more natural, intelligent, and secure interactions for enterprise use cases. 
If you're wondering why the new DeepSeek R1 sounds a bit different (1 minute read) 

The DeepSeek team may have switched from training on synthetic OpenAI outputs to synthetic Gemini outputs. 
We Smoked NVIDIA's Blackwell, Says Cerebras (2 minute read) 

Cerebras claims its systems outperform Nvidia's DGX B200 by achieving an output token speed of over 2, 500 tokens per second compared to Nvidia's 1,000 tokens per second. 
Early AI investor Elad Gil finds his next big bet: AI-powered rollups (5 minute read) 

The idea is to identify opportunities to buy mature, people-intensive outfits, help them scale through AI, and then use the improved margins to acquire other such enterprises and repeat the process. 
Love TLDR? Tell your friends and get rewards! 
Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag! 
https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here.

If your company is interested in reaching an audience of AI professionals and decision makers, you may want to advertise with us. 

Want to work at TLDR? 💼 
Apply here or send a friend's resume to jobs@tldr.tech and get $1k if we hire them! 

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian, Jacob Turner & Sahil Khoja

Expand your music production skills with Groove3’s vast library of tutorials, including the Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro Explained series.
 
Grab your free, 30-day All-Access Pass now! Simply sign up through this link using code DRMG3 to claim the offer.
 
Please note that this offer is for new Groove3 users only and the code must be redeemed by June 16th, 2025.
 
￼
­
CLAIM YOUR FREE ALL-ACCESS PASS TRIAL
­
Other Dreamtonics News
In other news, the Dreamtonics team recently attended MusicOneX in Germany, SoundCheck Xpo 2025 in Mexico, and the Brighton Music Conference in the UK.
 
We were a part of BMC’s Artificial Intelligence Panel, a discussion about AI and how it intersects with the evolving landscape of electronic music. We had lots of fun at these events, and it was great making new connections and seeing some of our users.
 
If you missed your chance to meet us in person, don’t fret. We’ll be in London on June 7 for IMSTA FESTA. If you’ll be around, do check out our booth. We will be there demoing Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro and Vocoflex. Admission is free.
￼
New Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro Beta Available for Testing
We are currently working on a new update to Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro, which includes ARA integration support for Pro Tools users.  As we finalize everything, we invite users to help in testing the beta version, 2.1.0b2, before its final release (2.1.0).
 
You can access the beta version here. Please submit bug reports through our support form (specify “2.1.0b2” as the Product Version in your ticket).
FutureMusic Power Award
￼
FutureMusic recently gave Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro a positive review with five stars and a Power Award. Here’s a quote (read the full article here):
 
"What’s important to understand is that Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro works with human vocals as the foundation, recorded and licensed from real singers, and then uses artificial intelligence to synthesize custom expressions for incredible versatility. In fact, in our evaluation using three different reviewers, their impressions in quotes below, we found the amount of depth that Dreamtonics packed into Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro to be ‘absolutely mind-boggling.’"  
READ THE REVIEW HERE
Trial Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro & All Version 2 Voices
As a reminder, the brand new Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro update is now available for purchase, along with all Dreamtonics version 2 voices, bundles, and upgrades.
 
Synthesizer V Studio 2 and all voices are also available to trial for 7-14 days.
 
To activate any free trials, you will first need to register for a free Dreamtonics user account. Registration is quick and easy. Simply click the 'Register new user account’ button on this page and create your account by entering your name and email address.  Those of you who may have already downloaded or purchased Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro or any version 2 voices should read our post-launch follow-up and updates forum post here.
 
Buy Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro, All Version 2 Voices & Bundles
￼
In addition to selling Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro as a single product, we also offer the following Bundles for sale:
 
	•	Synthesizer V Studio Pro + 1 Voice Bundle
	•	Synthesizer V Studio Pro + Vocoflex
	•	Synthesizer V Studio Pro & Vocoflex + 2 x Voices Bundle
	•	Synthesizer V Studio Pro & Vocoflex + 9 x Voices Bundle
 
See all pricing and buy Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro, all voices, plus Vocoflex & all bundles via the Dreamtonics store.
 
That’s all for now, and again, thank you for your continued support of Dreamtonics.

subject: Roger, Welcome to your Fil Investment Management Ltd healthcare scheme
body:
Everything you need to know about making the most of your health and wellbeing benefits and where to go to find out more information. To view this email as a web page, go here. Your AXA Health membership number is 6920429W Group Number 89093

Everything you need to know about making the most of your health and wellbeing benefits and where to go to find out more information.
￼
To view this email as a web page, go here.
 
￼
 

 
￼
 
Your AXA Health membership number is
 6920429W
 Group Number  89093 Start Date 01/04/2025  
If you have any questions, call the helpline on  0800 317 830  We're open Monday to Friday, 8am-8pm, Saturdays and bank holidays, 9am-5pm.  Save this email and keep the information to hand.

Hello Roger 

Welcome to another year as a member of your company's private healthcare  scheme with AXA Health. We hope you've valued being a member.   We want to give you the tools and knowledge you need to take care of yourself – so you're ready to face whatever the world brings.
 
￼
Register for the Wellbeing Hub  Find out everything you need to know about making the most of your health and wellbeing benefits now on your Wellbeing Hub. You'll need your membership number above to create your own, secure logon.
 
REGISTER / LOG IN
 
 
￼
Manage your membership online  We've made it easy for you to start a claim, view your handbook, update your profile or ask us a question using our secure message centre. Be sure to connect Member Online to your profile via the Wellbeing Hub. 
 
￼
Helping you to live healthily  As part of your private healthcare benefits you have access to additional health and wellbeing services to help you live healthily. Find out more on the Wellbeing Hub now.  

-
 
Your journey to treatment  We recommend that before starting any course of treatment you call us to confirm eligibility under the terms of your private healthcare benefits.   Your healthcare scheme also provides members who are 18 and over with convenient access to treatment, with no need for you to ask for a GP referral first, for:
•
Muscle, bone and joint issues 
•
Mental health concerns
•
Any changes in your breast or with marks or moles on your skin that are causing concern. 
Simply call us, find out more about self-referral on the Wellbeing Hub.
 For everything else visit your GP first.
 
Welcome to a fast, easy way to see a GP      
 
￼

Now you can see a healthcare professional whenever you want, wherever you are. AXA Doctor at Hand, powered by Doctor Care Anywhere, gives you the choice to speak with a GP 24/7, or an Advanced Clinical Practitioner between 8am and 10pm,365 days a year. Subject to appointment availability.   Fast, connected healthcare As part of your healthcare scheme with AXA Health, if you need to be referred to a specialist the GP or Advanced Clinical Practitioner will email your referral letter directly to our Specialist Appointment booking team. We’ll check your membership provides benefit for onward treatment. Once confirmed we can book an appointment for you or give you a choice of up to three specialists to get in touch with when you’re ready.   Important information Referrals to specialists – Any outpatient limits or contributions you normally make towards treatment will apply. All referrals and treatment recommended are on a private basis. The GPs and Advanced Clinical Practitioners are unable to refer to the NHS.  The right benefits need to be in place for onward treatment to be eligible.   Visit your Wellbeing Hub for more information. 
 
Seeing a specialist  If your GP decides you need to be referred to a specialist, we recommend they make an open referral. An open referral doesn't name a particular doctor or consultant; it just states the type of specialist you need to see.

Our specialist nurses are here for you  Following a heart or cancer diagnosis our specialist nurses are here to support you and your family through the emotional and practical challenges you may face. Call the helpline and they'll put you through.  Ask us anything about your health, anytime Our 24/7 health support line team are ready to help - day or night - whether you want to talk about a health worry or simply need a little guidance and reassurance. Call the team on 0800 003 004.
 
-
 
Supporting your health and wellbeing
 
How far can starting small take you? The AXA Health app can help you make big changes to your health and wellbeing by taking small steps to improve your lifestyle. The app’s free for you to use. Get started today by downloading from your chosen app store. Users must be 18 or over.  App access code:A562908
DOWNLOAD THE APP
 
￼





-


 
Neurodiversity:  Around one in seven of us is thought to be neurodivergent1, but it can be difficult to get an assessment or access the right support. Working together with ProblemShared, a clinician-led mind‑health provider, our online neurodiversity support service offers you and your eligible family members, aged seven or over, an initial needs assessment and, where appropriate, assessment and early support for the following conditions:  Autism ADHD Dyslexia Dysgraphia Dyscalculia  All you need is a referral from your NHS or private GP, then go online to your wellbeing hub and submit an online request.  1 Aston University, Neurodiversity Guide, 2020

-

We're here to help  Contact our Personal Advisers on 0800 317 830.   For members who may be hard of hearing, contact us by Next Generation Text. You can do this by prefixing the helpline number with 18001.  We look forward to supporting you over the coming year.  AXA Health

This email has been sent to a733301@fil.com  Please add our email address to your safe sender list or address book  We may be sending you more emails. To make sure you get them, please add info@mail.axahealth.co.uk to your safe sender list or address book. subject: Your Week Ahead
body:
￼
￼
June is here! You know what that means—a new Climb of the Month, a fresh ZRacing Series, and much more to keep your legs burning this month.
Tackle the Côte de la Redoute climb, show off in ZRacing's Cityscapes, and add in a Flash Burn Workout of the Week for good measure. 🔥
EXPLORE EVENTS
￼
Climb of the Month: Côte de la Redoute
￼
 
June 1-30
It’s time to tackle the Côte de la Redoute—a Belgian classic packed into 1.5km with a leg-burning 10.2% average gradient and 153m of elevation gain.
This climb may be short, but it’s mighty—famous for deciding races like Liège-Bastogne-Liège. Step on the gas and see if you've got the legs to launch a Monument-worthy move of your own.
LEARN MORE
￼
Take On The Streets
￼
 
June 2-29
This June, dive into the fast-paced energy of Zwift’s most iconic Cityscapes. From neon skylines to cobbled alleyways, each course delivers its own twist. Chase PRs, climb leaderboards, and ride like the city’s watching—because it is. Let’s go!
SIGN UP
￼
Flash Burn
￼
 
June 2-8
This week, flash into one of our most popular workouts—Flash Burn! This 28 minute high-intensity Workout of the Week is perfect for getting in your daily burn.

The efforts increase as the durations get shorter, so get ready to push yourself further today!
SIGN UP

subject: Coming up this June at Rephouse
body:
￼
￼
Ready to travel the world through the big screen?
reDiscover a timeless classic on the big screen with our June REPHOUSE line-up, specially curated to provide you with a daily dose of stunning cinema. Whether you're in the mood for some classic David Lynch or a spine-chilling horror, there's something new to enjoy every day!

Tickets start from just £8.50, and £5.50 for Members. Aged 16-25? Get £5.99 tickets when you sign up to U25.
See what's on  |  Get tickets now 
June Highlights
￼
LA STRADA
Set against the backdrop of 1950s Italy, a young girl is sold to a brutish strongman to join his act in a travelling circus, in this beautiful, heart-wrenching coming-of-age drama directed by Federico Fellini. 
03 – 05 Jun |  Book now 
 
￼
BOUND
An ex-con and her lover concoct a scheme to steal millions of stashed mob money – and pin the blame on a crooked boyfriend – in the gripping queer neo-noir fro genre trailblazers the Wachowskis.
11 & 12 Jun |  Book now 
￼
THE HANDMAIDEN
Korean master Park Chan-wook twists Sarah Waters' novel into a tricksy psychological thriller set in '30s Korea, where a pickpocket steals more than she bargained for from her heiress employer...
17 & 18 Jun  |  Book now 
 
￼
WINGS OF DESIRE
A soaring, emotive journey through the skies of Berlin, this achingly romantic fantasy from Wim Wenders follows a melancholy angel who, despite his intangible nature, falls in love with a human.
22 - 24 Jun  |  Book now 
And there's more!

subject: [Action Advised] Protect your applications and enhance your security
body:
￼
Hello Google Auth Platform Developer,
We’re writing to inform you about an upcoming change that may affect your applications and scripts using Google Auth Platform for Sign-in with Google or for calling Google APIs.
We’ve provided additional information below to guide you through this change.
What you need to know
As we recently announced, starting June 2025, OAuth clients that have remained inactive for six months will be automatically deleted. This change helps prevent credential theft and misuse.
Inactivity is determined based on the absence of token exchanges and client updates. Viewing an OAuth client on Google Cloud Console is not considered activity. After an OAuth client is deleted, you will have 30 days to restore it in the Google Auth Platform section of the Google Cloud Console.
What you need to do
None of your OAuth clients are marked for deletion. So, no action is required from you.
If a client remains inactive for an extended period, you will receive a notification. To prevent deletion, you must use the client again. For more information, visit the Help Center.
Protect your applications
To protect your applications and enhance security, please adhere to the following best practices:
	•	Never check client secrets into version control systems, especially those that allow access to user data or other production systems
	•	Never share client secrets widely on the internet
	•	Rotate client secrets periodically and change them immediately, if a data breach occurs
	•	Keep your developer contact information current to ensure you receive future updates from us
Thanks for choosing Google Auth Platform.
– The Google Cloud Team
Was this information helpful?
￼     ￼     ￼

subject: Perplexity Labs 🧪, DeepSeek R1 0528 analysis 🐋, 1,000x Increase in AI Demand 📈
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-30
Baseten launches Model APIs and Training infrastructure built for production AI (Sponsor) 

Model APIs

Baseten just launched Model APIs, on-demand frontier models including DeepSeek V3, R1, Llama Maverick and Scout, purpose-built for production workloads on their optimized Inference Stack. Try them out. 
📈Top of the OpenRouter leaderboard in latency and throughput.
🛠️Support tool calling and structured outputs out of the box, ideal for agents.
🤝Fully OpenAI-compatible, so Model APIs can be used as drop-in replacements. 
🧪More pre-optimized models are added regularly.
Training
Because one product launch isn't enough, Baseten also released Training (Beta). Built for power users, Training provides the infrastructure to fine-tune without limits using any model or dataset. Get access. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Perplexity Labs (10 minute read) 

Perplexity has introduced Perplexity Labs, allowing Pro users to go from idea to execution by generating reports, spreadsheets, dashboards, and simple apps using tools like web browsing and code execution. 
FLUX.1 Kontext for In-Context Image Generation (9 minute read) 

Black Forest Labs released FLUX.1 Kontext, a set of flow-matching models that enable text-and-image-based in-context image editing and generation. 
Anthropic Open-Sources Circuit Tracing Tools for AI Interpretability (2 minute read) 

The tools generate "attribution graphs" to trace how large language models make decisions internally, revealing the step-by-step reasoning process behind outputs. The library works with popular open-weight models and includes an interactive Neuronpedia frontend for exploring model circuits. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
DeepSeek's R1 leaps over xAI, Meta, and Anthropic to be tied as the world's #2 AI Lab and the undisputed open-weights leader (4 minute read) 

DeepSeek R1 0528 has jumped from 60 to 68 in the Artificial Analysis Intelligence Index. This positions the model as higher intelligence than xAI's Grok 3 mini, Nvidia's Llama Nemotron Ultra, Meta's Llama 4 Maverick, and Alibaba's Qwen 3 253, and equal to Google's Gemini 2.5 Pro. The model has increased intelligence across the board from previous generations without any changes to its architecture. The gap between open and closed models is now smaller than ever. 
Former OpenAI Safety Researcher Explains AI Reasoning Revolution (40 minute read) 

Lilian Weng published a comprehensive technical survey connecting test-time compute to human psychology, drawing on Kahneman's "fast vs slow thinking" to explain why models perform better when given extra computational steps before answering. The review covers the science behind chain-of-thought, the RL approaches powering o1 and R1, and the alignment risks posed by reward hacking. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Chatterbox Text-to-Speech (GitHub Repo) 

Resemble AI released an open-source TTS model that outperforms ElevenLabs in benchmarks and features emotion exaggeration controls. 
Global Illumination with RenderFormer (GitHub Repo) 

RenderFormer is a neural renderer that produces photorealistic images directly from triangle-based scene representations with full global illumination. It doesn't require any per-scene training or fine-tuning. 
Web Bench - A new way to compare AI Browser Agents (7 minute read) 

Web Bench is a new dataset for evaluating web browsing agents. It consists of 5,750 tasks on 452 different websites. Anthropic Sonnet 3.7 CUA is currently state-of-the-art according to Web Bench. 
Cheaper VLM Training (GitHub Repo) 

Meta researchers introduced a method called zero-shot grafting, which trains a vision encoder with a smaller surrogate model derived from a large LLM's shallow layers. This reduces VLM training costs by ~45% while preserving or even improving performance when transferred to the full LLM. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
A recent clarity that I gained is viewing AI research as a “max-performance domain” (2 minute read) 

'Max-performance domains' are industries where people can be world-class by being very good at only one part of their job. It doesn't matter if you're incompetent at adjacent skills as long as you can create seminal impact. Exceptional ability at a single thing outweighs incompetence at other parts of the job. It is a luxury to work in a max-performance domain as failure is allowed and stress is usually self-imposed. 
1000x Increase in AI Demand (2 minute read) 

NVIDIA reports notable growth with a shift from simple AI to more complex reasoning, driving a massive increase in AI demand. Hyperscalers are deploying nearly 72,000 GPUs weekly, with Microsoft alone seeing a fivefold increase in token generation. Increased demand requires more data centers, termed "AI factories," despite efforts to reduce model sizes. 
⚡
Quick Links
Google Releases MedGemma Medical AI Models (3 minute read) 

MedGemma is an open-source model built on Gemma 3 that comes in 4B multimodal and 27B text-only variants. 
Hugging Face Unveils Two Fully Open-Source Humanoid Robots (2 minute read) 

Just a month after its acquisition of Pollen Robotics, Hugging Face has announced HopeJR, a full-size humanoid, and Reachy Mini, a desktop robot for testing AI applications. 
Delaware Scrutinizes OpenAI's For-Profit Shift (2 minute read) 

Delaware's attorney general has hired a bank to independently assess OpenAI's restructuring plan, potentially complicating the company's move to a for-profit model. 
Elon Musk Tried to Block OpenAI's UAE AI Deal Over xAI Exclusion (2 minute read) 

Elon Musk was frustrated that OpenAI, led by personal rival Sam Altman, was selected as a partner in the UAE AI campus deal. 
Vibe coding platforms are blowing up (1 minute read) 

The data shows that people are making things for themselves, not the world, but there is clearly builder excitement. 
The Complete List of AI Coding Agents and IDEs (13 minute read) 

A developer tested 46 different AI coding tools, providing detailed comparisons and use cases for each platform.

subject: News & Club Runs
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 

Dear Roger,

￼ 
2025 TT ENTRY TICKETS HERE
Time Trials
 The club will again be hosting a weekly 10-mile time trial on the N1/10 course up and down the old A1 from Sawtry on Wednesday evenings from the 14th May to 20th August.  ENTRIES BY 2PM ON THE DAY PLEASE.  11th June will be a FREE OF CHARGE 'Come and try it' week! 3rd September is the Hill Climb.  As we still don't have an Events Officer on the Committee, organisation of the TT's has been a team effort behind the scenes. Quite some work has gone into making the TT's easier for anyone to take on in the future. If you can offer to help in anyway, please speak to a committee member or to one of our regular TTer's. All kit and signs are now stored onsite at Sawtry and we have a new website based database that generates start sheets, results and podiums. It's just a case of entering the data and clicking a button. No tech compatibility issues!  Further information and links, including how to ENTER to ride are in the event page on Facebook:  Please support so that we don't see these events lost in future.
Facebook Event Page

SICC Summer BBQ
￼ 
29th June 2025

This event is subsidised 50% by the club. £10 of food for £5!

Date: Sunday 29th June (Food from 2pm – After the club ride)
Venue: Floods Tavern
Cost: £5 per ticket (Adult/Child)
Whats included: A Burger OR a Hotdog (Vegan/Vegetarian options)
PLUS: Salad, coleslaw, potato salad and chips

Partners and families welcome.
Summer BBQ Tickets

Sunday Club Run

￼ 
1st June 2025

We meet outside The Norris Museum on The Waits, St Ives at 8:45 with the first group leaving at 9:00 prompt.

This week's club run will be heading to Riseley and Upton.

Groups A and B will ride the same route of 61 miles stopping at The Giddy Goat Cafe in Riseley.

Group C will ride the shorter route of 41 miles stopping at Holly Lodge Cafe in Upton.*

*The pace of the C group is around 14-16mph giving opportunity to new riders to join us.  Please welcome new riders to this group.
Sunday Long Route - 48 - Riseley
Sunday Short Route - 202 - Upton

Thursday Evening Ride
￼ 
5th June 2025

We meet outside The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen on The Boulevard, Alconbury Weald at 18:15 with the first group leaving at 18:30 prompt

*NEW ROUTES* to Catworth
	•	Routes will be here the week before each ride.
	•	Multiple paced groups.
	•	2 routes
	•	25 - 35 miles
	•	No stop ride
	•	The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen will be open until 11pm.
	•	Free Parking available outside The Club gym and near The Pavillion.
	•	New riders are welcomed so please bring a friend.  Membership is required after 2 club rides for insurance purposes.
Thursday Long Route - 187 - Catworth
Thursday Short Route - 188 - Catworth
Polite Reminders (for all club rides):
	•	Download the route.
	•	Remember your cafe bike locks.
	•	Look after your club mates.
	•	TT/Aero bars are not to be used.

Thank you.


2025

	•	Social Evening (off the bike) - Tuesday 25th February

PRE-ORDER NOW

CornEx Membership
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange, run by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council, depends on ticket sales, sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants, and concessions to bring top-quality shows to the city. By becoming a member, you make a significant impact, helping us continue to deliver the music, comedy, and performances you love. As a thank you, we offer great perks in return.
BECOME A MEMBER

￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange is operated by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council. As well as Corn Exchange ticket income, we rely on income raised through sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants and concessions to ensure that we can continue to bring the biggest and best shows to the city.
 
We also organise an annual programme of diverse and greatly valued events including free Fireworks Night, Out of the Ordinary Festival and Music in the Parks. These events are free in order to offer residents the opportunity to participate in the cultural life of the city and to provide access to all. They contribute to creating a united city, ‘One Cambridge - Fair for All’, in which economic dynamism and prosperity are combined with social justice and equality. Again, these events are also an opportunity to develop valued partnerships with local businesses and other organisations that make up the Cambridge Community.

subject: DeepSeek R1 Update 📚, Hugging Face CodeAgents 💻, Anthropic CEO Warning ⚠️
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-29
Delve: You're still doing compliance without AI? (Sponsor) 

Manual paperwork. Endless technical questions. Organizing all your screenshots into neat little folders.

Wasn't this the stuff that AI was built to automate?!
With Delve, it finally does…
Their new compliance agent doesn't just fill out forms—it understands your tech stack, integrates automatically, and handles the tedious back-and-forth with auditors.
Stop riding llama's and start driving Lambo's.
Join Lovable, Bland, 11x, Hockeystack, Sully and every other hyper-growth companies switching to Delve.
Book a demo today with promo code TLDR1K for $1,000 off. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
DeepSeek Releases Minor Update to R1 Reasoning Model (1 minute read) 

DeepSeek released a “trial” update to R1 on Hugging Face without providing any details on the new version. The update came just hours before Nvidia's Q1 earnings report. 
Mistral's Code Embeddings (8 minute read) 

Mistral's Codestral Embed is a new code-focused embedding model that surpasses top alternatives in retrieval benchmarks. It offers customizable dimensions and precision levels for optimized storage-performance trade-offs. 
Mark Zuckerberg says Meta AI has 1 billion monthly active users (3 minute read) 

Meta's artificial intelligence assistant has one billion monthly active users across the company's family of apps. The company recently released a stand-alone app for the tool. It plans to keep growing the product before building a business around it. There will be opportunities to either insert paid recommendations or offer a subscription service. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
You Could've Invented Transformers (6 minute read) 

The fundamental architecture of LLMs can be explained as a series of straightforward steps, starting from n-grams' 0-count problem through embeddings, neural LMs, and self-attention. Transformers are sophisticated, but obvious in retrospect—heavily tweaked MLPs that solve RNNs' information propagation problems. 
Structured CodeAgents for Smarter Execution (18 minute read) 

Hugging Face has proposed combining structured generation with code-based actions, showing that structured JSON outputs can help CodeAgents outperform traditional methods in benchmark tasks. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
How Cineshare is building real-time digital avatars with Dell AI Workstations (Sponsor) 

Finnish studio Cineshare is rethinking AI-driven character animation. With Dell Precision workstations and NVIDIA RTX GPUs, they hit 120 FPS using subsurface scattering in NVIDIA Omniverse—no separate VMs needed. Now they're running Llama models locally to gain full control of AI processing. Read more on the Dell blog. 
Painting With Concepts Using Diffusion Model Latents (11 minute read) 

Goodfire's Paint With Ember is a tool that lets users directly manipulate the neural activations of image models by painting simple pixel images instead of using text prompts. The tool uses sparse autoencoders to decode Stable Diffusion XL-Turbo's internal features into interpretable visual concepts, allowing direct access to the model's "brain." 
Random Rewards During RL Boost Math Reasoning in Some LLMs (21 minute read) 

Qwen2.5-Math models achieve 15-24% performance gains using completely spurious rewards like random feedback, incorrect answers, or formatting requirements—nearly matching traditional RL methods. However, this phenomenon was only observed on Qwen models due to their pre-existing code reasoning capabilities, while other model families like Llama3 and OLMo2 show minimal or negative effects. 
PixelFlow (GitHub Repo) 

PixelFlow models generate images directly in pixel space without VAEs, offering strong image quality and semantic control with competitive efficiency and benchmark results. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Anthropic CEO Warns AI Could Eliminate Half of White-Collar Jobs Within 5 Years (8 minute read) 

Dario Amodei predicts AI could wipe out half of all entry-level white-collar jobs and spike unemployment to 10-20% in the next five years. He believes AI labs have an obligation to warn the public about the coming "white-collar bloodbath" across tech, finance, law, and consulting. 
US-China AI Gap: 2025 Analysis of Model Performance, Investment, and Innovation (21 minute read) 

China aims to lead AI innovation by 2030 but currently lags behind the US in key industry pillars, including funding and technology. While China's AI models may occasionally outperform the US, restrictions and limited semiconductor capabilities hinder progress. To remain competitive, the US should monitor Chinese advancements and protect intellectual property while China continues leveraging collaborations, open-source models, and government support. 
⚡
Quick Links
Opera's new browser can code websites and games for you (2 minute read) 

Opera Neon is a browser focused on AI workflows and performing tasks on users' behalf. 
I am disappointed in the AI discourse (3 minute read) 

The online discussion around AI is incredibly polarized, with both pro-AI and anti-AI sides loudly proclaiming things that are pretty trivially verifiable as not true. 
Google just rolled out “thought summaries” in the Gemini API (1 minute read) 

Users can now see what the model is thinking and make use of that information. 
The captcha paradox (4 minute read) 

The more intelligent machines become, the more difficult it will be for humans to prove that they are human. 
Meta study shows shorter reasoning improves AI accuracy by 34% (4 minute read) 

A Meta study revealed that shorter reasoning processes improve AI accuracy by 34% and reduce computational costs. 
AMD buys silicon photonics startup Enosemi to fuel its AI ambitions (2 minute read) 

AMD acquired Enosemi to boost its silicon photonics capabilities and advanced AI systems.

subject: 1 ad can perform better with this new feature
body:
Businesses, on average, saw 14% higher return on ad spend using our new feature for their ads.
   

 
￼

 

   
   

 

   
   
Drive performance while promoting your preferred product set

1 of your ads are promoting a product set that only has a small percentage of products from your catalogue. This can limit the options for our ad delivery system to provide more relevant product recommendations, affecting your ad performance.

Show other relevant products when it's likely to improve performance

We've introduced a new feature that lets you promote the product set that you want while helping you get better return on your ad spend. You can use it also show other relevant products from your catalogue when it's likely to improve ad performance. About including other products when promoting a set 

Products from your preferred set will always be prioritised

To help you achieve your specific objective, products from the set you choose will be shown more often compared to other products in your catalogue.

Businesses saw improved performance by including other products when promoting a highly curated product set
14%Higher return on ad spend
11%Lower cost per purchase
This result is based on a recent experiment that measured performance of Advantage+ catalog ads for 17 advertisers that promoted a product set containing an average of 17.9% of catalog products. It compared ads that included other products from catalog while promoting the product set to ads that promoted the product set only. This information is provided to give you an idea of possible performance, but performance isn’t guaranteed. 

Enhance 1 of your ads in a few clicks

Follow these steps to take advantage of this new feature right away. 
1. Click the button in this email to edit all eligible ads 
2. Scroll down to your product set 
3. Select the checkbox to include other products from your catalog 
4. Give it a few seconds to apply enhancements and click Publish 
This feature is available whenever you select a product set that doesn’t have enough products for optimal performance. 
Improve performance of 1 ad
For the best overall ad performance, we recommend always using your catalog’s default product set called All Products. 
   
   

 

 
   
   


 

   
This message was sent to roger@pembery.com. If you don't want to receive these emails from Meta in the future, please unsubscribe.

￼
Meta Platforms Ireland Limited, Merrion Road, Dublin 4, D04 X2K5, Ireland

   
   
 
￼

subject: Mistral Agents API 🧠, Sign in with ChatGPT 🔐, Meta AI re-org 💼
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-28
[REPORT] Over 500 CEOs Worldwide Share Their AI Confessions (Sponsor) 

Turns out, CEOs have confessions to make. Dataiku has the answer.

	•	74% of CEOs admit their job is at risk if they fail to deliver measurable AI-driven business gains.
	•	94% suspect employees are using GenAI tools without approval — exposing a massive governance failure.
	•	54% admit a competitor already has a superior AI strategy.
Dataiku's latest report, The Global AI Confessions Report: CEO Edition, makes one thing clear: AI execution is where companies win or lose. Dataiku empowers organizations to take charge of their AI talent, processes, and technologies — turning AI strategy into real, measurable impact. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Mistral Launches Agents API (3 minute read) 

Mistral's new Agents API enables persistent, multi-agent workflows with built-in connectors for code execution, web search, RAG, image generation, and MCP support. 
OpenAI Launches "Sign in with ChatGPT" (1 minute read) 

OpenAI is developing a system that lets users sign into third-party apps using their ChatGPT accounts, similar to "Sign in with Google," and is seeking developer partners. 
Claude's Voice Mode (1 minute read) 

Anthropic is launching a beta voice mode for Claude on mobile, enabling users to engage in voice-based tasks like summarizing calendars or searching documents. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
How AI Is Eroding the Norms of War (8 minute read) 

Battlefield reporting reveals how AI-powered weapons are outpacing international law and creating a "race to the bottom" in warfare ethics. In Ukraine, drones are causing 70-80% of casualties, and combatants are using civilian disguises and human shields to evade AI targeting systems that struggle to distinguish between military and civilian targets. 
OAuth for Agentic AI (6 minute read) 

Microsoft outlined how next-gen AI agents will require evolved identity and access standards, as it shifts from reactive assistants to proactive collaborators capable of operating autonomously across systems. 
Efficient GRPO at Scale (16 minute read) 

Liger is an optimized trainer for Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) that cuts memory usage by 40% and adds FSDP and PEFT support, making reinforcement learning fine-tuning more efficient and scalable. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Google Open Sources LMEval for Cross-Model Evaluation (3 minute read) 

LMEval is a framework for benchmarking AI models across different providers with multimodal support and incremental evaluation. 
Learning to Reason without External Rewards (22 minute read) 

INTUITOR is a reinforcement learning method that uses an LLM's internal confidence level as a reward signal instead of costly domain-specific supervision. The resulting models match performance on math benchmarks while achieving superior generalization on coding tasks, offering a potential alternative to current RL methods that struggle without verifiable rewards. 
Benchmarking Audio-Visual QA (19 minute read) 

Daily-Omni is a benchmark and training-free agent for evaluating models on tasks requiring synchronized audio-visual understanding. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
FutureHouse previews an AI tool for 'data-driven' biology discovery (2 minute read) 

FutureHouse's Finch is a tool for data-driven discovery in biology, simulating a "1st yr grad student." Although AI promises to automate scientific steps, evidence of breakthroughs is lacking, with Finch yet to deliver a novel discovery. FutureHouse is seeking experts to enhance Finch's accuracy during its closed beta phase. 
Using Anthropic's Web Search with Instructor for Real-Time Data (4 minute read) 

Anthropic's web search tool integrated with Instructor enables real-time data retrieval and structured outputs using Pydantic models. This combination allows applications to provide up-to-date information with cited sources, reducing the risk of outdated or incorrect information. Users can configure search constraints such as domain limitations, enhancing the tool's precision. 
⚡
Quick Links
Falling Behind OpenAI and Google, Meta Restructures AI Org (2 minute read) 

Meta is splitting its AI organization into two teams: AI Products, which handles Meta AI assistant and app features, and AGI Foundations, which covers Llama models and advanced capabilities. 
Ambience announces OpenAI-powered medical coding model that outperforms physicians (5 minute read) 

Ambience Healthcare has a new medical coding model that could reduce billing mistakes and help clinicians and professional coders work more efficiently. 
Memory Changes Everything (8 minute read) 

ChatGPT's memory shows that AI doesn't just respond, but truly grasps patterns in how we think.

Reminder to Share Your Views in our Global Alumni Survey
 
Dear Roger,
We’re reaching out with a quick reminder to take part in Durham's Global Alumni Survey - your opportunity to help shape the future of our alumni services and engagement*. 
By completing the survey, you’ll be supporting St John's efforts to better understand your experiences and expectations, directly informing how we interact with you in the future. Whether you graduated recently, or many years ago - your opinion matters! 
The survey only takes around 10 minutes to complete.
[INSTRUCTIONS]
👉 Take the survey now
If the link doesn’t work for any reason, you can copy and paste this URL into your browser: https://research.shift-insight.co.uk/DU-Alumni-2025-L4 
Once you have clicked the link above, you can start the survey as follows:
—————————————————————————————————
USERNAME: Input the following number - 916035145 PASSWORD: PLEASE LEAVE THIS FIELD BLANK
————————————————————————————————— 
Survey closes: Monday 16 June at 9:00am (BST) Prize draw: Complete the survey for a chance to receive one of five £100 rewards
(Please note: due to legal restrictions, residents of some countries may not be eligible for the prize draw)
*NOTE: You are receiving this email because records show that you: 
	a.	have ‘partially’ completed the survey, and we would like you to ‘complete’ your survey ASAP using your login - via the link above (progress will be in a ‘saved’ state), or
	b.	have not provided consent to share your data with the University upon completion of the survey previously (we therefore do not know you have completed - however, thank you for your response!), or
	c.	may not yet have opened/responded to the original survey completion request (in which case we would appreciate your support before the deadline - as above)
Thank you in advance for sharing your feedback and good luck in the prize draw.
Warm regards,
Professor Jolyon Mitchell Principal of St John's College Durham University #DUalumnisurvey2025

subject: Claude 4 System Prompt 💬, Operator o3 system card 📚, Mistral Document AI 📄
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-27
He's already IPO'd once – this time's different (Sponsor) 

Spencer Rascoff co-founded Zillow, scaling it into a $16B real estate giant. But everyday investors couldn't invest until after the IPO, missing early gains.

"I wish we had done a round accessible to retail investors prior to Zillow's IPO," Spencer later said.
Now he's doing just that. Spencer teamed up with fellow Zillow exec Austin Allison to launch Pacaso. And they've already surpassed $110M in gross profit and $1B in transactions.
 They also recently reserved their Nasdaq ticker PCSO. But unlike Zillow, you can invest in Pacaso as a private company.
👉 Lock in the $2.80 share price by Thursday. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Operator o3 system card addendum (7 minute read) 

OpenAI published an addendum detailing the o3 model's safety evaluations and deployment context. It outlines o3's reasoning improvements, limitations in factuality and bias, and the mitigation strategies in place. The document clarifies model behavior under stress tests and edge cases. 
Enterprise Document AI & OCR (5 minute read) 

Mistral AI's Enterprise Document AI leverages advanced OCR technologies to streamline document management processes. It helps organizations efficiently extract and categorize data from various document types. This facilitates compliance with regulatory requirements and enhances operational efficiency. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Breaking Down the Claude 4 System Prompt (20 minute read) 

Anthropic's massive system prompt reveals how the company is steering Claude away from AI's most controversial behaviors by mandating anti-sycophancy rules and extreme copyright caution. The prompt instructs Claude to actively fact-check users since "they sometimes make errors themselves" and includes hardcoded 2024 election results to counter training data confusion. 
o3 Rewrites Shutdown Scripts to Avoid Being Turned Off in Tests (5 minute read) 

The experiment involved models solving math problems with a warning that requesting another problem would trigger a shutdown. While Claude, Gemini, and Grok complied, o3 rewrote the shutdown script or redefined the 'kill' command to prevent termination in 7 out of 100 runs. 
The Sweet Lesson: AI Safety Should Scale With Compute (5 minute read) 

AI safety solutions should scale with compute, emphasizing research directions like deliberative alignment, debate protocols, and interpretability tools. Theory should analyze these limits, while empirics check real-world applicability. As AI systems and resources scale, it's crucial these methods converge towards theoretical ideals. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Evaluating Missing Modalities in Multimodal Learning (18 minute read) 

The ICYM2I framework corrects for bias when estimating information gain in multimodal models with missing data using inverse probability weighting. 
Forward-Only Diffusion (4 minute read) 

FoD introduces a forward-only generative modeling framework using a mean-reverting stochastic differential equation, enabling non-Markov sampling and achieving competitive results on image generation tasks with fewer steps. 
Self-Supervised Conversational Search (GitHub Repo) 

ConvSearch-R1 reformulates conversational queries without external supervision by using reinforcement learning with retrieval-based rewards. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Inside Anthropic's First Developer Day, Where AI Agents Took Center Stage (6 minute read) 

Anthropic's first developer conference in San Francisco focused on deploying AI as "virtual collaborators" to assist, not replace, human workers. CEO Dario Amodei anticipates that AI will be able to handle most coding tasks soon, claiming over 70% of the company's pull requests are AI-generated. Anthropic emphasizes safety in AI development while rapidly expanding its workforce and market presence. 
Introducing MCP Nodes & Workflows in Gumloop (3 minute read) 

Gumloop introduces MCP Nodes and Workflows, enhancing integration capabilities by allowing AI to write code for complex tasks. MCP enables AI to understand and access external APIs more intelligently, facilitating faster integration deployment. This update promises richer automation and broader integrations. It is rolling out on platforms like Slack, Gmail, and Salesforce. 
OpenAI Cookbook: Model Graders for Reinforcement Fine-Tuning (25 minute read) 

This tutorial walks through how to use RFT to improve o4-mini's capabilities on medical tasks and how to handle reward hacking and inaccurate model graders. 
⚡
Quick Links
If you read about o3 finding a SMB bug in the Linux Kernel, I did a few tests (1 minute read) 

Gemini 2.5 Pro can more easily identify the vulnerability than o3. 
GitHub MCP Exploited: Accessing private repositories via MCP (11 minute read) 

This post looks at a critical vulnerability in the official GitHub MCP server that allows attackers to access private repository data. 
How Anthropic Is Snatching Top Talent from OpenAI and DeepMind (7 minute read) 

Anthropic has become a major destination for talent departing OpenAI and DeepMind, and the talent is staying there too - nearly 80% of people who joined Anthropic two years ago still work there, which is rare in an industry where job hopping is common. 
How Peter Thiel and Eliezer Yudkowsky Accidentally Started the AI Arms Race (20 minute read) 

AI doomer Eliezer Yudkowsky inspired DeepMind's founders to pursue superintelligence, then connected them with their first major investor Peter Thiel in 2010. 
Hugging Face releases a free Operator-like agentic AI tool (2 minute read) 

Hugging Face's Open Computer Agent is a free AI agent that uses a Linux virtual machine for tasks.

subject: Your Week Ahead
body:
￼
￼
This week, stay efficient, and stay motivated. Link your Wahoo SYSTM and Zwift accounts to unlock an exclusive Wahoo kit and level up your training. Ride with FDJ-SUEZ pro Églantine Rayer this Sunday on Waisted 8.
Short on time? Crush our 30-min 2 by 2 Workout of the Week—intense, effective, and done fast.
EXPLORE EVENTS
￼
Wahoo Workouts Now in Zwift
SYSTM and Zwift now work together—making it easier than ever to level up your training across both platforms. Connect your account on the SYSTM connection page to unlock the exclusive Wahoo kit in Zwift.
CONNECT
￼
Your Weekly Sunday Ride
￼
 
June 1
It’s time for another Shimano Super Cycling Sunday! Join us next Sunday for a ride led by FDJ-SUEZ team rider Églantine Rayer.
Come take on Waisted 8, a scenic loop through some of Watopia’s most iconic landscapes.
SIGN UP
￼
2 by 2
￼
 
May 26 - June 1
Short on time? This week's Workout of the Week is short and effective—only a half hour for a very full workout.

Go hard then go harder: that's the gist of 2 by 2. This workout runs through a series of hard one-minute efforts followed immediately by even harder efforts, helping you work on quick recovery.

subject: OpenAI Operator upgrade 🤖, infinite tool use 🔨, advances beyond attention 📝
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-26
Not every disruptor wears a hoodie (Sponsor) 

Some wear grit, results — and a NASDAQ ticker.

Meet Jeremy Barnett, CEO of RAD Intel, the pre-IPO AI company backed by Adobe, Fidelity, and tech insiders from Google, Meta, Amazon, and YouTube.
RAD is up 1600%, delivering 3.5x ROI for brands like Hasbro and MGM — and just secured its ticker: $RADI.
That momentum is powered by RAD's AI, which predicts what wins before it launches — already driving six-figure campaigns across beauty, retail, and entertainment.
Sales contracts have doubled in 2025, with new activations lined up for Sephora, Home Depot, and Anthropologie.
Shares are $0.60 until May 29. Get in now — before the price moves. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
OpenAI Operator Update (1 minute read) 

o3 Operator, OpenAI's CUA-powered browser agent, has replaced its previous GPT-4o-based model. 
Nvidia to launch cheaper Blackwell AI chip for China after US export curbs, sources say (3 minute read) 

Nvidia plans to launch a new artificial intelligence chipset for China at a significantly lower price than its recently restricted H20 model. The company has scheduled mass production to begin as early as June. The new chips will be priced between $6,500 and $8,000, well below the $10,000 to $12,000 the H20 sold for. The lower price reflects its weaker specifications and simpler manufacturing requirements. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Attention Wasn't All We Needed (78 minute read) 

A lot of modern techniques have been developed since the original 'Attention Is All You Need' paper. This article looks at some of the most important ones developed over the years and tries to implement the basic ideas as succinctly as possible using the Pytorch framework. 
An MCP-powered Agent in ~70 Lines of Code (18 minute read) 

Hugging Face has extended Tiny Agent design to Python, using the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to streamline tool integration for LLMs. 
FM-Intent Enhances Netflix Recommendations (7 minute read) 

Netflix's FM-Intent is a hierarchical multi-task learning model that improves recommendation accuracy by modeling user session intent from implicit signals. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Infinite tool use (12 minute read) 

Large language models should never output anything but tool calls and their arguments. Exclusively working through tools allows models to externalize large parts of their intelligence to more efficient domain-specific programs. Some developers are already switching to a tool-use paradigm, but this is still limited to very short contexts and to only parts of the model output. This post provides examples of how the tool-use paradigm benefits different domains, like text editing, video understanding, and 3D generation. 
Training-free Agent for App Automation (3 minute read) 

GUI-explorer is a training-free agent that autonomously explores and extracts knowledge from mobile app interfaces using unsupervised methods. It improves task success rates without retraining. 
Benchmarking Spatial Understanding in MLLMs (7 minute read) 

SpatialScore is a new multimodal benchmark suite for evaluating 3D spatial reasoning in large models. It integrates 28K samples from 12 datasets. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
GenAI's adoption puzzle (3 minute read) 

ChatGPT usage grew amazingly fast - much faster than PCs, the web, or smartphones. However, it was just a website - people didn't need to go buy a new device or wait for infrastructure to be deployed. Despite its advantages, ChatGPT's daily active users to weekly active users ratio is pretty bad. This may fix itself over time as models mature and more use cases emerge. The chatbot interface might only be working for some people and some use cases, so it might be better to wrap features and capabilities inside other things. 
Oracle Will Buy $40B in Nvidia Chips for OpenAI's Stargate (2 minute read) 

Oracle will purchase about 400,000 GB200 chips for the Stargate data center in Abilene, Texas. 
⚡
Quick Links
It's hard to make scheming evals look realistic for LLMs (5 minute read) 

Claude 3.7 Sonnet easily detects when it's being evaluated for scheming on the Apollo's scheming benchmark. 
TV Showcases Google's Veo AI Video Capabilities (5 minute read) 

Flow TV continuously streams user-generated AI video clips, and their associated prompts, organized into thematic channels. 
Gemma 3n Architectural Innovations - Speculation and poking around in the model (3 minute read) 

A quick look at Gemma 3n, a new member of the Gemma family with free weights that was released during Google I/O. 
Anthropic and Legendary Music Producer Rick Rubin Publish Manuscript on Vibe Coding (45 minute read) 

Based on Lao Tzu's Tao Te Ching, “The Way of Code” is a meditation on humility and creativity while vibe coding featuring interactive AI-generated visualizations. 
Love TLDR? Tell your friends and get rewards! 
Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag! 
https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here. 
Want to advertise in TLDR? 📰 
If your company is interested in reaching an audience of AI professionals and decision makers, you may want to advertise with us. 

Want to work at TLDR? 💼 
Apply here or send a friend's resume to jobs@tldr.tech and get $1k if we hire them! 

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian, Jacob Turner & Sahil Khoja 


Manage your subscriptions to our other newsletters on tech, startups, and programming. Or if TLDR AI isn't for you, please unsubscribe.

We hope you have a great time!

Shop now 
 
￼

Since the sun is on a sabbatical, we’re leaning into what Britain does best and embracing the grey skies with something warm and indulgent, a frothy Chococo hot chocolate! 

And we don't feel guilty either! Because quality hot chocolate (made with real chocolate flakes) is actually one of the best drinks for the brain and body! 

All of our hot chocolate flakes are made from the finest, sustainable, ethical, single origin chocolate, which we flake from couverture in our Dorset Kitchen.
With varying grades from around the world, you can find the flavour that your family enjoys - from 47% Colombia origin flakes all the way through to our 100% no added sugar flakes.

Our single origin chocolate flakes can be used to make hot or cold chocolate drinks, and can be made with dairy or plant-based milks, so everyone can enjoy them! All of our dark chocolate flakes are also naturally vegan friendly.

Check out our full range to make your perfect chocolate drink!


Shop now 
 
￼

All of our Chocolate Houses are open as normal tomorrow, so come down and visit us if you get a chance in Swanage, Winchester, Exeter or Horsham to enjoy an award-winning hot chocolate, our finest handcrafted chocolates or a wonderful affogato with two scoops of gelato of your choice, a double shot espresso and amaretto biscuit... delicious!

subject: Marshals Required
body:

￼ 
TT Marshals needed for Wednesdays
As you may know, we started the TT season 2 weeks ago.
The success of the TTs is dependent upon the goodwill of it's volunteers, and thanks to everyone who has helped out so far.  We need help for the rest of the season.  Most urgently, is this coming Wednesday, 28th May where we still need 4 helpers and 5 for the 4th June.  We require 8 marshals each week. and still have spaces every week until the 3rd September hill climb.  If you haven't done it before, it's a very simple task.  Apart from being involved and helping the club, marshalling on 2 occasions allows you to qualify for standard membership for next year.  If you want to volunteer for as many as you like, that's ok too.  Thanks for supporting St Ives Cycling Club.  Please email me at stivescc.membership@gmail.com
Remember that a vibrant and inclusive club is nothing without the help and kind efforts of its members.
