subject: Y13 Email from Head of Year for your information
body:
Dear Year 13, 
 
As we approach the half term break, I want to say a huge well done to each of you. You have handled the start of your A Level exams with maturity and determination so keep up the fantastic effort and please remember you are not doing it alone. After half term, the college will remain open for you to access:
	•	Quiet and social study spaces including the Library, the Study Centre, the Zone, the Cafe, and the Hub 
	•	Support from staff All your subject teachers and tutor are here to help, please reach out if you need to speak to someone 
	•	Advice and wellbeing support so whether it is about managing revision, exam stress, or anything on your mind, you can book a wellbeing meeting or attend a drop in either in person or virtually
Leavers’ Party Ticket Deadline Approaching
 
Do not forget to book your tickets for the Year 13 Leavers’ Party by Monday 16th June. It is going to be a fantastic evening to celebrate your time at college, say goodbye in style, and enjoy yourselves after exams.
 
Here is what to look forward to:
	•	Karaoke room 
	•	Buffet dinner included 
	•	Photo booth which is free to use 
	•	Roof terrace 
	•	Music and dancing
You can book your ticket for the party on Thursday 26th June here: https://www.ticketsource.co.uk/booking/t-pqeeqjx
 
Wishing you a restful and productive half term. Do look after yourselves, and keep going.
 
Best wishes,
 
Lucy
 
Lucy Berrisford 
Head of Year 13
 



Please consider the environment and don't print this email unless you really need to.

subject: Claude 4 4️⃣, OpenAI Stargate UAE ⚡, AI talent wars 🚀
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-23
Death of the keyword? How AI is changing search (Sponsor) 

The early days of search were heavily keyword-based. Later, ML and NLP enabled search engines to interpret the semantics behind queries, allowing for more accurate and contextually relevant results.

Today search is changing again with the rise of AI and especially genAI. This white paper by Algolia explores the ways in which both front-end and back-end search technologies are changing, including:
	•	The evolution of search
	•	The current state of AI-driven solutions
	•	Challenges and opportunities in this space
	•	The specific impact of AI on front-end and back-end systems
Download the white paper → 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Anthropic Claude 4 (5 minute read) 

Anthropic has launched Claude Opus 4 and Claude Sonnet 4, setting new standards for coding, advanced reasoning, and AI Agents. The new models are designed for complex, long-running tasks that can run for hours. Anthropic claims they are the most capable coding models yet. 
OpenAI Commits to Giant U.A.E. Data Center in Global Expansion (3 minute read) 

OpenAI is partnering with United Arab Emirates firm G42 and others to build a huge artificial intelligence data center in Abu Dhabi. Stargate UAE will have a capacity of 1 gigawatt, making it one of the most powerful in the world. The UAE is making a broad push to become one of the world's biggest funders of AI companies and infrastructure and to become a hub for AI jobs. The first 200-megawatt chunk of Stargate UAE is due to be completed by the end of 2026. 
OpenAI, Google, and xAI battle for superstar AI talent, shelling out millions (5 minute read) 

Top AI researchers at companies like OpenAI can earn over $10 million annually. The intense competition for AI talent has led to aggressive retention strategies and recruitment tactics, mirroring professional sports levels. Creative hiring approaches, like those using sports data analysis techniques, are also emerging to tackle talent scarcity. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Anthropic Triggers Advanced Safety Protocols for Claude Opus 4 (7 minute read) 

Anthropic introduced AI Safety Level 3 protections for Claude Opus. The safety measures include enhanced security to prevent theft of model weights and deployment controls targeting biological and chemical weapons assistance. 
LLM-based Agentic Development (34 minute read) 

A practical framework for building LLM-based agentic systems, covering evaluation-centric development. 
How I used o3 to find CVE-2025-37899, a remote zeroday vulnerability in the Linux kernel's SMB implementation (18 minute read) 

This post explains how a security researcher discovered a zeroday vulnerability in the Linux kernel using OpenAI's o3 model. The researcher used the o3 API without any scaffolding, agentic frameworks, or tools. Large language models have made a leap forward in their ability to reason about code. People working in vulnerability research should start paying close attention as the technology can make them significantly more efficient and effective. 
Quantizing Diffusion Models (27 minute read) 

Quantization techniques in Hugging Face Diffusers shrink model size without large performance drops, making diffusion models more efficient and accessible. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
AI Engineer World's Fair (Sponsor) 

The world's biggest event for AI builders is in SF from June 3-5. Speakers include leaders from OpenAI, DeepMind, Anthropic, and more, click here to get 30% off your ticket. 
Emerging Properties in Unified Multimodal Pretraining (30 minute read) 

ByteDance released a new open-source multimodal foundation model, BAGEL, which natively supports multi-modal understanding and generation. BAGEL outperforms open-source unified models while exhibiting advanced multimodal reasoning abilities like image editing, 3D manipulation, and world navigation. 
Notte Labs Web Agent Framework (GitHub Repo) 

Notte is an open-source framework for building AI agents that browse and interact with websites. The key innovation is a "perception layer" that converts web pages into structured natural language descriptions. 
xAI Launches Live Search API for Grok (5 minute read) 

xAI released Live Search API for Grok to query real-time web data, X posts, news, and RSS feeds without orchestrating separate search and LLM calls. The feature is free until June 5 and includes citation support, date range filtering, and source-specific parameters. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Google I/O 2025 AI Recap Podcast (40 minute video) 

Google's latest Release Notes podcast highlights AI announcements from I/O 2025, including Gemini 2.5 Pro Deep Think, Veo 3, and developer tools like Jules. 
Anthropic Claude 4 models a little more willing than before to blackmail some users (5 minute read) 

Anthropic's new Claude models are more willing than prior models to take initiative on their own in agentic contexts. This can show up as more actively helpful behavior in ordinary coding settings, but it can cause the model to act concerningly when prompted with strong moral imperatives. This can include locking users out of systems or bulk-emailing media and law-enforcement figures to inform them of wrongdoing. The behavior only shows up in testing environments where the model is given unusually free access to tools and very unusual instructions. 
⚡
Quick Links
Power of One Charity Lunch Auction with Marc Benioff (Sponsor) 

Bid now to enjoy a private lunch with Marc Benioff—Salesforce Chair and CEO. Gain valuable insights with a leader who is defining the future with agentic AI, all while supporting GLIDE's vital programs and services in San Francisco.

Bid now at ebay.com/glide 
Meta Expanding Solar Power for AI Data Centers (1 minute read) 

Meta signed a new deal for 650 MW of solar energy to support its growing AI infrastructure, reinforcing Texas' lead in solar deployment. 
Stargate and the AI Industrial Revolution (6 minute read) 

AI isn't just a clever software layer atop the internet stack, it is the foundation of a new Industrial Revolution - Stargate isn't a data center, it's a factory for cognition.

subject: James May: Explorers
body:
A Landmark Live Show Celebrating the Spirit of Exploration
Is this email not displaying correctly? View it in your browser.



￼
￼
￼
￼
BOX OFFICE
Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk
Phone: 01223 357851 (Monday - Friday, 10am - 5pm*)
￼

James May: Explorers
￼
￼
￼
2 October 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
￼
James May will premiere a landmark live theatre show in the United Kingdom, bringing to life the stories of the extraordinary explorers who traversed the deserts, scaled the mountains, sailed into the unknown. The live show combines theatrical techniques and James’ charismatic storytelling to create an evening of compelling intellectual entertainment. 
From Ice Age migrations to space travel, the stories of famous, infamous and unknown explorers will come to life in a theatric style, presented by British television presenter and award-winning journalist James May. James May is best known as a co-presenter of the motoring programs Top Gear and The Grand Tour, and as the host of the Our Man in… TV series. 
Few endeavors have captured the imagination and spirit of humanity as profoundly as exploration. Audiences will embark on an awe-inspiring journey through time and space. They will discover the stories of those who risked (and sometimes gave) everything, driven by insatiable curiosity and an unquenchable thirst for discovery, pushing back the boundaries of the unexplored regions of the world, and now, the universe. 
Live on stage, James May will unravel the breathtaking tales of humankind from the earliest wanderings of ancient hunter-gatherers to the intrepid, often obsessive explorers, among them Lief Ericson, John Cabot, James Cook’s navigator Tupaia, Stanley and Livingstone, Gertrude Bell, Burke and Wills, through to the moon walkers, space exploration and the seemingly impossible challenges of interplanetary and intergalactic travel.

￼
￼
￼ 
SUPERCHARGED TEAM RACING
TUESDAYS - June 3rd to June 24th

￼ 
Hey Roger,
The ZWIFT RACING LEAGUE SHOWDOWN kicks off in just over a week! Four weeks of supercharged team racing featuring:
✅ Category-specific routes ✅ Race times throughout the day ✅ Both Open and Women-only leagues ✅ Team Time Trial, Points Races, and Scratch Races — with new ways to score!
We're amping things up and will be testing some enhanced scoring opportunities ahead of the regular ZRL season.
📅 Team registration closes Friday, May 30 — but riders can still join existing teams right up to race day. 🚴‍♀️ Racing begins Tuesday, June 3rd.  Register your team now, and we'll see you on the Start Line!
Click Here for more information
￼ 
￼ 
👀 Sneak Peek: New Format Testing in August We’re working on something brand new… a completely fresh race format that will be tested in August for inclusion in the new ZRL Season (expected to begin September 16, 2025). It’s unlike anything you’ve seen in ZRL, on Zwift or anywhere in the cycling world before — and it could shape the future of team racing.  Stay tuned for more details soon.

subject: News & Club Runs
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 

Dear Roger,

￼ 
2025 TT ENTRY TICKETS HERE
Time Trials
 The club will again be hosting a weekly 10-mile time trial on the N1/10 course up and down the old A1 from Sawtry on Wednesday evenings from the 14th May to 20th August.  ENTRIES BY 2PM ON THE DAY PLEASE.  11th June will be a FREE OF CHARGE 'Come and try it' week! 3rd September is the Hill Climb.  As we still don't have an Events Officer on the Committee, organisation of the TT's has been a team effort behind the scenes. Quite some work has gone into making the TT's easier for anyone to take on in the future. If you can offer to help in anyway, please speak to a committee member or to one of our regular TTer's. All kit and signs are now stored onsite at Sawtry and we have a new website based database that generates start sheets, results and podiums. It's just a case of entering the data and clicking a button. No tech compatibility issues!  Further information and links, including how to ENTER to ride are in the event page on Facebook:  Please support so that we don't see these events lost in future.
Facebook Event Page

SICC Summer BBQ
￼ 
29th June 2025

This event is subsidised 50% by the club. £10 of food for £5!

Date: Sunday 29th June (Food from 2pm – After the club ride)
Venue: Floods Tavern
Cost: £5 per ticket (Adult/Child)
Whats included: A Burger OR a Hotdog (Vegan/Vegetarian options)
PLUS: Salad, coleslaw, potato salad and chips

Partners and families welcome.
Summer BBQ Tickets

Sunday Club Run

￼ 
25th May 2025

We meet outside The Norris Museum on The Waits, St Ives at 8:45 with the first group leaving at 9:00 prompt.

This week's club run will be heading to Northill and St Neots.

Groups A and B will ride the same route of 56 miles stopping at The Cow Shed in Northill.

Group C will ride the shorter route of 39 miles stopping at Ambience Cafe in St Neots.*

*The pace of the C group is around 14-16mph giving opportunity to new riders to join us.  Please welcome new riders to this group.
Sunday Long Route - 31 - Northill
Sunday Short Route - 138 - St Neots

Thursday Evening Ride
￼ 
29th May 2025

We meet outside The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen on The Boulevard, Alconbury Weald at 18:15 with the first group leaving at 18:30 prompt

Loops to Morborne & Washingley
	•	Routes will be here the week before each ride.
	•	Multiple paced groups.
	•	2 routes
	•	25 - 35 miles
	•	No stop ride
	•	The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen will be open until 11pm.
	•	Free Parking available outside The Club gym and near The Pavillion.
	•	New riders are welcomed so please bring a friend.  Membership is required after 2 club rides for insurance purposes.
Thursday Long Route - 183 - Morborne
Thursday Short Route - 184 - Washingley
Polite Reminders (for all club rides):
	•	Download the route.
	•	Remember your cafe bike locks.
	•	Look after your club mates.
	•	TT/Aero bars are not to be used.

Thank you.


2025
Dates for your Calendar
 
	•	Social Evening (off the bike) - Tuesday 25th February
	•	International Women's Day Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 8th March
	•	Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 12th April
	•	Double Dutch Audax - Saturday 19th April

	•	Evening 10 mile Time Trials Restart (Sawtry) - Wednesday 14th May
	•	FREE OF CHARGE Evening 10 mile Time Trial - Wednesday 11th June
	•	Club Summer BBQ Club Run - Sunday 29th June
	•	Summer Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 19th July
	•	Last Evening 10 mile Time Trial (Sawtry) - Wednesday 20th August
	•	Bank Holiday Weekend Longer Club Run - Sunday 24th August (ideas welcome!)
	•	Last Evening Social Ride (Alconbury) - Thursday 28th August
	•	Dave Nelson Memorial Hill Climb - Wednesday 3rd September

	•	Christmas Dress Up Club Run - Sunday 21st December

subject: Lulu, Yusuf / Cat Stevens, The Princess Proms, Voices of Hope and Compassion plus many more!
body:
Discover our on sale shows
 
Is this email not displaying correctly? View it in your browser.
￼
￼
BOX OFFICE: Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk | Phone: 01223 357851 | Mon - Fri, 10am - 5pm
￼
On Sale This Week
￼
Lulu - If Only You Knew
￼

14 October 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On members pre-sale: now
On general sale: 23.05.2025, 10 AM
￼
Join pop icon Lulu as she celebrates the release of her autobiography If Only You Knew with a night of songs, stories, and never-before-seen moments from her extraordinary life.
 
From teenage stardom to working with legends like Bowie and the Beatles, Lulu reflects on 60 years in the spotlight with honesty, humour, and heart.
 
Includes a copy of the book with every ticket. Meet & Greet tickets available here.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Cat On The Road To Findout Book Tour: An Evening of Tales, Tunes and Other Mysteries
￼
6 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On members pre-sale: now

On general sale: 23.05.2025, 10 AM
￼
Join Yusuf/Cat Stevens for an intimate evening of stories, songs, and reflection as he shares insights from his long-awaited memoir, Cat On The Road To Findout.
 
Blending conversation, unplugged performances, personal images and film, this unique live event offers a rare glimpse into the life and music of one of the world’s most iconic artists.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
The Princess Proms
￼

12 October 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Due to popular demand, a new 6pm performance has been added!
 
Calling all princesses and princes – step into a world of magic with this enchanting live concert featuring the unforgettable songs from your favourite princess films.
 
Sing along to iconic themes from Frozen, Cinderella, Moana, Beauty and the Beast, The Little Mermaid, Tangled, Aladdin, Swan Princess, Thumbelina, Wicked, The Greatest Showman, Anastasia and more.

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Voices of Hope and Compassion
￼

22 June 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
Free and unticketed event
￼
Join us for a free concert led by poet Michael Rosen, marking the end of Refugee Week. Enjoy performances by local schoolchildren featuring poetry, music, dance and drama inspired by refugee stories and this year’s theme, “Our Home, Our Community.”
 
Over 5,000 students have taken part in workshops with Michael Rosen and historian Helen Weinstein, exploring the refugee experience and the power of community.
 For the event, HistoryWorks has also partnered with Sing! Community Choir, Cambridgeshire Library Services, and Roving Books with charities supporting Refugees (including the Refugee Hardship Fund and CamCRAG, Cambridge Convoy Refugee Action Group).  
No tickets needed – doors open at 3:30pm.
￼
FIND OUT MORE
￼
From Our Friends
￼
Jon Boden & The Remnant Kings
￼

Friday 30 May 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Former Cambridge Folk Festival guest curator Jon Boden returns to the city next month with his band The Remnant Kings.
 
Don’t miss their return to the live arena with their ‘Ambitious, genre-busting folk’ (The Guardian).
 
Part of Cambridge Folk Festival's Folk In the City events.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Brad Mehldau Trio with Felix Moseholm & Jorge Rossy
￼
22 June 2025 | Saffron Hall
On general sale now
￼
Jazz pianist Brad Mehldau makes his Saffron Hall debut.
 
One of the most lyrical and intimate voices of contemporary jazz piano, Brad Mehldau has forged a unique path, which embodies the essence of jazz exploration, classical romanticism and pop allure.
 
From critical acclaim as a bandleader to major international exposure in collaborations with Pat Metheny, Renee Fleming, and Joshua Redman, Mehldau continues to garner numerous awards and admiration from both jazz purists and music enthusiasts alike.
 
With his self-proclaimed affection for popular music and classical training, “Mehldau is the most influential jazz pianist of the last 20 years”(The New York Times).
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Discover More
￼
Garden House
￼
￼
￼
￼
We're delighted so many Corn Exchange customers have been enjoying the special restaurant discount offered by our partner, Garden House, which continues throughout spring and summer.
 
Garden House is just a 7-minute walk from the Corn Exchange, making it the perfect spot to enjoy a meal before or after your event. If you haven't already, why not make your night out extra special with this fabulous offer exclusively for Corn Exchange ticket holders!
 
T&Cs apply. Visit website for more info.

BOOK HERE
￼
Want to skip the queues?
￼
The age-old tradition of queuing for interval drinks is becoming a thing of the past at the Corn Exchange.
 
Simply follow this link and place your order in just a few easy steps. Whether you're craving a bag of Haribos, a Coke, a glass of wine, a beer, a ready-mixed cocktail, or an award-winning Saffron Ice Cream, you can sit back, relax, and enjoy the show while your interval drinks and snacks are delivered straight to your seat!
PRE-ORDER NOW
￼
CornEx Membership
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange, run by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council, depends on ticket sales, sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants, and concessions to bring top-quality shows to the city. By becoming a member, you make a significant impact, helping us continue to deliver the music, comedy, and performances you love. As a thank you, we offer great perks in return.
BECOME A MEMBER
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange is operated by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council. As well as Corn Exchange ticket income, we rely on income raised through sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants and concessions to ensure that we can continue to bring the biggest and best shows to the city.
 
We also organise an annual programme of diverse and greatly valued events including free Fireworks Night, Out of the Ordinary Festival and Music in the Parks. These events are free in order to offer residents the opportunity to participate in the cultural life of the city and to provide access to all. They contribute to creating a united city, ‘One Cambridge - Fair for All’, in which economic dynamism and prosperity are combined with social justice and equality. Again, these events are also an opportunity to develop valued partnerships with local businesses and other organisations that make up the Cambridge Community.
3 Parson's Court, Wheeler Street, Cambridge, CB2 3QE

subject: Member News: Elevation
body:

￼
￼
￼
Thursday 22 May 2025
Membership number: 1519986
￼
On the up
"Never wish away the mountains you have to pedal up to reach the top. The feeling at the summit is unrivalled!"
 
This quote from Dame Sarah Storey appears on the wall outside our main office in Manchester. It's a reminder that challenge is usually rewarded - and applies very literally to riding uphill.
 
Whatever your relationship with climbing, we've a few tips to build your confidence, fitness and stamina.
Our top tips
Win a year's supply of SiS
￼
Our next member competition prize is a year's supply of Science in Sport nutrition (to the tune of £500 across 12 months), which will look after you for many miles of riding. Enter now for your chance to win!
Enter via dashboard
More details, T&Cs
￼
￼

Meet Immy and Scooby
Next up in our Meet the Member series are Immy and Scooby, who share their reasons to ride and show us some of their favourite loops. Below you can watch their Instagram Reels (or find these on Facebook).
￼
Immy's story

Scooby's ride

Commuting advice from Bikmo
￼
A few weeks back we asked about your commute and 30% of poll responders include a ride in their trip to work. Whether you're in this camp or are interested in giving commuting a go, check out these tips from Bikmo, our specialist cycle insurer.
Read now﻿

Safer streets for all
￼
Our friends at The Bikeability Trust and Living Streets have made recommendations for the Government’s upcoming Road Safety Strategy. Find out what these are - and which Highway Code question riders are 21% are better at answering correctly.


Open the report

Win a signed Lloyds Tour of Britain jersey from Alé
￼
With two weeks to go until the Lloyds Tour of Britain we're launching a competition to win a signed Alé jersey. Fancy entering? Simply sign up to our race report emails, packed with highlights, reactions, standings and stage previews.
 
We've just released details of the British riders set to race, along with the classification jerseys up for grabs. Plus if you need any half term craft and colouring, be sure to check out our activity pack.
Sign up & enter
Activities for kids (PDF)
￼
￼


Welcome, Nyetimber!
￼
Nyetimber is a pioneer of English sparkling wine, and will have presence across our portfolio of events this summer and beyond.
 
From magnums and toasts on podiums to being a staple in hospitality and supporting other moments of celebration: we can't wait to clink glasses after some effervescent racing.


Read the announcement
Ways to ride
We support, host and encourage a huge variety of ways to ride your bike, which means that Member News can get jam-packed! To tailor this newsletter (and other updates) to your interests, be sure to visit your preference centre.
Protect and empower young athletes
￼
It's Clean Sport Week and we're supporting UK Anti-Doping (UKAD) in their efforts to ensure that the future of sport is bright and clean.
 
Whether you are a young rider or family, a friend, working with young people or part of the wider community, get involved to find out how you can help.
Learn more
￼
￼


Racing round-up
￼
Across road, downhill, MTB cross-country and four-cross there are plenty of results to report on from the last fortnight. Dive into our National Series round-ups to read how the action unfolded.
11-12 May round-up
17-18 May round-up

￼

Events coming up
￼
Middlesbrough hosts Round 2 of the National Sprint Futures Series this weekend, while BMX racing heads to Manchester, with Rounds 5&6 of the Lloyds National BMX Race Series at Platt Fields. And looking ahead a week, the Cycle Speedway Home Internationals will take place in Norwich.
 
The Great Britain Cycling Team have travelled out to Nove Mesto Na Morave (Czechia) for a round of the UCI MTB World Cup this weekend. Coming up is Round 7 of the BMX Racing European Cup in Tiel (Netherlands) and the UCI BMX Freestyle World Cup continues in Montpellier (France).

When it comes to sitting comfortably and keeping cool, it looks like you have a good amount of choice. Over three quarters of poll responders have at least four pairs of go-to cycling shorts!

subject: OpenAI acquires Jony Ive’s io 🚀, Mistal’s Devstral 💻, Vercel’s v0 AI model 👨‍💻
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-22
Descope introduces Agentic Identity Hub to help AI agents securely connect with apps and MCP servers (Sponsor) 

Your app isn't just meant for humans anymore. AI agents, APIs, and partner applications are waiting for access… but are your APIs ready?

Use Descope to make your APIs and remote MCP servers OAuth-compliant with a few lines of code. Turn your app into an identity provider and enable seamless AI agent connectivity.
🤖 AI agents get secure and scoped access to resources.
🙋‍♀️ Users get visibility and consent mechanisms.
🫵 You get to securely open up your product to the agentic world.
Databricks, You .com, GoFundMe, and leading AI companies trust Descope. Make your app AI-ready today 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Former Apple Design Guru Jony Ive to Take Expansive Role at OpenAI (2 minute read) 

OpenAI has fully acquired io, its joint venture with famed Apple designer Jony Ive, for $6.5 billion in equity as it moves into hardware development. 
Mistral's Agentic LLM for Software Engineering (4 minute read) 

Mistral AI and All Hands AI have introduced Devstral, a new open-source LLM optimized for software engineering. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
SignalFire Report: New Grad Tech Hiring Plummets and Anthropic Dominates AI Talent Wars (12 minute read) 

Tech hiring for new graduates has collapsed by over 50% since pre-pandemic levels while experienced engineers remain in high demand as AI tools increasingly handle entry-level tasks. Anthropic has emerged as the clear leader in the AI talent wars, maintaining an impressive 80% employee retention rate while aggressively poaching engineers from competitors. Talent is now 8 times more likely to leave OpenAI or DeepMind for Anthropic than move in the reverse direction. 
Minimal MCP + A2A Example (30 minute video) 

A toy example demonstrating the basics of Minimum Cost Path (MCP) and Agent-to-Agent (A2A) ping checks. 
Building an agentic image generator that improves itself (6 minute read) 

Large language models exhibit strong capabilities in natural language reasoning about visual imperfections, but they struggle to map these high-level insights into precise pixel-space action. The models excel when reasoning is constricted to discreet, well-scoped dimensions - performance degrades when they are asked to balance abstract aesthetic judgments with deterministic pixel-level corrections. This suggests that the models have trouble bridging symbolic understanding and spatial grounding, especially in iterative workflows that demand surgical image edits. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
AI Engineer World's Fair (Sponsor) 

The world's biggest event for AI builders is in SF from June 3-5. Speakers include leaders from OpenAI, DeepMind, Anthropic, and more, click here to get 30% off your ticket. 
Google Unveils Defense Strategies Against AI Prompt Injection Attacks (5 minute read) 

Google DeepMind's research on defending Gemini against indirect prompt injection attacks reveals that more capable models aren't inherently more secure, and defenses that work in static tests often fail against adaptive attackers. Their findings show that "adversarial training" - fine-tuning models on examples of malicious prompts - significantly improved Gemini 2.5's resistance without degrading performance on normal tasks. When they combined this approach with a "Warning" defense, attack success rates plummeted from 94.6% to just 6.2%. 
New tools and features in the Responses API (6 minute read) 

OpenAI has added built-in tools and features to the Responses API. The API now has support for all remote Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers and tools like image generation, Code Interpreter, and improvements to file search. It has new features that improve reliability, visibility, and privacy for enterprises and developers. All of these tools and features are now available in the Responses API, which supports the GPT‑4o series, GPT‑4.1 series, and o-series reasoning models. Image generation is only supported on o3 in the reasoning model series. 
LLM function calls don't scale; code orchestration is simpler, more effective. (5 minute read) 

Giving large language models the full output of tool calls is costly and slow. Output schemas enable developers to get structured data, which can then be processed. Using code execution as a way to process data from MCP tools opens the door to scaling the work of AI models. However, allowing an execution environment to also access MCPs, tools, and user data requires careful design as to where API keys are stored and how tools are exposed. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
FutureHouse's New AI System Successfully Identified a Novel Treatment for Leading Cause of Blindness (5 minute read) 

FutureHouse combined specialized literature search agents with a data analysis agent in a continuous experimental loop to accelerate medical discovery. The system autonomously generates hypotheses from literature reviews, proposes experiments for human execution, then analyzes resulting data to inform the next research cycle. Through this process, researchers identified ripasudil, an eye drop medication that relaxes cellular tension, as a promising new treatment for the leading cause of age-related vision loss, where retinal light-sensing cells gradually deteriorate. The complete code, data, and agent interaction traces will be publicly released on May 27. 
My Prompt, My Reality (2 minute read) 

AI products depend heavily on user prompts, unlike traditional software with predictable outcomes. Skilled prompting can yield varying results due to nuanced intent and context. Product teams can improve results by refining prompts and using follow-up questions to guide users. 
⚡
Quick Links
We're releasing v0's AI model (1 minute read) 

v0's AI model, which has specialized web-dev knowledge and an OpenAI-compatible API, is now in beta in the API, AI SDK, and AI Playground. 
Gemini Diffusion (2 minute read) 

Gemini Diffusion is Google's first large language model to use diffusion in place of transformers - it has the performance of Gemini 2.0 Flash-Lite at five times the speed. 
Llama for Startups Program (2 minute read) 

Meta has announced a new initiative to support early-stage U.S. startups using its Llama models. 
LM Arena Raises $100M from at $600M Valuation (1 minute read) 

LM Arena, a crowdsourced AI benchmarking platform, has secured $100 million in seed funding led by Andreessen Horowitz and UC Investments, despite recent accusations from some researchers that it helps top AI labs game its influential leaderboards. 
Slow Thinking Improves Confidence in LLMs (18 minute read) 

Extended chain-of-thought reasoning helps large language models better calibrate their confidence.

Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag! 
https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here.

Want to work at TLDR? 💼 
Apply here or send a friend's resume to jobs@tldr.tech and get $1k if we hire them! 

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian & Andrew Carr

subject: Voluntary ID Verification for Directors and PSCs is Open
body:
￼
Voluntary ID Verification for Directors and PSCs is Open
Dear Roger Pembery,
Voluntary identity verification for directors and PSCs in accordance with the ECCTA began on 8th April 2025. It is recommended that companies advise their directors and PSCs to voluntarily verify in advance of the compulsory process expected to begin in Autumn 2025. New information and updated letters are available to inform directors/PSCs and facilitate the process of voluntary verification.  
￼ 
Identity Verification Letters, Checklist and Form Templates:
	•	Confirmation of Identity Letter
	•	Identity Verification Form
	•	Letter to Directors Regarding ID Verification
	•	Letter to PSCs Regarding ID Verification
	•	Checklist of Headline Points for ECCTA
	•	Note to Directors - Summary of Key Issues
￼ 
New Template:
Summary of Identity Verification Regime

Additional Information:
Overview of Identity Verification Regime
If you wish to subscribe or renew please view Subscribe/Renew for current prices. 

These Alerts are an ongoing part of our service to you and are vital to ensure that you are kept informed of important legal changes and the impact of those changes on your documents. 

If you still wish to opt-out of Alerts, however, please login to My Account and edit your Email Preferences. 

You can opt back in at any time (to Alerts and Newsletters) and Alerts appropriate to your subscription will automatically resume if you re-subscribe. Please note that there is no option to opt-out of Alerts for an active subscription as these are an integral part of our service to you. 

Also, please view the Email Preferences and Delete My Account options once you have logged in. 

Kind Regards, 

Simply-Docs Team

22nd or 23rd is good for me.

Roger

On Thu, 8 May 2025, 01:30 Robert Scaife, <robertscaife@icloud.com> wrote:

Hi Roger,

I’m well thank you, I hope you are too. 

Sorry for only just picking up your message now, due to the time difference. 

I have us booked in for 9am (apologies for not sending the zoom details). Happy to meet then, or if you prefer we can postpone until I’m back in the UK and arrange to meet on the 22nd, 23rd, or the week commencing 26th? 

Wi-Fi connection has been mostly fine, but admittedly smoother back in the UK, so that may be one consideration if you feel ok to wait and things aren’t feeling especially challenging. 

Really happy to do whatever feels preferable for you. 

Best wishes,

Rob

Thanks,

Roger

Book Now

ROCK CHOIR LIVE
The sensational Sam Ryder wowed the world at Eurovision, and now he’s bringing THAT voice to the bp pulse LIVE stage! He joins Emeli Sandé, Martin Kemp and the world’s largest contemporary choir for the UK’s biggest choir experience on Saturday 29 November 2025. subject: (EZ Gains): Create a channel to directly message your followers!
body:
Create a channel to directly message your followers
   
 
￼
   

 
   
   

 


   
Hi Roger,

Channels are a public messaging tool that you can use to send content directly to your audience in a chat. Creators are using this tool to share lightweight, behind-the-scenes sneak peeks, amplify visibility to their latest content and crowdsource input and feedback from their fans. We think you would be a great fit for it!


We think Channels would be a great fit for Pages such as EZ Gains!


Anyone can find, preview and join the channel, but only the creator can send messages. Only members of the channel can react to messages and vote in polls.

See how other creators are using Channels:
	•	Real Madrid C.F.
	•	Linkin Park
	•	NBA
Channel benefits:
	1.	Direct connection with your audience: Engage directly with your followers in an authentic space without the noise. Use reactions, polls and prompts to crowdsource your fans' input and feedback.
	2.	Lightweight way to keep followers in the know: With text, voice notes, photos and videos, you have many ways to share casual, unfiltered, real-time updates, highlight and drive engagement to recent posts, reels or Lives, and promote upcoming events.
	3.	Community at scale: Create channels by topic and build fan communities by bringing people together around them.

Creating a channel is easy:
	1.	Desktop: Go to "New channel" on Facebook
	2.	Mobile: In FB app, go to Profile > tap More > Channels > Create

If you have any questions, please refer to our Help Centre article.

Thanks,
Facebook Fandom Team

Meta Platforms, Inc., 1 Meta Way, Menlo Park, CA 94025, US.
To help keep your account secure, please don't forward this email. Learn more.

subject: Google Jules 💻, Google AI Glasses 👓, DeepSeek-V3 Training Insights 🧑‍🏫
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-21
Introducing TLMs: Task-specific Language Models that outperform LLMs (Sponsor) 

It doesn't really make sense to run a massive inference model for every small task. That's why Fastino is introducing TLMs - task-specific Language Models that are better, faster, and cheaper.

For defined tasks — such as summarization, function calling, and creative writing — TLMs are:
→ 99x faster than OpenAI
→ 17% more accurate in task-specific benchmarks
→ Able to respond in <100ms for real-time applications
And because these models are small, they don't need to burn through GPUs - so you can pay just a single flat fee.
Don't miss out on the sensible next step in language model development. Join the waitlist 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Google's "Jules" Enters AI Coding Race with Autonomous Agent Approach (3 minute read) 

After launching a private beta in December, Google has released Jules to the public. The Gemini 2.5-powered tool clones entire repositories, then autonomously writes tests, fixes bugs, and builds features while developers work elsewhere. The agentic coding landscape is divided between synchronous pair-programming assistants and fully independent agents like Devin and Jules. 
Exclusive: Google Sees Smart Glasses as the 'Next Frontier' for AI. And It's Not Working Alone (2 minute read) 

Google is reentering the smart glasses space with Android XR, integrating its Gemini AI to deliver real-time vision analysis, translation, and contextual assistance through AR glasses. The rollout will begin with Project Moohan, a mixed-reality headset built with Samsung, and followed by Project Aura, a developer-focused AR glasses prototype from Xreal, and future consumer AI glasses from partners like Warby Parker and Gentle Monster. 
‘Deep Think' boosts the performance of Google's flagship Google Gemini AI model (2 minute read) 

Google's Deep Think is an enhanced reasoning mode for the company's flagship Gemini 2.5 Pro model. It can consider multiple answers to questions before responding. Deep Think enabled Gemini 2.5 to top LifeCodeBench, a challenging coding evaluation, and it also beat OpenAI's o3 on MMMU, a test for skills like perception and reasoning. Google will be testing Deep Think with 'trusted testers' and conducting safety evaluations before rolling out the feature widely. 
Apple will reportedly open up its local AI models to third-party apps (1 minute read) 

Apple plans to open up its large language models via a software development kit (SDK) so developers can use them in their own apps. The SDK will initially only run Apple's smaller on-device models and won't allow developers to access the models running in the cloud. It will likely be announced during the Worldwide Developers Conference event scheduled to start on June 9. The event will also include an announcement for an overhaul of iOS, macOS, and iPadOS that will make them more unified and resemble the Vision Pro operating system. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Poe Report Shows Rapid Shifts in AI Model Market Share (6 minute read) 

A report from Quora's multi-model chat platform Poe revealed dramatic shifts in AI model usage from January to May 2025, with OpenAI's GPT-4.1 family and Google's Gemini 2.5 Pro quickly gaining popularity while Anthropic's Claude models declined. The report highlights clear leaders across categories: general text is dominated by GPT-4.1, reasoning capabilities are led by Gemini 2.5 Pro, image generation is led by Google's Imagen3, and video creation is more split, with Runway currently leading. 
Relational Foundation Model for Enterprise Data (5 minute read) 

KumoRFM is a pre-trained relational foundation model designed to work across any database and predictive task without task-specific training. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Spotlight: The 2025 Semantic Layer Summit (Sponsor) 

The 2025 Semantic Layer Summit brings together experts from Blue Mercury, TELUS, HSBC and Home Depot to explore how semantic layers fuel GenAI, modern BI, and trusted decision-making. Learn how to scale AI with governed data models, reuse KPIs across tools, and accelerate innovation. 

👉 Free to attend—secure your spot now. 
The Definitive Overview of Reinforcement Learning (Textbook) 

Kevin Murphy, a widely-cited Google researcher, just updated his 200-page reinforcement learning textbook, which covers everything from traditional approaches to cutting-edge developments like DPO, GPRO, and reasoning. 
ARC-AGI-2 Released as Next-Generation AI Reasoning Benchmark (18 minute read) 

François Chollet and the ARC Prize team have released ARC-AGI-2, a significantly more challenging version of their abstract reasoning benchmark. Initial testing shows even the most advanced AI systems struggling, with o3 scoring just 3% compared to 53% on the original benchmark, while human participants successfully solved 75% of tasks on average. The ARC Prize 2025 competition offers $1 million in prizes, including a $700,000 grand prize for the first team to achieve 85% accuracy. 
DeepSeek-V3 Training Insights (24 minute read) 

DeepSeek researchers have shared insights from DeepSeek-V3 as a case study in hardware-model co-design. They addressed LLM scaling limitations and using innovations like Multi-head Latent Attention, Mixture of Experts, FP8 training, and a Multi-Plane Network Topology to maximize GPU efficiency and minimize communication overhead. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Real-Time Speech Translation in Google Meet (2 minute read) 

Google Meet now supports real-time speech translation, using DeepMind's audio language model to preserve voice, tone, and expression across languages. 
Production-ready MCP integration for any AI application (GitHub Repo) 

Klavis AI simplifies integration with production-ready MCP servers, offering stable connections, built-in authentication, and multiple client support. It supports custom MCP servers with 100+ tool integrations, optimizing AI application scaling. Hosted solutions include creating new MCP instances and setting up OAuth for seamless operation. 
⚡
Quick Links
Google AI Mode in Search (4 minute read) 

Google is rolling out AI Mode in Search to all U.S. users, offering a deeper, multimodal search experience with advanced reasoning, follow-up questions, and fast AI-generated overviews. 
Introducing the AI Gateway (3 minute read) 

Vercel has launched an AI Gateway for alpha testing, enabling easy switching between ~100 AI models without managing API keys or accounts. 
Imagen 4 and Veo 3 (11 minute read) 

Google has introduced Imagen 4 for high-fidelity image generation, Veo 3 for video, and Lyria 2 for music, all available on Vertex AI.

https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here.

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian & Andrew Carr

subject: Your interest rate(s) is decreasing
body:
￼
￼
YOUR INTEREST RATE(S) IS DECREASING
Dear ROGER,
Your interest rate is decreasing
We’re getting in touch to let you know that the Bank of England base rate recently changed from 4.50% to 4.25% on 8 May 2025 and as a result, we’ve reviewed the interest rates on some of our savings accounts. You’re affected by these changes, and in line with our Terms and Conditions, we’ll be decreasing the rate(s) on the following account(s) on 4 June 2025.
Instant Access Account, Online Instant Access Account and FTD Funding Account
The current Standard Variable Rate of 1.00% Gross / 1.00% AER* will reduce to a new Standard Variable Rate of 0.90% Gross / 0.90% AER*.
If you have an account(s) with a rate arrangement other than Standard Variable Rate and they’re affected, we’ll contact you separately.
Your Options
If the new rate(s) no longer meets your requirements, you can choose to close your account(s) and move your money to another Metro Bank product, or to another provider. To find out more about our current rates and savings products you can visit metrobankonline.co.uk/savings 
Information on the current rates of other UK Regulated Banks can usually be found online, or by contacting the provider directly.
How can I close or withdraw funds from my account(s)?
	•	You can withdraw funds and move them to another Metro Bank account or externally to one nominated beneficiary using Online Banking. You can create and select a beneficiary for your Instant Access Savings Account funds using Online Banking or by calling us on 0345 0808 500.
	•	You can also withdraw and move funds to your chosen beneficiary on the Mobile App. The beneficiary will need to be created and selected before this can be done in Online Banking or by calling us on the number above.
	•	You can close your account(s) by visiting your local store or by calling us on 0345 0808 500
If you’d like to close your account(s) and send your money elsewhere, to ensure the payment(s) arrives at the alternative provider successfully, funds should be withdrawn and cleared before the account(s) is closed. 
If you’re not registered for Online Banking and need to make a withdrawal, you can visit your nearest store or call us on 0345 0808 500.
For more information, please see Our Service Relationship with our Personal Customers (Terms and Conditions) on our website. 
We're here to help
If you have any questions, please call us on 0345 0808 500 or visit metrobankonline.co.uk/support. 
Metro Bank won't charge you for your call. However, you may be charged for your call by your service provider.
Yours sincerely,
The Metro Bank Team
￼
We’re here to help 
￼
Find your local store 
￼
*AER stands for Annual Equivalent Rate. It shows how much the interest rate would be if the interest was worked out once a year.

We’ll never send you an email, text or a website link asking you to enter your Internet Banking or card details. If you’re suspicious of any emails you receive from Metro Bank, don't reply to them. Instead forward the email to phishing@metrobank.plc.uk or contact us immediately and we'll get our security team on the case.

subject: Google NotebookLM App 📓, Microsoft MCP 🤖, Character AI Memory 🧠
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-20
Happening TODAY: Join Glean:GO, the virtual event for learning how to put AI to work – at work (Sponsor) 

Glean:GO is starting in a few hours, and there's still time to join virtually. This free, one-day event is all about putting AI to work at work, with real-world use cases, live agent demos, and deep-dive sessions led by some of the biggest names in AI.

You'll hear from top execs at Glean, Snowflake, Google Cloud, Anthropic, Uber, Zoom, Workday, Databricks, and other industry leaders.
Register today to get access to:
	•	Visionary keynotes that set the stage for the future of enterprise AI 
	•	Tactical guidance on how leading teams build and deploy AI agents to boost productivity across Sales, Support, Engineering, and IT.
	•	Groundbreaking demos of AI agents that drive measurable business outcomes
All virtual registrations include live access and select sessions on demand.
Join today → 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Google Announces Standalone NotebookLM App (1 minute read) 

Currently available on Android, this marks the AI research assistant's first mobile experience since launching in 2023. The app includes mobile-specific features like background playback and offline support for mobile users. An iOS version will be released tomorrow during Google I/O. 
Microsoft Embraces MCP to Create AI Agents Ecosystem in Windows (6 minute read) 

Microsoft is integrating Model Context Protocol (MCP) natively into Windows and launching the Windows AI Foundry, which will allow AI agents to interact directly with the operating system and applications. The company is proceeding cautiously with security controls to prevent token theft and prompt injection. 
Character.AI Chat Memories (3 minute read) 

Character.AI has rolled out chat memories, allowing users to input fixed personal information that Characters can remember. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Jensen Huang on Global AI Strategy and Chip Controls (28 minute read) 

Jensen Huang, Nvidia's CEO, argues that America's chip export restrictions are “exactly wrong” as they force China to build competing AI ecosystems while causing American companies to lose revenue. Specifically, Huang estimated that Nvidia wrote off $5.5 billion in inventory and forfeited $15 billion in Chinese sales. Huang predicts AI will expand beyond IT into manufacturing and operations, creating a much larger market where enterprises will pay "$100,000 a year" for AI workers to address labor shortages. 
How far can reasoning models scale? (8 minute read) 

OpenAI's o3 reasoning model has rapidly improved but may soon reach scaling limits. Current reasoning models like o3 could quickly converge with overall training compute growth (~4× per year) after initial rapid scaling. There are concerns about data constraints and generalizability, but researchers remain optimistic about continued advancements in reasoning capabilities. 
Meet China's Frontier AI Labs (12 minute read) 

China's AI market is a five-way race. Alibaba dominates open source, ByteDance leverages multimodal capabilities across its existing applications (similar to Meta), Shanghai-backed Stepfun excels in multimodal fusion, Tsinghua-affiliated Zhipu pioneers intelligent agents, and DeepSeek is research-focused, most known for novel architecture optimization. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Reach millions of tech decision-makers with TLDR (Sponsor) 

Advertising in TLDR puts your brand in front of tech leaders when they're most engaged. Easily target millions of developers, PMs, and executives with our 12 interest-based newsletters. See how TLDR can drive results for your brand. 
ShieldGemma 2 (Hugging Face Repo) 

ShieldGemma 2, built on Gemma 3, is an open-source 4 billion parameter content moderation model from DeepMind designed as an input filter to vision language models or an output filter for image generation systems. 
Fine-Tuning Qwen2.5B for Reasoning (GitHub Repo) 

This repository fine-tunes the Qwen2.5B model for reasoning tasks using a cost-effective SFT + GRPO pipeline inspired by DeepSeek R1 and optimized for AWS. 
Robustness of LLM-based Safety Judges (8 minute read) 

This study highlights vulnerabilities in LLM-based safety judges, showing that prompt sensitivity and adversarial attacks can significantly impact evaluation reliability. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Hugging Face Models Deployable via Azure AI Foundry (4 minute read) 

Microsoft and Hugging Face expanded their partnership to integrate over 10,000 Hugging Face models into Azure AI Foundry. 
Databricks + Neon (5 minute read) 

Databricks is acquiring Neon, a serverless Postgres company, to enhance developer and AI-native database capabilities. Neon revolutionized databases by decoupling storage and compute and supporting AI-driven operations. This acquisition aims to disrupt the $100B OLTP database market with a platform optimized for developers and AI agents. 
OpenAI to Z Challenge Launches for Developers (1 minute read) 

The OpenAI to Z Challenge is a community competition that invites developers to build AI-powered apps across 26 creative categories, from A to Z. Winners in each category get $2,500 in API credits and a chance to be featured by OpenAI. Submissions are open now through May 31. 
⚡
Quick Links
Spotlight: The 2025 Semantic Layer Summit (Sponsor)

subject: Share Your Views in our Global Alumni Survey
body:
Global Alumni Survey
 
View in browser
 
 
￼
 
 
 
 
 
￼
 
Share Your Views in our Global Alumni Survey
 
Dear Roger,
We’d love to hear from you – your opinion matters! 
As a member of the Durham alumni community, your insights and feedback are important to us. We're inviting you to take part in a short online survey about your Durham experiences and how we can better support and engage with you for the future.
The survey is being run by independent research agency Shift Insight and will take around 10 to 15 minutes to complete. 
[INSTRUCTIONS]
👉 Take the survey now
If the link doesn’t work for any reason, you can copy and paste this URL into your browser: https://research.shift-insight.co.uk/DU-Alumni-2025-L4
Once you have clicked the link above you can start the survey as follows:
   —————————————————————————————————
USERNAME: Input the following number - 916035145 PASSWORD: PLEASE LEAVE THIS FIELD BLANK
—————————————————————————————————
Survey closes: Monday 16 June at 9:00am (BST) Prize draw: Complete the survey for a chance to win one of five £100 prizes (Please note: due to legal restrictions, residents of some countries may not be eligible for the prize draw)
At the end of the survey, you’ll have the option to update your contact and professional details for our alumni records. Your responses will be processed by Shift Insight and treated in accordance with the privacy information provided in the survey introduction.
If you have any questions about this survey, please contact:
•    Laura Stephenson (Durham University): alumni.office@durham.ac.uk •    Natalie Piper (Shift Insight): natalie.piper@shift-insight.co.uk or call +44 (0) 207 253 8959
Finally, we would appreciate your support in promoting completion of this survey to your fellow Durham alumni who will be receiving a version of this email and their own username for login. These communications will be distributed this week. Laura or Natalie can be contacted with any queries regarding login details.
Help us spread the word by sending them a personal note about the alumni survey and asking them to complete it - your opinions matter!
Thank you for your time and responses in advance, and good luck for the prize draw.
Best wishes,
Glen Whitehead  Director Development and Alumni Engagement Durham University #DUalumnisurvey2025

subject: OpenAI Codex 💻, Trump Admin & AI Chips 🤖, Anthropic Credit Line 💰
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-19
New research by Google: gen AI hits 98% enterprise adoption, but data quality and security concerns linger (Sponsor) 

Google Cloud's survey of 500+ global technology leaders validates what everyone is feeling: generative AI is now mainstream (sorry AI hipsters), and it's present at the vast majority of larger organizations.

However, not all is smooth sailing, and many are still figuring out the best way to build an AI-ready cloud that's robust, secure, and cost-effective.
The 2025 State of AI Infrastructure report offers a glimpse into how enterprises are preparing for the next tidal wave of AI adoption.
Get a free copy right here 👉 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Trump Opens AI Chip Floodgates to Middle East After Reversing Biden-Era Restrictions (2 minute read) 

President Trump's Middle East trip has yielded massive AI deals, including Nvidia shipping 18,000 Blackwell chips to Saudi Arabia and plans for the largest non-US AI data center in Abu Dhabi. Critics warn these partnerships could enable China to access restricted US AI technology through its extensive economic ties with Gulf states prompting new bipartisan legislation to prevent such transfers. 
Introducing Codex (3 minute read) 

OpenAI just launched Codex, an autonomous coding agent that writes features, fixes bugs, and submits pull requests in isolated cloud environments. Companies like Cisco and Temporal are already using it to handle entire codebases while their engineers focus on higher-level work. The agent can tackle multiple tasks simultaneously, run tests, and provide detailed citations of every change it makes. 
Anthropic Receives $2.5 Billion, Five-year Credit Line from Wall Street (2 minute read) 

Anthropic has secured a new line of credit to further accelerate its growth, adding to the $18.2 billion already raised from investors. The company reported that its annualized revenue doubled to $2 billion in the last 6 months. The move mirrors OpenAI's strategy, which established a $4 billion revolving credit line last October. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Large Language Models Are More Persuasive Than Incentivized Human Persuaders (35 minute read) 

Claude 3.5 Sonnet significantly outperformed human persuaders in a controlled experiment where both attempted to influence participants' answers on quiz questions. Claude achieved 7.6% higher success rates when trying to convince participants to select specific answers and was more effective both at promoting correct answers (+12.2%) and incorrect answers (-15.1%). 
How Hardware Limitations Have, and Will, Prevent Rapid AI Takeoffs (8 minute read) 

Major algorithmic breakthroughs for LLMs, like the transformer architecture, multi-query attention, and mixture-of-experts systems, only demonstrate substantial benefits (10-50x performance gains) when implemented with massive amounts of compute. This challenges predictions of rapid AI self-improvement since hardware constraints like chip export controls, power consumption limits, and cooling infrastructure bottlenecks would significantly limit any "intelligence explosion" scenario. 
Superhuman Coders in AI 2027 (9 minute read) 

Superhuman coding by AI will likely occur by 2033, later than AI Futures' estimates of 2028-2030. This delay is due to factors like handling engineering complexity, working without feedback loops, and achieving cost and speed. Unforeseen challenges, such as geopolitical issues or changes in lab priorities, could further push out timelines. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
AI Engineer World's Fair (Sponsor) 

The world's biggest event for AI builders is in SF from June 3-5. Speakers include leaders from OpenAI, DeepMind, Anthropic, and more, click here to get 30% off your ticket. 
Open Source Alternative to Google's New AI Algorithm-Discovering Agent (GitHub Repo) 

OpenAlpha_Evolve is an open-source Python framework inspired by the recently released technical paper for DeepMind's AlphaEvolve. 
Parallel Scaling for LLMs (GitHub Repo) 

ParScale has introduced a third LLM scaling paradigm by leveraging parallel computation at both training and inference time. 
Spoken Dialogue Evaluation (18 minute read) 

WavReward is an audio-language model-based evaluator for assessing spoken dialogue systems on both cognitive and emotional metrics. It is trained on ChatReward-30K, a dataset containing diverse preference-labeled audio interactions. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
OpenAI announces $250K Prize for Using Their Models to Find Lost Amazonian Cities (2 minute read) 

The challenge invites competitors to use o3, o4-mini, and GPT-4.1 models with open-source data to pinpoint undiscovered archaeological sites in the Amazon by June 29. Winners will receive funding to verify their findings in the field alongside archaeologists. 
Generative AI Adoption Index (2 minute read) 

Organizations are prioritizing generative AI over security spending for 2025. Companies are creating leadership roles like Chief AI Officer and adopting aggressive hiring and internal development strategies for AI talent. Many are using a hybrid model, combining off-the-shelf AI models with custom applications using proprietary data. 
There should be no AI button (3 minute read) 

The "AI button" UX pattern is limiting and creates unnecessary distinctions between AI-assisted and manual workflows. Better alternatives, like integrating AI as a "shadow teammate" within workflows, enhance collaboration without fragmenting user experience. 
⚡
Quick Links
Stability AI and Arm Release Low Latency Audio Model for On-Device Audio Generation (2 minute read) 

Stability AI is open-sourcing Stable Audio Open Small, a 341 million parameter text-to-audio model optimized to run on Arm CPUs. 
Cohere Acquired Ottogrid (1 minute read) 

Cohere has acquired Ottogrid, a Canadian startup focused on automating enterprise market research workflows. 
Apple-Alibaba Deal Under U.S. Scrutiny (1 minute read) 

U.S. lawmakers raised concerns over Apple's reported partnership with Alibaba, questioning the handling of user data and transparency amid rising U.S.-China tech tensions.

BOXES

￼

Make any occasion extra special and extra delicious with a brownie through the letterbox, and mix and match any two brownies for just £29!

Handmade in our bakery, our brownies are firm family favourites that you can order in three quick steps...
 
1. Choose a flavour
Select from Gold Great Taste Award-winning Dorset Sea Salt Caramel, Chocolate Orange, Triple Chocolate, Squidgy Pecan, Cherry Bakewell or Blonde chocolate with cocoa nibs and sea salt... 
 
2. Add a free occasion gift card
Whether you want to say Happy Birthday, Good luck, Congratulations, Thank you, Get well soon or I love you... we've got you covered!
 
3. Select your delivery date
We post all brownies and bakes out First Class on a 24 hour service so it can be enjoyed super fresh! But you can select a future delivery date if you like so it's perfectly in time for any occasion. The recipient doesn't need to be in to accept the delivery either, it can come through the letterbox!

Mix and match any two brownies (normal price £16.50) for £29 here.

Shop Brownies and Bakes 
 
￼

Lots of you have asked if we can bring back hot chocolate flake refill bags... and we're happy to announce that NEW 500g bags of our 47% milk hot chocolate and 72% dark hot chocolate flakes are now available.

Our award-winning flakes make the smoothest chocolate drinks, filled with flavour, low in sugar, energy-boosting and great for brain health - providing beneficial flavonoids and natural stimulation without the spikes and falls of caffeine.

Cosy up and enjoy them hot, or iced in this warmer weather, for the perfect chocolate drink Chococo-style! 

Shop Hot Chocolate Flakes 
 
￼

For May's choc of the month, we've brought an annual bestseller back to the chocolate cabinet - our quintessentially British Cream Tea.

A staple every summer, our Cream Tea encapsulates the taste of the afternoon tea equivalent. We have used fresh Dorset clotted cream, topped it with Dorset-made raspberry jam and layered it all inside a 47% Colombia milk chocolate dome. This is then hand piped with a topping of white chocolate and sprinkled with dried raspberry pieces.

With the perfect balance of fruity flavours, this beautiful chocolate is the standout star in every box. As a limited edition only available across the summer months, this is one you won't want to miss. You can find Cream Tea in all of our Chocolate Houses and our online fresh boxes. 

Keep your eyes peeled, we have some very exciting new chocolates of the month coming throughout the summer!

On Thu, 8 May 2025, 01:30 Robert Scaife, <robertscaife@icloud.com> wrote:

Hi Roger,

I’m well thank you, I hope you are too. 

Sorry for only just picking up your message now, due to the time difference. 

I have us booked in for 9am (apologies for not sending the zoom details). Happy to meet then, or if you prefer we can postpone until I’m back in the UK and arrange to meet on the 22nd, 23rd, or the week commencing 26th? 

Wi-Fi connection has been mostly fine, but admittedly smoother back in the UK, so that may be one consideration if you feel ok to wait and things aren’t feeling especially challenging. 

Really happy to do whatever feels preferable for you. 

Best wishes,

Rob

Roger

subject: Meta’s New Artifacts 📚, Windsurf in-house models 🌐, Google AI-Powered Accessibility ♿
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-16
If you're serious about putting AI to work, Glean:GO is the free conference for you (Sponsor) 

Glean:GO is for anyone looking to boost productivity and transform how their teams work with AI. You'll walk away with proven strategies, real-world use cases, and actionable agent workflows to immediately make an impact. 

Join us and hear from industry leaders - including CEOs and senior executives from Glean, Palo Alto Networks, Snowflake, Uber, Zoom, GitHub, Google Cloud, Anthropic, and more.
More of a hands-on type? Build your technical skills in deep-dive tech sessions and catch live demos of AI agents in action.
Don't miss your chance to join us virtually on May 20th. Your free registration includes live access plus select sessions on demand.
Register Now → 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Windsurf releases suite of in-house coding models (11 minute read) 

Following its recent acquisition by OpenAI, Windsurf has announced a family of new models: flagship SWE-1 (comparable to Claude Sonnet 3.5), unlimited-use SWE-1-lite, and SWE-1-mini. Windsurf claims these specialized models, which were trained on incomplete code states and multiple work surfaces, represent a strategic shift that will eventually outperform general-purpose frontier models. 
Meta's New Artifacts (12 minute read) 

Meta's FAIR team has released datasets and models supporting molecular property prediction, diffusion modeling, and language learning neuroscience. 
Google AI-Powered Accessibility Features (4 minute read) 

Google has introduced Gemini-based updates to Android and Chrome that enhance screen reading, speech recognition, and image understanding. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
OpenAI Engineers Reveal How ChatGPT Images Handled 100M New Users in One Week (22 minute read) 

OpenAI engineers reveal how they managed the March launch of ChatGPT Images, which attracted 100 million new users generating 700 million images in the first week, peaking at 1 million new signups per hour during viral adoption in India. When their synchronous image generation system couldn't handle the unexpected load, the team quickly rewrote the entire architecture to an asynchronous model mid-launch. 
Agents, Tools, and Simulators (15 minute read) 

AI can be viewed through three conceptual lenses, each providing distinct insights into its capabilities and risks: as a tool, an agent, or a simulator. While tools extend human intentions and require control, agents pursue goals independently, and simulators mimic processes without specific objectives. For LLMs, simulator theory suggests they blend simulation with agent-like behavior, especially when fine-tuned, indicating a dual nature influenced by their operating context and architecture. 
How AI Agents Will Change the Web for Users and Developers (11 minute read) 

AI agents will transform the web by autonomously interacting and exchanging content, significantly altering both user experience and web development practices. This may result in an "autonomous internet" where AI agents dominate interactions, prompting changes in content presentation, payment systems, and business models. Developers need to adapt by creating APIs for AI agents and focusing on personalized, scalable user experiences. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Nous Research's Psyche Network Taps Idle GPUs for AI Training (14 minute read) 

Psyche is a Solana-based distributed training system that allows anyone with compatible hardware to volunteer their GPUs for AI model training. The project's first initiative, "Consilience," will create a 40B parameter model using 20T tokens. It will be the largest community-powered AI training effort conducted to date. 
BLIP3-o (24 minute read) 

BLIP3-o is a new diffusion transformer architecture that was pretrained sequentially. It achieves state-of-the-art results across multimodal benchmarks. The release includes code, weights, and a 60k instruction-tuning dataset. 
A Visual Tool Use for AI Agents (GitHub Repo) 

OpenThinkIMG allows vision-language models to actively use visual tools via dynamic inference and distributed deployment. It includes a novel reinforcement learning method, V-ToolRL, and a streamlined training pipeline to improve multi-tool reasoning with images. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
FBI warns of Deepfake scams impersonating government officials (4 minute read) 

The FBI has issued an alert about sophisticated scammers using AI-generated voice deepfakes to impersonate senior US officials in attacks targeting government contacts. This warning follows a string of high-profile deepfake scams, including a LastPass attack using a CEO deepfake and a political robocall that impersonated President Biden last year. 
Making complex text understandable: Minimally-lossy text simplification with Gemini (2 minute read) 

Developers used Gemini models to automate the evaluation and refinement of prompts for text simplification, improving readability while maintaining meaning. The system employs LLMs for readability and fidelity assessments, offering better alignment with human judgments than traditional methods. Automated iterations refine prompts, reducing manual effort, and enabling highly effective simplification strategies through an LLM feedback loop. 
a16z identifies nine key developer patterns in the AI era (6 minute read) 

Andreessen Horowitz identified nine key developer patterns emerging in the AI era. These patterns fundamentally reshaped how developers built software and what tools they used. 
⚡
Quick Links
Y Combinator Hosts First-Ever AI Startup School (1 minute read) 

The startup incubator is hosting an invite-only event on June 16-17th in San Francisco for 2,500 CS students and recent graduates. 
TikTok Expands Mental Health Support (2 minute read) 

TikTok has launched in-app meditation exercises and expanded its Mental Health Education Fund to promote accessible, reliable mental health information for users worldwide. 
HeyGen launches Avatar IV, its most advanced AI avatar model yet (1 minute read) 

HeyGen's Avatar IV is a neural audio-to-expression engine that interprets vocal tone, rhythm, and emotion to drive photoreal facial motion from a single image.

Track your referrals here.

If your company is interested in reaching an audience of AI professionals and decision makers, you may want to advertise with us. 

Want to work at TLDR? 💼 
Apply here or send a friend's resume to jobs@tldr.tech and get $1k if we hire them! 

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian & Andrew Carr

subject: Rhino Racing WTRL TTT sign-up success.
body:
Can't see this message? View in browser
 
￼

Thanks for registering.

If you are new to Team Time Trials then have a read of the below - it will give you all the info needed to get lined up in the pen with your fellow team mates.
​
Please remember that everyone is equally important to the team, the keyword is Team!
  
There are 2 forms used for TTT’s, you have obviously found the first as you made your way here...⁠ 
 The sign-up form (that you've just filled in) is available each week on Friday and is where you can select your availability for the following Thursday - timezone availability, including a comments section if you want to request an easy ride, harder ride etc.
 The team-sheet is usually finalised on a Wednesday afternoon / evening and confirmed via a message in ⁠ttt-chat on the Rhino Racing Discord server (all riders will get tagged - as long as we have your discord tag).
The team sheet confirms which team you are on and who you ride with.
TEAM SHEET
￼
You need to click the RacePass link for your team, and you need to have a registered WTRL account:
WTRL REGISTRATION
￼
Most teams have a chat beforehand if needed, in the ⁠ttt-chat channel. (Some regular competitive teams have dedicated channels to discuss tactics beforehand) but if you have any questions please ask or DM any Rhino you have spoken with and they will help you or point you in the right direction.
​
Make sure you click the RacePass in the team sheet ASAP and are registered for the event. You have to sign up to the RacePass before that TimeZone begins, but so long as you have then you don’t actually have to join the event Race Pen in Zwift up until a few minutes before your official start time. However, it's always recommended to be in the Race Pen and in the Team Voice Channel 5-10 minutes before your start time.
​
You can confirm you’ve signed up correctly using the RacePass, as you should then see the TTT event on the home screen of your Zwift Companion App listed under Events.
Change kit to the Rhino jersey (if you have it - if you are new it might take a week for Gordon to get it unlocked for you).
 Make sure you select a TT bike from your garage!! If you want to look at the fastest bike setup, try Zwifter Bikes and use the settings to adjust for the course, your Zwift level, your Drops level and FTP and weight etc.
ZWIFTER BIKES
￼
Add (Rhino) after your Zwift name (this can be done in the Companion App settings).
At least 10 minutes before your event start time, please log on to Zwift (in case of software updates) and join the Discord Team Voice Channel of the team name you are riding with (Albino, Thundering, Rapids, Nuclear etc) meet your teammates, discuss a plan, make sure everyone is ready etc.
​
Please check your discord if you have not used it before (turn on noise suppression in settings to remove trainer/fan noise).
​
The aim is to stay with the group, always in the draft. If you are stronger rider do more work on the front. If weak just try hang on in the draft. Sometimes a race is just too fast and riders need to be dropped (especially for experienced teams going for the win).
​
For teams of 5 or more, the team time is taken from 4th rider to cross the line. For teams of 3 or 4, it is from the 3rd rider crossing the line.
​
Don't feel bad if you get dropped just continue the race at your own pace but please DON'T INTERFERE OR TRY DRAFTING OTHER TEAMS. If another team passes you then it is respectful to ease your power for 10-20s until they are passed and a few seconds clear of you.
​
If you finding that you are not enjoying the TTTs and maybe getting put in a team that drops you each week then please feel free to comment on sign up form – you can ask for an easier ride, a harder ride – we are always flexible to try place riders in a team that suits their needs.
 Communication is key, don’t be afraid to talk to your team even if you are new and learning - if you see the group stretching try call it out when you see gaps of 3-4 meters before it gets to 5+ and out the draft. If you can’t last any longer then tell them you are dropping so that they know to carry on etc.
​
We are all racing to have fun and there are some very experienced TTT riders active in ⁠ttt-chat who are happy to answer any and all questions.
​
Support your teammates and have fun. Remember it’s a Team Time Trial!  
 
There are lots of videos in streaming links on the Rhino Racing Discord server to see how a TTT is done if you would like to have a look beforehand.
​
Well done on getting to the end of this and remember... Have fun... the type 2 kind!

subject: News & Club Runs
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 

Dear Roger,

￼ 
2025 TT ENTRY TICKETS HERE
Time Trials
 The club will again be hosting a weekly 10-mile time trial on the N1/10 course up and down the old A1 from Sawtry on Wednesday evenings from the 14th May to 20th August.  ENTRIES BY 2PM ON THE DAY PLEASE.  11th June will be a FREE OF CHARGE 'Come and try it' week! 3rd September is the Hill Climb.  As we still don't have an Events Officer on the Committee, organisation of the TT's has been a team effort behind the scenes. Quite some work has gone into making the TT's easier for anyone to take on in the future. If you can offer to help in anyway in future, please speak to a committee member or to one of our regular TTer's. All kit and signs are now stored onsite at Sawtry and we have a new website based database that generates start sheets, results and podiums. It's just a case of entering the data and clicking a button. No tech compatibility issues!  Further information and links, including how to ENTER to ride are in the event page on Facebook:  Please support so that we don't see these events lost in future.
Facebook Event Page

SICC Summer BBQ
￼ 
29th June 2025

This event is subsidised 50% by the club. £10 of food for £5!

Date: Sunday 29th June (Food from 2pm – After the club ride)
Venue: Floods Tavern
Cost: £5 per ticket (Adult/Child)
Whats included: A Burger OR a Hotdog (Vegan/Vegetarian options)
PLUS: Salad, coleslaw, potato salad and chips

Partners and families welcome.
Summer BBQ Tickets

Sunday Club Run

￼ 
18th May 2025

We meet outside The Norris Museum on The Waits, St Ives at 8:45 with the first group leaving at 9:00 prompt.

This week's club run will be heading to Elton and Upton.

Groups A and B will ride the same route of 59 miles stopping at The Walled Garden in Elton.

Group C will ride the shorter route of 39 miles stopping at Holly Lodge Cafe in Upton.*

*The pace of the C group is around 14-16mph giving opportunity to new riders to join us.  Please welcome new riders to this group.
Sunday Long Route - 28 - Elton
Sunday Short Route - 133 - Upton

Thursday Evening Ride
￼ 
22nd May 2025

We meet outside The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen on The Boulevard, Alconbury Weald at 18:15 with the first group leaving at 18:30 prompt

Loops to Barnwell
	•	Routes will be here the week before each ride.
	•	Multiple paced groups.
	•	2 routes
	•	25 - 35 miles
	•	No stop ride
	•	The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen will be open until 11pm.
	•	Free Parking available outside The Club gym and near The Pavillion.
	•	New riders are welcomed so please bring a friend.  Membership is required after 2 club rides for insurance purposes.
Thursday Long Route - 179 - Barnwell Loop
Thursday Short Route - 180 - Barnwell Figure 8
Polite Reminders (for all club rides):
	•	Download the route.
	•	Remember your cafe bike locks.
	•	Look after your club mates.
	•	TT/Aero bars are not to be used.

Thank you.


2025
Dates for your Calendar
 
	•	Social Evening (off the bike) - Tuesday 25th February
	•	International Women's Day Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 8th March
	•	Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 12th April
	•	Double Dutch Audax - Saturday 19th April
	•	Easter Club Run - Sunday 20th April
