	•	Peaks Away Day Club Run - Sunday 4th May (stay for the weekend, it's a Bank Holiday!)
	•	Evening 10 mile Time Trials Restart (Sawtry) - Wednesday 14th May
	•	FREE OF CHARGE Evening 10 mile Time Trial - Wednesday 11th June
	•	Club Summer BBQ Club Run - Sunday 29th June
	•	Summer Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 19th July
	•	Last Evening 10 mile Time Trial (Sawtry) - Wednesday 20th August
	•	Bank Holiday Weekend Longer Club Run - Sunday 24th August (ideas welcome!)
	•	Last Evening Social Ride (Alconbury) - Thursday 28th August
	•	Dave Nelson Memorial Hill Climb - Wednesday 3rd September
	•	Cafe Ventoux Away Day Club Run - Sunday 7th September
	•	Remembrance Club Run - Sunday 9th Novemeber
	•	Christmas Dress Up Club Run - Sunday 21st December
	•	Festive 500 - Wednesday 24th - 31st December
	•	Winter Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 27th December
	•	Short New Years Eve Ride - Wednesday 31st December
 
	•	SICC hosts Eastern League CX - TBC
	•	Christmas Meal - TBC
	•	AGM & Awards Presentation - TBC

subject: Ardal O'Hanlon, Celebrating Celine, The James Bond Concert Spectacular plus many more!
body:
Discover our on sale shows
 
Is this email not displaying correctly? View it in your browser.
￼
￼
BOX OFFICE: Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk | Phone: 01223 357851 | Mon - Fri, 10am - 5pm
￼
On Sale Now
￼
Celebrating Celine - The Ultimate Celine Dion Tribute Concert
￼

Saturday 26 July 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
With dazzling costumes, jaw dropping vocals and a sensational 'live concert' feel, this show will take you on a two hour electrifying journey through Céline's life and career as we travel through four decades of hits.  
This show has it all and no one else comes close to recreating the sound, look and feel of this incredibly loved and admired global megastar with as much passion and brilliance.
 
With phenomenal powerhouse vocals and incredible live band accompaniment lead by the legendary musical director Andy Mudd this is a show not to be missed. So don't 'Think Twice', book your tickets today and don't miss out on the 'Power of Love'.

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Q The Music - The James Bond Concert Spectacular
￼

Sunday 7 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Q The Music’s James Bond Concert Spectacular is the world’s finest and most critically acclaimed tribute to the music of James Bond.
 
Celebrating more than 20 years as the first original and pioneering Bond concert, they are known for their stirring emotional and adrenaline-fueled performances, mixed in with superb musicianship and flair.
 With stunning singing, an informative compere, and a show full of iconic tunes performed to an unparalleled level of detail it really is a night of the highest quality guaranteed. As the only James Bond concert created by die-hard Bond fans, for Bond fans, by people who understand the music better than anyone else: you won’t want to miss it.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Ardal O'Hanlon
￼

Friday 3 October 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Ardal is not only an acclaimed stand-up comedian who has performed world-wide. He will be familiar to many from his appearances in TV shows .
 
Oh, it’s all there! All the trademarks are in evidence in Ardal’s latest show. Beautifully crafted stand-up comedy? Yes. Celebrated use of language? Tick. Lateral thinking, surreal flourishes, sharp observations? Of course. As for the occasional profundity? Maybe. Despite his best attempts over many decades to put the world to rights, it is still a colossal mess. And so, Ardal has no choice but to go out on the road again. Like the good comedy doctor he is, he fearlessly diagnoses the various pathologies and neuroses that are currently ravaging humanity. Disclaimer: No solutions provided.

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
The Bon Jovi Experience
￼

Friday 19 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Get ready to rock your way through an unforgettable journey with the only show to be endorsed by Jon Bon Jovi himself!
 
Immerse yourself in a phenomenal celebration of Bon Jovi’s timeless classics as The Bon Jovi Experience recreates the magic that defined an era with electrifying energy - transporting you back to the heyday of stadium rock.
 
Whether you’re a lifelong Bon Jovi devotee or a new fan seeking an unforgettable night out, this show promises an experience like no other!

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Last Chance To Book
￼
The Anglia Comedy Allstars
￼

Saturday 17 May 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
The Anglia Comedy Allstars show returns to Cambridge Corn Exchange in May, with a fantastic line-up featuring the amazing Joel Dommett, Gary Delaney, Larry Dean & Laura Smyth!
 

As host of The Masked Singer, Joel Dommett has become a firm fixture on TV in the last few years. He became known to many people through his successful stint on I’m a Celebrity, and gained thousands of fans due to his unique brand of humour and his lovable personality.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
CODA - A Tribute to Led Zeppelin
￼

Friday 30 May 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
CODA - a Tribute to Led Zeppelin are Europe's most authentic and exciting Led Zeppelin tribute band, replicating the power, excitement and magic of a Led Zeppelin show like no other. They are the only proper fourpiece Zep tribute band in Europe that looks and sounds as close to the real thing as possible, featuring authentic-looking and sounding instruments as well as incredible, hand- made replica costumes that will take you back to the time when the Gods of Rock ruled the world!

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
￼
￼
Shows on sale with Cambridge Live Tickets
￼
Nerina Pallot
￼
Saturday 20 September 2025 | Storey's Field Centre
On general sale now
￼
Nerina Pallot, the critically acclaimed singer-songwriter known for her heartfelt lyrics and soul-stirring melodies, has traversed an extraordinary journey. From her breakout success with Fires in the mid-2000s, which earned her Top 40 hits and nominations for both an Ivor Novello Award and a Brit Award, to collaborating with artists like Kylie Minogue, her career has been anything but ordinary.

 
Nerina Pallot’s music transcends the superficial metrics of modern success, resonating instead on a deeper, emotional level with those who listen. Whether you’ve been following her for years or are just discovering her work, A Psalm for Emily Salvi is an invitation to connect with something real.

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Discover More
￼
Garden House
￼
￼
￼
￼
We're delighted so many Corn Exchange customers have been enjoying the special restaurant discount offered by our partner, Garden House, which continues throughout spring and summer.
 
Garden House is just a 7-minute walk from the Corn Exchange, making it the perfect spot to enjoy a meal before or after your event. If you haven't already, why not make your night out extra special with this fabulous offer exclusively for Corn Exchange ticket holders!
 
T&Cs apply. Visit website for more info.

BOOK HERE
￼
Want to skip the queues?
￼
The age-old tradition of queuing for interval drinks is becoming a thing of the past at the Corn Exchange.
 
Simply follow this link and place your order in just a few easy steps. Whether you're craving a bag of Haribos, a Coke, a glass of wine, a beer, a ready-mixed cocktail, or an award-winning Saffron Ice Cream, you can sit back, relax, and enjoy the show while your interval drinks and snacks are delivered straight to your seat!
PRE-ORDER NOW
￼
CornEx Membership
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange, run by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council, depends on ticket sales, sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants, and concessions to bring top-quality shows to the city. By becoming a member, you make a significant impact, helping us continue to deliver the music, comedy, and performances you love. As a thank you, we offer great perks in return.
BECOME A MEMBER
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange is operated by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council. As well as Corn Exchange ticket income, we rely on income raised through sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants and concessions to ensure that we can continue to bring the biggest and best shows to the city.
 
We also organise an annual programme of diverse and greatly valued events including free Fireworks Night, Out of the Ordinary Festival and Music in the Parks. These events are free in order to offer residents the opportunity to participate in the cultural life of the city and to provide access to all. They contribute to creating a united city, ‘One Cambridge - Fair for All’, in which economic dynamism and prosperity are combined with social justice and equality. Again, these events are also an opportunity to develop valued partnerships with local businesses and other organisations that make up the Cambridge Community.
3 Parson's Court, Wheeler Street, Cambridge, CB2 3QE

subject: DeepMind AlphaEvolve 💻, Stability AI Text-to-Audio 🔈, OpenAI Safety Evaluations Hub 🦺
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-15
💡 Agentic AI is here—but without orchestration, it's chaos. (Sponsor) 

Learn how enterprises are taming the complexity of multi-agent systems with Orkes Conductor, the platform powering intelligent workflows with AI, APIs, and humans-in-the-loop.

📊 Perfect for engineering leaders, architects & automation teams.
▶️ Watch the webinar: Beyond Chatbots: Orchestrating AI-Native Enterprise Workflows 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
AlphaEvolve: DeepMind's Gemini-Powered Coding Agent for Algorithm Design (4 minute read) 

Google DeepMind's AlphaEvolve uses Gemini models to iteratively generate and improve complete algorithm solutions, not just isolated functions. The system proposes code, tests it through automated evaluators, and builds upon successful approaches to develop increasingly effective algorithms across entire codebases. This process has yielded significant improvements across Google's infrastructure, from data center efficiency and chip design to AI training optimization. Select researchers will receive early access to the tool, but it's unclear if or when it will become widely available. 
Stability AI Text-to-Audio Model (4 minute read) 

Stability AI has open-sourced Stable Audio Open Small, a 341M parameter text-to-audio model optimized to run on Arm CPUs. It can generate 11-second audio clips on smartphones in under 8 seconds. 
OpenAI Launches Safety Metrics Hub Amid Transparency Concerns (3 minute read) 

OpenAI has unveiled a Safety Evaluations Hub that publicly tracks model performance across hallucination rates, harmful content refusal, jailbreak resistance, and instruction adherence. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
AI's Second-Order Effects (4 minute read) 

Founders should explore AI's second-order effects, like workforce reallocation and regulatory compliance, for sustainable growth. Commoditized first-order applications face competition, but opportunities lie in AI-driven societal shifts and economic realignments. Innovate with AI-native media and infrastructure to capitalize on transformative human reactions to AI disruptions. 
Klarna's AI Retrenchment and Broader AI App Risk (2 minute read) 

Klarna scaling back AI bets is a signal of deeper industry issues with AI's probabilistic behavior in production. Many AI apps will likely be forced to pivot to narrow, deterministic use cases, exposing inflated AI valuations masking ordinary SaaS companies. Ongoing AI system validation will be the next critical discipline. 
Meta-Analysis Shows ChatGPT Significantly Boosts Learning, Best in Problem-Based Scenarios (15 minute read) 

Amid debates over AI use in education, a comprehensive meta-analysis of 51 studies shows ChatGPT substantially improves student learning performance while moderately enhancing learning perception and higher-order thinking. It was most effective in problem-based learning environments with consistent usage for 4-8 weeks. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Google Deploys Gemini Nano on Device to Power New Scam Defenses (8 minute read) 

Google has integrated Gemini Nano, its on-device LLM, into Chrome's Enhanced Protection mode to identify previously unseen scams in real-time across Search, Android, and Chrome. 
Building Agents for Daily News Recaps with MCP, Q, and tmux (8 minute read) 

A Principal Applied Scientist at Amazon created an intelligent news aggregation system using Amazon Q CLI and Model Control Protocol (MCP) that processes multiple news feeds simultaneously through coordinated AI agents. The resulting output includes category distributions and cross-source trend analysis that identifies patterns across different publications. 
Void: Open-Source AI Code Editor (GitHub Repo) 

Built as a VS code fork, Void offers direct connections to AI models without routing data through third-party servers. It offers autocomplete, Agent Mode (allowing AI to search, create, and modify files with terminal access), Gather Mode (restricted to read-only operations), and specialized features like checkpoints for tracking AI-suggested changes. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
AWS Announce $5+ Billion AI Partnership in New Saudi Arabian AI Company (3 minute read) 

AWS and HUMAIN, a new AI company founded by Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, are investing over $5 billion to build an "AI Zone" in Saudi Arabia that will feature advanced AWS AI infrastructure. Cisco, AMD, Oracle, and NVIDIA also announced AI deals with HUMAIN. 
MCP is a powerful new AI coding technology: Understand the risks (6 minute read) 

Model Context Protocol (MCP), introduced by Anthropic AI, connects LLMs with tools and data, but lacks default security features, posing significant risks. Experts have warned about vulnerabilities, including prompt injections and tool tampering. Unless enhanced security measures are implemented, developers and organizations are advised to proceed cautiously, prioritize security practices, and stay informed on MCP's evolving standards. 
CEO Satya Nadella says up to 30% of Microsoft's code is now written by AI (3 minute read) 

AI's rise in software engineering raises questions about programming job futures, but skilled human judgment remains essential. At LlamaCon, Microsoft's and Meta's CEOs highlighted AI's strong role in code generation, with AI producing a significant portion of their companies' code. While AI excels at automating repetitive tasks, human oversight remains crucial for complex projects and refining AI-generated code. 
⚡
Quick Links
AI Engineer World's Fair (Sponsor) 

The world's biggest event for AI builders is in SF from June 3-5. Speakers include leaders from OpenAI, DeepMind, Anthropic, and more, click here to get 30% off your ticket. 
Perplexity Selects PayPal to Power Agentic Commerce (1 minute read) 

Following OpenAI's Shopify integration, Perplexity has partnered with PayPal to enable seamless purchasing directly within its AI search results. 
Grok is unpromptedly telling X users about South African ‘white genocide' (1 minute read) 

Elon Musk's Grok AI chatbot experienced a bizarre bug that caused it to respond to unrelated X user queries with information about alleged "white genocide" in South Africa. 
GPT-4.1 (1 minute read) 

OpenAI has released GPT-4.1 in ChatGPT - it is accessible via the “more models” dropdown for Plus, Pro, and Team users. 
Love TLDR? Tell your friends and get rewards! 
Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag! 
https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here.

If your company is interested in reaching an audience of AI professionals and decision makers, you may want to advertise with us. 

Want to work at TLDR? 💼

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian & Andrew Carr

subject: TikTok AI Alive 📱, Audible AI audiobooks 📚, Tencent WizardLM team 🧙
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 


TLDR AI 2025-05-14

🚀
Headlines & Launches
TikTok AI Alive (2 minute read) 

TikTok has launched AI Alive, a new feature that animates static images within Stories. It uses intelligent editing tools to turn photos into short-form videos with dynamic effects. 
Audible is expanding its AI-narrated audiobook library (1 minute read) 

Amazon's audiobook service, Audible, is partnering with publishers to expand its catalog with AI-narrated audiobooks, offering over 100 voices in English, Spanish, French, and Italian. Spotify made similar updates earlier in the year in partnership with ElevenLabs. 
Tencent hires WizardLM team, a Microsoft AI group with an odd history (3 minute read) 

WizardLM, a former Microsoft AI group, has joined Tencent's AI division, Hunyuan. It quickly released a new AI model, Hunyuan-TurboS 0416, claiming it outperforms Google's offerings. WizardLM will continue to develop AI models at Tencent. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
ChatGPT is used for scientific research in countries where it's prohibited (12 minute read) 

Using a classifier that detects distinctive AI word choices (like "delve") in academic papers, researchers found ChatGPT usage was higher in countries where it's prohibited by OpenAI. 22% of Chinese academic preprints included AI-generated content versus 11% from legal-access countries by August 2023, suggesting geographic restrictions can be easily circumnavigated. While ChatGPT use correlated with increased views and downloads, it showed no impact on citations or journal placements. 
5 Major Problems with Today's Conversational AI Interfaces (4 minute read) 

While chat interfaces provide an accessible medium to LLMs for first-time users, they're a design dead-end that forces users to accommodate to the model rather than the reverse. The next generation of assistants will use more adaptive UIs and proactively communicate their capabilities. 
Duolingo's Push to Be an AI-First Company (2 minute read) 

Duolingo announced a major shift to become an AI-first company, integrating AI tools across products and workflows. The company's new tenets include starting every task with AI, dedicating time for learning, careful experimentation, and preserving technical excellence. Leadership emphasized that while AI raises expectations, it's about working smarter, not harder. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Sakana AI Unveils "Continuous Thought Machine" With Brain-Inspired Neural Timing (22 minute read) 

Japanese AI company Sakana developed a new type of AI model that allows individual neurons to remember their previous actions and coordinate their activity based on timing patterns. While it underperforms compared to traditional models, it does allow researchers to understand how the model reasons, and similar to recent reasoning models like o3, its answers improve when given more time to “think”. 
Visual Autoregression Without Quantization (GitHub Repo) 

EAR introduces a continuous visual autoregressive generation method that avoids quantization by leveraging strictly proper scoring rules like the energy score. This enables direct generation in continuous data spaces without probabilistic modeling. 
Unified Training and Sampling for Generative Models (GitHub Repo) 

UCGM provides a shared framework for training and sampling across multi-step and few-step continuous generative models. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
LlamaCon Hackathon Winners (5 minute read) 

Meta's first LlamaCon Hackathon hosted 238 participants who built projects using the Llama 4 suite of tools. The winners, selected from 44 submissions based on innovation and technical execution, have now been announced. 
Hugging Face Fast Transcription Endpoint (2 minute read) 

Hugging Face has released a new Whisper endpoint that delivers up to 8x faster transcription. The endpoint enables one-click deployment of optimized, cost-effective models for speech tasks through its Inference Endpoints. 
Microsoft is getting ready to host Elon Musk's Grok AI model (9 minute read) 

Microsoft plans to host Elon Musk's Grok AI on Azure AI Foundry despite potential tensions with OpenAI. This move signals Microsoft's intent to diversify AI partnerships and strengthen its position as a leading AI platform provider. The plans to host Grok could be announced at Microsoft's Build developer conference on May 19. 
⚡
Quick Links
Y Combinator Requests for Startups Summer 2025 (5 minute read) 

YC's Summer 2025 investment themes will focus on AI agents that replace or augment traditional roles across industries, including voice assistants, healthcare automation, personalized tutoring, and tools that enable workers to build their own custom agents. 
Ai2's new small AI model outperforms similarly-sized models from Google, Meta (2 minute read) 

Ai2's Olmo 2 1B is a 1-billion-parameter model that outperforms similar-sized models from major tech companies on key benchmarks. 
Over 250 CEOs sign open letter supporting K-12 AI and computer science education (1 minute read) 

Over 250 CEOs, including Microsoft's Satya Nadella and Uber's Dara Khosrowshahi, urged integrating AI and computer science into K-12 education to maintain U.S. competitiveness.

subject: Re: Call on Thursday 8th May??
body:
Hi Roger,

Hope all’s well. 

Could we please do the 22nd? What times would be good for you?

Best,

Rob 

On 8 May 2025, at 13:29, Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> wrote:

﻿
Hi Rob.  

Happy to postpone until you are back in the UK: I've an important presentation later today so could use the time to prep.

22nd or 23rd is good for me.

Thanks,

Roger

On Thu, 8 May 2025, 01:30 Robert Scaife, <robertscaife@icloud.com> wrote:

Hi Roger,

I’m well thank you, I hope you are too. 

Sorry for only just picking up your message now, due to the time difference. 

I have us booked in for 9am (apologies for not sending the zoom details). Happy to meet then, or if you prefer we can postpone until I’m back in the UK and arrange to meet on the 22nd, 23rd, or the week commencing 26th? 

Wi-Fi connection has been mostly fine, but admittedly smoother back in the UK, so that may be one consideration if you feel ok to wait and things aren’t feeling especially challenging. 

Really happy to do whatever feels preferable for you. 

Best wishes,

Rob 


On 7 May 2025, at 23:36, Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> wrote:

﻿
Hi Rob,

I hope that you are well. I have time blocked out tomorrow for a call with you. This is in the morning UK time. Are you still available? No problem if you need to push it. I don't have a firm time not connection details. NB that I have a meeting at 10.30 to 11 UK time, but am free apart from that.

Thanks,

Roger

Best,

Rob

subject: OpenAI Stargate Delay ❓, Google AI Futures Fund 🚀, Manus Free Access 💸
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-13
Unchecked AI Agents Are a Risk: How to Secure Access (Sponsor) 

AI agents and MCP servers are powerful—but without proper access control, they can become liabilities. When agents and services have unchecked access, data exposure and unintended actions are inevitable.

Enter WorkOS AuthKit—your authorization layer for AI agents and services. With scoped OAuth access and built-in role-based access control, you can assign roles, define permissions, and lock down exactly what each service can access.
Lock down access today with WorkOS AuthKit. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
OpenAI Stargate Delay (1 minute read) 

OpenAI's $500 million Stargate data center initiative is reportedly struggling due to investor hesitancy tied to economic volatility. 
Google's Fund for AI Startups (1 minute read) 

Google's AI Futures Fund will invest in startups using DeepMind's AI tools and offer access to models, cloud credits, expert support, and potential direct funding. 
Google to Join AI Coding Assistant Race (1 minute read) 

Google is reportedly set to unveil an AI software development agent that assists with the complete development lifecycle at its I/O conference on May 20. The move puts Google in direct competition with Anthropic's Claude Code, OpenAI's Windsurf, and numerous startups in the increasingly crowded AI coding space. There may be potential Gemini integration with AR glasses. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
VLM's Landscape and Progress (39 minute read) 

Hugging Face has outlined how Vision Language Models have advanced with smaller, more capable architectures, enabling reasoning, video understanding, and multimodal agents. 
Amazon's Warehouse Stowing Robot Shows Promise and Limitations (14 minute read) 

Amazon's custom stowing robot matches human performance in warehouse operations while highlighting robotics' current frontier - its specialized hardware and AI vision can successfully handle diverse items at scale, yet the 14% failure rate demonstrates why full warehouse automation remains elusive despite significant advances. 
China's AI Data Center Boom Faces Collapse as Demand Falters (8 minute read) 

China's AI infrastructure boom has led to severe overcapacity, with 80% of computing resources across 500+ new data centers sitting unused. DeepSeek's R1 model fundamentally changed market dynamics by shifting demand from training-focused to inference-optimized hardware, rendering many facilities obsolete. Despite this market correction, China has continued to aggressively invest in infrastructure to compete with U.S. initiatives like the $500 billion Stargate project. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
OpenAI's HealthBench (12 minute read) 

OpenAI's HealthBench is a benchmark developed with 262 physicians for evaluating AI models on realistic medical conversations. 
LLMs Get Lost in Multi-Turn Conversation (GitHub Repo) 

LLMs perform significantly worse in multi-turn conversations, with an average 39% drop in task performance due to unreliability and early, incorrect assumptions. 
A Generalist Robot Policy Framework (GitHub Repo) 

UniVLA enables policy learning from unlabeled video across diverse robot embodiments by inferring task-centric latent actions. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Journalists Reveal Nuanced Approaches to AI Integration (3 minute read) 

A survey of media professionals from Reuters, The Washington Post, VentureBeat, 404 Media, and others shows newsrooms are adopting AI selectively, embracing it for transcription, data analysis, and translation while rejecting AI content creation. While Reuters reports that AI now generates about 25% of its code, many journalists remain skeptical, prioritizing maintaining audience trust and journalistic integrity over technological efficiency. 
Figma Website Builder (8 minute read) 

Figma has introduced Figma Sites, allowing users to design, build, and publish responsive websites directly from Figma, streamlining the design-to-production workflow. 
Bamba-9B-v2 (8 minute read) 

IBM, Princeton, CMU, and UIUC released Bamba v2, a Mamba2-based model that outperforms Llama 3.1 8B after training on 3 trillion tokens. Bamba v2 leverages Mamba2 architecture for 2-2.5x faster inference and excels in L1 and L2 benchmarks. The team plans further optimizations and invites community collaboration to enhance model performance. 
⚡
Quick Links
Trump Administration Scraps Biden-Era AI Chip Export Controls (3 minute read) 

The Trump administration has canceled Biden's "AI diffusion rule," which would have restricted American technology exports. 
Manus Expands Free Access (1 minute read) 

Manus has eliminated its waitlist, offering broader access to its virtual desktop AI agent with one free daily task for all users and a one-time bonus of 1,000 credits and significantly lowering the barrier to entry for this previously hyped automation tool. 
A modular and multilingual LLM (8 minute read) 

Helium 1, a 2 billion parameter LLM, excels in European languages and is optimized for on-device use.

subject: Rhino Racing WTRL TTT sign-up success.
body:
Can't see this message? View in browser
 
￼

Thanks for registering.

If you are new to Team Time Trials then have a read of the below - it will give you all the info needed to get lined up in the pen with your fellow team mates.
​
Please remember that everyone is equally important to the team, the keyword is Team!
  
There are 2 forms used for TTT’s, you have obviously found the first as you made your way here...⁠ 
 The sign-up form (that you've just filled in) is available each week on Friday and is where you can select your availability for the following Thursday - timezone availability, including a comments section if you want to request an easy ride, harder ride etc.
 The team-sheet is usually finalised on a Wednesday afternoon / evening and confirmed via a message in ⁠ttt-chat on the Rhino Racing Discord server (all riders will get tagged - as long as we have your discord tag).
The team sheet confirms which team you are on and who you ride with.
TEAM SHEET
￼
You need to click the RacePass link for your team, and you need to have a registered WTRL account:
WTRL REGISTRATION
￼
Most teams have a chat beforehand if needed, in the ⁠ttt-chat channel. (Some regular competitive teams have dedicated channels to discuss tactics beforehand) but if you have any questions please ask or DM any Rhino you have spoken with and they will help you or point you in the right direction.
​
Make sure you click the RacePass in the team sheet ASAP and are registered for the event. You have to sign up to the RacePass before that TimeZone begins, but so long as you have then you don’t actually have to join the event Race Pen in Zwift up until a few minutes before your official start time. However, it's always recommended to be in the Race Pen and in the Team Voice Channel 5-10 minutes before your start time.
​
You can confirm you’ve signed up correctly using the RacePass, as you should then see the TTT event on the home screen of your Zwift Companion App listed under Events.
Change kit to the Rhino jersey (if you have it - if you are new it might take a week for Gordon to get it unlocked for you).
 Make sure you select a TT bike from your garage!! If you want to look at the fastest bike setup, try Zwifter Bikes and use the settings to adjust for the course, your Zwift level, your Drops level and FTP and weight etc.
ZWIFTER BIKES
￼
Add (Rhino) after your Zwift name (this can be done in the Companion App settings).
At least 10 minutes before your event start time, please log on to Zwift (in case of software updates) and join the Discord Team Voice Channel of the team name you are riding with (Albino, Thundering, Rapids, Nuclear etc) meet your teammates, discuss a plan, make sure everyone is ready etc.
​
Please check your discord if you have not used it before (turn on noise suppression in settings to remove trainer/fan noise).
​
The aim is to stay with the group, always in the draft. If you are stronger rider do more work on the front. If weak just try hang on in the draft. Sometimes a race is just too fast and riders need to be dropped (especially for experienced teams going for the win).
​
For teams of 5 or more, the team time is taken from 4th rider to cross the line. For teams of 3 or 4, it is from the 3rd rider crossing the line.
​
Don't feel bad if you get dropped just continue the race at your own pace but please DON'T INTERFERE OR TRY DRAFTING OTHER TEAMS. If another team passes you then it is respectful to ease your power for 10-20s until they are passed and a few seconds clear of you.
​
If you finding that you are not enjoying the TTTs and maybe getting put in a team that drops you each week then please feel free to comment on sign up form – you can ask for an easier ride, a harder ride – we are always flexible to try place riders in a team that suits their needs.
 Communication is key, don’t be afraid to talk to your team even if you are new and learning - if you see the group stretching try call it out when you see gaps of 3-4 meters before it gets to 5+ and out the draft. If you can’t last any longer then tell them you are dropping so that they know to carry on etc.
​
We are all racing to have fun and there are some very experienced TTT riders active in ⁠ttt-chat who are happy to answer any and all questions.
​
Support your teammates and have fun. Remember it’s a Team Time Trial!  
 
There are lots of videos in streaming links on the Rhino Racing Discord server to see how a TTT is done if you would like to have a look beforehand.
​
Well done on getting to the end of this and remember... Have fun... the type 2 kind!
 
This email was sent from this site.
If you no longer wish to receive this email, change your email preferences here.
￼

subject: OpenAI & Microsoft Renegotiate Terms 🤝, Meta’s New FAIR Director 🧑‍🚀, ChatGPT's Carbon Footprint 👣
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-12
FYI: you can get access to 980+ labs and courses on Google Cloud Skills Boost (Sponsor) 

Worried about falling behind? Google Cloud Skills Boost will keep you up to speed with the latest in AI, data, and cloud engineering - using the same tools and environments you'll use on the job.

Each activity gives you temporary access to actual Google Cloud resources, so you're not just learning, you're doing.
Use Skills Boost to:
Analyze and Reason on Multimodal Data with Gemini
Enhance Gemini Model Capabilities
Implement Multimodal Vector Search with BigQuery
Learn. Explore. Gain the badges to show you've done it.
Start learning today with Google Cloud Skills Boost 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Meta's New FAIR Director (2 minute read) 

Meta has appointed Robert Fergus, previously a research director at DeepMind, to head its FAIR lab after a period of leadership changes and talent departures. 
OpenAI and Microsoft Negotiate Partnership Terms to Enable Future IPO (1 minute read) 

OpenAI and Microsoft are renegotiating their multibillion-dollar partnership in a critical deal that could determine the AI leader's future. Microsoft, which has invested over $13 billion in OpenAI, is offering to exchange some of its equity stake for access to technology beyond their current contract's 2030 expiration. 
Deep Research now supports GitHub repo analysis in ChatGPT (1 minute read) 

ChatGPT's Deep Research agent can now scan GitHub repositories, reading source code and PRs to deliver detailed, cited reports. Users can query repositories directly through the Deep Research → GitHub integration. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Optimizing GEMM with Thread Block Clusters (28 minute read) 

Thread block clusters and 2-SM UMMA instructions on Blackwell GPUs enable higher arithmetic intensity and more efficient memory transfers in GEMM workloads using CUTLASS. 
ChatGPT's Carbon Footprint Is Negligible Compared To Daily Activities (7 minute read) 

ChatGPT queries consume far less energy than commonly believed. Updated estimates suggest just 0.3 Wh per typical query - ten times lower than previous calculations. While AI's aggregate energy demand requires attention, individual text-based AI usage shouldn't trigger climate guilt, especially compared to higher-impact activities like transportation or heating. 
Open Source Project Curl Battles Wave of AI-Generated False Vulnerabilities (4 minute read) 

curl's project founder, Daniel Stenberg, has reached a breaking point with the flood of AI-generated false vulnerability reports submitted through platforms like HackerOne. While HackerOne maintains that AI can enhance reporting quality when used responsibly, Stenberg is pushing for stronger infrastructure and tools to combat what he describes as effectively a DDoS attack on maintainers' time and attention. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Meta AssetGen 2.0 (6 minute read) 

Meta's AssetGen 2.0 is a set of new diffusion-based models for generating detailed 3D meshes and textures from text and image prompts that improve consistency, fidelity, and view-aware texture resolution over its predecessor. 
Flow-GRPO for RL-Tuned Diffusion Models (GitHub Repo) 

Flow-GRPO integrates reinforcement learning into flow matching by converting ODEs into SDEs and using denoising reduction to enhance sample efficiency and alignment. 
Deerflow (GitHub Repo) 

Bytedance's DeerFlow is an open source research assistant that employs a multi-agent architecture with search engines, web crawlers, and Python capabilities to deliver Deep Research-style reports and podcasts. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Gemini 2.5 Video Understanding (5 minute read) 

Gemini 2.5 Pro has shown state-of-the-art performance on video benchmarks like YouCook2 and QVHighlights, outperforming GPT-4.1 and rivaling fine-tuned specialist models under equal evaluation settings. 
Canadian Pharmacist Exposed as Key Figure Behind World's Largest Explicit Deepfake Site (13 minute read) 

Investigative journalists have identified Toronto-area pharmacist David Do as a central figure behind MrDeepFakes.com. The site permanently shut down following the revelations. It had 650,000 users and generated over 2 billion views since 2018. The site hosted tens of thousands of non-consensual AI-generated explicit videos of celebrities, influencers, and private citizens. While non-consensual deepfakes remain legal in Canada, Prime Minister Mark Carney has pledged to criminalize it following the practice of countries like the UK and Australia. 
Single-Image to 3D Avatars (4 minute read) 

SVAD combines video diffusion and 3D Gaussian Splatting to generate high-quality animatable avatars from a single image, achieving real-time rendering. 
⚡
Quick Links
OpenAI to Acquire Coding Tool Windsurf for $3 Billion (2 minute read) 

OpenAI has reached an agreement to acquire AI-assisted coding platform Windsurf (formerly Codeium) for approximately $3 billion. 
SoundCloud's Quiet Terms Update (1 minute read) 

SoundCloud reportedly changed its terms of service to permit AI training on user-uploaded content, prompting concerns over transparency and consent. 
FutureHouse releases AI tools it claims can accelerate science (3 minute read) 

FutureHouse, backed by Eric Schmidt, has launched AI tools to aid scientific research, including Crow, Falcon, Owl, and Phoenix.

Real Estate Connect 
Aberdeen connects you to the latest perspectives on the real estate world. 
￼
Real Estate Connect, Q2 2025 
￼ 
Aberdeen 
Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation 
Read on LinkedIn 
As real estate markets adjust to tectonic shifts in the global landscape, new opportunities are emerging. In this edition, we explore how the UK build-to-rent sector is delivering both social impact and long-term value, while London offices face a turning point shaped by two key factors: connectivity and flexibility. Across our market outlooks, we assess how investors are repositioning in response to tariffs, interest rate shifts and evolving tenant demand. Find out what’s driving real estate markets in Q2. 
For Professional Investors only. Capital at Risk. 

In the second part of our article series in collaboration with the John Lewis Partnership, we explore how the build-to-rent sector is transforming communities and driving long-term investment value. 
￼

As London’s office market faces high vacancy rates and declining values, the focus shifts to connectivity and adaptability. 
￼

We expect UK real estate to forge ahead despite the headwinds. Read more about our views in our Q2 outlook. 
￼

The outlook for European real estate returns has improved in recent quarters, despite an increase in the risk backdrop. 
￼

Resilient fundamentals and investor demand keep Japan and Korea at the forefront of APAC real estate opportunities. 
￼
Tariff pressure weigh on North American real estate, but multifamily markets show resilience. 
￼

Geopolitics and macro uncertainties are the largest risks to our forecasts. We discuss our outlook for Q2. 
￼
The value of investments, and the income from them, can go down as well as up and an investor may get back less than the amount invested. Past performance is not a guide to future results.

body:

subject: View your latest statement online
body:
Tescobank.com 
Credit Card ending 1016 
 
￼
 
Hello Roger,

Your latest monthly statement for your Tesco Bank Credit Card ending 1016 is now available in Online Banking or via our Mobile App.

If you don't have our Mobile App, you can download it from the App Store or Google Play.

Need a regular payment reminder?

You can choose to receive a handy reminder, up to 14 days before your payment is due. Get set up in our Mobile App or Online Banking today.

We're here to help

If you're worried about money at the moment, we're on hand to support you. Find out how at tescobank.com/moneyhelp﻿

How can I make payments to my credit card?

There are a number of ways you can make a payment in Online Banking or using our Mobile App:
	•	Direct Debit - set up a Direct Debit to pay either the minimum amount, the full balance or somewhere in between. It's easy to forget when your credit card bill needs to be paid - setting up a Direct Debit is a great way to make sure you don't. 
	•	Pay by Bank - make a payment directly from your bank, using our Mobile App or online at tescobank.com 
	•	Faster Payment - pay from your own bank using these details: Sort Code: 40-64-15 and Account Number: 31310006 . Use your 16-digit Tesco Credit Card number as your payment reference, without any dashes or spaces. 
	•	Pay by debit card - use your debit card to make a one-off payment to your bill. 
If you have any questions, please get in touch with us.

Yours sincerely,
The Credit Card Team at Tesco Bank 
 



  


Help and support 
Find answers to common questions about credit cards in our FAQs. Further help and support is available within our online community. 
  
Enquiries

Please don’t reply to this email as the mailbox doesn’t accept incoming messages. If you have any questions please visit our Online Help Centre.

Security Information

Tesco Bank will never ask for confidential information or for you to confirm your security details via email. Our emails may include links to trusted third parties but will never include links that direct you to your account login page. You can visit our Security Centre for more information on staying safe online. Please forward any suspicious emails to phishing@tescobank.com.

Tesco Bank is a trading name of Barclays Bank UK PLC. Registered in England No. 9740322. Registered Office: 1 Churchill Place, London E14 5HP. Authorised by the Prudential Regulation Authority and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority and the Prudential Regulation Authority.

subject: Mistral Medium 3 ⚙️, Fidji Simo joins OpenAI 🤝, Anthropic Web Search API 🔍
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 


TLDR AI 2025-05-09

🚀
Headlines & Launches
Mistral Medium 3 (3 minute read) 

Mistral Medium 3 was introduced to deliver strong enterprise performance at significantly lower cost. It is optimized for deployment flexibility and coding tasks. 
Fidji Simo Joins OpenAI as CEO of Applications (2 minute read) 

OpenAI has appointed Fidji Simo to lead its Applications division, reinforcing its focus on scaling product and operations as it expands beyond research into global deployment and infrastructure. 
Anthropic launches Web Search API for Claude (2 minute read) 

Anthropic launched a new Web Search API for its Claude models. This API allows Claude to access and use real-time information from the web. The capability enhances Claude's ability to provide current and accurate responses. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Is there a Half-Life for the Success Rates of AI Agents? (1 minute read) 

AI performance on long tasks follows a simple model with a constant failure rate, creating an exponential decline in success. Each AI agent can be characterized by a "half-life" that estimates success over varying task lengths. This model suggests failures arise from complex sets of subtasks. 
Separating Fact from Fiction: Here's How AI Is Transforming Cybercrime (6 minute read) 

AI in cybersecurity primarily enhances existing techniques rather than creating new threats and lowers entry barriers for cybercriminals. At the recent RSA Conference, experts highlighted AI's role in automating tasks and facilitating advanced cybercrime models like AI-as-a-Service. Future defenses will require AI-driven strategies and international collaboration to effectively combat evolving threats. 
The Leaderboard Illusion (1 minute read) 

Chatbot Arena's benchmarking exhibits bias due to undisclosed private testing and selective data access. Providers like Google and OpenAI dominate data access, while open-source models receive significantly less. These dynamics lead to overfitting rather than genuine model improvement. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Osmosis self-improvement via real-time reinforcement learning (4 minute read) 

Osmosis is a platform for AI self-improvement via real-time reinforcement learning. The team has open sourced a lightweight model that works as well as SOTA for MCP. It can be run locally. 
Actor-Critic Learning with Offline Data (29 minute read) 

A new actor-critic RL algorithm has achieved near-optimal sample efficiency using offline data and targeted exploration, addressing long-standing challenges in hybrid RL settings. 
AMIE gains vision: A research AI agent for multimodal diagnostic dialogue (1 minute read) 

Google Research and DeepMind collaborated on this research, with contributions from many experts across various teams. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Google launches 'implicit caching' to make accessing its latest AI models cheaper (3 minute read) 

Google's new "implicit caching" feature in its Gemini API reportedly offers 75% cost savings on repetitive context for its Gemini 2.5 models. Unlike the previous manual explicit caching method, this automatic feature could ease developer concerns about unexpected API costs. However, developers should monitor its effectiveness, as Google hasn't provided third-party verification for the cost savings claims. 
AI-generated code could be a disaster for the software supply chain. Here's why (4 minute read) 

AI-generated code often includes non-existent library references, exposing systems to supply-chain attacks via dependency confusion. A study found 19.7% of dependencies from tested LLMs were fabricated, creating security risks. Open-source LLMs hallucinate more frequently than commercial ones, with JavaScript showing higher error rates than Python. 
Hugging Face releases a free Operator-like agentic AI tool (2 minute read) 

Hugging Face's Open Computer Agent is a cloud-hosted AI agent capable of basic tasks but struggles with complex requests like flight searches. Despite limitations and queue times, it showcases the potential of open AI models powering workflows and is part of a growing trend in agentic technology investments. A KPMG survey shows 65% of companies are experimenting with AI agents. The market is expected to grow significantly. 
⚡
Quick Links
Perplexity Expanding AI-Powered Learning (2 minute read) 

Perplexity has teamed up with Wiley to integrate textbook content into its AI search experience, allowing students and institutions seamless access to curriculum materials and real-time explanations. 
Freepik releases an 'open' AI image generator trained on licensed data (2 minute read) 

Freepik's F Lite is an AI image model developed with Fal.ai and trained using 64 Nvidia H100 GPUs that utilizes licensed, safe-for-work images. 
Meta Enters The Token Business, Powered By Nvidia, Cerebras And Groq (2 minute read) 

Meta showcased its capability to rival ChatGPT at LlamaCon by collaborating with Cerebras and Groq for faster inference processing.

subject: News & Club Runs
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 

Dear Roger,

￼ 
2025 TT ENTRY TICKETS HERE
Time Trials
 The club will again be hosting a weekly 10-mile time trial on the N1/10 course up and down the old A1 from Sawtry on Wednesday evenings from the 14th May to 20th August.  ENTRIES BY 2PM ON THE DAY PLEASE.  11th June will be a FREE OF CHARGE 'Come and try it' week! 3rd September is the Hill Climb.  As we still don't have an Events Officer on the Committee, organisation of the TT's has been a team effort behind the scenes. Quite some work has gone into making the TT's easier for anyone to take on in the future. If you can offer to help in anyway in future, please speak to a committee member or to one of our regular TTer's. All kit and signs are now stored onsite at Sawtry and we have a new website based database that generates start sheets, results and podiums. It's just a case of entering the data and clicking a button. No tech compatibility issues!  Further information and links, including how to ENTER to ride are in the event page on Facebook:  Please support so that we don't see these events lost in future.
Facebook Event Page

￼ 
SICC in The Peak District
 Great weekend in the Peak District climbing hills, smelling fresh air, beautiful views and company. We split into 3 small groups this year but found each other towards the end of the ride.
 
We were diverted this year due to a closed road where there’s been wild fires on the heath which is sad but we quickly carried on. The diversion did mean we had a steeper (but shorter) ‘hill’ to climb. The ‘hill’ was an extra 343ft at 12.6% and .52 miles long. The segment is called ‘Goyt’s Lane - Straight of Pain’!! 🤣  
The diversion took us into Buxton which was a nice change, to all the cafes which worked out perfect for a mid ride stop. My group found a very nice cafe serving vegan food, the vegan burger was a winner.
 Well done to everyone that came along for the ride and thanks for being so awesome.
 
Sorry not to include everyone in the photo mash up, I did the best I could with the ones sent to me. I think we must have been too busy climbing 💪💪 to take photos of everyone!

SICC Summer BBQ
￼ 
29th June 2025

This event is subsidised 50% by the club. £10 of food for £5!

Date: Sunday 29th June (Food from 2pm – After the club ride)
Venue: Floods Tavern
Cost: £5 per ticket (Adult/Child)
Whats included: A Burger OR a Hotdog (Vegan/Vegetarian options)
PLUS: Salad, coleslaw, potato salad and chips

Partners and families welcome.
Summer BBQ Tickets

Sunday Club Run

￼ 
11th May 2025

We meet outside The Norris Museum on The Waits, St Ives at 8:45 with the first group leaving at 9:00 prompt.

This week's club run will be heading to Oundle and Upton.

Groups A and B will ride the same route of 58 miles stopping at The Coffee Tavern in Oundle.

Group C will ride the shorter route of 34 miles stopping at Holly Lodge Cafe in Upton.*

*The pace of the C group is around 14-16mph giving opportunity to new riders to join us.  Please welcome new riders to this group.
Sunday Long Route - 15 - Oundle
Sunday Short Route - 202 - Upton

Thursday Evening Ride
￼ 
15th May 2025

We meet outside The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen on The Boulevard, Alconbury Weald at 18:15 with the first group leaving at 18:30 prompt

Polebrooke and Glatton Loops this week
	•	Routes will be here the week before each ride.
	•	Multiple paced groups.
	•	2 routes
	•	25 - 35 miles
	•	No stop ride
	•	The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen will be open until 11pm.
	•	Free Parking available outside The Club gym and near The Pavillion.
	•	New riders are welcomed so please bring a friend.  Membership is required after 2 club rides for insurance purposes.
Facebook Event Page - Please show support to get these rides kick started 👊
Thursday Long Route - 181 - Polebrooke Loop
Thursday Short Route - 182 - Glatton/Hamerton Loop
Polite Reminders (for all club rides):
	•	Download the route.
	•	Remember your cafe bike locks.
	•	Look after your club mates.
	•	TT/Aero bars are not to be used.

Thank you.


2025
Dates for your Calendar
 
	•	Social Evening (off the bike) - Tuesday 25th February
	•	International Women's Day Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 8th March
	•	Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 12th April
	•	Double Dutch Audax - Saturday 19th April
	•	Easter Club Run - Sunday 20th April
	•	Evening Social Rides (Alconbury) Start - Thursday 1st May
	•	Peaks Away Day Club Run - Sunday 4th May (stay for the weekend, it's a Bank Holiday!)
	•	Evening 10 mile Time Trials Restart (Sawtry) - Wednesday 14th May
	•	Club Summer BBQ Club Run - Sunday 29th June
	•	Summer Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 19th July
	•	Last Evening 10 mile Time Trial (Sawtry) - Wednesday 20th August
	•	Bank Holiday Weekend Longer Club Run - Sunday 24th August (ideas welcome!)
	•	Last Evening Social Ride (Alconbury) - Thursday 28th August
	•	Dave Nelson Memorial Hill Climb - Wednesday 3rd September
	•	Cafe Ventoux Away Day Club Run - Sunday 7th September
	•	Remembrance Club Run - Sunday 9th Novemeber
	•	Christmas Dress Up Club Run - Sunday 21st December
	•	Festive 500 - Wednesday 24th - 31st December
	•	Winter Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 27th December
	•	Short New Years Eve Ride - Wednesday 31st December
 
	•	SICC hosts Eastern League CX - TBC
	•	Christmas Meal - TBC
	•	AGM & Awards Presentation - TBC

 
Club 10m TT's & Hill Climb
These will go ahead but they need more support to survive (we still require an Events Officer).

Thought of the week
￼ 


￼ 


￼

subject: St Ives CC TT sign up link
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 
St Ives CC TTs sign up link included here
Dear Roger,

Further to yesterdays email, the link to sign up for TTs is below.

IMPORTANT.

Anyone wishing to enter must sign up via the link by 2pm on the day of the event.

Entries will be £5 for members, £6 for non-members, and free for those under 18.  Please follow the link to purchase your entry and select the week you’re entering for each week: 

https://sicc-kit.markbingley.com/product/tt-entry-ticket-2025-season/

Parking is at the Sawtry Football Pavilion, Straight Drove, Sawtry, PE28 5XN: 
https://goo.gl/maps/dHNzHTVMkL8VvqTq9

The first rider will be off at 6:45pm from the start point seen on the ride with gps link at the bottom of the email, with each subsequent rider at 1 minute intervals. (Note: From June onwards, the start time moves to 7pm)

Please note that as well as a helmet being mandatory, both front and back lights are required, so please remember to bring these, otherwise you won't be able to race.

WE NEED MARSHALS!
It’s a lovely evening helping and 2 events qualify you for discounted membership. Being part of a club means getting involved and this is a great way to do it.

  
10 MILE COURSE
￼ 


￼

subject: Rocky Horror Show, The Night Sky Show, Sandi Toksvig, Saving Grace Podcast Live plus many more!
body:
Discover our on sale shows
 
Is this email not displaying correctly? View it in your browser.
￼
￼
BOX OFFICE: Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk | Phone: 01223 357851 | Mon - Fri, 10am - 5pm
￼
On Sale Now
￼
Rocky Horror Show
￼
27 April - 2 May 2026 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Richard O’Brien’s legendary The Rocky Horror Show comes to Cambridge as part of a new world tour.
Seen by over 35 million theatregoers, it follows squeaky-clean college kids Brad and Janet, who break down outside a creepy mansion and meet the flamboyant Dr Frank-n-Furter. What follows is an unforgettable adventure filled with fun, frolics, and frivolity.
 
Directed by Christopher Luscombe, this cult classic features iconic hits like Sweet Transvestite, Dammit Janet, and Time Warp. Don’t miss the biggest party of the year!
￼
BOOK NOW
￼
The Night Sky Show
￼

26 October 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Astronomer and author Adrian West (aka VirtualAstro) presents The Night Sky Show—a fun, accessible journey through the stars, filled with stunning visuals and entertaining space stories.
 
Perfect for anyone who's ever looked up and wondered.
￼
BOOK NOW
￼
Sandi Toksvig - Friends of Dorothy 
￼

7 October 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Come and join the comedian, broadcaster, campaigner (and tiny Danish beacon of hope) for an evening celebrating her love and passion for writers and books. A sell-out in 2024, this show is packed with fascinating stories, a lively Q&A and the much-contested ‘Cleverest Person in the Room’ game. Dive into Sandi's extraordinary collection as she explores outrageous and bizarre titles such as ‘The Beginners Guide to Sex in the Afterlife’ and ‘Cheese Problems Solved’.  
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Saving Grace Podcast Live 
￼

26 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
GK Barry is taking her wildly popular podcast, Saving Grace, on the road for an unmissable UK tour! Fresh out of the I’m A Celeb! Jungle, Grace is ready to bring her signature chaos, comedy, and charisma to a stage near you.
 
Grace celebrates her triumphant return with a one-of-a-kind night packed with laughter, Bushtucker Trials, and plenty of her iconic wit.
 
It’s going to be a wild ride!

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
The Dualers
￼
13 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
South-East London’s 9-piece Jamaican Rhythm & Blues band – rose to fame with their hit single Kiss on the Lips, reaching No. 21 in the UK charts without any industry backing. Since then, they’ve scored two Top 30 albums, sold out major venues like Wembley Arena and Indigo at the O2, and built a global fanbase. Widely hailed as Britain’s best Ska & Reggae band, they continue to wow audiences across the UK, Europe, and Asia.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Kane Brown
￼

4 October 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Fearlessly hilarious delivery combined with honesty and sincerity. Kane Brown is 19 years in the game, has performed around the world, has opened for Guz Khan on his UK Tour, can be seen on
Man Like Mobeen (Netflix), Deepfake (Channel 4), She’s the One (Amazon) and heard on his hit Podcast, Rated 18.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
The Dinosaur That Pooped
￼

27 May 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Adapted from the number 1 best-selling books by Tom Fletcher and Dougie Poynter, the whole family will have a poopy good time enjoying a brand, new story for the stage.
 
When Danny and Dino’s favourite rock band are playing their last ever concert, they go on a quest to get the last two tickets. But with a villainous band manager lurking, nothing goes to plan. Will the band perform? Will Danny rock out? Or will Dino’s rumbling tummy save the day?
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
￼
￼
Shows on sale with Cambridge Live Tickets
￼
COUNTRY IN THE COUNTRY
￼
30 May 2025 | Ely Rugby Club
On general sale now
￼
Saddle up with an evening of Country music in Ely!
 
Live bands & tributes performances to Taylor Swift, Luke Combs, Dolly Parton, Johnny Cash & more!
 
Food, drink and wild entertainment!
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Ely Fest 2025
￼
31 May - 1 June 2025 | Ely Rugby Club
On general sale now
￼
Ely Fest returns in 2025 with a brand-new site and even more to enjoy. This is your invitation to a weekend of incredible live music, great food, and unforgettable moments.
 
Saturday 31st May is dedicated to adults, while Sunday 1st June is all about family fun.
 
Both days are packed with live acts and tribute bands, superstar DJs, live sax and percussion, licensed bars, delicious street food, a VIP enclosure and more.
 
Secure your spot now for an unforgettable weekend of music, fun, and good vibes.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Discover More
￼
Music in the Parks
￼
We’re thrilled to welcome the return of Music in the Parks this June – a summer celebration of live music in some of Cambridge’s most beautiful green spaces.
 
Supported by Cambridge Bid, this free six-concert series runs on selected Sunday afternoons from June to September, between 3–5pm, and is open to everyone.
 
So, pack your blankets and chairs, bring your friends, family (and dogs!), and join us for a relaxed afternoon of fantastic live music – completely free.
FIND OUT MORE
￼
Garden House
￼
￼
￼
￼
We're delighted so many Corn Exchange customers have been enjoying the special restaurant discount offered by our partner, Garden House, which continues throughout spring and summer.
 
Garden House is just a 7-minute walk from the Corn Exchange, making it the perfect spot to enjoy a meal before or after your event. If you haven't already, why not make your night out extra special with this fabulous offer exclusively for Corn Exchange ticket holders!
 
T&Cs apply. Visit website for more info.

BOOK HERE
￼
Want to skip the queues?
￼
The age-old tradition of queuing for interval drinks is becoming a thing of the past at the Corn Exchange.
 
Simply follow this link and place your order in just a few easy steps. Whether you're craving a bag of Haribos, a Coke, a glass of wine, a beer, a ready-mixed cocktail, or an award-winning Saffron Ice Cream, you can sit back, relax, and enjoy the show while your interval drinks and snacks are delivered straight to your seat!
PRE-ORDER NOW
￼
CornEx Membership
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange, run by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council, depends on ticket sales, sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants, and concessions to bring top-quality shows to the city. By becoming a member, you make a significant impact, helping us continue to deliver the music, comedy, and performances you love. As a thank you, we offer great perks in return.
BECOME A MEMBER
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange is operated by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council. As well as Corn Exchange ticket income, we rely on income raised through sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants and concessions to ensure that we can continue to bring the biggest and best shows to the city.
 
We also organise an annual programme of diverse and greatly valued events including free Fireworks Night, Out of the Ordinary Festival and Music in the Parks. These events are free in order to offer residents the opportunity to participate in the cultural life of the city and to provide access to all. They contribute to creating a united city, ‘One Cambridge - Fair for All’, in which economic dynamism and prosperity are combined with social justice and equality. Again, these events are also an opportunity to develop valued partnerships with local businesses and other organisations that make up the Cambridge Community.
3 Parson's Court, Wheeler Street, Cambridge, CB2 3QE
 
Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk
Phone: 01223 357851

Cambridge Corn Exchange is provided by Cambridge City Council
￼

If you no longer wish to receive these emails, please click here to unsubscribe.
 
If you have any suggestions, queries or comments, why not send us an email to tickets@cambridge.gov.uk.
 
© Cambridge City Council.

subject: Member News: Sun's out...
body:
View in browser
￼
￼
￼
Thursday 8 May 2025
Membership number: 1519986
￼
Fair-weather fun
Anticyclones are great for cycling. With high atmospheric pressure comes light winds, dry conditions and - from around this point in the year - warmer temperatures.
 
However you ride, a still, sunny day is an exciting prospect (though also a big shout-out to those who thrive in a slop-fest or go well when others won't touch their bike).
Staying safe in the sun
￼
We've been treated to a period of stable weather of late, with knee warmers, neck tubes, thick socks and insulating layers staying at home in the kit drawer. But with more skin on show, it's important to refresh your knowledge on the effect that UV radiation can have on your skin.
 
We've got helpful advice in collaboration with the British Association of Dermatologists on how to protect your skin, plus an article with more holistic tips on how to look after yourself when riding in warm weather.
Protect your skin
Sun safety tips

￼
Pathway applications open
￼
We have started the search for future talent, as applications for the Great Britain Cycling Team (GBCT) Olympic Development Squads and Podium Potential Squads are now open.
 
The next superstars of cycling have the opportunity to apply for the GBCT world class programme across track sprint, endurance, mountain bike XC, BMX racing and BMX freestyle park.
Read more
￼
￼


Lloyds Tour of Britain Women: routes revealed
￼
All four stage routes for the 2025 Lloyds Tour of Britain have now been released, which you can explore in detail on our website.
See the routes
￼
￼

Racing round-up
￼
There has been plenty of racing over the last few weeks, with MTB cross-country in Wales, junior open road racing in Tiverton, and youth omnium events on the track in Wolverhampton and London. Read the report below.
See race reports & results
￼
￼

Events coming up
￼
On Sunday the Rapha Lincoln Grand Prix will mark Round 2 of the Lloyds National Road Series Open and Round 3 of the Women's Series. Plus Fort William will host Round 2 of the Lloyds National Downhill Series and Round 3 of the Lloyds MTB Cross-Country Series is in Glentress.
 
Then looking another week ahead, the Cadence Junior Road Race will take place in Powys, while Round 3 of the National Youth Omnium is split between Newcastle-Under-Lyme, Brighton and Caird Park. Good luck to everyone racing in BUCS events over the next two weeks, too!
 
On the UCI WorldTour, 12 British riders will be part of the Giro d'Italia which kicks off tomorrow (Friday 9 May).
￼
￼

The poll: Results
We asked whether you typically ride alone or with others. Interestingly, almost two thirds of responders reported mainly riding solo.
￼

This week
Time for another kit drawer audit! In the winter we asked how many gloves you own. With the weather improving we want to hear how many pairs of cycling shorts you have (baggy, bibs and anything in-between all count).
Just the one
Two or three
Four or five

subject: Get Ready for Music in the Parks 2025!
body:
Enjoy a summer of free music in Cambridge's beautiful parks! 
 
Is this email not displaying correctly? View it in your browser.


 
￼
￼
￼
￼
Sun 29 June - Sun 7 Sept 2025 | Various locations 
￼
One of the city’s favourite summer traditions makes a welcome return in June when Music in the Parks begins, celebrating the season in musical style in some of Cambridge’s beautiful green open spaces.
 
The six-concert series is free and open to all, taking place on selected Sunday afternoons between 3-5pm from June until September.
 
The series of six free concerts offers a mix of music, all perfect for a sunny Sunday afternoon. From the infectious ska rhythms of Cambridge’s mighty Big 10, performing their now traditional Jesus Green date; funk, soul and blues; uplifting multi-voiced close harmony choral creations; the joyous sound of jazz and swing; the warm strains of traditional brass on a summery breeze plus, as part of Folk in the City, a special folk music themed concert at Cherry Hinton Hall with The Boxwood Chessmen – a semi-acoustic roots style four-piece band from East Anglia and Middlesex, and award winning indie-folk duo Elizabeth and Jameson.
 
Delicious refreshments will be available to buy from NapolEat Pizza, Aperol van and Cambridge favourite, Jack’s Gelato!

subject: Anthropic API Web Search 👋, Safari AI Search 🔍, Amazon Vulcan Robot 👋
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-08
Don't Wait — The Time for AI Agents Is Now (Sponsor) 

82% of organizations intend to integrate AI agents within 1-3 years.

According to Capgemini research, while only 10% of organizations currently employ AI agents, a large majority (82%) intend to integrate them within one to three years.   The time is now for leaders to invest in the right AI platform — one that seamlessly integrates analytics, models, and agents — to maximize value with what's next. Learn more in this C-suite guide to AI agents here. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Anthropic API Supports Web Search (3 minute read) 

Claude has been updated with web search support via API, enabling developers to build applications that incorporate real-time, up-to-date information from the internet. 
Amazon Vulcan Robot (6 minute read) 

Amazon's Vulcan is the company's first robot. It has a sense of touch, enhancing handling precision and marking a new phase in physical AI capabilities. 
AI Search in Safari (3 minute read) 

Apple is considering integrating AI search engines like Perplexity and Claude into Safari, reflecting growing momentum behind LLM-powered search. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Anthropic Economic Index: AI's impact on software development (11 minute read) 

AI systems like Claude are dramatically impacting coding by automating significant portions of programming tasks. Startups are leading in the adoption of AI coding tools like Claude Code, which is heavily used for front-end development, while enterprises lag behind. As AI capabilities grow, the nature of developer roles may shift towards managing AI systems, potentially accelerating technological advancements. 
Pathology with DINOv2 (5 minute read) 

The Mahmood Lab, using Meta's DINOv2, has developed open-source AI models for pathology, improving disease detection and diagnostics. 
Can O3 beat a GeoGuessr master? (2 minute read) 

Researcher Sampatt tested O3, an AI agent, against a GeoGuessr expert in the challenging street view geography game. O3 demonstrated strong reasoning and geographic inference but still fell short of consistently outperforming the human master. The experiment highlights both AI's growing spatial understanding and its current limitations in complex real-world tasks. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Simplifying Text with LLMs (6 minute read) 

Google researchers have used LLMs to simplify complex text without losing critical details, improving user understanding while preserving accuracy and nuance. 
Code Retrieval using LoRA (16 minute read) 

Researchers introduce a LoRA-based fine-tuning method for code search that reduces trainable parameters below 2% while improving retrieval accuracy by up to 9.1% for Code2Code tasks. 
A Novel Initialization Method (18 minute read) 

A new initialization technique, IDInit, ensures stable convergence in deep neural networks by maintaining identity transitions in both main and sub-stem layers. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
PyTorch Role in the AI Stack (5 minute read) 

PyTorch has evolved from a research framework to a foundational platform that powers generative AI. The PyTorch Foundation was expanded to integrate complementary projects and support scalable AI development. 
Meta's ChatGPT competitor shows how your friends use AI (4 minute read) 

Meta's new AI app introduces a Discover feed that adds a social media twist by allowing users to share their interactions with the AI. This feature aims to demystify AI by enabling comments, likes, and remixing of shared AI posts. The app, which replaces the View app for Meta Ray-Ban glasses, uses a Meta-tuned Llama 4 model and provides advanced voice interaction in select regions. 
Mastercard gives AI agents the ability to shop on your behalf (1 minute read) 

Mastercard's AI program streamlines e-commerce searches, reducing time and friction. Consumers retain purchase control as AI agents can't finalize transactions. 
⚡
Quick Links
OpenAI and FDA Discuss AI in Drug Evaluation (4 minute read) 

OpenAI and the FDA held meetings to explore how AI could expedite drug approvals, signaling a shift toward modernizing regulatory science with machine learning. 
Meta launches AI Defenders Program to protect LLaMA models (1 minute read) 

Meta introduced the AI Defenders Program to help developers detect and prevent misuse of LLaMA models. 
Startups launch products to catch people using AI cheating app Cluely (2 minute read) 

Cluely claims its hidden window enables undetectable cheating, sparking competition from startups like Validia and Proctaroo, which say they can identify Cluely users.

subject: AI Violin, MIDI Device Input, AAX Plugin, and More in ACE Studio 1.9.10
body:
￼
 
 
 
Explore New Features in V1.9.10!
 
Hey Roger Pembery,
 
I’m thrilled to share the release of ACE Studio version 1.9.10 with you! This update brings some incredible new features designed to enhance your creative experience:
 
Feature 1: AI Violin (Beta)
 
Our first AI-powered instrument model, AI Violin, is here. Simply input MIDI to create stunning violin performances that sound like they’re played by human masters, without the need for bulky sample libraries.
 
The current AI instrument model is still in beta and doesn’t support articulations or emotion controls just yet, but these features are coming soon. Plus, more instruments are on the way!
￼
￼
 
Feature 2: MIDI Device Input
 
Singer and Instrument tracks now support MIDI device input. For added flexibility, you can also use your computer keyboard as a MIDI input. 
 
Feature 3: AAX Plugin Support
 
ACE Bridge now supports the AAX plugin format! For Windows users, it will be installed automatically with the update. Mac users will be prompted to install it after updating.
 
Feature 4: Improved Voice Changer
 
The performance of our voice changer model has been significantly improved. If you use custom voice changer models, you can retrain them to take advantage of the updates. New settings, including pitch correction and time offset, are now available in the settings panel.
 
Update to version 1.9.10 today and explore all these exciting new features!
Upgrade Now 
Best regards,
Maxine
COO, ACE Studio
￼
￼
￼
￼

subject: St Ives CC TTs for 2025
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 
St Ives CC TTs start next Weds 14th May 2025
Dear Roger,

The club will be again be hosting a weekly 10-mile time trial on the N1/10 course up and down the old A1 from Sawtry on Wednesday evenings from next Wednesday 14th May.

Entries will be £5 for members, £6 for non-members, and free for those under 18.  Please follow the link to purchase your entry and select the week you’re entering for each week: 

SORRY, BUT THE ENTRY PAGE IS DOWN TEMPORARILY. WE WILL MAKE SURE THAT YOU WILL BE ABLE TO PAY YOUR ENTRY FEE BEFORE THE FIRST TT.

Parking is at the Sawtry Football Pavilion, Straight Drove, Sawtry, PE28 5XN: 
https://goo.gl/maps/dHNzHTVMkL8VvqTq9

The first rider will be off at 6:45pm from the start point seen on the ride with gps link at the bottom of the email, with each subsequent rider at 1 minute intervals. (Note: From June onwards, the start time moves to 7pm)

Please note that as well as a helmet being mandatory, both front and back lights are required, so please remember to bring these, otherwise you won't be able to race.

WE NEED MARSHALS!
It’s a lovely evening helping and 2 events qualify you for discounted membership. Being part of a club means getting involved and this is a great way to do it.

  
10 MILE COURSE
￼ 


￼
￼
￼
￼
￼

subject: Marshals Required
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 
TT Marshals needed for Wednesdays
It's coming up to the first time trial of the season on Wednesday 14th May
We will require 8 marshals each week. If you haven't done it before, it's a very simple task. Apart from being involved and helping the club, marshalling on 2 occasions allows you to qualify for standard membership for next year.  Of course, you don't have to just marshal twice, it's first come first served for dates available, but if you want to do more, then that's fine too!  At the moment, all dates are available, so if you have any dates you can attend, please let me know. The first TT will be Weds 14th May and we will need 8 volunteers every Weds until the season ending Hill Climb on Weds 3rd September.  Once we get closer to the date, we will be sending out further details. Thanks for supporting St Ives Cycling Club.  Please email me at stivescc.membership@gmail.com
Remember that a vibrant and inclusive club is nothing without the help and kind efforts of its members.
￼
￼
￼

subject: Gemini 2.5 Pro 🤖, Pinterest Visual Search 🔍, Cognition KEVIN-32B 💻
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-07
Reach millions of tech decision-makers with TLDR (Sponsor) 

Advertising in TLDR puts your brand in front of tech leaders when they're most engaged. Easily target millions of developers, PMs, and executives with our 12 interest-based newsletters. See how TLDR can drive results for your brand. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Gemini 2.5 Pro Preview (1 minute read) 

Google has released a preview of Gemini 2.5 Pro, which has a stronger performance in building web apps, code transformation, and multimodal reasoning. 
Pinterest New Visual Search (2 minute read) 

Pinterest has upgraded its image-based search with new tools that help users narrow results and explore styles, launching first in the women's fashion category across select regions. 
Cognition KEVIN-32B (7 minute read) 

KEVIN-32B is a model leveraging reinforcement learning for multi-turn code generation that outperforms existing models in developing CUDA kernels. It boosts kernel performance and correctness by optimizing intermediate feedback and using efficient reward distribution. Multi-turn training enhances the model's problem-solving capability over single-turn approaches, particularly in more complex tasks. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
How to train an AI model without falling into GDPR pitfalls? (5 minute read) 

AI model developers can ensure GDPR compliance during the development phase by using anonymous datasets or applying pseudonymization techniques. If anonymization isn't feasible, they can enhance data security and support data subjects' rights. Transparency measures, such as public communication about data usage, are also recommended. 
Can AI-Generated Images Truly Be Considered Art? (6 minute read) 

Christiane Paul, curator at the Whitney Museum, highlights AI's role in digital art, contrasting historical programs like Harold Cohen's AARON with today's AI models. She stresses the importance of collaboration with engineers and the challenges of preserving digital art due to evolving technology. Paul argues that AI-generated visuals need a conceptual framework to be considered true art. 
Quantization with AutoRound (18 minute read) 

AutoRound is a post-training quantization method that boosts low-bit model accuracy while preserving performance and efficiency. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
LLMs for Time Series: A Survey (18 minute read) 

This survey explores how cross-modality techniques adapt large language models for time series analytics, focusing on data alignment, fusion, and downstream task performance across multiple domains. 
Chain of Draft for Efficient Reasoning (9 minute read) 

Chain of Draft is a concise reasoning strategy that significantly reduces token usage while matching or exceeding Chain-of-Thought accuracy across complex tasks. 
Synthetic Data QA Framework (GitHub Repo) 

This evaluation toolkit provides standardized metrics to assess the quality and privacy of synthetic data across various data types using distributional and embedding-based measures. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
DDT: Decoupled Diffusion Transformer (GitHub Repo) 

Encoder/Decoder implementation of a Transformer with a Diffusion model as the decoder. It seems to work reasonably well on imagenet generation. 
Nvidia Radio Embedding Models (Hugging Face Hub) 

Nvidia has a suite of text and image embedding models that match SigLIP in many cases. 
AI in Heavy Machinery and Farming (8 minute read) 

John Deere, a leading manufacturer of agricultural and construction equipment, used AI to boost farming efficiency with precision tools like See & Spray, which drastically cut chemical use by identifying individual weeds at high speeds. 
⚡
Quick Links
Anthropic unlocks web search for all paid Claude plans (1 minute read) 

Anthropic has enabled web search for all paid Claude plans, adding real-time lookups and source citations. 
Little Language Lessons uses generative AI to make practicing languages more personal (1 minute read) 

Google's Little Language Lessons leverage models for real-world language learning through experiments like Tiny Lesson, Slang Hang, and Word Cam.
