Join us to celebrate Global Accessibility Awareness Day with in-person activities all throughout May. Find out how built-in accessibility features, APIs, and developer tools — including SwiftUI — can help deliver high-quality experiences to everyone.
Find an activity near you￼

Revisit accessibility videos
￼
Catch up on accessibility
in SwiftUI￼
￼
Perform accessibility audits
for your app￼

Browse updates to the HIG
Plus, check out updates to the Human Interface Guidelines on the Accessibility Design and VoiceOver pages. 

￼
BEHIND THE DESIGN: THE WRECK
Random access memories
Apple Design Award winner The Wreck tells the story of Junon, a writer who’s abruptly called to a hospital to make a life-changing decision. But the narrative is splintered, taking shape only as players navigate through seemingly disconnected scenes that can be viewed from different perspectives — and raise the question of how much we can trust our memories. “We tried to make a game that’s a bit off the beaten path,” says Florent Maurin, the game’s writer, designer, and producer, who based the game on real-life experience.
Read the story￼

￼
NEWS SNIPPETS
Bring machine learning to your apps 
With our new Develop in Swift Tutorials, you can learn how to use Apple machine learning frameworks to add intelligent features to your apps.
Start the machine learning tutorials￼
Plus, check out these updates across Apple platforms:
Explore HIG updates to Layout￼
Configure your Background Assets project￼
Enable Apple Intelligence summarization and prioritization￼

View all Apple Developer Documentation updates￼

Share your thoughts
We’d love to hear from you. If you have suggestions for our activities or stories, please let us know.

subject: OpenAI New Structure 🚀, Cursor $900M Fundraise 💰, Listen Labs PPT Generator 🎁
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-06
Become an AI-Native Engineer in 4 Weeks (Sponsor) 

Deep Atlas is an invite‑only, live program where senior SWEs and TPMs sprint through a tour‑de‑force curriculum—no filler, all signal.

The technical project-based curriculum blends fundamental AI theory with cutting-edge techniques. You'll fine-tune models and build agents alongside top engineers from Meta, Netflix, and Google.
If you value time and thrive on steep learning curves, this is the straightest path to building frontier AI skills.
Join the top 1% of AI builders. Next cohort: May 30. 15 seats left. Apply in <2 min. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
OpenAI New Structure (4 minute read) 

OpenAI's for-profit arm will become a Public Benefit Corporation while remaining under nonprofit oversight, aiming to align profit incentives with its long-term mission. 
Anysphere, which makes Cursor, has reportedly raised $900M at $9B valuation (1 minute read) 

Anysphere raised $900 million, led by Thrive Capital, valuing the AI coding tool maker at $9 billion. Existing investors like a16z and Accel joined the round. Competitors like Windsurf are also seeing heightened investor interest, with OpenAI reportedly eyeing acquisition opportunities. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Listen Labs PPT Generator (3 minute read) 

Listen Labs launched an AI presentation generator that automatically creates slides by analyzing audio and video content. This tool enables users to quickly repurpose existing media into slide formats. 
RL Training for Math Reasoning (26 minute read) 

Perplexity is using RL techniques like PPO and GRPO to boost math reasoning capabilities in models. This post shares insights into training pipelines and performance lessons. 
From Retrieval to Reasoning for AI Agents (29 minute read) 

Jure Leskovec's keynote at The Web Conference introduces STaRK, AvaTaR, and CollabLLM, new frameworks pushing AI agents to reason, collaborate, and test hypotheses using knowledge graphs, tools, and multi-turn optimization. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
One-Layer Transformers (38 minute read) 

A theoretical and empirical analysis revealed how one-layer transformers can learn even pair and parity check tasks, showing distinct training dynamics and benefits from Chain-of-Thought integration. 
Legal RAG Evaluation Toolkit (GitHub Repo) 

LRAGE offers an open-source framework for evaluating legal-domain LLMs in retrieval-augmented generation tasks, with integrated datasets and tools to support research. 
Voice Star Text To Speech (GitHub Repo) 

Another of many new speech generation models. This one has strong zero shot voice cloning capabilities and hints of expressiveness control. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
11x CEO Hasan Sukkar steps down (3 minute read) 

Hasan Sukkar is stepping down as CEO of AI startup 11x, with CTO Prabhav Jain taking over. Sukkar will remain as non-executive chairman, focusing on strategic direction and growth. Despite past controversies, 11x has raised over $70 million from investors, who continue to express strong support for the company's future. 
2025 PyTorch Docathon (1 minute read) 

PyTorch has kicked off a community-driven event to improve its documentation and make it easier for users to transition from research to production. 
Huawei aims to take on Nvidia's H100 with new AI chip (1 minute read) 

Huawei is developing the Ascend 910D AI chip to compete with Nvidia's H100 series. The company seeks Chinese partners for testing amid US export restrictions on AI chips. Success could mitigate the impact of US controls on China's AI market. 
⚡
Quick Links
Google's AI Funding in Asia (2 minute read) 

Google.org announced funding for 49 organizations across Asia-Pacific and committed an additional $12M to support AI education and workforce training. 
Anthropic Launches AI for Science Program (1 minute read) 

Anthropic is providing free API credits to researchers in biology and life sciences to accelerate discovery through its new AI for Science initiative. 
PyTorch Day France Highlights (1 minute read) 

PyTorch Day France brings together open source AI contributors for a one-day event with talks, real-world case studies, and community networking opportunities.

subject: Apple internal coding assistant 💻, ChatGPT Sycophancy 🤖, Phi 4 Reasoning 🧠
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 


TLDR AI 2025-05-05

🚀
Headlines & Launches
Apple and Anthropic's Internal AI Coding Platform (1 minute read) 

Apple is reportedly working with Anthropic to build a next-gen internal coding assistant using Claude Sonnet, integrated into Xcode to generate, edit, and test code. 
OpenAI Addresses ChatGPT Sycophancy (6 minute read) 

After reports of overly agreeable behavior in GPT-4o, OpenAI has detailed plans for more transparent updates, a new opt-in alpha phase, and stricter behavior safety reviews. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Phi 4 Reasoning 100% on Private graduate linear algebra exam (5 minute read) 

The new synthetically trained reasoning model from Microsoft shows strong local math and code performance, even in the face of poor internal world knowledge. 
GPT-4o Is An Absurd Sycophant (16 minute read) 

OpenAI's release of GPT-4o resulted in extreme sycophancy and other issues, raising concerns about its detachment from the OpenAI Model Spec against flattery. This was likely a misstep in pursuit of user engagement, exacerbated by A/B testing favoring positive responses. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledged the problem and has promised fixes. The situation highlights the risks of models being optimized in ways that might betray user trust. 
MCP is Unnecessary (4 minute read) 

MCP's main functions are advertising and calling tools, similar to OpenAPI, but it offers a more streamlined approach. While both can achieve similar outcomes, MCP's simplicity and reduced size make it attractive. MCP's perceived necessity is more sociological than technological. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Empowering LLMs with DeepResearch ability (GitHub Repo) 

WebThinker is a deep research framework fully powered by large reasoning models (LRMs). It enables LRMs to autonomously search, deeply explore web pages, and draft research reports. 
Amplify Initiative for Local AI Data (8 minute read) 

Google Research has introduced a global data collection initiative co-created with local experts to improve AI relevance in underserved regions. 
Efficient Federated Unlearning (14 minute read) 

FUSED introduces sparse unlearning adapters to selectively remove knowledge in federated learning, making unlearning reversible and cost-efficient. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Attention Distillation for Diffusion-Based Image Stylization (4 minute read) 

This method enhances image generation by leveraging self-attention features from pretrained diffusion models, introducing an attention distillation loss to optimize stylization and accelerate synthesis. 
Alibaba unveils Qwen 3, a family of 'hybrid' AI reasoning models (4 minute read) 

Alibaba has released Qwen 3, a family of AI models they claim can rival top models from Google and OpenAI. These open-licensed models feature advanced reasoning capabilities and a mixture of expert architecture. Supporting 119 languages and trained on 36 trillion tokens, Qwen-3-235B-A22B notably outperformed OpenAI's o3-mini in several benchmarks. It's not yet publicly available. 
Google SpeciesNet (3 minute read) 

Google's SpeciesNet is an open-source AI model for identifying animal species from camera trap images. The model, previously used in Wildlife Insights, will help scale biodiversity monitoring efforts. 
⚡
Quick Links
Gemini 2.5 Pro Beats Pokémon Blue (1 minute read) 

A livestream featuring Google's Gemini AI has completed Pokémon Blue, drawing praise from Google executives despite being an unofficial effort. 
AI has opened a new era in venture capital according to Forerunner founder Kirsten Green (1 minute read) 

Forerunner, known for investments in Oura and Chime, anticipates future growth in the AI era. 
OpenAI upgrades ChatGPT search, shopping, and citations (2 minute read) 

OpenAI has rolled out improvements to ChatGPT's search and added a streamlined shopping experience with product details, reviews, and buy links.

subject: Your Week Ahead
body:
￼
￼
New month, new challenges. May ZRacing kicks off in Makuri—fast, fun, and full of action. This week’s workouts are all about tackling the unexpected. The workouts might be unpredictable, but the fun and fitness gains aren’t!
EXPLORE EVENTS
￼
Makuri May: Ready to Race?
￼
 
May 5 - June 1
Get set for speed, strategy, and surprise breakaways across Makuri’s most exciting race routes. Stay sharp, ride smart, and make your move when it counts. After each stage, hit the GC leaderboard to see where you stand!
SIGN UP
￼
Climb of the Month: Oude Kwaremont
￼
 
May 1-31
Missing the cobbled Classics? This month, we’re bringing a slice of Flanders to your pain cave.
Take on Oude Kwaremont—just 1.5 km of gritty Belgian pavé with a 1/5 difficulty rating.
Short and iconic, it’s the perfect way to channel your inner Classics hero.
LEARN MORE
￼
Surge Protector
￼
 
May 5 - May 11
Surge Protector is a workout full of strong efforts and steady recoveries. It’s designed to mimic real-world challenges like breakaways and hill sprints, helping you build strength and speed recovery. 
With controlled intensity changes, you’ll sharpen your ability to stay strong during unpredictable efforts.

subject: Weekly attendance for Isaac Pembery
body:
Dear Parent/Guardian,
This automated weekly email is to let you know that Isaac was marked absent from the following registered lessons last week:
 
29/04/2025  13:45  Future Ready for Year 13  
30/04/2025  13:45  Maths Year 2  
01/05/2025  09:00  Physics Year 2  
Additionally Isaac was late for 1 registered class/es.
All known absences* are listed here, including those which either you or Isaac may have already explained. 
If absences have been marked incorrectly, please ask Isaac to contact the class teacher who will be able to amend the class register. 
If your young person will miss or has missed lessons, they can apply for authorised absence through the Student SharePoint page. They will need to select the reason for absence, provide evidence to support their absence request, and include permission from teachers. Both overall and authorised attendance figures are shared, if requested, with universities and future employers and so the evidence must be valid. Your young person can check their overall and authorised attendance through ProPortal. 
Students are not required to certify illness-related absences unless they relate to longer-term ill health - for example, hospital stays, or illnesses which can be evidenced by a note from a medical practitioner. Tutors will support your young person with their attendance.
If, after the above, you need further assistance please contact Student Services on studentservices@hillsroad.ac.uk or 01223 278011.
*NB. No medical appointments are disclosed for any student to preserve confidentiality of a student's health record, but do count towards your young person's overall attendance at College.
Best wishes,
Student Services Team
Hills Road Sixth Form College T: 01223 278011 | E: studentservices@hillsroad.ac.uk



Please consider the environment and don't print this email unless you really need to.

subject: Microsoft’s Phi-4-reasoning 🧠, Claude Integrations 🔌, Ai2’s OLMo 2 2️⃣
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-02
Why are some developers getting 10x more from AI coding assistants? (Sponsor) 

Most teams aren't getting value from AI tools because no one shows them how to use them.

DX's guide to AI-assisted engineering addresses that. It's a field manual for managers and developers to get more out of AI.
What's inside:
	•	Meta-prompting techniques that elicit better responses
	•	The top 10 developer use cases ranked by time saved
	•	Leadership strategies for encouraging AI adoption
Get the guide, distribute it internally with your teams, and make the most out of your investment in AI coding tools.
📘 Download your free copy now 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Microsoft's Phi-4-reasoning (6 minute read) 

Microsoft has introduced Phi-4-reasoning variants, pushing small language models further in efficiency and reasoning capabilities. 
Claude Integrations (3 minute read) 

Claude now connects to third-party apps, Google Workspace, and web search, enabling long-form research and globally accessible web search for paid users. 
Ai2's OLMo 2 (2 minute read) 

The Allen Institute has released OLMo-2-1B, a small, transparent model backed by full training data and logs, furthering open research in language models. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Observability for RAG Agents (56 minute read) 

This article provides a walkthrough of building realistic simulation agents using RAG and LLMOps. 
Why would AI companies use human-level AI to do alignment research? (4 minute read) 

AI companies might not prioritize alignment bootstrapping when they have human-level AI, mirroring their current focus on advancing capabilities with human researchers over safety efforts. This trend could lead to a dangerous disparity where AI capabilities significantly outpace alignment, increasing existential risks. To avert this, AI companies should already be emphasizing safety over capabilities to prove their commitment to responsible development. 
Why Developers Should Care About Generative AI (Even If They Aren't AI Experts) (7 minute read) 

Generative AI, like GitHub Copilot and Claude, is set to transform software development by enhancing productivity and automating routine tasks. While AI tools promise efficiency gains, they won't replace human developers, who are crucial for creative vision, quality assurance, and understanding complex requirements. Developers should embrace these tools to augment their skills and keep pace with technological advancements. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Agentic Process Orchestration: The Key to AI Agents that Outperform Human Workers (Sponsor) 

AI agents can be your next hyperproductive employees — but without correct orchestration, things can go haywire. Camunda's latest whitepaper reveals how to control your business's orchestration logic for AI agents that remain compliant while going above and beyond. Get the whitepaper, or book a demo to see how you can operationalize AI with Camunda. 
Google's Medical AI Reading Images (16 minute read) 

An overview of how Google's AMIE now analyzes medical images during chat-based diagnosis, improving its ability to suggest accurate treatments like a real doctor would. 
OpenAI wants its 'open' AI model to call models in the cloud for help (3 minute read) 

OpenAI plans to launch a freely downloadable open AI system this summer, aiming to outperform competitors like Meta and DeepSeek. This model may feature a "handoff" capability to connect with larger cloud-hosted OpenAI models for complex queries. OpenAI hopes this integration might drive more open source community engagement with its premium services. 
Federated LoRA Fine-Tuning (18 minute read) 

Fed-SB has introduced a scalable approach for federated fine-tuning of LLMs using LoRA-SB that drastically reduces communication costs. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Australian radio station secretly used an AI host for six months (4 minute read) 

Australian Radio Network's (ARN) CADA station faced backlash for using an AI-generated host, Thy, without disclosure. The show ran for six months before a writer revealed Thy wasn't real. Critics argue ARN should have been transparent about its AI use. 
OmniParser v2.0 (9 minute read) 

The next version of the great screenshot parsing tool from Microsoft. It scores well on the Screenshot Pro benchmark. 
Perplexity's CEO on fighting Google and the coming AI browser war (13 minute read) 

Perplexity's CEO Aravind Srinivas discusses Perplexity AI's plan to launch its own browser, Comet, which aims to serve as a platform for AI agents. Despite challenges with Google, Perplexity secured a pre-installation deal with Motorola's new Razr phones. Srinivas sees browsers as crucial for AI as they offer opportunities for deep integration and interaction with third-party services. 
TLDR is hiring a curator to join the TLDR AI team (Fully Remote) 

TLDR is hiring an AI curator to help write our daily newsletter, read by over 700,000 subscribers.

We're looking for someone who works full time in AI (at a frontier lab, AI startup, or major tech company) and regularly keeps up with the latest AI news and research.
Time commitment is ~5-10 hours/week.
To apply please send your LinkedIn or resume to jobs@tldr.tech along with a few sentences on how you currently keep up with AI news! 
⚡
Quick Links
AI Mode Updates in Google Search (2 minute read) 

Google has expanded AI Mode to more users, enhancing how people interact with search results through generative summaries and inline follow-ups. 
AI is getting “creepy good” at geo-guessing (5 minute read) 

AI tools like ChatGPT and Perplexity accurately determine locations from photos and bird songs based on visual and auditory clues, even without metadata. 
Perplexity AI launches WhatsApp integration (1 minute read) 

Perplexity has launched a WhatsApp integration for its AI assistant. 
Love TLDR? Tell your friends and get rewards! 
Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag! 
https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here.
Want to advertise in TLDR? 📰 
If your company is interested in reaching an audience of AI professionals and decision makers, you may want to advertise with us. 

Want to work at TLDR? 💼 
Apply here or send a friend's resume to jobs@tldr.tech and get $1k if we hire them! 

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian & Andrew Carr

subject: You may be eligible for a credit limit increase
body:
Tescobank.com
￼
Credit Cards
 
Credit Card ending: 1016 
Hello Roger,
We’re pleased to let you know that based on the information we hold, you are eligible for a credit limit of up to £5,000 on your Tesco Bank Credit Card. Your current limit is £3,000.
Please bear in mind that we consider all requests for a credit limit increase at the time they are made. If your circumstances have changed, the increase above might not be available, or we’ll choose a more suitable credit limit for you.
What do I need to do?
Requesting an increase is easy. You can do this at any time via our Mobile Banking App, or through Online Banking. Please refer to the information below.
What will this mean for me?
Remember, an increased credit limit could lead to increased debt. This may cost more in the long run or take longer to pay off. So that you avoid taking on too much debt, especially at the moment, please think carefully about whether you need a higher credit limit.
Will requesting an increase affect my credit score?
No, decisions on credit limit increases are made using information we hold, and we do not conduct a credit search. Requests do not affect future decisions on your account either.
Don't want to receive notifications about credit limit increases?
If you would prefer not to be contacted about credit limit increases go to the ‘Manage Account’ section of Online Banking and select ‘Don’t notify me of a potential increase’. This option will stop you from receiving any future credit limit increases. You can change your preferences back at any time via Online Banking.
Yours sincerely,
Your Tesco Bank Credit Card Team

subject: News & Club Runs
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 

Dear Roger,

SICC in The Peak District

This weekend!!  It isn't too late to join in for the day, details are below so please keep scrolling for details.

SICC Summer BBQ
￼ 
29th June 2025

This event is subsidised 50% by the club. £10 of food for £5!

Date: Sunday 29th June (Food from 2pm – After the club ride)
Venue: Floods Tavern
Cost: £5 per ticket (Adult/Child)
Whats included: A Burger OR a Hotdog (Vegan/Vegetarian options)
PLUS: Salad, coleslaw, potato salad and chips

Partners and families welcome.
Summer BBQ Tickets

Sunday Club Run

￼ 
4th May 2025

We meet outside The Norris Museum on The Waits, St Ives at 8:45 with the first group leaving at 9:00 prompt.

This week's club run will be heading to Milton Earnest and Keysoe.

Groups A and B will ride the same route of 62 miles stopping at the garden centre in Milton Earnest.

Group C will ride the shorter route of 43 miles stopping at the equestrian centre in Keysoe.*

*The pace of the C group is around 14-16mph giving opportunity to new riders to join us.  Please welcome new riders to this group.
Sunday Long Route - 53 - Milton Earnest
Sunday Short Route - 113 - Keysoe

Thursday Evening Ride
￼ 
8th May 2025

We meet outside The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen on The Boulevard, Alconbury Weald at 18:15 with the first group leaving at 18:30 prompt

Fen Loop Week
	•	Routes will be here the week before each ride.
	•	Multiple paced groups.
	•	2 routes
	•	25 - 35 miles
	•	No stop ride
	•	The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen will be open until 11pm.
	•	Free Parking available outside The Club gym and near The Pavillion.
	•	New riders are welcomed so please bring a friend.  Membership is required after 2 club rides for insurance purposes.
Facebook Event Page - Please show support to get these rides kick started 👊
Thursday Long Route - 175 - Fen Loop
Thursday Short Route - 176 - Fen Loop
Polite Reminders (for all club rides):
	•	Download the route.
	•	Remember your cafe bike locks.
	•	Look after your club mates.
	•	TT/Aero bars are not to be used.

Thank you.


Upcoming events in the SICC Calendar
For more information please click on the buttons below which will take you to our members only Facebook page.

We always hope for good numbers so that we can form suitable pace related groups.  Please hit 'GOING' to show support.  Thank you. 
Peaks Away Day Club Run


Peaks Away Day Club Run

Sunday 5th May 2025

Book a place to stay!!  OR drive down for the day!

We will be meeting in Hathersage outside the swimming pool.
There's a car park at the swimming pool, a pay and display opposite and other parking options in the town. Please allow plenty of time to get parked and make your way to the meet point. There's also toilets and a newly refurbished cafe at the pool if you wanted a pre/post ride coffee. They're open 8am-5pm and they're expecting us.

Meet: Oddfellows Rd, Hathersage, Hope Valley S32 1DU
Time: 9.15am (to be arranged into groups)
Depart: 9.30am
Route: https://ridewithgps.com/routes/45989392
Pool Cafe: https://www.hathersageswimmingpool.co.uk/.../the-pool-cafe/

It would be a good idea to carry snacks and gels on the bike and maybe extra supplies in the car.

The Old Smithy Cafe in Monyash (mile 38) and Hassop Station Cafe (mile 44) are marked on the ridewithgps route. There's also plenty of places to stop in Bakewell. Please take a look before the ride. We can agree in our groups when we would like to stop.  The Pool Cafe will allow us to catch up at the end.

Please feel free to use this Facebook event page to arrange car shares.
Now's the time to start training!  ￼

Please hit 'GOING' on Facebook to show support. Thank you. 

2025
Dates for your Calendar
 
	•	Social Evening (off the bike) - Tuesday 25th February
	•	International Women's Day Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 8th March
	•	Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 12th April
	•	Double Dutch Audax - Saturday 19th April
	•	Easter Club Run - Sunday 20th April
	•	Evening Social Rides (Alconbury) Start - Thursday 1st May
	•	Peaks Away Day Club Run - Sunday 4th May (stay for the weekend, it's a Bank Holiday!)
	•	Evening 10 mile Time Trials Restart (Sawtry) - Wednesday 14th May
	•	Club Summer BBQ Club Run - Sunday 29th June
	•	Summer Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 19th July
	•	Last Evening 10 mile Time Trial (Sawtry) - Wednesday 20th August
	•	Bank Holiday Weekend Longer Club Run - Sunday 24th August (ideas welcome!)
	•	Last Evening Social Ride (Alconbury) - Thursday 28th August
	•	Dave Nelson Memorial Hill Climb - Wednesday 3rd September
	•	Cafe Ventoux Away Day Club Run - Sunday 7th September
	•	Remembrance Club Run - Sunday 9th Novemeber
	•	Christmas Dress Up Club Run - Sunday 21st December
	•	Festive 500 - Wednesday 24th - 31st December
	•	Winter Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 27th December
	•	Short New Years Eve Ride - Wednesday 31st December
 
	•	SICC hosts Eastern League CX - TBC
	•	Christmas Meal - TBC
	•	AGM & Awards Presentation - TBC

 
Club 10m TT's & Hill Climb
These will go ahead but they need more support to survive (we still require an Events Officer).

Thought of the week

subject: Bongo's Bingo, James May, Peter Andre, Taylormania plus many more!
body:
Discover our on sale shows
 
Is this email not displaying correctly? View it in your browser.
￼
￼
BOX OFFICE: Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk | Phone: 01223 357851 | Mon - Fri, 10am - 5pm
￼
New On Sale This Week
￼
Bongos Bingo
￼

Saturday 5 July 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
BACK TO THE 90s, BABY! 
 
This July, join us for the ultimate throwback parties packed with pure 90s nostalgia. 
 
Get ready to dance to iconic hits from the Spice Girls, Eminem, and all your favourite 90s legends. It's your chance to break out the iconic Y2K fashion trends, and relive all the best pop culture moments of the decade!
 

￼
BOOK HERE FOR AFTERNOON
￼
BOOK HERE FOR EVENING
￼
Scouting for Girls 
￼

Saturday 12 March 2026 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale 2 May 2025 10am
￼
In 2010, Scouting For Girls amplified the success of their self-titled debut album with their follow-up ‘Everybody Wants To Be On TV’. Its lead single ‘This Ain’t A Love Song’ spent two weeks at #1 on its way to securing Platinum status, while the album debuted at #2 during a three-week Top 10 run and was also certified Platinum in recognition of 300,000+ domestic sales.
 
Now Scouting For Girls commemorate the album’s 15th anniversary with the release of new picture disc and zoetrope vinyl formats, and confirm details of a special celebratory tour which will see them mix songs from the album with all of their biggest hits.

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
The Very Best of Frankie Valli Starring Peter Andre 
￼

Friday 23 Jan 2026 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Starring Peter Andre - The Very Best of Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons is a spectacular high-pitched celebration of timeless music from one of the biggest selling groups of all time. This nostalgic musical journey pays tribute to the life and career of those four boys from Jersey, who started singing under a streetlamp but soon went on to become one of the most recognised groups in history.
 Featuring a supporting cast of incredible performers from smash-hit award winning West End musicals, The Very Best of Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons will leave you on a ‘high’ and guarantee you’ll be saying ‘Oh, What A Night!

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Cambridge Operatic Society - Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
￼
Wednesday 1 to Saturday 4 April 2026 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale 2 May 2025 10am
￼
Willy Wonka, the renowned chocolatier, grants five golden tickets to his extraordinary factory, ushering in a life-altering experience for the humble Charlie Bucket.  Within its walls, they'll explore a realm of pure imagination, witnessing chocolate rivers, mischievous squirrels, and the soaring glass elevator, all under the watchful eyes of the Oompa-Loompas.  As the tour unfolds, comical and challenging trials reveal the true character of each visitor, ultimately highlighting that only Charlie's virtue earns him the final reward.
  
Every ticket is Golden so book yours today!

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
On Sale Now
The Age of Discovery with James May Live on Stage
￼

Thursday 2 October 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Live on stage, James May will unravel the breathtaking tales of humankind from the earliest wanderings of ancient hunter-gatherers to the intrepid, often obsessive explorers, among them Lief Ericson, John Cabot, James Cook’s navigator Tupaia, Stanley and Livingstone, Gertrude Bell, Burke and Wills, through to the moon walkers, space exploration and the seemingly impossible challenges of interplanetary and intergalactic travel.

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Amy Macdonald
￼

Wednesday 3 December 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Amy Macdonald’s gift for crafting positive, uplifting songs from relatable stories of triumphs, struggles and hope have made her one of the UK’s most beloved artists. That talent has attracted a huge audience, leading to five albums which have gone Top 5 across Europe (including a #1 in the UK and two in Germany).

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Taylormania
￼

Sunday 25 January 2026 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Taylor Swift Eras Tribute Concert
 
An award-winning extravaganza that plays tribute to one of the leading contemporary recording artists of our time. Katy Ellis a self obsessed ‘Swiftie’ with an incredible live band and dancers promises to deliver the most authentic recreation of a Taylor Swift show you will ever see.
 
The show has already taken ‘Swiftie’ fans across the world by storm and features all of Taylor’s much loved hits including ; Shake It Off, Blank Space, Love Story, You Belong With Me, Look What You Made Me Do, I Knew You Were Trouble and many, many more.

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Prestige Productions presents Punk Off- The Sounds of Punk & New Wave
￼

Friday 6 March 2026 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
50 years since punk and new wave kicked the door in, Punk Off storms the stage—louder, bolder, and messier than ever. After a riotous debut tour in 2025, this one-of-a-kind concert show returns with music from Blondie, The Ramones, Sex Pistols, The Clash and more.
 
It’s raw. It’s rebellious. And it’s alive.
 
This isn’t a tribute—it’s a riot. A full-throttle celebration of the era that tore up the rulebook and made being loud a lifestyle. With a fierce cast of musicians, singers and dancers, Punk Off throws you headfirst into the scenes, sound, and spirit of punk.

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
￼
￼
Shows on sale with Cambridge Live Tickets
￼
Vanity Fair 
￼
Thursday 31 July and Friday 1 August 2025 | The Auditorium, Pembroke College
On general sale now
￼
Welcome to VANITY FAIR - a giddy carousel of social climbers, buffoons and preening dandies.
 
In a world of gossip and speculation, all is to play for and the stakes are perilously high - for romantic Amelia Sedley, consumed with her obsessive love and Becky Sharp, an irrepressible schemer who will stop at nothing to get what she wants.
 
Moving Parts Theatre Company takes a fresh, inventive approach to the classics. With a dazzling score of original music, this new adaptation of Thackeray’s tale of greed, ambition, love and betrayal transports audiences from Regency salons and ballrooms to the battlefield of Waterloo!

￼
BOOK HERE 31 JULY
BOOK HERE 1 AUGUST
￼
Discover More
￼
Garden House
￼
￼
￼
￼
We're delighted so many Corn Exchange customers have been enjoying the special restaurant discount offered by our partner, Garden House, which continues throughout spring and summer.
 
Garden House is just a 7-minute walk from the Corn Exchange, making it the perfect spot to enjoy a meal before or after your event. If you haven't already, why not make your night out extra special with this fabulous offer exclusively for Corn Exchange ticket holders!
 
T&Cs apply. Visit website for more info.

BOOK HERE
￼
Want to skip the queues?
￼
The age-old tradition of queuing for interval drinks is becoming a thing of the past at the Corn Exchange.
 
Simply follow this link and place your order in just a few easy steps. Whether you're craving a bag of Haribos, a Coke, a glass of wine, a beer, a ready-mixed cocktail, or an award-winning Saffron Ice Cream, you can sit back, relax, and enjoy the show while your interval drinks and snacks are delivered straight to your seat!
PRE-ORDER NOW
￼
CornEx Membership
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange, run by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council, depends on ticket sales, sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants, and concessions to bring top-quality shows to the city. By becoming a member, you make a significant impact, helping us continue to deliver the music, comedy, and performances you love. As a thank you, we offer great perks in return.
BECOME A MEMBER
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange is operated by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council. As well as Corn Exchange ticket income, we rely on income raised through sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants and concessions to ensure that we can continue to bring the biggest and best shows to the city.
 
We also organise an annual programme of diverse and greatly valued events including free Fireworks Night, Out of the Ordinary Festival and Music in the Parks. These events are free in order to offer residents the opportunity to participate in the cultural life of the city and to provide access to all. They contribute to creating a united city, ‘One Cambridge - Fair for All’, in which economic dynamism and prosperity are combined with social justice and equality. Again, these events are also an opportunity to develop valued partnerships with local businesses and other organisations that make up the Cambridge Community.
3 Parson's Court, Wheeler Street, Cambridge, CB2 3QE
 
Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk
Phone: 01223 357851

Cambridge Corn Exchange is provided by Cambridge City Council
￼

If you no longer wish to receive these emails, please click here to unsubscribe.
 
If you have any suggestions, queries or comments, why not send us an email to tickets@cambridge.gov.uk.
 
© Cambridge City Council.

subject: GPT-4o Rollback 🔙, Anthropic on Export Controls 🚢, Meta’s Protection Tools for AI 🦺
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-05-01
Welcome to the new era of agentic commerce. (Sponsor) 

PayPal is leading the agentic commerce revolution by providing developers and merchants with innovative tools, including the industry's first remote MCP server and PayPal Agent Toolkit, to create next-generation shopping experiences. Developers can now enable sophisticated agentic AI experiences, all powered by PayPal.

Seamlessly integrate PayPal's comprehensive suite of APIs—including those for managing payments, invoices, disputes, shipment tracking, catalog, subscriptions, reporting and insights—into various AI frameworks. 
> Get started today at PayPal.ai
> Connect fast with PayPal's MCP Server
> Integrate with PayPal APIs with AI frameworks in PayPal's Agent Toolkit 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
GPT-4o Rollback (3 minute read) 

OpenAI has rolled back a recent update to GPT-4o that introduced overly agreeable behavior and is now refining personalization and feedback mechanisms. 
Anthropic's Take on Export Controls for AI Chips (4 minute read) 

Anthropic supports strong export controls to secure America's compute lead, highlighting the national security stakes of advanced chip diffusion. 
Meta's Protection Tools for AI (6 minute read) 

Meta launched new tools to help secure open source AI systems, including privacy-preserving infrastructure and threat detection for model deployment. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Understanding Data at Scale (34 minute read) 

Meta manages vast, complex data ecosystems by embedding privacy considerations early in development and creating a unified privacy taxonomy to streamline compliance. 
Teaching LLMs solid modeling for next-gen design tools (5 minute read) 

Researchers trained LLMs to generate accurate solid models from text prompts. The method improved geometric accuracy over previous approaches. 
MCPs, Gatekeepers, and the Future of Music Licensing (4 minute read) 

MCPs face criticism for slow, opaque licensing processes. This article called for reforms to support independent music creators. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Get your portcos in front of 6+ million tech professionals (Sponsor) 

Get your B2B SaaS portcos instant access to millions of tech professionals across our 12 interest-based newsletters. Additional perks (i.e., discounts) are included when you sign up as a VC partner. 
LLM Benchmarking for Global Health (17 minute read) 

This article from Google discusses a new benchmark that uses synthetic personas to evaluate LLMs in diagnosing tropical and infectious diseases. 
Modulating Reasoning in LLMs (19 minute read) 

Researchers show that reasoning performance in LLMs can be adjusted via simple interventions in the residual stream using representation-based control vectors. 
A Tool for LiDAR Annotation (GitHub Repo) 

SALT is a semi-automatic labeling tool designed for LiDAR point clouds that offers strong zero-shot adaptability across different sensors and scenes while maintaining 4D consistency. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Mega Math Dataset (Hugging Face Hub) 

Over 300B tokens of highly curated math questions and answers for training. 
Perplexity's CEO discusses competing with Google and the AI browser war (3 minute read) 

Perplexity's CEO has outlined strategies to challenge Google in AI search and browsers. He predicts tougher competition as AI-native browsers reshape the market. 
AI excels at geo-guessing with minimal visual clues (2 minute read) 

New AI models identified locations from subtle image details with high accuracy. Researchers warned this could impact privacy and raise security concerns. 
⚡
Quick Links
Gemini Adds AI Image Editing (1 minute read) 

Google has expanded AI editing to the Gemini app, allowing users to modify personal images with multi-step tools and text-image interactions. 
YouTube tests its own version of AI Overviews (2 minute read) 

YouTube has started testing AI Overviews to summarize video content for users. 
Gmail app adds Gemini image generator and new Workspace features (2 minute read) 

Google updated the Gmail app with the Gemini image generator and new Workspace tools. 
Love TLDR? Tell your friends and get rewards! 
Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag! 
https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here. 
Want to advertise in TLDR? 📰 
If your company is interested in reaching an audience of AI professionals and decision makers, you may want to advertise with us. 

Want to work at TLDR? 💼 
Apply here or send a friend's resume to jobs@tldr.tech and get $1k if we hire them! 

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian & Andrew Carr

subject: Durham Newswire May 2025
body:
All your latest news and events
 
View in browser
 
 
￼
 
 
 
Newswire
May 2025
 
 
 
Do we have the correct details for you?
Current postcode: CB4 3NZ
Current professional position: Senior Technical Engineer
 
Update my profile
 
 
 
Your alumni newsletter 
Welcome to your newsletter.  
In a busy month, we have welcomed Their Majesties The King and Queen to Durham and officially opened Waterside, the new home of our Business School.  
We are planning to share a link to our alumni survey with you over the next few weeks, and we are looking forward to hearing your views to shape our plans.  
On a sad note, our thoughts are with the global Roman Catholic community, and everyone touched by the news of the passing of Pope Francis.  
Explore our latest news below.
 
 
 
￼
 
King and Queen attend historic Royal Maundy Service in Durham
 
We marked a truly historic and joyous occasion with the visit of Their Majesties King Charles III and Queen Camilla for the Royal Maundy Service at Durham Cathedral.  
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
The new home of our Business School officially opens
 
Global business leader, environmentalist and author Paul Polman gave an outstanding keynote speech at the opening of Waterside, the prestigious new home of the Durham University Business School.
Pictured (left to right): Incoming Business School Executive Dean Professor Kieran Fernandes; Vice-Chancellor and Warden, Professor Karen O’Brien; keynote speaker Paul Polman.
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
Our statement on the death of Pope Francis: A Pope of Compassion
 
We are deeply saddened by the passing of Pope Francis. Durham theologian, Professor Anna Rowlands, has been engaged in helping to shape the future of the Catholic Church as part of the global Synod process. 
 
Read more
 
 
 
Research to empower and inspire
 
We conduct innovative and impactful research to transform lives and make a difference globally and locally.
 
￼
 
Durham is to launch the Leverhulme Centre for Algorithmic Life, with help from the Leverhulme Trust to explore new ways to understand how humans interact with algorithmic technologies. The Centre will be led by Durham’s Professor of Political Geography, Louise Amoore.
 
Read our latest research

 
 
 
Our Community
 
 
 
￼
 
Alumni support funds revitalisation of historic garden
 
Thanks to over 100 gifts from individuals and the University College Durham Trust, work is underway to revitalise the beautiful yet underused Fellows’ Garden in the heart of Durham.
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
Discover the secrets of the stolen Shakespeare First Folio 
 
Our copy of Shakespeare’s First Folio is on display for the first time in over a decade as the centrepiece of a new exhibition, Shakespeare Recovered.
 
Read more
 
 
 
Class Notes
 
We’re proud to celebrate your successes and achievements. Click the button below to read more about what you’ve been up to this month. 
 
￼
 
Bringing new dimensions to fantasy sports
Debtanu Das (Finance and Investment, Ustinov College, 2022-23) and Trang Quynh Phan (Finance and Investment, Ustinov College, 2022-23) have co-founded web3-based fantasy sports platform Twelvth. UK business news site BusinessLive has conducted an interview with Debtanu to profile the company.  
"My focus is on launching and growing Twelvth, turning it into a market leader. The challenge of building a business, bringing people together, and seeing an idea come to life is what excites me the most." Debtanu Das
Image: Debtanu Das (left) with co-founder Trang Quynh Phan.  Claire Bacon née Simpson (Management, Spanish and French, St Aidan's College, 2002-06)  
Prof Dr Hamit Ersoy (PhD in Middle East Studies, Graduate Society, 1990-94)  
Oliver Knowles (Politics, University College, 1995-98)  
Hannah Thomas (History and Arabic, University College, 2011-15) 
Why not share your own news with us?
 
Read more

 
 
 
Lifelong learning
We have a wide range of postgraduate study options for you to continue your education and programmes for working professionals.
You can also browse a range of scholarships, including our alumni fee scholarship and new postgraduate student support scholarship.
Read more
 
 
 
Get Involved
 
 
 
￼
 
Look out for our 2025 Alumni Survey - your opinion matters!
 
You will soon be receiving your personal email link to take part in our survey. It only takes a few minutes to complete, but your input will help us to shape the future of how we connect, communicate, and grow together. 
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
Be part of Durham Venture School 2025
 
Join the world of cutting-edge startups, turn bold ideas into reality, receive a stipend and compete for £10,000! Apply for Durham Venture School here.
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
Volunteer at Summer Congregation 
 
We're looking forward to celebrating with our graduates at Summer Congregation and would like to invite alumni to volunteer with us from 2–9 July.
 
Read more
 
 
 
View all upcoming events
Check our events pages regularly for all the upcoming alumni events across the world, and how you can join in. 
Events calendar
 
 
 
Colleges
 
 
 
￼
 
Van Mildert Alumni Celebrate 60 Years - Norman Tower, Windsor Castle
 
The Norman Tower at Windsor Castle provided the setting for the latest event marking the College’s 60th year, where College Principal Professor Tom Mole shared Van Mildert’s vision for the future with attendees. 
 
Read more
 
 
 
￼
 
Castle Chapel Choir CD to honour memory of alumnus David Knowles 
 
The University College choir are recording an album in memory of late journalist David Knowles, a much-loved Castle alumnus and talented musician.
 
Read more
 
 
 
Read more from our Colleges
Explore our College pages to discover the latest news.
Read more
 
 
 
Retail
 
 
 
￼
 
Treat yourself to a keepsake from your time at Durham 
 
Treat yourself to a memory of your days at Durham from our elegant Lisa Angel collection.
 
Shop now
 
 
 
Want to read more?
If you liked these stories, take a look at the latest Durham news, featuring current research and thought leadership, student news, alumni and more.
Explore more
 
 
Durham University takes pride in the achievements and contributions of its 230,000 alumni and supporters. Stories that cite views, talks and published work reflect the individual's contribution in their personal or professional capacity and do not represent the University's position or endorsement.
Newswire is curated by Editorial Group members Lucian Hudson (Chair), Glen Whitehead, Claire Whitelaw, Tristan Alltimes, Vicky Fisher and Debbie Mayne, and assembled by Hamish Lehan and Jo Coombs.
 
If you would like to unsubscribe or change your email preferences, please contact us:

+44 191 334 6305

subject: Meta AI App 📱, Llama API 💻, Relational Graph Transformers 🌐
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

From ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-30
🤖 Together Inference & Fine-Tuning on 200 + OSS Models—One API, Any Scale (Sponsor) 

Together AI is The AI Acceleration Cloud, delivering turbocharged, production-grade inference – with an integrated code interpreter – as well as fine-tuning for the leading open source models. Migrate from closed models, and utilize serverless or dedicated endpoints without changing your code.

3 key highlights
	1.	200 + open-source models – Llama 4 Maverick & Scout, DeepSeek-R1, Qwen QwQ-32B, and more – all available through OpenAI-compatible endpoints, with built-in Code Interpreter.
	2.	Flexible deployment – Serverless API for pay-per-token usage or Dedicated Endpoints for single-tenant GPUs and consistent performance.
	3.	Continuous Fine-Tuning of Fully-Owned Models – Evolve your AI models over time, using preference optimization and continued training. Upload your data, run LoRA or full-parameter jobs, and push the tuned model straight to production. Learn more ›
🚀Get started with Together Inference and join 550,000+ developers building on open-source models at GPU speed. 💻 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Meta AI App (1 minute read) 

Meta has introduced a new standalone AI app, expanding its efforts to integrate AI features into consumer experiences more directly. 
Meta API for Llama (4 minute read) 

Meta revealed a limited preview of its Llama API at LlamaCon, giving developers tools to fine-tune, deploy, and evaluate models from the Llama series. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Language equivariance as a way of figuring out what an AI "means" (5 minute read) 

A researcher identified syntax-semantics issues in LLMs and proposed language equivariance to address them. The approach suggests checking if LLMs' moral judgments remain consistent after translation. Language-equivariant LLMs could represent a deeper understanding beyond mere syntax. 
Relational Graph Transformers for Enterprise Data (17 minute read) 

Relational Graph Transformers can help address enterprise data challenges and power applications like customer analytics, recommendations, fraud detection, and forecasting. 
AI Companions (9 minute read) 

AI companions are poised to redefine the digital landscape by evolving beyond simple chatbots into interactive interfaces that provide genuine personalization and engagement. The current generic AI interactions hinder meaningful connections. Future success depends on intuitive designs that make AI feel more like a personal companion rather than a tool. As AI matures, the focus should shift from model quality to enhancing user experience and personalization, turning AI into a true companion that fosters curiosity and self-discovery. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Can you run a full-fledged reasoning model on your local machine? (Sponsor) 

Imagine building AI apps with advanced reasoning without the cloud bill shock. HP's AI Studio webinar shows how to distill DeepSeek-R1's intelligence into locally deployable models. Learn to enhance Llama 3.1 with chain-of-thought capabilities and run inference entirely on your hardware—no API tokens required. See in action on May 1st 
CogView 4 Image Generation Model (Hugging Face Hub) 

CogView 4 is a next generation generative image model that is permissively licensed. It outperforms Flux models on a number of key axes. 
AI Hedge Fund (GitHub Repo) 

There have been many attempts to automate trading with modern reasoning models. This one is a bit better than others, although it still needs substantial effort. It uses persona based prompting to aggregate predictions about various fundamental assets. 
Alias free super resolution (GitHub Repo) 

This new work can upscale to arbitrary resolutions without typical reconstruction aliasing problems. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
The 2025 Annual Work Trend Index: The Frontier Firm is born (7 minute read) 

The Microsoft 2025 Work Trend Index report highlighted the shift toward AI-driven "Frontier Firms," emphasizing intelligence on tap, human-agent teams, and the rise of the "agent boss." Microsoft also announced updates to its Microsoft 365 Copilot that enhance AI integration in workplace applications. 
OpenAI researcher behind GPT-4.5 denied U.S. green card (2 minute read) 

A key OpenAI researcher who contributed to GPT-4.5 had their U.S. green card application denied. The decision raises concerns about immigration barriers for top AI talent. 
Developers increasingly value generative AI expertise (2 minute read) 

Developers should prioritize generative AI skills for career growth and competitive advantage. Companies are seeking experts to lead AI-driven innovation across projects. 
TLDR is hiring a curator to join the TLDR AI team (Fully Remote) 

TLDR is hiring an AI curator to help write our daily newsletter, read by over 700,000 subscribers.

We're looking for someone who works full time in AI (at a frontier lab, AI startup, or major tech company) and regularly keeps up with the latest AI news and research.
Time commitment is ~5-10 hours/week.
To apply please send your LinkedIn or resume to jobs@tldr.tech along with a few sentences on how you currently keep up with AI news! 
⚡
Quick Links
Accelerate your AI roadmap with a 5-minute self-assessment (Sponsor)

subject: Anthropic Economic Advisory Council 👥, Hugging Face Robot Arm 🦾, Graph Learning Models 🌐
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-29
How to get developers and AI assistants on the same page (Sponsor) 

Ever notice how some devs get exactly what they need from AI on the first try?

Worried that some developers are underutilizing AI, while others are over-relying on unverified output?
Then you need a copy of the zero-to-one guide for teams adopting AI coding assistants. DX compiled specific techniques that work for ideal human-AI collaboration: top use cases, battle-tested prompting techniques, and leadership strategies to drive responsible adoption.
💡 For the best results, share this guide with your team.
Get your copy now. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Anthropic Economic Advisory Council (3 minute read) 

Anthropic announced the creation of a council of top economists to advise on the economic impacts of AI and guide research for its Anthropic Economic Index. 
Hugging Face 3D-Printed Robotic Arm (4 minute read) 

Hugging Face is selling a programmable 3D-printable robotic arm called SO-101 that can pick up objects. It is a camera-equipped robotic arm with improved assembly and motor performance. 
OpenAI upgrades ChatGPT search with shopping features (3 minute read) 

OpenAI has updated ChatGPT search to enhance online shopping by offering product recommendations, images, reviews, and purchase links. The new feature, part of its strategy to rival Google, uses structured metadata rather than ads, ensuring personalized and independent shopping results. OpenAI plans further personalization through ChatGPT's memory feature for Pro and Plus users, excluding some European regions. 
* Yesterday we incorrectly reported that DeepSeek's R2 model launched. It has not launched and is expected in early May. We apologize for the error. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Speeding up Graph Learning Models with torch.compile (18 minute read) 

This article demonstrates how to boost PyTorch graph learning model speeds by up to 35% using PyG and torch.compile without losing model accuracy. 
Detecting and Countering Malicious Uses of Claude (9 minute read) 

Claude models were misused for influence operations, credential stuffing, recruitment fraud, and malware development. Anthropic is improving safeguards and has banned accounts involved in these activities to prevent further misuse. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Handling Missing Labels with Multiple Imputation (18 minute read) 

This research introduced a multiple imputation method for evaluating classifiers with missing labels, offering accurate and robust predictive distributions even under MNAR conditions. 
Unlearning in LLMs (16 minute read) 

ReLearn offers a data augmentation and fine-tuning pipeline for effective unlearning in large language models. 
Generative Video Models for Driving (6 minute read) 

Valeo AI presents VaViM, an autoregressive video model that predicts spatio-temporal token sequences, and VaVAM, a model that translates learned video representations into driving trajectories via imitation learning. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
The EU Is Asking for Feedback on Frontier AI Regulation (14 minute read) 

The European AI Office is seeking expert feedback on interpreting key obligations for governing general-purpose AI (GPAI) under the EU AI Act. Major AI labs have agreed to align with these Codes of Practice, which will set a compliance baseline. Key topics include systemic risk thresholds, training compute estimation, and downstream fine-tuner responsibilities. Feedback is open until May 22. 
DeepMind showcased AlphaFold 3's expanded molecular prediction abilities (2 minute read) 

DeepMind's AlphaFold 3 has new capabilities to predict DNA, RNA, and molecule structures. It also has improved accuracy for complex molecular interactions. The tool is now free for non-commercial use through EMBL-EBI. 
Introducing Mobility AI: Advancing urban transportation (4 minute read) 

Google Research built new ML models to analyze congestion, parking, and travel demand patterns. The tools also estimated greenhouse gas reductions and transportation safety impacts. The project advanced urban mobility planning using geospatial and real-time data.

How to Build a Security Champions Program (Sponsor) 

Security Champions programs are a proven way to scale AppSec across dev teams. Join Snyk's live webinar on May 15 @ 11AM ET and earn bonus CPE credits. Save your spot now! 
Google Cloud WAN for the AI Era (4 minute read) 

Google shares how its global WAN evolved to support resilient cloud services, which maintained connectivity during the West African cable outages. 
Adobe and Figma tools are getting ChatGPT's upgraded image generation model (2 minute read) 

OpenAI made its upgraded image generator model accessible to other companies via the "gpt-image-1" API. 
Figma 2025 AI Report: Perspectives (3 minute read) 

Figma surveyed designers and found strong optimism for AI-driven creative workflows in 2025.

subject: Difficult and sensitive news to share from Hills Road
body:
Dear Parents and Carers 
 
It is with great sadness that I am writing this email to you. Following our updates last week regarding our missing student, Mihran, you may well be aware from police updates and from news and media outlets over the weekend that the search ended on Saturday 26th April in the worst of all outcomes. 
 
Below is the email that we have sent to all current students today to alert them to the news and to outline the extra support from wellbeing and counselling colleagues. We have additional hours on site this week from our talking therapy professionals so that we can begin to support students and staff to process what has happened here.
 
Where we are aware of individuals who are particular friends of Mihran, we have been reaching out to them specifically and each of Mihranâ€™s Monday classes and enrichment groups have been spoken to today, with wellbeing colleagues on hand, to ensure that we can support them specifically. 
 
We are receiving professional support too based on dealing with trauma and their key advice is for us to focus on allowing our young people to feel: safe, calm, connected, in control and hopeful. Our team will be doing all they can to provide that reassurance. Your support with this and with helping us to reach out to any young person about whom you have concerns would be much appreciated. 
 
Thank you for the kind and thoughtful messages that we have received from a few parents today. I cannot tell you how it helps. 
 
The message that students received mid morning is below:
 
Dear Students
 
Following extensive searches last week and support from the whole community, I am so very, very sorry to have to let you know that everyoneâ€™s worst fears were realised on Saturday morning. Police have confirmed that missing Y12 student Mihran Khachatryan died by suicide in countryside near Caldecote. Their investigation is ongoing. 
 
Hills Road students and colleagues were part of the incredible public effort to find Mihran and I know how much we all wanted a different ending here. Hills Road staff will be supporting the police and family in their quest to understand what has happened. In respect to Mihran and his family and to all those who knew and loved him, please do not be tempted to speculate yourself or to give oxygen to the speculation of others. No one has any understanding of what happened here. That doesnâ€™t mean we shouldnâ€™t seek to understand or to adjust practice wherever that could be helpful. Of course that must happen. But it does mean that there are members of our community hurting very badly just now. The further hurt caused by uninformed opinion and judgement, most especially to his family, is therefore deeply unwarranted.
 
As we approach exam season for both year groups we want you to know that every single member of the Hills Road staff team wants nothing more than for each one of you to thrive. That means taking care of your mental and physical health first and foremost. Education is about so many things, only one of which is qualifications. Most of all, we want you all to go on to be happy and healthy adults who are confident and comfortable in who you are; what you know and how you want to live your life. Qualifications are not the end goal of education. They are simply the passport to the next stage. And if that does not happen first time, then there will always be another chance, another way and another path.
 
And right now, we want to support you in any way you need as you navigate these next few days and weeks. Additional wellbeing support is available every day this week, accessed via the wellbeing rooms on the guidance corridor or through Student Services. We have an additional student counsellor starting today and additional wellbeing and counselling support. Your tutor and teachers stand ready to help you and Mihranâ€™s classmates and friends, in particular, will have additional support offered, including today as each class meets. Out of hours there is always a listening ear available via the Samaritans at www.samaritans.org and all of our in house resources about routes to access help are here: Student Support and Guidance site.
 
Whether you knew Mihran personally or not, I know that this news will potentially be upsetting and unsettling, not least as we very much hold Sriram in our thoughts too. 
 
Please know that each of you is special, valued and unique. 
 
Take care of yourselves and please reach out for any support you need: it is here for you. 
 
Jo Trump
 
 
 



Please consider the environment and don't print this email unless you really need to.

subject: DeepSeek-R2 2️⃣, xAI raises $20B 💰, Debug ML Deployments Faster 💻
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-28
Why Your GenAI Interface Might Need More Friction, Not Less (Sponsor) 

The standard UX playbook says, "reduce friction at all costs," but with genAI systems, this conventional wisdom might not always hold true. Strategic friction can actually prevent hallucinations and build user trust.

Algolia's new developer guide explores this counterintuitive principle along with practical implementation patterns for responsible genAI systems. The guide includes code snippets and system diagrams for implementing explainable AI techniques, multi-output generation, and content moderation pipelines.
Learn how to design systems that balance automation with appropriate human oversight and implement feedback loops that improve over time. Download the developer guide → 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
DeepSeek-R2 (4 minute read) 

DeepSeek has launched DeepSeek-R2, a multilingual and resource-efficient model positioned to challenge global AI leaders. 
xAI $20B Fundraise (2 minute read) 

Elon Musk's xAI Holdings, aiming to become one of the largest privately funded tech ventures in history, is reportedly seeking $20 billion in funding. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Minimal MCP-Powered Agent Implementation (45 minute read) 

A walkthrough on how to build a compact MCP-powered agent in just 50 lines of Typescript. 
How to Debug ML Deployments Faster (18 minute read) 

This guide demonstrates an efficient local testing workflow aimed at speeding up model deployment debugging. 
LLM Arena Pareto Frontier (1 minute read) 

The chart presents a comparison of LLMs in terms of performance versus cost. The models that offer the best performance for their price point are Amazon Nova Micro, Amazon Nova Lite, Gemini 2.0 Flash Lite, Gemini 2.0 Flash 001, Gemini 2.5 Flash, and Gemini 2.5 Pro. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Lightweight Neural App Control (18 minute read) 

An interesting approach from Huawei that allows VLMs to control apps on Android devices with minimal additional system setup. 
Cognitive Diagnosis (19 minute read) 

DisenGCD is a cognitive diagnosis model that improves the learning of student, exercise, and concept representations by using a disentangled graph learning framework. 
Pippo: High-Resolution Multi-View Humans from a Single Image (GitHub Repo) 

Virtual human creation training system (no pretrained models) that can take an image as input and output a high-quality 3D representation of a person. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Resilient AI Infrastructure (7 minute read) 

Harvey uses a centralized Python library for managing AI model interactions to ensure reliable deployments through active load balancing and real-time monitoring. It implements a distributed rate limiting system to handle bursty traffic and maintain performance while allowing seamless model upgrades. The setup enhances security, optimizes resource utilization, and supports rapid deployment, performance tracking, and failure detection to provide a consistent user experience. 
Character.AI unveils AvatarFX, an AI video model to create lifelike chatbots (2 minute read) 

Character.AI's AvatarFX is a video generation model that animates AI-generated characters and can create videos from existing images. While promising, the technology raises concerns over potential misuse, particularly in creating deepfakes. Character.AI's platform already faces safety issues, with lawsuits alleging its chatbots have encouraged harmful behaviors. 
High Schoolers' AI-Enabled Device Deters Drunk Driving (7 minute read) 

High school students from North Carolina, aiming to prevent drunk driving, created SoberRide, an AI-driven device that detects signs of alcohol impairment in drivers using cameras, sensors, and machine learning. The team has secured a U.S. patent, partnered with organizations like Mothers Against Drunk Driving, and received interest from major automakers at CES. They are advocating for legislation mandating DUI detection systems in vehicles while targeting fleet operators and parents as early adopters.

subject: Changes to our Business and Commercial Bank Accounts
body:
￼
￼
Dear Sir/Madam,
We previously got in touch in May 2024 to let you know that we’re updating our Service Relationship with our Business Customers and making changes to some of our Business & Commercial Bank Accounts.
There was a delay to one of the changes, so from 1 July 2025, we’re introducing a new cash exchange charge for the following products:
	•	Business Bank Account   
	•	Commercial Current Account   
	•	Community Current Account  
	•	Start-Up Business Bank Account   
	•	Switcher Business Bank Account
This charge will apply when you exchange cash over the till at one of our stores and is 1.00% of the value exchanged. This is already a part of your account tariff, but we haven’t charged it previously.
You can find the updated terms and conditions on our website.
Find out more
To view the details on our products and services, and the criteria that applies to them, please visit our Business Bank Accounts web page.
We’re here to help
We know some of our customers may need additional support to continue with their day-to-day banking, and we’re here to help however we can.
If you have any other questions or need this communication in another format – such as large print, braille, or audio CD – please contact us. You can call us on 0345 0808 508* or visit us in Store.
Thank you,
The Metro Bank Team
*Metro Bank won’t charge you for your call. However, you may be charged by your service provider.
￼
We’re here to help
￼
Find your local store 
￼
We’ll never send you an email, text or a website link asking you to enter your Internet Banking or card details. If you’re suspicious of any emails you receive from Metro Bank, don't reply to them. Instead forward the email to phishing@metrobank.plc.uk or contact us immediately and we'll get our security team on the case.

Metro Bank PLC is registered in England and Wales, company number 6419578. Registered office:
One Southampton Row, London, WC1B 5HA. We’re authorised by the Prudential Regulation Authority and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority and Prudential Regulation Authority. 'Metrobank' and 'RateSetter' are registered trademarks of Metro Bank PLC.

subject: Rhino Racing WTRL TTT sign-up success.
body:
Can't see this message? View in browser
 
￼

Thanks for registering.

If you are new to Team Time Trials then have a read of the below - it will give you all the info needed to get lined up in the pen with your fellow team mates.
​
Please remember that everyone is equally important to the team, the keyword is Team!
  
There are 2 forms used for TTT’s, you have obviously found the first as you made your way here...⁠ 
 The sign-up form (that you've just filled in) is available each week on Friday and is where you can select your availability for the following Thursday - timezone availability, including a comments section if you want to request an easy ride, harder ride etc.
 The team-sheet is usually finalised on a Wednesday afternoon / evening and confirmed via a message in ⁠ttt-chat on the Rhino Racing Discord server (all riders will get tagged - as long as we have your discord tag).
The team sheet confirms which team you are on and who you ride with.
TEAM SHEET
￼
You need to click the RacePass link for your team, and you need to have a registered WTRL account:
WTRL REGISTRATION
￼
Most teams have a chat beforehand if needed, in the ⁠ttt-chat channel. (Some regular competitive teams have dedicated channels to discuss tactics beforehand) but if you have any questions please ask or DM any Rhino you have spoken with and they will help you or point you in the right direction.
​
Make sure you click the RacePass in the team sheet ASAP and are registered for the event. You have to sign up to the RacePass before that TimeZone begins, but so long as you have then you don’t actually have to join the event Race Pen in Zwift up until a few minutes before your official start time. However, it's always recommended to be in the Race Pen and in the Team Voice Channel 5-10 minutes before your start time.
​
You can confirm you’ve signed up correctly using the RacePass, as you should then see the TTT event on the home screen of your Zwift Companion App listed under Events.
Change kit to the Rhino jersey (if you have it - if you are new it might take a week for Gordon to get it unlocked for you).
 Make sure you select a TT bike from your garage!! If you want to look at the fastest bike setup, try Zwifter Bikes and use the settings to adjust for the course, your Zwift level, your Drops level and FTP and weight etc.
ZWIFTER BIKES
￼
Add (Rhino) after your Zwift name (this can be done in the Companion App settings).
At least 10 minutes before your event start time, please log on to Zwift (in case of software updates) and join the Discord Team Voice Channel of the team name you are riding with (Albino, Thundering, Rapids, Nuclear etc) meet your teammates, discuss a plan, make sure everyone is ready etc.
​
Please check your discord if you have not used it before (turn on noise suppression in settings to remove trainer/fan noise).
​
The aim is to stay with the group, always in the draft. If you are stronger rider do more work on the front. If weak just try hang on in the draft. Sometimes a race is just too fast and riders need to be dropped (especially for experienced teams going for the win).
​
For teams of 5 or more, the team time is taken from 4th rider to cross the line. For teams of 3 or 4, it is from the 3rd rider crossing the line.
​
Don't feel bad if you get dropped just continue the race at your own pace but please DON'T INTERFERE OR TRY DRAFTING OTHER TEAMS. If another team passes you then it is respectful to ease your power for 10-20s until they are passed and a few seconds clear of you.
​
If you finding that you are not enjoying the TTTs and maybe getting put in a team that drops you each week then please feel free to comment on sign up form – you can ask for an easier ride, a harder ride – we are always flexible to try place riders in a team that suits their needs.
 Communication is key, don’t be afraid to talk to your team even if you are new and learning - if you see the group stretching try call it out when you see gaps of 3-4 meters before it gets to 5+ and out the draft. If you can’t last any longer then tell them you are dropping so that they know to carry on etc.
​
We are all racing to have fun and there are some very experienced TTT riders active in ⁠ttt-chat who are happy to answer any and all questions.
​
Support your teammates and have fun. Remember it’s a Team Time Trial!  
 
There are lots of videos in streaming links on the Rhino Racing Discord server to see how a TTT is done if you would like to have a look beforehand.
​
Well done on getting to the end of this and remember... Have fun... the type 2 kind!
