subject: Anthropic Model Welfare 🌐, Adobe’s New Image Model 🖼️, Perplexity & Motorola 🤝
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-25
GenAI search in ecommerce: what's actually working? (Sponsor) 

Keyword matching is becoming yesterday's approach as context-aware systems take over - but “just add AI” isn't going to work for mature digital stores.

Algolia's new eBook skips the fluff and gets technical about how genAI impacts ecommerce search from a full-stack perspective. The eBook covers:
> The nuts and bolts of retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and why it creates more trustworthy search results
> Practical architectural patterns for implementing GenAI across your search stack
> Technical frameworks for evaluating AI output quality
Get the eBook to learn how to build search architectures that your competitors will struggle to match. Download your copy. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Anthropic Exploring Model Welfare (6 minute read) 

Anthropic launched a new research initiative to examine the potential moral relevance of AI systems, including how and when model welfare should be considered in alignment and safety efforts. 
Adobe's New Image Model (18 minute read) 

Adobe unveiled a major Firefly update that unifies image, video, audio, and vector generation tools, along with mobile support and deeper Creative Cloud integration. 
Perplexity and Motorola Partnership (1 minute read) 

Perplexity will be pre-installed on new Motorola phones with features like voice control, smart reminders, and direct integration with Moto AI, including 3 months of Pro access. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Deploying Agents as Real-time APIs (38 minute read) 

PhiloAgents lesson shows how to turn game simulation agents into API-ready, real-time interactive characters for more immersive environments. 
The urgency of interpretability in AI (4 minute read) 

AI interpretability must advance as models grow more complex. The field should prioritize transparency to mitigate risk. 
OpenAI Alums, Nobel Laureates Urge Regulators to Save Company's Nonprofit Structure (13 minute read) 

A recent letter signed by prominent figures argued against OpenAI's transition to a for-profit model, stating it undermines its founding mission to ensure AGI benefits humanity. The letter urged state attorneys general to block the restructuring, emphasizing that prioritizing shareholder returns could jeopardize essential safeguards. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Trae AI Introduces @Agent: Build Your Own Team of AI Developers (Sponsor) 

Trae, the AI-powered IDE, now lets you summon specialized AI agents using @mentions (just like tagging that colleague who actually remembers context). Create your own custom agents, define their rules, and never lose context between conversations. Read about out the new agent ecosystem on the Trae blog 
Google's Benchmark for Brain Modeling (9 minute read) 

Google, HHMI, and Harvard have introduced ZAPBench, a larval zebrafish dataset combining structural and functional brain data for advancing neural activity prediction models. 
Weed Mapping for Smarter Farming (16 minute read) 

This study introduces RoWeeder, a new framework for identifying weeds in agricultural fields using unsupervised methods. It combines crop-row detection with a noise-resistant deep learning model, training it to differentiate crops from weeds based on crop-row information. 
Efficient LLM Distillation (2 minute read) 

MiniPLM is a new framework designed to enhance pre-training of small language models using knowledge from larger models. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Low-latency Streaming Apps with Google's Live API (8 minute read) 

Google's Live API lets developers build real-time interactive apps by processing live audio, video, and text with minimal delay. 
Omdet Turbo (Hugging Face Hub) 

A strong improvement in real time, open vocabulary, object detection. 
Faster Drug Development (16 minute read) 

GEMCODE is a new AI-based system for automating co-crystal screening. 
⚡
Quick Links
Distilling DeepSeek-R1 into local models with HP AI Studio (Sponsor) 

Learn how to shrink DeepSeek-R1's reasoning powers into models that fit on your machine, deploy to Ollama for local inference, and free your AI from the cloud. Join the live workshop 
Perplexity launches AI-powered mobile assistant for iOS (3 minute read) 

Perplexity launched an AI assistant app for iOS with real-time answers and research tools. 
Google's AI Overviews reach 1.5 billion monthly users (2 minute read) 

Google reported that AI Overviews hit 1.5 billion monthly users. 
Microsoft 365 Copilot: Your window into the world of agents (5 minute read) 

Microsoft announced the release of Microsoft 365 Copilot Wave 2, which introduces new capabilities like AI-powered search, content creation tools, and an Agent Store featuring reasoning agents powered by OpenAI. 
Love TLDR? Tell your friends and get rewards! 
Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag! 
https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here. 
Want to advertise in TLDR? 📰 
If your company is interested in reaching an audience of AI professionals and decision makers, you may want to advertise with us. 

Want to work at TLDR? 💼 
Apply here or send a friend's resume to jobs@tldr.tech and get $1k if we hire them! 

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian & Andrew Carr 


Manage your subscriptions to our other newsletters on tech, startups, and programming. Or if TLDR AI isn't for you, please unsubscribe.

subject: News & Club Runs
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 

Dear Roger,

Thursday Evening Rides

These restart next week.  Keep scrolling for the routes for Thursday 1st May and further details.

SICC Summer BBQ
￼ 
29th June 2025

This event is subsidised 50% by the club. £10 of food for £5!

Date: Sunday 29th June (Food from 2pm – After the club ride)
Venue: Floods Tavern
Cost: £5 per ticket (Adult/Child)
Whats included: A Burger OR a Hotdog (Vegan/Vegetarian options)
PLUS: Salad, coleslaw, potato salad and chips

Partners and families welcome.
Summer BBQ Tickets

Photo's from last week...
￼ 

Sunday Club Run

27th April 2025

We meet outside The Norris Museum on The Waits, St Ives at 8:45 with the first group leaving at 9:00 prompt.

This week's club run will be heading to Shepreth.

Groups A and B will ride the same route of 57 miles stopping at Hot Numbers Cafe in Shepreth.  Cafe Amigo is also on the route.

Group C will ride the shorter route of 43 miles also stopping at Hot Numbers Cafe in Shepreth.*

*The pace of the C group is around 14-16mph giving opportunity to new riders to join us.  Please welcome new riders to this group.
Sunday Long Route - 57 - Shepreth
Sunday Short Route - 136 - Shepreth
Thursday Evening Ride
Facebook Event Page - Please show support to get these rides kick started 👊
1st May 2025

We meet outside The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen on The Boulevard, Alconbury Weald at 18:15 with the first group leaving at 18:30 prompt

EVENING RIDES RESTARTING NEXT WEEK ON 1ST MAY!!
	•	Routes will be here the week before each ride.
	•	Multiple paced groups.
	•	2 routes
	•	25 - 35 miles
	•	No stop ride
	•	The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen will be open until 11pm.
	•	Free Parking available outside The Club gym and near The Pavillion.
	•	New riders are welcomed so please bring a friend.  Membership is required after 2 club rides for insurance purposes.
Thursday Long Route - 177
Thursday Short Route - 178
Polite Reminders (for all club rides):
	•	Download the route.
	•	Remember your cafe bike locks.
	•	Look after your club mates.
	•	TT/Aero bars are not to be used.

Thank you.


Upcoming events in the SICC Calendar
For more information please click on the buttons below which will take you to our members only Facebook page.

We always hope for good numbers so that we can form suitable pace related groups.  Please hit 'GOING' to show support.  Thank you. 
Peaks Away Day Club Run


Peaks Away Day Club Run

Sunday 5th May 2025

Book a place to stay!!  OR drive down for the day!

We will be meeting in Hathersage outside the swimming pool.
There's a car park at the swimming pool, a pay and display opposite and other parking options in the town. Please allow plenty of time to get parked and make your way to the meet point. There's also toilets and a newly refurbished cafe at the pool if you wanted a pre/post ride coffee. They're open 8am-5pm and they're expecting us.

Meet: Oddfellows Rd, Hathersage, Hope Valley S32 1DU
Time: 9.15am (to be arranged into groups)
Depart: 9.30am
Route: https://ridewithgps.com/routes/45989392
Pool Cafe: https://www.hathersageswimmingpool.co.uk/.../the-pool-cafe/

It would be a good idea to carry snacks and gels on the bike and maybe extra supplies in the car.

The Old Smithy Cafe in Monyash (mile 38) and Hassop Station Cafe (mile 44) are marked on the ridewithgps route. There's also plenty of places to stop in Bakewell. Please take a look before the ride. We can agree in our groups when we would like to stop.  The Pool Cafe will allow us to catch up at the end.

Please feel free to use this Facebook event page to arrange car shares.
Now's the time to start training!  ￼

Please hit 'GOING' on Facebook to show support. Thank you. 

2025
Dates for your Calendar
 
	•	Social Evening (off the bike) - Tuesday 25th February
	•	International Women's Day Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 8th March
	•	Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 12th April
	•	Double Dutch Audax - Saturday 19th April
	•	Easter Club Run - Sunday 20th April
	•	Evening Social Rides (Alconbury) Start - Thursday 1st May
	•	Peaks Away Day Club Run - Sunday 4th May (stay for the weekend, it's a Bank Holiday!)
	•	Evening 10 mile Time Trials Restart (Sawtry) - Wednesday 14th May
	•	Club Summer BBQ Club Run - Sunday 29th June
	•	Summer Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 19th July
	•	Last Evening 10 mile Time Trial (Sawtry) - Wednesday 20th August
	•	Bank Holiday Weekend Longer Club Run - Sunday 24th August (ideas welcome!)
	•	Last Evening Social Ride (Alconbury) - Thursday 28th August
	•	Dave Nelson Memorial Hill Climb - Wednesday 3rd September
	•	Cafe Ventoux Away Day Club Run - Sunday 7th September
	•	Remembrance Club Run - Sunday 9th Novemeber
	•	Christmas Dress Up Club Run - Sunday 21st December
	•	Festive 500 - Wednesday 24th - 31st December
	•	Winter Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 27th December
	•	Short New Years Eve Ride - Wednesday 31st December
 
	•	SICC hosts Eastern League CX - TBC
	•	Christmas Meal - TBC
	•	AGM & Awards Presentation - TBC

 
Club 10m TT's & Hill Climb
These will go ahead but they need more support to survive (we still require an Events Officer).

Thought of the week

subject: Fwd: Next steps email
body:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Mia Perez <mia.perez1402@gmail.com>
Date: Fri, 25 Apr 2025, 12:16
Subject: Re: Next steps email
To: <claire@pembery.com>


Hello Claire,

Thank you for the follow up. I am self-funded and I would be paying rent using my savings and family support. I am planning to start my PhD in September/October and pay rent using those funds if I stay at Cambridge. 

I also saw your Whatsapp asking about the reference. They sold the flat shortly after which explains why its registration may have changed. This was my last long-term lease but I can ask my current mesne tenant for a letter. As soon as I get their consent I will follow up to this email with their contact details.

Thank you for your patience

Best wishes,
Mia

On Thu, 24 Apr 2025 at 17:47, <claire@pembery.com> wrote:
Hi Mia
 
I am about to email your supervisor.  Before I do can you just clarify if you get any funding from them – payment or an allowance?  If not do you get income from another source?
 
Many thanks
Claire
 
 
From: Mia Perez <mia.perez1402@gmail.com>  Sent: 23 April 2025 12:43 To: claire@pembery.com Subject: Re: Next steps email
 
Hi Claire,
 
Thank you for your email. My information is below:
 
1. Contact details:
First name: Meritxell
Surname: Perez Vila
Address: 19 St Christopher's Ave, Cambridge CB3 0JD
Phone number: +44 7294989885
Email: mia.perez1402@gmail.com
 
2.1 Evidence of ability to pay the rent:
I have attached the first page of my work agreement (attachment 1), the first page of my bank statement (attachment 2), and a screenshot of my savings account (attachment 3). 
 
2.2 Contact details of employer:
I am an independent scholar at the University of Cambridge (like a self-employed contractor), but you can contact my direct supervisor Alexander Corbett (alc220@cam.ac.uk) for a reference.
 3. Contact details of a past landlord:
I have attached a letter my landlord wrote for me last year (attachment 4), but if necessary you can contact John Shaw at shawfog@btinternet.com. 
 4. Passport and visa:
Attachment 5. I do not require a visa as part of the EU Settlement Scheme. I can provide you with a share code if you need to check my status.  5. Current address: 19 St Christopher's Ave, Cambridge CB3 0JD
 6. Ideal start date:
May 5th, 2025.
 
Please let me know if you have any further questions or if you want me to clarify any of these points.
 
Thank you very much, I look forward to starting our agreement.
 
Best wishes,
Mia
 
On Tue, 22 Apr 2025 at 20:53, <claire@pembery.com> wrote:
Hi Mia
 
It was lovely to meet you on Saturday. I am delighted you would like to rent the ground floor bedroom at 8 The Terrace Hampden Gardens.
 
Here is the next steps email. Once I have the details then I will be able to draw up a lease which I can send over to you for signing. Once I have the references back I will countersign the agreement. The rent is £700 per month payable on or before 1st of every month. I will provide you payment details in due course.
 
I need the following please:
 
1. Your contact details - full name and postal address. I assume that this email and your mobile number are the ones to use for the Deposit Protection Service. 
2. Evidence of your ability to pay the rent -a copy of your contract of employment showing salary or last ideally 3 months payslips. Plus contact details for your employer - name, email address and telephone number so I can obtain a reference.
3. The contact details of a past landlord (name, email address and phone number) so I can obtain a reference from them.
4. A scanned copy of your passport (photograph page) and any visas. I will need to check the original before you move in.
5. Your current address (required for the lease).
6. The ideal start date for the lease.
 
I am required to send you a copy of the gas safety certificate and the government’s how to rent guidance.  Both of which I have attached to this email.
 
I also forgot to mention that I use the Deposit Protection Service (DPS) for deposits. You can find more information about the DPS here About The DPS.
 
I hope the above all makes sense.
 
Please can you confirm receipt of this email. I look forward to hearing from you soon.
 
Best wishes 
Claire

￼
Kate Rusby
￼

20 December 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale: 25.04.2025, 10 AM
￼
Kate Rusby celebrates two decades of her much-loved Christmas tour with a special show, Christmas Is Merry. A seasonal staple for fans across the UK, Kate’s heart-warming concerts blend reimagined carols, original songs, and Yorkshire tradition, all brought to life by her distinctive voice and renowned band—complete with her iconic brass players.

This milestone year promises an unforgettable evening filled with festive joy, stunning stage design, and the warmth that has made Kate’s tour a cherished Christmas tradition. Join us for a magical night that captures the true spirit of the season.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
The Anglia Comedy Allstars
￼

20 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
The Anglia Comedy Allstars returns to Cambridge Corn Exchange this September with a stellar line-up featuring the brilliantly funny Simon Amstell, Simon Brodkin, Aurie Styla and Felicity Ward. Headliner Simon Amstell, known for his acclaimed Netflix special Set Free and hosting roles on Popworld and Never Mind the Buzzcocks, brings his signature confessional style to the stage. Simon Brodkin, famed for his outrageous stunts and sharp stand-up, joins the bill alongside Aurie Styla, whose charm and charisma have made him a festival favourite, and Felicity Ward, a multi-award-winning comic seen on Mock the Week and Live at the Apollo.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Baga Chipz - 'Chip Off The Old Block' Tour
￼
30 August 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
After the smash-hit success of her ‘Material Girl’ and ‘Much Betta!’ tours, Baga Chipz is back and bigger, louder and more outrageous than ever. This autumn, join the self-proclaimed council estate princess for a no-holds-barred evening of live vocals, filthy jokes, wild stories and big laughs, with everything from big band ballads to pub singalongs and a heartfelt tribute to her friend The Vivienne. Expect sequins, wigs, feather boas and a whole lot of sass, as Baga spills the tea on everything from RuPaul’s Drag Race to meeting the Queen. With an audience Q&A and plenty of party vibes, this adults-only x-rated comedy extravaganza promises to be the ultimate knees-up—definitely not one for the faint-hearted or the under-18s!
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Q The Music - The James Bond Concert Spectacular
￼

7 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Q The Music’s James Bond Concert Spectacular is the world’s leading tribute to 007’s iconic soundtracks, praised globally for its thrilling performances and musical excellence. Celebrating over 20 years as the original Bond concert, the show features all the classic themes—from Goldfinger to Live and Let Die—alongside powerful chase sequences and orchestral suites, performed by top UK musicians. With glowing endorsements from Bond legends like David Arnold and George Lazenby, and narration by former Moneypenny Caroline Bliss, this critically acclaimed concert is a must for any Bond fan. Expect a night of unforgettable music, memories and sophistication.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
The Dualers
￼

13 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
The Dualers return in 2025 with a major UK tour, showcasing new tracks from their upcoming album Beach Life. Hailing from South-East London, this 9-piece Jamaican Rhythm & Blues band rose to fame when their debut single Kiss on the Lips broke into the UK charts at number 21 without any industry backing. Since then, they’ve earned top 30 albums, hit the big screen with Truly Madly in Fool’s Gold, and sold out major venues including Wembley Arena and 14 shows at Indigo at the O2. Widely celebrated as Britain’s finest Ska and Reggae band, The Dualers continue to wow fans across the UK, Europe and Asia.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Arrival – The Hits of ABBA
￼

18 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Calling all Dancing Queens – get ready to step back into the glittering world of the 70s as Arrival – The Hits of ABBA returns in 2025 with their internationally acclaimed show. Following sell-out performances in over 30 countries, this award-winning tribute brings ABBA’s timeless hits to life with outstanding vocals, stunning replica costumes, interactive video footage and all the energy of a real ABBA concert. From Waterloo to Mamma Mia, Gimme! Gimme! Gimme! to SOS, prepare for a night of non-stop singalongs, dancing in the aisles and pure pop nostalgia.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
￼

 
 
Shows on sale with Cambridge Live Tickets


￼
Tim Boniface presents The Sunday Jazz Sessions
￼

29 June 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
The Sunday Jazz Sessions give you a chance to hear some of the UK’s best jazz musicians, in Cambridge’s Coolest Cocktail bar. Hosted by Cambridge based jazz instrumentalist Tim Boniface.
 

This June, we are joined by the incredible Alto Saxophonist Charles Rothwell. Come and join us for three hours of amazing live music, and a complimentary glass of Prosecco, beer or soft drink, all for only £15.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Discover More
￼
Garden House
￼
￼
￼
￼
We're delighted so many Corn Exchange customers have been enjoying the special restaurant discount offered by our partner, Garden House, which continues throughout spring and summer.
 
Garden House is just a 7-minute walk from the Corn Exchange, making it the perfect spot to enjoy a meal before or after your event. If you haven't already, why not make your night out extra special with this fabulous offer exclusively for Corn Exchange ticket holders!
 
T&Cs apply. Visit website for more info.

BOOK HERE
￼
Want to skip the queues?
￼
The age-old tradition of queuing for interval drinks is becoming a thing of the past at the Corn Exchange.
 
Simply follow this link and place your order in just a few easy steps. Whether you're craving a bag of Haribos, a Coke, a glass of wine, a beer, a ready-mixed cocktail, or an award-winning Saffron Ice Cream, you can sit back, relax, and enjoy the show while your interval drinks and snacks are delivered straight to your seat!
PRE-ORDER NOW
￼
CornEx Membership
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange, run by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council, depends on ticket sales, sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants, and concessions to bring top-quality shows to the city. By becoming a member, you make a significant impact, helping us continue to deliver the music, comedy, and performances you love. As a thank you, we offer great perks in return.
BECOME A MEMBER
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange is operated by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council. As well as Corn Exchange ticket income, we rely on income raised through sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants and concessions to ensure that we can continue to bring the biggest and best shows to the city.
 
We also organise an annual programme of diverse and greatly valued events including free Fireworks Night, Out of the Ordinary Festival and Music in the Parks. These events are free in order to offer residents the opportunity to participate in the cultural life of the city and to provide access to all. They contribute to creating a united city, ‘One Cambridge - Fair for All’, in which economic dynamism and prosperity are combined with social justice and equality. Again, these events are also an opportunity to develop valued partnerships with local businesses and other organisations that make up the Cambridge Community.

subject: FW: Next steps email
body:
Hi Roge
 
I have drafted an agreement for Mia. However I am still trying to work out how she gets income.  She has nearly £7k between her 2 bank accounts but refers to being like a self employed contractor so I don’t know if she gets a grant/allowance from the department.  I have emailed her to ask that.  If she does not get any income from the uni I would think we need to get some payments in advance – like 3 months for example.
 
I have left the agreement in word atm until we know about her income as we may want to change the rental schedule on pagw 10 if there is no regular income.
 
Cx
 
 
From: Mia Perez <mia.perez1402@gmail.com>  Sent: 23 April 2025 12:43 To: claire@pembery.com Subject: Re: Next steps email
 
Hi Claire,
 
Thank you for your email. My information is below:
 
1. Contact details:
First name: Meritxell
Surname: Perez Vila
Address: 19 St Christopher's Ave, Cambridge CB3 0JD
Phone number: +44 7294989885
Email: mia.perez1402@gmail.com
 
2.1 Evidence of ability to pay the rent:
I have attached the first page of my work agreement (attachment 1), the first page of my bank statement (attachment 2), and a screenshot of my savings account (attachment 3). 
 
2.2 Contact details of employer:
I am an independent scholar at the University of Cambridge (like a self-employed contractor), but you can contact my direct supervisor Alexander Corbett (alc220@cam.ac.uk) for a reference.
 3. Contact details of a past landlord:
I have attached a letter my landlord wrote for me last year (attachment 4), but if necessary you can contact John Shaw at shawfog@btinternet.com. 
 4. Passport and visa:
Attachment 5. I do not require a visa as part of the EU Settlement Scheme. I can provide you with a share code if you need to check my status.  5. Current address: 19 St Christopher's Ave, Cambridge CB3 0JD
 6. Ideal start date:
May 5th, 2025.
 
Please let me know if you have any further questions or if you want me to clarify any of these points.
 
Thank you very much, I look forward to starting our agreement.
 
Best wishes,
Mia
 
On Tue, 22 Apr 2025 at 20:53, <claire@pembery.com> wrote:
Hi Mia
 
It was lovely to meet you on Saturday. I am delighted you would like to rent the ground floor bedroom at 8 The Terrace Hampden Gardens.
 
Here is the next steps email. Once I have the details then I will be able to draw up a lease which I can send over to you for signing. Once I have the references back I will countersign the agreement. The rent is £700 per month payable on or before 1st of every month. I will provide you payment details in due course.
 
I need the following please:
 
1. Your contact details - full name and postal address. I assume that this email and your mobile number are the ones to use for the Deposit Protection Service. 
2. Evidence of your ability to pay the rent -a copy of your contract of employment showing salary or last ideally 3 months payslips. Plus contact details for your employer - name, email address and telephone number so I can obtain a reference.
3. The contact details of a past landlord (name, email address and phone number) so I can obtain a reference from them.
4. A scanned copy of your passport (photograph page) and any visas. I will need to check the original before you move in.
5. Your current address (required for the lease).
6. The ideal start date for the lease.
 
I am required to send you a copy of the gas safety certificate and the government’s how to rent guidance.  Both of which I have attached to this email.
 
I also forgot to mention that I use the Deposit Protection Service (DPS) for deposits. You can find more information about the DPS here About The DPS.
 
I hope the above all makes sense.
 
Please can you confirm receipt of this email. I look forward to hearing from you soon.
 
Best wishes 
Claire

Next gen joy
This edition is all about kids. So whether you have a young rider in your immediate family or someone in the wider community who is passionate about pedalling, read on to hear about traffic-free coaching spaces, a recipe for a sweet snack you can make together and our next monthly competition.
 
Thinking it's not for you? Then why not practice being playful just like Ella and Corran from the Great Britain Cycling Team. We're all just big kids, after all.
Playing on bikes
Clubs for kids
￼
Go-Ride is a network of registered clubs offering coached sessions for children, with activities taking place in traffic-free spaces run by trained British Cycling coaches. From simply giving cycling a try through to talent development, our clubs are great places to forge a love for all things bikes.
 
Search for your nearest club - and explore the many ways there are to ride. Plus you can keep up-to-date with how we're evolving Go-Ride to modernise and secure the future of cycle sport.
Find your nearest
￼
￼

Your monthly competition
￼
With kids taking pole position, this month's prize is a Frog Bike to support a child or young person to ride - or level up. Enter for a chance to win any Frog Bike model up to the value of £590 (subject to availability).
 
Full terms and conditions are available below and on the Rewards Hub.
Enter via dashboard

While there is a youngster in the above video from Lazer, the fit principles are the same for adults. Perhaps it's time to check the tightness of your helmet cage, the flappiness of straps and your angle of tilt to ensure the highest level of protection.
Watch the video

Make your own energy bars

Whether it's a family weekend activity or a ritual for your weekend ride, making your own energy bars is a great bit of preparation.
 
Use the basics of this recipe to get started, but why not then experiment with your own additions?
Open the recipe

We offer kids' membership from £20 a year, but if they join a British Cycling affiliated club it's free up to the age of 15. See more details and get the discount code on our website via the button below.
 
Plus did you know we offer family membership? For £125 (Member) or £200 (Premium) a year, two adults and any number of children at the same address can enjoy the benefits of being a member.

The riders will depart a Forestry England site close to Pickering in Dalby Forest, crossing the North York Moors National Park to finish in Redcar. Check out the remaining venues below.

subject: Email regarding missing person - any help in raising awareness appreciated.
body:
Dear Parents and Carers
 
For those of you who live in Hardwick and the surrounding area of Cambridge, you will hopefully already be aware that there is an ongoing police search for a missing person that began late on Monday evening. 
 
The missing young person is a current Y12 student of Hills Road Sixth Form College and we are appealing to our students, staff and wider Hills Road community to share his image (below) in any groups, channels or ways that you have available to you to see if we can raise awareness that might trigger a memory or a positive sighting. As you can imagine, colleagues who work with him here, together with his circle of friends are anxiously awaiting news. His family are living through each unbearable hour at a time.
 
Details are in the email below that we sent last night to students appealing for any help we can provide to the police as a community in suggesting any possible leads or sightings. 
 
Obviously we know this is difficult news for everyone to be processing and we are very aware of the particular support needs just now of the students who know Mihran most closely. Support routes are available for our students through the student services team; through wellbeing drop-ins daily and through our counselling team and every student is encouraged to reach out to their tutor too for any support they might need right now.
 
Thank you in advance for any help you are able to provide in supporting the raising of awareness here. Links are available via our Hills Road socials on Facebook and Instagram too for ease of sharing and the link to our news article is here: https://www.hillsroad.ac.uk/latest-news/mihran
 
 
 
 
 
Dear Students
 
I am writing to ask for all of your help please. As you may have seen in the media, one of our year 12 students, Mihran Khachatryan has been reported missing. The police are continuing to work to confirm Mihran’s whereabouts and are conducting full scale searches as part of their missing person’s enquiry. We are in regular communication with the police and Mihran’s friends here at College too. We are now asking everyone in our college community to share these recent images of Mihran as widely as possible to jog any memories anywhere that might help to locate him please.
 
Mihran was last seen on the evening of Monday 21st April at approximately 7pm in the Hardwick area, where he went out for a walk wearing a grey coat, blue cargo trousers, and dark grey shoes. He is approximately 5ft 6” tall, with a slim build and dark hair tied in a ponytail. Mihran regularly walked in the evening and this behaviour was not out of character for him. 
 
Recent images of Mihran are below. 
 
￼
￼
 
 
If you have any information at all that may assist the police, please call 101 and quote reference 538 of 21 April. 
 
I am well aware that this could be difficult news for you to hear. As a college we are here to support you- please just reach out to your tutor, or self-refer to the wellbeing or counselling teams. I will be in touch when we have further information. For now, please share the information and photo of Mirhan as widely as possible.
 
Do take care of yourselves. 
 
Best wishes
 
Tim
 
Tim Lomas
Vice Principal- Student Progression and Support
 
￼
 
01223 247 251| tlomas@hillsroad.ac.uk | www.hillsroad.ac.uk
Hills Road Sixth Form College, Cambridge, CB2 8PE 
 
 

 P Please consider the environment and don't print this email unless you really need to.

subject: OpenAI Image Generation API 💻, Grok Vision 👓, Claude Misuse Report 📑
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-24
Meet Junie – your smart coding agent from JetBrains (Sponsor) 

JetBrains has launched Junie — a smart coding agent now available to all JetBrains users!

Junie is designed to handle development tasks either autonomously or in collaboration with you. Whether you want to delegate routine work or partner on more complex problems, Junie is here to help. It can explore your project, generate context-aware code, run tests when needed, and share the results for your review.
→ Try Junie in JetBrains IDEs 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
OpenAI Image Generation API (8 minute read) 

The image generation model behind ChatGPT's visuals has been made available via API, enabling developers to integrate image creation into apps and services. 
Grok Vision Available for iOS Users (1 minute read) 

xAI's Grok chatbot has gained the ability to interpret visual inputs, allowing users to ask questions about what they saw, similar to features in ChatGPT and Gemini. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Claude Misuse and Threat Report (8 minute read) 

Claude was exploited in influence campaigns that used LLMs to coordinate social media bot behavior. This article explains how Anthropic upgraded safety mechanisms to prevent such misuse. 
Content Discovery Search with Llama (7 minute read) 

Litmos integrated Llama to improve learning content discovery in its LMS, addressing issues with traditional keyword search and raising user engagement. 
High Throughput MoE Systems (19 minute read) 

MoE models like DeepSeek-V3/R1 simultaneously achieve higher throughput and lower latency when utilizing more GPUs in multi-node deployments across most scenarios. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Google's Mobility AI (13 minute read) 

Google's Mobility AI initiative aims to modernize city transport systems through AI-driven data analysis, simulation, and optimization tools. 
Fast Graph Generation (18 minute read) 

ANFM introduces a new approach to graph generation using filtration techniques, allowing for faster and more efficient model training. The method achieves a 100x speedup compared to diffusion models while maintaining competitive performance. 
A Faster, Lighter Vision Transformer for Image Super-Resolution (14 minute read) 

The Low-to-high Multi-Level Transformer addresses the complexity and inefficiency of recent Vision Transformer (ViT) methods for image super-resolution. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Analyzing o3 and o4-mini with ARC-AGI (9 minute read) 

The ARC Prize Foundation evaluated OpenAI's new models, o3 and o4-mini, using the ARC‑AGI benchmarks to assess their reasoning capabilities. o3-medium achieved notable results on ARC-AGI-1 but failed to make significant progress on the more challenging ARC-AGI-2, especially in high-reasoning scenarios. o4-mini proved cost-efficient but less accurate, indicating a trade-off between performance and resource usage. 
Hugging Face demo explores LLM energy consumption in real time (2 minute read) 

A new Hugging Face space that visualizes how much energy LLM queries consume during interactions. 
⚡
Quick Links
Google Gemini 350M Monthly Users (3 minute read) 

Court documents revealed Gemini had 350 million monthly users, a major jump from last year. 
OpenAI would buy Google's Chrome, exec testifies at trial (4 minute read) 

OpenAI is interested in buying Google's Chrome if antitrust measures force a sale to restore competition in search. 
Sam Altman steps down as Oklo board chair, freeing nuclear startup to work with more AI companies (3 minute read) 

Sam Altman has stepped down as chair of Oklo to give the nuclear startup more flexibility in exploring partnerships. 
Love TLDR? Tell your friends and get rewards! 
Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag! 
https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here. 
Want to advertise in TLDR? 📰 
If your company is interested in reaching an audience of AI professionals and decision makers, you may want to advertise with us. 

Want to work at TLDR? 💼 
Apply here or send a friend's resume to jobs@tldr.tech and get $1k if we hire them! 

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian & Andrew Carr 


Manage your subscriptions to our other newsletters on tech, startups, and programming. Or if TLDR AI isn't for you, please unsubscribe.

subject: Need to speak to speak to a clinician today? Your AXA Doctor at Hand account has been renewed

subject: Banking & Financial Services Salaries: 2025 Insights Available
body:
Stay competitive with the latest salary benchmarks and hiring trends.
￼
Dear Rober, 
 
In a rapidly evolving market, staying ahead of salary trends is essential—whether you're hiring top talent or negotiating pay rises. The Goodman Masson Banking & Financial Services Salary Guide 2025 provides up-to-date compensation data to help you attract, retain, and reward the best professionals.   Having access to the latest salary data enables you to…
	•	Stay competitive – Ensure your financial services salary packages align with market expectations across risk, compliance, and investment roles.
	•	Navigate hiring challenges – Secure top talent in high-demand areas such as regulatory finance, digital banking, and treasury management.
	•	Support retention and engagement – Offer competitive pay and benefits to retain skilled professionals in a shifting economic and regulatory landscape. 
Access the Salary Data
Good Data for Great Decision-Making    
While our salary guide provides essential data, every firm faces unique challenges. Speak with our specialist banking and financial services recruiters for tailored insights on the nuanced factors impacting your hiring and retention strategies. 
 
Get in Touch
￼
 
Andrew Michael CEO Goodman Masson

subject: Pi-0.5 🤖, AvatarFX by Character.AI 🧑‍💻, Cohere Embed 4 4️⃣
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-23
Is your GenAI strategy stuck? (Sponsor) 

LLMs often fall short because of overlooked issues in training, evaluation, or implementation. Turing's 5-minute assessment helps you identify what stage you're in—and what to prioritize next.

You'll get:
● A quick read on your organization's AI readiness
● Guidance on common gaps at your current stage
● Curated next steps to help you move forward
Start the assessment and accelerate your GenAI maturity. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Pi-0.5: Robots in the Wild (12 minute read) 

The Physical Intelligence team has tested its house cleaning robot in novel unseen environments and found it performs quite well. The team achieved this with a mixture of VLM training and action tokenization. 
AvatarFX by Character.AI (4 minute read) 

Character.AI's AvatarFX generates photorealistic, emotionally expressive videos from static images with strong temporal consistency and support for multi-speaker dialogue. 
Embed 4: Multimodal search for business (4 minute read) 

Cohere's Embed 4 is a state-of-the-art multimodal embedding model that enables enterprises to add powerful search and retrieval capabilities to agentic AI applications. Embed 4 offers leading multimodal and multilingual performance in 100+ languages, breakthrough context length up to 128k tokens, and domain-specific understanding for regulated industries like finance, healthcare, and manufacturing. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
Graph Transformers (34 minute read) 

This article introduces Graph Transformers and explores how they differ from and complement GNNs. 
OpenAI o3 and o4-mini System Card (2 minute read) 

OpenAI's o3 and o4-mini models use tools in their thought processes to enhance capabilities like image transformation and data analysis. However, o4-mini underperforms on PersonQA, showing higher hallucination rates compared to o3 and o1. This paper also discusses "sandbagging," a behavior where models hide their full capabilities for strategic advantage. 
Questions about the Future of AI (33 minute read) 

This article raises questions about AI's future, focusing on challenges with agency development, reinforcement learning, and economic impacts. It discusses the strategic direction of AI capabilities, the implications of open-source models, and the alignment challenges posed by advanced AI technologies. It also explores post-AGI scenarios, including potential economic growth and geopolitical influences. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
Reach millions of tech decision-makers with TLDR (Sponsor) 

Advertising in TLDR puts your brand in front of tech leaders when they're most engaged. Easily target millions of developers, PMs, and executives with our 12 interest-based newsletters. See how TLDR can drive results for your brand. 
Personalized Multi-Agent Systems (GitHub Repo) 

FlowReasoner is a reasoning-based meta-agent that uses reinforcement learning and external feedback to generate custom multi-agent systems for user queries. 
Multimodal Entity Linking (8 minute read) 

KGMEL integrates text, images, and knowledge graph triples in a three-stage pipeline to improve accuracy in multimodal entity linking tasks. 
DeepMind's Framework for AI Afterlives (35 minute read) 

DeepMind outlines a framework and ethical considerations for generative AI agents that could act as posthumous representations of real individuals. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
AI models can generate exploit code at lightning speed (5 minute read) 

Generative AI models can create proof-of-concept exploit code within hours of a vulnerability disclosure. This can be demonstrated by using GPT-4 to generate an exploit for a critical Erlang SSH vulnerability. The rapid capability highlights the need for faster response times and automation in defense strategies. 
Japan's robot learns to smell and sniff out danger before it strikes (4 minute read) 

Ainos and ugo have integrated AI Nose technology into humanoid robots, enabling them to detect scents, enhancing decision-making and interaction. This advancement will transform industries such as healthcare, safety, and manufacturing by real-time monitoring of environmental conditions. The technology is set for real-world deployment tests in various sectors. 
Agency Is Eating the World (9 minute read) 

AI is enabling a new wave of lean, successful companies led by individuals who leverage technology to achieve what once required large teams, challenging traditional specialization and credentialism. High-agency individuals are driving this shift, using AI to rapidly accomplish complex tasks across industries without needing deep expertise. The future favors those willing to act independently, embracing AI-driven efficiency over traditional, hierarchical business structures.

We're looking for someone who works full time in AI (at a frontier lab, AI startup, or major tech company) and regularly keeps up with the latest AI news and research.
Time commitment is ~5-10 hours/week paid at a rate of $100/hr.
To apply please send your LinkedIn or resume to jobs@tldr.tech along with a few sentences on how you currently keep up with AI news!

Rivian Adds Cohere CEO to Board (2 minute read) 

Rivian has appointed Cohere's CEO Aidan Gomez to its board, signaling deeper investment in integrating AI across its electric vehicle ecosystem.

25% of Gen Z believe AI is already conscious, while 52% think it soon will be.

We're thrilled to present Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro, a major update to our flagship singing voice synthesis application. Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro now offers singing with a more human level of naturalness, and up to 300% faster rendering speeds.

subject: Year 13 Parent and Carer survey
body:
Dear Parents and Carers,
 
Thank you to those of you who completed the Ofsted questionnaire during our inspection the week before the Easter break.  The inspection went well and we look forward to sharing the report once it is finalised and published.
 
Ofsted do not share the questionnaire responses with us in detail, but each year at this time we in any case ask parents and carers of Year 13 students for their feedback through our own parent and carer survey.  This year, in response to requests last summer, we have included some free text boxes too.
 
Please could you complete this survey by Friday 2 May, to enable us to continue to review and keep improving what we do.
 
https://fs22.formsite.com/HillsRoadSixthForm/LeaversParental/index
 
With thanks and best wishes. 
 
Ian Pryer (he/him)
Deputy Principal

subject: Anthropic on AI Harms ♥️, Instagram AI Teen Protection 🦺, OpenAI & Shopify integration 🤝
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-22
Concierge: Talk to your apps with natural language (Sponsor) 

Wish AI understood your context and could take actions for you? Concierge is the first connected AI Assistant that can read & write to your apps in real-time. Simply connect in 2 clicks (Gmail, Slack, Notion, Jira, HubSpot, Linear, Asana, Confluence, Airtable, Attio, Salesforce, etc) and ask Concierge anything.

Reply to emails, update CRMs, create new tickets, summarize customer feedback, draft a PRD, do research across knowledge sources, and more.
Try Concierge for free or use the code TLDR3 to get Concierge Pro for 3 months. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Our Approach to Understanding and Addressing AI Harms (7 minute read) 

Anthropic unveiled a multidimensional framework to assess and mitigate AI harms, addressing both catastrophic and everyday risks. The approach evaluates physical, psychological, economic, societal, and autonomy impacts, guiding policy, testing, and enforcement strategies. This initiative, aiming for adaptable, proportionate safeguards as AI capabilities evolve, complements its Responsible Scaling Policy. 
Instagram AI-based Teen Protection (3 minute read) 

Meta is using AI to identify teens on Instagram and automatically place them in restricted teen account settings, which now include even stronger default protections and require parental approval for changes. 
🧠
Deep Dives & Analysis
o3 over optimization is back (30 minute read) 

This post explores the challenge of the new crop of reasoning models and presents evidence to suggest that OpenAI is over-optimizing on certain objectives that make its models brittle and prone to hallucinations. 
Verifiable rewards for writing (1 minute read) 

Writing quality reward models (WQRM) are a way to evaluate the quality of creative writing. They can be used to train creative writing models. WQRMs are a new development for RL-trained models with verifiable rewards. This thread shows a case where WQRM correlated strongly with overall writing quality. 
AI assisted search-based research actually works now (6 minute read) 

Recent advancements in LLMs like OpenAI's o3 and o4-mini have made them effective for search-based tasks, avoiding past issues with hallucinations. Unlike earlier models, these LLMs integrate search results into their reasoning process, providing reliable real-time insights. This progression diminishes reliance on traditional search engines and suggests shifts in the Web's economic model. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Research
🔄 Inner → outer dev loop: How Indeed is automating engineering workflows with AI (Sponsor) 

Happening live this Thursday! Join Erika Rice Scherpelz, VP of Engineering at Sourcegraph and Kristina Hager, Principal Software Engineer at Indeed, for a discussion on accelerating developer iteration (inner loop), automating deployment and delivery (outer loop), and the role of AI-driven engineering practices throughout the entire SDLC. Join the conversation 
Fast Conformal Prediction (18 minute read) 

LOO-StabCP boosts the speed of conformal prediction by using leave-one-out stability, providing scalable uncertainty estimation without sacrificing accuracy. 
Robust Autonomy Emerges from Self-Play (25 minute read) 

This study presents a simulated self driving agent that went 2 years between collisions. It was trained fully with self-play and is a substantial improvement over the state-of-the-art trained on Gigaflow. 
AlphaGeometry 2 (17 minute read) 

DeepMind has released the next version of its geometry model, which answers 84% of questions correctly, up from 54% by prior methods. The main improvements come from the Gemini language model and better search. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Hackathon for non-devs and vibe coders (1 minute read) 

Stackblitz, the creators of Bolt, is hosting the world's largest hackathon for non-devs and vibe coders on 5/30 for anyone around the world to participate. 
MAGI 1 - Autoregressive Video Generation at Scale (Hugging Face Hub) 

The MAGI 1 model is a new autoregressive video generation model that can generate long form and consistent videos. It performs on par with Wan video generation while being slightly below some closed models.

TLDR is hiring an AI curator to help write our daily newsletter, read by over 700,000 subscribers.

We're looking for someone who works full time in AI (at a frontier lab, AI startup, or major tech company) and regularly keeps up with the latest AI news and research.
Time commitment is ~5-10 hours/week paid at a rate of $100/hr.
To apply please send your LinkedIn or resume to jobs@tldr.tech along with a few sentences on how you currently keep up with AI news! 
⚡
Quick Links
Free Course: Intro to GenAI and Prompt Engineering (Sponsor) 

Offered by the Cloud Security Alliance (CSA), this free self-paced course delivers a foundational understanding of how generative AI models work, and how to create and refine prompts to improve output. Register for free 
Google AI Academy for Infrastructure Startups (4 minute read) 

Google is inviting AI startups focused on U.S. infrastructure to apply for its six-month accelerator, offering mentorship, technical support, and strategic guidance. 
OpenAI hints at native Shopify checkout integration in ChatGPT (2 minute read) 

New code strings in ChatGPT's web bundle reference “buy_now” buttons and a “shopify_checkout_url,” suggesting OpenAI is building a native purchase flow into the assistant. 
Mercor Graduate Fellowship (2 minute read) 

Mercor launched a $50,000 fellowship for PhD students and postdocs in STEM focused on identifying raw talent based on ideas, not pedigree or connections.

subject: Gemini 2.5 Flash 🔦, Claude Code Best Practices 💻, OpenAI Preparedness Framework 📚
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-21
2025 is the year of the AI Voice Agent, with ElevenLabs powering it all (Sponsor) 

Developers are turning to ElevenLabs to deploy lifelike voice agents at scale and are seeing unprecedented adoption. Their agents are built to:

	•	Answer inbound customer support calls 24/7
	•	Schedule appointments at doctor's offices, realtors, and financial advisors
	•	Provide 1-1 tutors for language practice, math class, and interview prep
Choose from 5k+ voices, craft a system prompt, connect a phone number, and you're live. 
Try it free and join thousands of developers already building with ElevenLabs. 
Ready to scale? Get expert guidance from their team. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Gemini 2.5 Flash (6 minute read) 

The next Flash model from Gemini has been released. It is a substantial upgrade from previous versions and matches Claude on a number of important STEM benchmarks. 
Claude Code Best Practices (7 minute read) 

Anthropic has released a detailed engineering guide on how to use its agentic programming assistant. It requires more specificity than traditional models. 
Our updated Preparedness Framework (5 minute read) 

OpenAI has updated its Preparedness Framework to enhance safety measures against severe risks from advanced AI capabilities. The revision emphasizes clear criteria for prioritizing high-risk capabilities, sharper capability categories, scalable evaluations, and defined safeguard reports. This framework will be continually updated in line with emerging technological advancements and insights from internal and external experts. 
🧠
Research & Innovation
Flexible Image Watermarking (19 minute read) 

MaskMark provides a simple, dual-mode solution for global and local watermarking using a masking-based Encoder-Distortion-Decoder framework. 
Sleep-Time Compute for LLM Efficiency (24 minute read) 

A novel approach to reduce LLM inference costs by precomputing useful context-related quantities before user queries. It shows up to 5x test-time savings and accuracy gains on reasoning tasks. 
Personalized Image Synthesis with Auto-Regressive Models (14 minute read) 

This paper explores the training auto-regressive models for personalized image generation to achieve comparable fidelity to diffusion-based methods through a two-stage optimization process. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Resources
Transforming Data into Insights with Multimodal LLMs (Sponsor) 

Diverse data (images, text, audio) is notoriously difficult to analyze. HP's upcoming webinar shows how multimodal large language models can help you integrate and analyze these different data formats more effectively. Whether you're new to multimodal analysis or looking to enhance your current methods, you'll learn to create real-world applications, this session will provide valuable strategies for making better data-driven decisions. Save your virtual seat 
Aligning LVMs with Human Preferences (GitHub Repo) 

VistaDPO improves video-text alignment by optimizing preference learning across spatial and temporal dimensions using a new 7.2K sample dataset and hierarchical optimization. 
Hallucination Reduction in VLMs (GitHub Repo) 

REVERSE introduces a training and inference pipeline that enables VLMs to self-detect and revise hallucinations. 
ZeroSumEval Benchmark (GitHub Repo) 

A dynamic evaluation framework that uses competitive multi-agent simulations to benchmark LLMs across reasoning, knowledge, and planning tasks. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Garment Generation (4 minute read) 

A new two-stage generative framework for clothing design that enables detailed control over silhouette, color, and logos. It also introduces GarmentBench, a large dataset for multi-conditional garment synthesis. 
Gemini Image Segmentation (4 minute read) 

It is well known that Gemini's vision capabilities are quite good. This post explores one specific use case in segmentation which is surprisingly easy. 
South Korea's AI Chip Champion Is Poised To Carve Out Global Niche (10 minute read) 

Rebellions, South Korea's first AI chip unicorn, merged with SK Telecom's Sapeon to compete globally against giants like Nvidia. The company aims to produce energy-efficient AI chips - its Rebel chip promises significant power savings over Nvidia's H100. With support from top talent and strategic partnerships, Rebellions is targeting international growth and plans to IPO by 2026. 
⚡
Quick Links
LTXV Distilled 0.9.6 Video Model (Hugging Face Hub) 

LTX video model is a state-of-the-art open video model. 
Generate videos in Gemini and Whisk with Veo 2 (2 minute read) 

Starting today, Gemini Advanced users can generate videos using the Veo 2 model, translating text-based prompts into high-resolution, cinematic videos. 
OpenAI has launched the ChatGPT Image Library (1 minute read) 

OpenAI launched the ChatGPT Image Library on the Web and Android/iOS for Free, Plus, and Pro users. 
Love TLDR? Tell your friends and get rewards! 
Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag! 
https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here.
Want to advertise in TLDR? 📰 
If your company is interested in reaching an audience of AI professionals and decision makers, you may want to advertise with us. 

Want to work at TLDR? 💼 
Apply here or send a friend's resume to jobs@tldr.tech and get $1k if we hire them! 

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian & Andrew Carr

New Features in Ample Bass v4

	◦	Dual View Modes.

subject: New Claude Features: Introducing Research and Google Workspace
body:
￼
￼
Hello,
 
Today, we’re introducing two new capabilities that make Claude a more informed and capable collaborator — Research and a Google Workspace integration that connects your email, calendar and documents to Claude. 
￼
Research: Now available on Max plan With Research, Claude can securely search across both your internal work context and the web to help you make decisions and take action faster than before. Claude conducts multiple intelligent searches that build on each other, exploring different angles of your question to deliver comprehensive answers with verified citations in minutes. Research is currently in beta and available on the Max plan in the United States, Japan and Brazil.   Google Workspace integration - Available on Pro and Max plans Claude now integrates with Gmail and Calendar, in addition to Google Docs – helping it gain deeper insight into your work context. By connecting Google Workspace, Claude can search emails, review documents, and see your calendar commitments – eliminating the need to manually upload files or repeatedly provide context about your work and schedule.
 
If you are interested in using these new capabilities, upgrade to one of our paid plans today. 
 
—The Anthropic Team
￼
￼
￼
￼
 
This email was sent to roger@pembery.com. Unsubscribe.
 
Anthropic PBC, 548 Market St, PMB 90375, San Francisco, CA 94104

subject: Your invitation to inspiring evening talks this April at Hills Road Sixth Form College
body:
Dear Parents and Carers
 
Just a reminder of the opportunity to book a ticket for the speakers who will be visiting us during the next two weeks. Tickets are free to all students, parents and carers but must be booked using the links below.
 
 
 
 
￼
  Dear all,  Please find below some details of our next exciting talks in the series of 50th anniversary events.
 

 
￼
A Career in Law: What Do Barristers and Judges Really Do? Her Honour Judge Helen Arthur  📅 Wednesday 23 April ⏰ 7:30 pm 📍 The Hall, Hills Road Sixth Form College 🎟️ Free to attend but book in advance   Have you ever wondered what life is really like for a barrister or judge, bearing the weighty responsibility of making decisions that impact people’s futures?  Hills Road alumna Helen will share her experiences from over 20 years in family law. First as a barrister, now as a Circuit Judge on the Midlands Circuit, Helen’s work involves some of the most complex and sensitive legal cases.   After Hills Road, Helen went on to study Law in London before becoming a family law barrister, representing parents, children, and local authorities in cases that shape lives.  Whether you’re a young person considering a career in law, fascinated by how our justice system works, or simply curious about Helen’s journey, join us for what promises to be an engaging and thought-provoking evening!
Sign up for 23 April with Her Honour Judge Helen Arthur
￼
An evening with a Bestselling Author Sarah Vaughan   📅 Tuesday 29 April ⏰ 7:30 pm 📍 The Hall, Hills Road Sixth Form College 🎟️ Free to attend but book in advance   International bestselling author, former Guardian journalist and former Hills Road parent Sarah Vaughn, read English at Brasenose College, Oxford and went on to train at the Press Association.  She is perhaps best known for her breakout thriller Anatomy of a Scandal, now a worldwide number-one Netflix series, as well as Little Disasters, recently adapted into an upcoming 'tense and compelling' TV drama to be released this Spring.  Sarah was told she couldn't be a journalist as she wasn't tough enough. Applying to Oxford, she was told to a women's college, or she would never get in. She ignored both bits of advice, and now, aims give Hills Road students the inspiration she never had aged 16-18! Sarah will talk about her career to date, overcoming challenges, and offer inspiring insights into working in the world of journalism, publishing or TV.
Sign up for 29 April with Sarah Vaughan
 
 
We hope to see you soon and hope you enjoy a restful Easter period.
 
Best wishes,  Hills Road Marketing Department

 

 P Please consider the environment and don't print this email unless you really need to.

Is there a sustainable way to monetize AI? (Sponsor) 

You've built something powerful with AI. Now you're asking: how do we price it? Many startups are getting the answer wrong right now—and putting their business's viability at risk.

In Metronome's upcoming webinar, pricing experts from 49 Palms Ventures and Metronome CEO Scott Woody will explore strategies and best practices for monetizing AI. Learn how to:
→ Find a logical starting point with the 9-step AI pricing framework
→ Assess and communicate your AI product's value
→ Create flexible, iterable pricing systems that can evolve with the market
Register now to save your spot. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Mistral Classifier Factory (5 minute read) 

Mistral, a French AI startup, has launched a new product that allows users to very quickly build and deploy custom classifiers for a whole variety of tasks (e.g., spam, moderation, and more). 
Goodfire raises $50m series A to steer and understand models (5 minute read) 

Goodfire is a mechanistic interpretability company with strong expertise in SAEs, among other things. It is working closely with closed and open model providers to steer, control, and understand model motivations and behavior. 
Visual Reasoning with OpenAI o3 and o4-mini (5 minute read) 

OpenAI's latest visual models can reason with images through tool-augmented transformations, enabling a new level of multimodal understanding and step-by-step visual problem-solving. 
🧠
Research & Innovation
Efficient Line Art Colorization with Broader References (12 minute read) 

Novel efficient long-context fine-grained ID preservation framework for line art colorization, achieving high precision, efficiency, and flexible usability for comic colorization. It transforms black-and-white line art into vibrant illustrations by effectively integrating extensive contextual references. 
Scene Captioning (14 minute read) 

3D CoCa is a unified framework that combines vision-language contrastive learning and captioning for 3D scenes. 
Large Reasoning Models as a Judge (8 minute read) 

JudgeLRM is a family of LLMs trained with reinforcement learning for judgment tasks. Unlike SFT, it excels in reasoning-heavy evaluations, outperforming models like GPT-4 and DeepSeek-R1. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Resources
DeepSpeed's DeepCompile (GitHub Repo) 

The DeepSpeed team has worked to bring compilation to their distributed training efforts. This compilation speeds up various bottlenecked operations by many times. It makes use of a patched version of torch compile. 
Speech Instruction Fine-Tuning Dataset (Hugging Face Hub) 

SIFT-50M (Speech Instruction Fine-Tuning) is a 50-million-example dataset designed for instruction fine-tuning and pre-training of speech-text large language models (LLMs). It is built from publicly available speech corpora containing a total of 14K hours of speech and leverages LLMs and off-the-shelf expert models. The dataset spans five languages, covering diverse aspects of speech understanding and controllable speech generation instructions. SIFT-50M augments existing speech datasets with instruction-based question-answer (QA) pairs for speech understanding and includes approximately 5 million examples for controllable speech generation. 
End-to-End Latent Diffusion Training with REPA-E (3 minute read) 

REPA-E enables stable, joint training of VAEs and latent diffusion models using a representation-alignment loss, achieving state-of-the-art results on ImageNet. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Meta Releases Many New Artifacts (12 minute read) 

Meta has released an image Encoder, a VLM, a 3D object localization model based on JEPA, and weights for a BLT model that operates directly on bytes without tokenization. 
Hugging Face Inference Supports Cohere Models (9 minute read) 

Cohere became the first model creator to directly host and serve its enterprise-focused AI models on Hugging Face. 
Create AI-generated soundtrack in Shorts with Dream Track (3 minute read) 

YouTube's Dream Track is now available in the U.S. on YouTube Shorts and the YouTube Create app, enabling AI-generated instrumental soundtracks for content creators. These tracks can be remixed globally to create unique Shorts, fostering a collaborative ecosystem. The feature integrates directly with YouTube's creation tools and adheres to community guidelines. 
⚡
Quick Links
OpenAI Flex Processing (2 minute read) 

OpenAI has introduced Flex processing, a cost-saving API option that trades slower response times and intermittent availability for lower prices, ideal for non-production tasks. 
Conversational AI for Cells (1 minute read) 

C2S-Scale is a new family of LLMs that interprets single-cell data and translates biological signals into natural language for applications in personalized medicine and drug discovery. 
Anthropic enhances Claude with Research and Google Workspace integration (4 minute read) 

Anthropic has launched new Claude features: Research for autonomous multi-step search with citations and Google Workspace integration for context-aware assistance.

https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2

Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian & Andrew Carr

subject: News & Club Runs
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 

Dear Roger,

St Ives CC
Development Squad News

Big congratulations to Toby Mannall 👏 for coming 1st in the latest NCRA Spring Road Race last Saturday and to Sam Smith 👏 who was the 1st Junior taking 2nd overall.

This race was the 4th in a series of 6 NCRA Spring Road Races.  The next race is on Saturday 19th April in Southwick.

This is a fantastic result for the St Ives CC Development Team that supports our youth, Junior and U23's.
￼ 
Development Squad Instagram Page

SICC Summer BBQ
￼ 
29th June 2025

This event is subsidised 50% by the club. £10 of food for £5!

Date: Sunday 29th June (Food from 2pm – After the club ride)
Venue: Floods Tavern
Cost: £5 per ticket (Adult/Child)
Whats included: A Burger OR a Hotdog (Vegan/Vegetarian options)
PLUS: Salad, coleslaw, potato salad and chips

Partners and families welcome.
Summer BBQ Tickets

Photo's from last week...
￼ 
￼ 

Sunday Club Run

20th April 2025

We meet outside The Norris Museum on The Waits, St Ives at 8:45 with the first group leaving at 9:00 prompt.

This week's club run will be heading to Warmington and Upton.

Groups A and B will ride the same route of 59 miles stopping at Rectory Farm Kitchen in Warmington.

Group C will ride the shorter route of 34 miles stopping at Holly Lodge in Upton.*

*The pace of the C group is around 14-16mph giving opportunity to new riders to join us.  Please welcome new riders to this group.
Sunday Long Route - 52 - Warmington
Sunday Short Route - 201 - Upton
Thursday Evening Ride
Facebook Event Page - Please show support to get these rides kick started 👊
1st May 2025

We meet outside The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen on The Boulevard, Alconbury Weald at 18:15 with the first group leaving at 18:30 prompt

EVENING RIDES RESTARTING ON 1ST MAY!!
	•	Routes will be here the week before each ride.
	•	Multiple paced groups.
	•	2 routes
	•	25 - 35 miles
	•	No stop ride
	•	The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen will be open until 11pm.
	•	Free Parking available outside The Club gym and near The Pavillion.
	•	New riders are welcomed so please bring a friend.  Membership is required after 2 club rides for insurance purposes.
Thursday Long Route - TBA
Thursday Short Route - TBA
Polite Reminders (for all club rides):
	•	Download the route.
	•	Remember your cafe bike locks.
	•	Look after your club mates.
	•	TT/Aero bars are not to be used.

Thank you.


Upcoming events in the SICC Calendar
For more information please click on the buttons below which will take you to our members only Facebook page.

We always hope for good numbers so that we can form suitable pace related groups.  Please hit 'GOING' to show support.  Thank you. 
Double Dutch, Ship of the Fens Audax
Peaks Away Day Club Run
Double Dutch, Ship of the Fens Audax

Saturday 19th April 2025

ENTER ONLINE HERE

Peaks Away Day Club Run

Sunday 5th May 2025

Book a place to stay!!  OR drive down for the day!

We will be meeting in Hathersage outside the swimming pool.
There's a car park at the swimming pool, a pay and display opposite and other parking options in the town. Please allow plenty of time to get parked and make your way to the meet point. There's also toilets and a newly refurbished cafe at the pool if you wanted a pre/post ride coffee. They're open 8am-5pm and they're expecting us.

Meet: Oddfellows Rd, Hathersage, Hope Valley S32 1DU
Time: 9.15am (to be arranged into groups)
Depart: 9.30am
Route: https://ridewithgps.com/routes/45989392
Pool Cafe: https://www.hathersageswimmingpool.co.uk/.../the-pool-cafe/

It would be a good idea to carry snacks and gels on the bike and maybe extra supplies in the car.

The Old Smithy Cafe in Monyash (mile 38) and Hassop Station Cafe (mile 44) are marked on the ridewithgps route. There's also plenty of places to stop in Bakewell. Please take a look before the ride. We can agree in our groups when we would like to stop.  The Pool Cafe will allow us to catch up at the end.

Please feel free to use this Facebook event page to arrange car shares.
Now's the time to start training!  ￼

Please hit 'GOING' on Facebook to show support. Thank you. 

2025
Dates for your Calendar
 
	•	Social Evening (off the bike) - Tuesday 25th February
	•	International Women's Day Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 8th March
	•	Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 12th April
	•	Double Dutch Audax - Saturday 19th April
	•	Easter Club Run - Sunday 20th April
	•	Evening Social Rides (Alconbury) Start - Thursday 1st May
	•	Peaks Away Day Club Run - Sunday 4th May (stay for the weekend, it's a Bank Holiday!)
	•	Evening 10 mile Time Trials Restart (Sawtry) - Wednesday 14th May
	•	Club Summer BBQ Club Run - Sunday 29th June
	•	Summer Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 19th July
	•	Last Evening 10 mile Time Trial (Sawtry) - Wednesday 20th August
	•	Bank Holiday Weekend Longer Club Run - Sunday 24th August (ideas welcome!)
	•	Last Evening Social Ride (Alconbury) - Thursday 28th August
	•	Dave Nelson Memorial Hill Climb - Wednesday 3rd September
	•	Cafe Ventoux Away Day Club Run - Sunday 7th September
	•	Remembrance Club Run - Sunday 9th Novemeber
	•	Christmas Dress Up Club Run - Sunday 21st December
	•	Festive 500 - Wednesday 24th - 31st December
	•	Winter Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 27th December
	•	Short New Years Eve Ride - Wednesday 31st December
 
	•	SICC hosts Eastern League CX - TBC
	•	Christmas Meal - TBC
	•	AGM & Awards Presentation - TBC

 
Club 10m TT's & Hill Climb
These will go ahead but they need more support to survive (we still require an Events Officer).

Thought of the week

subject: The Divine Comedy, 2:22 A Ghost Story, Elvana, An Evening with Aggers and Tuffers plus many more!

On Sale This Week
￼
The Divine Comedy
￼

15 October 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Since The Divine Comedy’s last album Office Politics (2019), Neil Hannon has remastered the full back catalogue, released the top 5 Charmed Life (2022), and written original songs for the hit film Wonka.
 

New album Rainy Sunday Afternoon lands this September, recorded at Abbey Road and led by new track Achilles. The UK tour follows in October, with EU and Irish dates in 2025.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
2:22 A Ghost Story
￼
22 - 27 June 2026 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
Cornex Members pre-sale: now
On general salE: 18.04.2025, 10 AM
￼
Following seven West End seasons, a record-breaking UK and Ireland tour, and productions around the world, 2:22 A Ghost Story arrives in Cambridge.
 
Winner of Best New Play at the WhatsOnStage Awards, this gripping supernatural thriller by Uncanny creator Danny Robins has featured stars including Lily Allen, Tom Felton and James Buckley. A tense, funny night at the theatre where secrets surface and the supernatural looms—what do you believe?
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Elvana: Elvis Fronted Nirvana
￼

20 February 2026 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
Cornex Members pre-sale: now
On general sale: 19.04.2025, 12 PM
￼
ELVANA - THE WORLD'S FINEST ELVIS FRONTED TRIBUTE TO NIRVANA!
From the bowels of Disgraceland, Rock & Roll icons of the afterlife are raised from the dead! Rock & Roll meets Grunge as Elvis fronts Nirvana and gives the band the front man it’s been missing since ’94. Elvana tear through Nirvana’s catalogue whilst splicing in grunged up sections of the king of rock & rolls finest moments, culminating in a whopper mash up of overdrive & old school Rockabilly. It smells like cheeseburgers and teen spirit, daddy-o!
￼
BOOK HERE

11 April 2026 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now

Cricket legends Aggers and Tuffers are BACK and ready to bowl you over as they return to the stage with their highly anticipated 2026 tour! 
 
With a collective career of over 5 decades, Aggers and Tuffers have remained connected to the sporting world as commentators, media personalities, and even participants of some of the nation's favourite TV shows. 
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
David Olusoga: A Gun Through Time
￼

15 November 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
How can a single weapon shape the world? What stories lie behind the guns that changed history, from battlefields to the criminal underworld?
 
Historian and broadcaster David Olusoga (Black and British, A House Through Time) explores the social history of three firearms that transformed societies and the lives of our ancestors.

￼

Cher: The Shoop Shoop Show

19 April 2026 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now

Experience The Shoop Shoop Show – The Cher Collection as it tours the UK and Europe in 2026. Starring Starstruck winner Rachael Hawnt, this high-energy tribute spans Cher’s greatest hits—from disco and pop-rock anthems to ABBA classics.
 
With stunning vocals, dazzling costumes and a live band, it’s the ultimate celebration of Cher as she turns 80.

Join Hot Content and their friends Quasar, and Colonel Spanky’s Love Ensemble, for a night you will not forget! Three of the hottest bands on the Cambridge scene will be performing back to back, inviting all - town and gown - to get involved in the May Week fun. Cambridge Corn Exchange, run by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council, depends on ticket sales, sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants, and concessions to bring top-quality shows to the city. By becoming a member, you make a significant impact, helping us continue to deliver the music, comedy, and performances you love. As a thank you, we offer great perks in return.

Cambridge Corn Exchange is operated by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council. As well as Corn Exchange ticket income, we rely on income raised through sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants and concessions to ensure that we can continue to bring the biggest and best shows to the city.
 
We also organise an annual programme of diverse and greatly valued events including free Fireworks Night, Out of the Ordinary Festival and Music in the Parks. These events are free in order to offer residents the opportunity to participate in the cultural life of the city and to provide access to all. They contribute to creating a united city, ‘One Cambridge - Fair for All’, in which economic dynamism and prosperity are combined with social justice and equality. Again, these events are also an opportunity to develop valued partnerships with local businesses and other organisations that make up the Cambridge Community.
