subject: Grok Studio 📃, OpenAI o3 and o4-mini 💻, Generative Modeling Latent Representations 🌐
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-17
Run model inference on NVIDIA B200 GPUs with Baseten (Sponsor) 

Baseten is now offering inference on NVIDIA B200 GPUs. B200s are ideal for workloads with aggressive throughput, latency, and cost requirements. By leveraging B200 GPUs, Baseten customers are achieving:

📈 5x higher throughput
📉 50%+ lower cost per token
📉 38% lower latency for the largest LLMs
With B200 GPUs, you can run models like DeepSeek, Llama, and Qwen to power code generation, search, reasoning agents, and more. Get access to Baseten's B200s and run performant applications at scale.
Run model inference on B200 GPUs with Baseten 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Grok Canvas-like Tool for Document Creation (1 minute read) 

Grok, the chatbot from xAI, now includes Grok Studio, a canvas-like tool to build documents and basic apps. It's now live for all users. 
Latents for Generative Modeling (61 minute read) 

Candidate for best blog post of the year for folks interested in generative modeling. This post breaks down the history, intuition, and key innovations for learned latents. 
OpenAI o3 and o4-mini (3 minute read) 

OpenAI has released the new o3 and o4-mini models, which improve ChatGPT's tool use and enable smarter, faster reasoning with integrated web search, file analysis, and image generation. 
🧠
Research & Innovation
NVIDIA's Temporally Consistent Video Diffusion (4 minute read) 

NVIDIA's EquivDM is a framework that enhances video diffusion by using consistent noise for better motion tracking and 3D-consistent outputs with fewer sampling steps. 
Intellect 2 Distributed Training (17 minute read) 

Prime Intellect has trained a 32B network, fully distributed, with reinforcement learning for reasoning. It has open sourced a substantial amount of its code and useful libraries. 
M1: Towards Scalable Test-Time Compute with Mamba Reasoning Models (30 minute read) 

M1 is a Mamba reasoning model that has been trained with extended test time computation. It doesn't fully match state-of-the-art models, but it shows strong performance, especially on long context and through-put. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Resources
DeepMath dataset (GitHub Repo) 

103K examples of highly filtered and decontaminated math problems for reasoning model training. 
Prima CPP (GitHub Repo) 

Prima CPP is an extension of llama.cpp that tries to enable mmaping of memory for large models to enable them to run on low RAM environments. 
Tile Language (GitHub Repo) 

Tile Language is a concise domain-specific language designed to streamline the development of high-performance GPU/CPU kernels (e.g., GEMM, Dequant GEMM, FlashAttention, and LinearAttention). By employing a Pythonic syntax with an underlying compiler infrastructure on top of TVM, it allows developers to focus on productivity without sacrificing the low-level optimizations necessary for state-of-the-art performance. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Assort Health Secures $26 Million (6 minute read) 

Assort Health, a leading AI platform for managing patient calls, has announced new funding, bringing total capital to $26 million, to accelerate its mission of improving healthcare access. The company's technology has led to 8x revenue growth since late 2024 by reducing call hold times and increasing appointment accuracy, evidenced by high patient satisfaction. Backed by prominent investors, Assort Health integrates with EHR systems, achieving a 99% scheduling accuracy and over a 90% resolution rate. 
Hugging Face Updated HELMET Benchmark (12 minute read) 

Hugging Face has expanded its HELMET benchmark to include more models and insights, helping researchers evaluate long-context LLMs like Phi-4 and Jamba 1.6. 
Google Uses AI to Cut Scam Ads by 90% (1 minute read) 

Google's 2024 Ads Safety Report highlights how LLM upgrades blocked billions of bad ads, suspended 700K+ scam accounts, and reduced impersonation scams significantly. 
⚡
Quick Links
Stable Diffusion Now Runs Faster on AMD GPUs (3 minute read) 

Stability AI and AMD optimized several Stable Diffusion models for Radeon GPUs and Ryzen AI, improving speed and performance for AMD users. 
OpenAI in talks to pay about $3 billion to acquire AI coding startup Windsurf (2 minute read) 

OpenAI plans to acquire AI coding tool Windsurf for $3 billion to enhance its generative AI capabilities. 
Liquid V1 7B (Hugging Face Hub) 

Liquid is a multimodal LLM that integrates visual comprehension and generation by tokenizing images into discrete codes.

The sensational alternative folk band The Lumineers are back with a bang in 2025, having recently released their fifth studio record and 
kicking off their Automatic World Tour.
 See them live at Utilita Arena Birmingham on 28 May,
 alongside special guest Michael Marcagi - you won’t want to miss it!                                                                             
Get Tickets
Great events coming soon
￼

TORVILL & DEAN
Torvill & Dean's Our Last Dance tour heads to Birmingham next weekend! Witness their legendary ice dancing one last time and experience the magic before they retire from skating for good. Tickets are selling fast, best availability on the evening performance on Sunday 27 April.
Get Tickets
￼
KEVIN HART
Kevin Hart is heading back across the pond this spring to bring us his latest stand-up comedy tour, Acting My Age, which is his ninth stand-up special to date. See the superstar comedian at Utilita Arena Birmingham on 8 May, grab the last remaining tickets now!
Get Tickets
￼
BETMGM PREMIER LEAGUE DARTS
Premier League Darts is back in Brum on Thursday 1 May! See the sport’s top stars battle it out for the coveted title. Watch the darts in style, with private entrance, access to an exclusive bar and lounge, and premium category seats - limited tickets remaining!
Get Tickets
￼
DIANA ROSS
Don't miss the legendary Diana Ross in Birmingham this June! Experience two sets of iconic hits from The Supremes to her solo career, backed by her band and live orchestra. Expect unforgettable classics like 'Chain Reaction', 'I'm Coming Out', 'Ain't No Mountain High Enough' and many more!
Get Tickets
￼
￼
CHASE AND STATUS

Chase and Status electrified Coachella at the weekend with their drum and bass set, even bringing out Stormzy! See their energy live in Birmingham on 2 May. Limited tickets remaining, secure the Icon Experience and make your night extra special.

Get Tickets

FREE UPGRADE TO VIP PARKING AT BP PULSE LIVE
Ultra-fast charge your EV before a show at the bp pulse Gigahub™ located on the NEC campus and get a free upgrade to VIP parking close to the arena. Spaces are limited so pre-book your spot now. 
Book Now

subject: MoonDream 2.0 🌝, OpenAI Social Network 🫂, Nvidia H20 Exports to China 🇨🇳
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-16
Get more from your LLMs (Sponsor) 

When LLMs fail, it's rarely about the model's raw power. Turing's “Maximizing Your LLM ROI” whitepaper shows how the real culprits — misaligned training, poor evaluation, and optimization gaps — can quietly sabotage ROI.

Inside, you'll learn how to:
● Reduce hidden inefficiencies that drive up LLM costs
● Strengthen evaluation techniques for higher accuracy and reliability
● Build an AI strategy that maximizes performance and business value
Get the white paper now to optimize your AI investments. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
MoonDream 2.0 Release (6 minute read) 

MoonDream is a small, 2B parameter VLM that outperforms many open and closed models. It has recently gotten a strong upgrade on chartQA and a number of other useful benchmarks. 
OpenAI Explores Social Network (2 minute read) 

OpenAI is testing an internal prototype of a ChatGPT-integrated social feed focused on image generation, potentially expanding into a standalone social network. 
Nvidia H20 Exports to China Restricted (1 minute read) 

The U.S. now requires Nvidia to obtain a license for exporting its H20 AI chips to China, citing potential misuse in supercomputers. 
🧠
Research & Innovation
TxGemma Open Model for Therapeutic Development (12 minute read) 

Google has released another model based on its suite of Gemma models. This one is tuned to help discover therapeutic treatments in medical sciences. It outperforms most specialized and all open generalized models. 
Data Decide (17 minute read) 

AllenAI has released a tool that can be used to help decide which data to include in pre-training. This framework is quite useful for understanding what goes into a filtering run for pre-training. 
Conversion Rate Prediction in Ad Systems (11 minute read) 

Pinterest researchers have proposed a multitask framework that uses Deep Hierarchical Ensemble Networks to improve CVR predictions in ad systems. It shows state-of-the-art results through feature combination and auxiliary learning. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Resources
Open Source OpenAI Production Kernels (GitHub PR) 

OpenAI has open sourced some of its fp4 and MoE kernels to the Triton language GitHub. 
Nemotron H Models (Hugging Face Hub) 

Nvidia's ADLR team has released the weights for the hybrid mamba Nemotron models, which have strong long context performance and decent general benchmark abilities. 
Auto Deploy (GitHub Repo) 

A new way to transform PyTorch and Hugging Face models into a faster, deployable, format for fast inference. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
OpenAI's Updates Preparedness Framework (7 minute read) 

OpenAI has revised its safety strategy and introduced sharper risk categories, stronger evaluation processes, and new guidelines for managing advanced AI capabilities. 
Canada Has Answer to Energy Needs in AI Race, Ex-Google CEO Says (1 minute read) 

Canada has 250 data centers and aims to expand by leveraging its abundant energy resources, like hydro and nuclear. Conservative leader Pierre Poilievre advocates for increased resource production to boost economic benefits domestically. 
Jack Ma Advocates for AI to Serve Humanity, Not Dominate (11 minute read) 

Jack Ma advocates for AI development focused on enhancing human life, warning against technologies that dominate. He urges global collaboration to create ethical guidelines, ensuring AI complements rather than replaces human capabilities. His call reflects broader public sentiment favoring technology that supports societal welfare. 
⚡
Quick Links
Transforming Data into Insights with Multimodal LLMs in AI Studio (Sponsor) 

Discover how HP's AI Studio is transforming medical research and diagnostics. Join us to learn how AI Studio can help you effectively integrate and analyze different data formats. Register now to secure your spot for the webinar 
Notion Launches AI-Powered Email (2 minute read) 

Notion Mail is a Gmail-integrated client that helps users manage, search, and reply to email using AI. 
OpenAI slashes AI model safety testing time (5 minute read) 

OpenAI has reduced the time and resources for safety testing its AI models, raising concerns over rushed releases without proper safeguards. 
ChatGPT became the most downloaded app globally in March (3 minute read) 

ChatGPT became the most downloaded non-gaming app in March, surpassing Instagram and TikTok with 46 million downloads.

subject: OpenAI GPT 4.1 🚀, Hugging Face acquires Pollen Robotics 🤖, DolphinGemma 🐬
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-15
Delve goes viral on X for pulling all-nighters to ship autopilot for SOC 2 (Sponsor) 

Delve officially launched Computer Use Agents that allow founders and GRC teams to go auto-capture all screenshots for SOC 2.

And customers are using it to achieve incredible results:
	•	Lovable got fully SOC 2 compliant in less than 20 hours
	•	11x ditched their old compliance platform, saved 143 hours on SOC 2, and unlocked $1.2M ARR
	•	Bland AI got SOC 2 and unlocked $500k ARR within 7 days
If you want to ditch your old platform, they'll even migrate you off for FREE.
Book a demo here for $2000 off compliance in April!
(PS: TLDR readers get free custom Arc'teryx jackets) 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
OpenAI GPT-4.1 (12 minute read) 

OpenAI has launched three new models in its API: GPT‑4.1, GPT‑4.1 mini, and GPT‑4.1 nano. These models outperform GPT‑4o and GPT‑4o mini across the board, with major gains in coding and instruction following. They also have larger context windows—supporting up to 1 million tokens of context—and are able to better use that context with improved long-context comprehension. They feature a refreshed knowledge cutoff of June 2024. 
Hugging Face Acquires Pollen Robotics (4 minute read) 

Hugging Face, the center of the open source AI community, has long stated its goal is to be a decentralized DeepMind. While this isn't exactly the case, adding in an open source robotics platform via Pollen moves it closer to that goal. 
DolphinGemma (6 minute read) 

DeepMind has announced DolphinGemma, a large language model developed by Google that helps scientists study how dolphins communicate — and hopefully find out what they're saying, too. 
🧠
Research & Innovation
Seaweed-7B: Cost-Effective Training of Video Generation Foundation Model (21 minute read) 

The ByteDance team has released a paper showing how to train a competitive 7B parameter video generation model on a “modest” compute budget of 655k H100 hours. It has strong performance on a number of temporally difficult tasks. 
PixelFlow: Pixel-Space Generative Models with Flow (30 minute read) 

Most generative models on continuous signals operate in latent space due to computational constraints. This work introduces a series of cascades that allow the generation to happen directly in pixel space. This eliminates the need for a pretrained VAE. 
InteractVLM: 3D Interaction Reasoning from 2D Foundational Models (24 minute read) 

New VLM that can reason about contacts between humans in 3D and objects. It does so by leveraging a strong base model and lifting its reasoning into 3D with clever multi-view rendering. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Resources
3B parameter tokenizer (GitHub Repo) 

Scaling up image tokenizers is challenging because they tend to collapse. This work introduces GigaTok, which is a massive tokenizer with superior reconstruction performance. Decoder scaling and regularization helped with stability and overall quality. 
Improved MoE with C3PO (GitHub Repo) 

C3PO introduces a new test-time optimization technique that improves accuracy in Mixture-of-Experts LLMs by re-mixing expert weights based on similar reference samples. 
Visual Reasoning with Less Data (16 minute read) 

Using MCTS to quantify sample difficulty, ThinkLite-VL improves reasoning in VLMs with just 11k training samples and no distillation. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
BrowseComp Benchmark for Hard-to-Find Knowledge (9 minute read) 

OpenAI's BrowseComp is a new benchmark of 1,266 problems designed to evaluate AI agents' browsing skills in gathering complex, hard-to-locate information online. 
Business Leaders' Thoughts on AI Possibilities (6 minute read) 

Executives from nine companies share how they're leveraging Google Cloud's AI tools to drive innovation across sectors, with over 600 real-world use cases highlighted. 
6 highlights from Google Cloud Next 25 (2 minute read) 

Vertex AI introduces updates to video, image, speech, and music generation models, enhancing creative workflows for businesses. Google AI is enabling specialized AI agents for companies, improving productivity and security. A new Agent2Agent Protocol allows different AI agents to securely communicate across platforms. 
⚡
Quick Links
DeepSeek to Open Source its Inference Engine (2 minute read) 

DeepSeek's inference engine is built on VLLM, although it is now heavily modified. 
NVIDIA to Manufacture AI Supercomputers in the U.S. (12 minute read) 

NVIDIA is localizing AI hardware production by building factories in Texas and Arizona, aiming to produce Blackwell chips and AI supercomputers entirely within the U.S. 
Gemini Adds Question Generation to Google Classroom (1 minute read) 

Educators can now use Gemini to generate questions or quizzes from selected text in Google Classroom, enhancing lesson interactivity and streamlining content creation.

body:
View in browser
￼

­ 
￼
­ 
￼
­ 
￼
The wait is over.
Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro is officially out now!
￼
­
BUY NOW
­
Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro is a major update to our flagship singing voice synthesis application, and now offers singing with a more human level of naturalness, plus up to 300% faster rendering speeds.
 
Here’s what else is new:
 
	•	Enhanced control of phonemes, Vocal Modes, AI Retakes.
	•	Smart Pitch Controls - a new system to precisely shape pitch expressions with.
	•	A first-of-its-kind "Mouth Opening" feature - a fresh parameter for nuanced vowel pronunciation.
	•	A new Voices Panel to view, audition, and activate 7-day trials of all available Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro voices.  
You can now purchase the software, along with all Dreamtonics version 2 voices, bundles, and upgrades. As a special offer, all Dreamtonics version 2 voices are available at $69, a discount from the regular price of $79, until April 20th, 2025.
 
Synthesizer V Studio 2 and all voices are also available to trial free for 7-14 days.  
To activate your free 14-day Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro trials and any 7-day voice trials, you will first need to register for a free Dreamtonics user account. Registration is quick and easy. Simply click the 'Register new user account’ button on this page and create your account by entering your name and email address.
 
You can now also purchase Synthesizer V Studio 2 and all Dreamtonics software and voices via our new user account system, which is linked to our store too.
 
Those of you who may have already downloaded or purchased Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro or any version 2 voices should read our post-launch follow-up and updates forum post here.
GET FREE TRIALS
­
BUY NOW
­
­
What top media titles are saying about Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro
  
“ Now Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro takes its skills to the next level, and it looks like creating realistic-sounding vocals from MIDI notes and typed text couldn't be easier. Synthesizer V Studio is unique in its use of, and ability to manipulate, real vocal recordings rather than relying on trained AI to do the same job.”
Music Radar - February 2025
￼
“ Since its initial release, Synthesizer V has provided musicians with a tool for generating and refining vocal performances. The software enables users to input melodies, write lyrics, and select from a variety of AI-driven vocalists while customising expressive details. With this new version, Dreamtonics has introduced a series of enhancements designed to improve realism, workflow efficiency, and creative control.”
Attack Magazine - February 2025
￼
“ At the NAMM Show 2025, Tokyo-based Dreamtonics were showcasing the latest version of their innovative vocal synthesis software. Dreamtonics have re-trained the underlying AI and carefully reworked the Vocal Modes available for each voice to enhance their stylistic distinction, a move which not only improves the quality of each voice, but also prepares them for the new level of detailed edits offered by version 2. ”
Sound On Sound Magazine - February 2025
￼
What top professionals are saying about Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro
 
 
“ I think Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro is a real breakthrough for creating vocal melodies and writing lyrics. I was blessed to be able to sing anything I can dream up, but so many people don’t have the ability. I was surprised how quickly I was able to get up and running. The midi functionality is a real game-changer. Being able to play in my melodies and then just copy lyrics from the previous take was seamless. This is a great app and plugin!”
Mischke Butler - Singer, Songwriter, Vocal Producer, Vocal Coach & Vocal Arranger (Michael Jackson, The Spice Girls, Britney Spears, Keke Palmer, and Little Mix)
￼
"Synthesizer V Studio 2 Pro is an incredibly useful tool for song writing and vocal production." Chris Garcia - Vocal Producer & Music Producer (Adel, Dua Lipa, Lana Del Rey, Katie Perry, Christina Aguilera, Celine Dion)

Input notes via MIDI, type some words and then pick your vocalist! I want to basically shout from a mountain top and let everyone in the world know about this incredible technology." Jordan Rudess - Keyboardist and Multi-Instrumentalist (Dream Theater)

body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-14
The Battle against Bots: How to protect your AI app (Sponsor) 

Modern bots are smarter than ever—executing JavaScript, storing cookies, rotating IPs, and even cracking CAPTCHAs with AI. As attacks grow more sophisticated, traditional detection just isn't enough. 

Enter WorkOS Radar—your all-in-one bot defense solution. With just a single API, you can instantly secure your signup flow against brute force attacks, leaked credentials, and disposable emails. Stop bots in their tracks and keep your real users safe.

Start protecting your app today with WorkOS Radar. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Safe Superintelligence valued at $32B (2 minute read) 

OpenAI co-founder Ilya Sutskever's AGI moonshot was recently valued at a substantial leap from its September funding round. 
Airtable's New AI Assistant (4 minute read) 

Airtable has launched Airtable Assistant in beta alongside new capabilities that drastically change what it means to build apps in Airtable. The updates make it easier than ever for developers to build and modify apps, create automations and interfaces, and answer any business questions on enterprise data using natural language. 
Verified ID May Be Required for Future OpenAI API Access (1 minute read) 

OpenAI plans to gate access to certain upcoming models behind a new Verified Organization process that will require government-issued ID. Verification will be limited to one org per ID every 90 days. 
🧠
Research & Innovation
Anthropic Report on University Student AI Usage (22 minute read) 

Anthropic has released a great educational report on how different groups of university students are using AI. Most groups in STEM use it for homework help while groups in humanities use it less and generally more for ideation and brainstorming. 
3D Object Part Segmentation (7 minute read) 

HoloPart is a semantic 3D Object segmentation model that can identify and separate a single 3D object into meaningful sub-pieces. 
Efficient Compression for MoE Models (14 minute read) 

C-Prune is a two-stage pruning method that compresses Mixture-of-Experts models by clustering similar experts and pruning redundant clusters. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Resources
Jax Recommendation Engine (GitHub Repo) 

A great recommendation engine with metrics, implementations of embedding models, and training infrastructure. 
Reasoning VLM from Kimi (GitHub Repo) 

One of the first open reasoning models for visual question answering. This small model is extremely good at grounded question answering for images, image captioning, and even some math based on image input. 
Document Reranking (9 minute read) 

LLM4Ranking is a new modular framework that supports both open and closed LLMs for document reranking, complete with evaluation tools and reproducible benchmarks across popular datasets. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Google launches AI short film initiative (3 minute read) 

Google has partnered with filmmakers to produce AI-themed short films, aiming to explore the emotional and ethical dynamics of human-AI coexistence. 
YouTube backs NO FAKES Act to fight AI misuse (2 minute read) 

YouTube supports new legislation to combat AI-generated impersonations, reinforcing its commitment to protecting creators and viewers from deepfake harms. 
Canva unveils Visual Suite 2.0 with AI-powered productivity tools (4 minute read) 

Canva introduced Visual Suite 2.0 at Canva Create 2025, integrating AI-driven features like Magic Studio, Canva Sheets, and Magic Charts to streamline design workflows. The suite also includes Canva Code for website creation and an enhanced Photo Editor with AI capabilities. These tools aim to unify design, data, and development in a single platform. 
⚡
Quick Links
HeyBoss AI Website Builder (Product) 

HeyBoss offers fully customizable AI websites and apps, unlike Wix and Squarespace's template-based approach. 
Fully open fast inference models (Hugging Face Hub) 

Apriel models from ServiceNow research are designed for fast inference and showcase good performance. 
Samsung and Google Cloud Expand Partnership, Bring Gemini to Ballie, a Home AI Companion Robot by Samsung (3 minute read)

subject: Rhino Racing WTRL TTT sign-up success.
body:
Can't see this message? View in a browser
 
￼

Thanks for registering.

If you are new to Team Time Trials then have a read of the below - it will give you all the info needed to get lined up in the pen with your fellow team mates.
​
Please remember that everyone is equally important to the team, the keyword is Team!
  
There are 2 forms used for TTT’s, you have obviously found the first as you made your way here...⁠ 
 The sign-up form (that you've just filled in) is available each week on Friday and is where you can select your availability for the following Thursday - timezone availability, including a comments section if you want to request an easy ride, harder ride etc.
 The team-sheet is usually finalised on a Wednesday afternoon / evening and confirmed via a message in ⁠ttt-chat on the Rhino Racing Discord server (all riders will get tagged - as long as we have your discord tag).
The team sheet confirms which team you are on and who you ride with.
TEAM SHEET
￼
You need to click the RacePass link for your team, and you need to have a registered WTRL account:
WTRL REGISTRATION
￼
Most teams have a chat beforehand if needed, in the ⁠ttt-chat channel. (Some regular competitive teams have dedicated channels to discuss tactics beforehand) but if you have any questions please ask or DM any Rhino you have spoken with and they will help you or point you in the right direction.
​
Make sure you click the RacePass in the team sheet ASAP and are registered for the event. You have to sign up to the RacePass before that TimeZone begins, but so long as you have then you don’t actually have to join the event Race Pen in Zwift up until a few minutes before your official start time. However, it's always recommended to be in the Race Pen and in the Team Voice Channel 5-10 minutes before your start time.
​
You can confirm you’ve signed up correctly using the RacePass, as you should then see the TTT event on the home screen of your Zwift Companion App listed under Events.
Change kit to the Rhino jersey (if you have it - if you are new it might take a week for Gordon to get it unlocked for you).
 Make sure you select a TT bike from your garage!! If you want to look at the fastest bike setup, try Zwifter Bikes and use the settings to adjust for the course, your Zwift level, your Drops level and FTP and weight etc.
ZWIFTER BIKES
￼
Add (Rhino) after your Zwift name (this can be done in the Companion App settings).
At least 10 minutes before your event start time, please log on to Zwift (in case of software updates) and join the Discord Team Voice Channel of the team name you are riding with (Albino, Thundering, Rapids, Nuclear etc) meet your teammates, discuss a plan, make sure everyone is ready etc.
​
Please check your discord if you have not used it before (turn on noise suppression in settings to remove trainer/fan noise).
​
The aim is to stay with the group, always in the draft. If you are stronger rider do more work on the front. If weak just try hang on in the draft. Sometimes a race is just too fast and riders need to be dropped (especially for experienced teams going for the win).
​
For teams of 5 or more, the team time is taken from 4th rider to cross the line. For teams of 3 or 4, it is from the 3rd rider crossing the line.
​
Don't feel bad if you get dropped just continue the race at your own pace but please DON'T INTERFERE OR TRY DRAFTING OTHER TEAMS. If another team passes you then it is respectful to ease your power for 10-20s until they are passed and a few seconds clear of you.
​
If you finding that you are not enjoying the TTTs and maybe getting put in a team that drops you each week then please feel free to comment on sign up form – you can ask for an easier ride, a harder ride – we are always flexible to try place riders in a team that suits their needs.
 Communication is key, don’t be afraid to talk to your team even if you are new and learning - if you see the group stretching try call it out when you see gaps of 3-4 meters before it gets to 5+ and out the draft. If you can’t last any longer then tell them you are dropping so that they know to carry on etc.
​
We are all racing to have fun and there are some very experienced TTT riders active in ⁠ttt-chat who are happy to answer any and all questions.
​
Support your teammates and have fun. Remember it’s a Team Time Trial!  
 
There are lots of videos in streaming links on the Rhino Racing Discord server to see how a TTT is done if you would like to have a look beforehand.
​
Well done on getting to the end of this and remember... Have fun... the type 2 kind!

subject: View your latest statement online
body:
Tescobank.com 
Credit Card ending 1016 
 
￼
 
Hello Roger,

Your latest monthly statement for your Tesco Bank Credit Card ending 1016 is now available in Online Banking or via our Mobile App.

If you don't have our Mobile App, you can download it from the App Store or Google Play.

Need a regular payment reminder?

You can choose to receive a handy reminder, up to 14 days before your payment is due. Get set up in our Mobile App or Online Banking today.

We're here to help

If you're worried about money at the moment, we're on hand to support you. Find out how at tescobank.com/moneyhelp﻿

How can I make payments to my credit card?

There are a number of ways you can make a payment in Online Banking or using our Mobile App:
	•	Direct Debit - set up a Direct Debit to pay either the minimum amount, the full balance or somewhere in between. It's easy to forget when your credit card bill needs to be paid - setting up a Direct Debit is a great way to make sure you don't. 
	•	Pay by Bank - make a payment directly from your bank, using our Mobile App or online at tescobank.com 
	•	Faster Payment - pay from your own bank using these details: Sort Code: 40-64-15 and Account Number: 31310006 . Use your 16-digit Tesco Credit Card number as your payment reference, without any dashes or spaces. 
	•	Pay by debit card - use your debit card to make a one-off payment to your bill. 
If you have any questions, please get in touch with us.

Yours sincerely,
The Credit Card Team at Tesco Bank 
 



  


Help and support 
Find answers to common questions about credit cards in our FAQs. Further help and support is available within our online community. 
  
Enquiries

Please don’t reply to this email as the mailbox doesn’t accept incoming messages. If you have any questions please visit our Online Help Centre.

Security Information

Tesco Bank will never ask for confidential information or for you to confirm your security details via email. Our emails may include links to trusted third parties but will never include links that direct you to your account login page. You can visit our Security Centre for more information on staying safe online. Please forward any suspicious emails to phishing@tescobank.com.

subject: ChatGPT Memory 🧠, Mira Murati fundraising 💰, Amazon’s AI Investment 🤖
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-11
Exploring AI in your software building? (Sponsor) 

Reap AI's rewards of ⚡speed and 🤖efficiency…

… while avoiding the 📉risk, 🔮hallucinations, and 🔨manual toil. 
CircleCI wants to make it easier for you to leverage AI confidently and easily.
Explore some of these helpful resources today!
🤖 7 tips for effective system prompting: a developer's guide to building better AI applications
🧑‍🏫 Automated testing for LLMOps on DeepLearning.AI [Free course]
Hungry to get started? Learn how CircleCI can make building with AI easier and more enjoyable. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
ChatGPT Now Uses All Past Conversations (1 minute read) 

ChatGPT can now remember all your past conversations, a step toward more personalized and long-term useful AI systems. 
Mira Murati's Startup Aims for $2B Round (2 minute read) 

Ex-OpenAI execs have joined Mira Murati's new startup, which is targeting a $2B raise despite having no product yet, banking on its star team and ambitious AI goals. 
Amazon's Heavy AI Investment (28 minute read) 

Amazon CEO Andy Jassy, in their annual letter, emphasizes that massive AI investment is essential to reinvent customer experiences, with over 1,000 GenAI projects underway and growing infrastructure demands. 
🧠
Research & Innovation
OmniCaptioner (9 minute read) 

OmniCaptioner is a unified visual captioning framework capable of generating detailed textual descriptions across diverse visual domains, including natural images, textual visuals, and structured graphics. It enhances visual reasoning with LLMs, improves image generation tasks, and enables efficient supervised fine-tuning with less data. 
BrowseComp agent benchmark (12 minute read) 

OpenAI has released a new agent based benchmark that tests an agent's ability to locate hard-to-find information via actions in the browser. Its DeepResearch system/model gets 51%, whereas humans get around 80%. 
Neural Motion Simulator for Embodied AI (14 minute read) 

MoSim introduces a world model for motion dynamics that improves skill acquisition and enables zero-shot learning, effectively turning model-free RL into model-based. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Resources
VideoChat R1 (GitHub Repo) 

An inference time compute captioning method for video question answering. It uses RL to improve the overall reasoning of the model which leads to a 30% boost in object tracking tasks. 
Concept Attention (GitHub Repo) 

A novel method to view concepts in the attention map of neural networks. 
Mammal Pose Estimation (GitHub Repo) 

KITPose is a novel keypoints-interactive model designed for general mammal pose estimation. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Our vision for accelerating creativity and productivity with agentic AI (9 minute read) 

Adobe is integrating agentic AI across its product suite, including Acrobat, Photoshop, and Premiere Pro, to enhance creativity and productivity by automating repetitive tasks and providing smart recommendations. Agentic AI aims to empower users at all levels by allowing them to focus more on creative endeavors and less on technical execution. This approach will help streamline workflows, enabling professionals to achieve more with their tools. 
US engineers' AI converts simple text into walking robots in a day (4 minute read) 

Duke University's Text2Robot enables non-experts to create functional 3D robots from simple text inputs using a generative AI framework. This technology democratizes robotic design by eliminating complex barriers previously requiring extensive technical knowledge. 
Announcing the Agent2Agent Protocol (A2A) (8 minute read) 

Aiming to advance AI collaboration and automation in enterprise environments, Google Cloud has launched the Agent2Agent (A2A) protocol to enable seamless interoperability between AI agents across different platforms and vendors, with support from over 50 tech partners including Atlassian, Salesforce, and PayPal. A2A provides a standardized framework for secure communication and task coordination among agents, enhancing productivity and reducing costs for enterprises. The open-source protocol also supports varied modalities and long-running tasks. 
⚡
Quick Links
Sculptor: Catch and fix issues as you code (3 minute read) 

Sculptor is an early access coding agent environment that embeds software engineering best practices by running code in sandboxed environments. 
WordPress AI Website Builder (4 minute read) 

A new AI website builder creates complete WordPress sites from user input, ideal for entrepreneurs, freelancers, and bloggers. 
Trump administration backs off Nvidia's H20 chip crackdown (2 minute read) 

The Trump administration reversed plans to restrict Nvidia's H20 AI chip exports to China after Nvidia CEO promised U.S. investments.

subject: 🌺 Roundhouse Three Sixty is in full bloom, new gigs announced & more...
body:
￼ 
Roundhouse Three Sixty is finally here!
Are you ready? Roundhouse Three Sixty has officially here! We’ve kicked off an unmissable month of performances across music, spoken word, theatre, visual arts, podcasts, club nights and more.
Keep scrolling to see highlights from across the festival programme, as well as just announced gigs and upcoming opportunities from our Youth Programme...
￼ 

Don't miss out on £5 tickets!
Aged 30 or under? We're offering a limited number of £5 tickets for shows across the entire festival.
From Vogue Rites: Face the Music Ball to Sona Jobarteh & the Philharmonia, don't miss your chance to experience the festival for just a fiver! 
If you're 30 or under, head to the 'Essential Info & Fees' section on the event of your choice to book. 
SEE THE FULL PROGRAMME 
￼ 
Jack Rooke's SHOW HOLE
Sat 12 April | Doors 8pm
Jack Rooke’s SHOW HOLE is bringing even more chaos with a special performance by Patrick Wolf! After soundtracking Big Boys season 3 finale with The Magic Position, his appearance is set to be unforgettable. 
Joining him on the lineup are DJ sets from James Acaster, Self Esteem, Lolly Adefope, and the Big Boys cast. Expect a live performance from genre-bending collective Figs In Wigs, plus more surprise guests! 
It's big, camp, and truly unmissable. Don’t miss out on the party and grab your tickets now!
BOOK TICKETS 
￼
Roundhouse Poetry Slam Final
Thu 17 April | 7:30pm
The Roundhouse Poetry Slam Final returns for its 20th year, spotlighting the UK’s best emerging spoken word talent as they compete for the coveted Slam Champion title and a cash prize. 
Proudly supported by Taylor Wessing, the final will be hosted by BBC Radio 1’s Vick Hope and poet Toby Campion, with Caleb Femi as a guest judge — returning 10 years after his own Slam win.
Can’t make it in person? No problem! 
Watch the Poetry Slam Final livestream online on our website.

BOOK TICKETS 
￼
Corinne Bailey Rae presents Black Rainbows Orchestral
Sun 27 April | 6:30pm
Corinne Bailey Rae joins the festival for a one-off event, reimagining her Mercury Prize-nominated album Black Rainbows with the Guildhall Session Orchestra. This exclusive performance transforms her powerful ode to Black femininity, ancestral strength, and transcendence into a bold orchestral experience, featuring brand-new arrangements created with Guildhall musicians.

The Guardian hailed the album as 'an extraordinary new sound.' Don’t miss this genre-blending fusion of rock, electronica, jazz, and Afrofuturism.
BOOK TICKETS 

JUST ANNOUNCED GIGS
￼
Perfume Genius
Tue 11 November 
Seattle-born Perfume Genius brings his emotionally raw, sonically expansive sound to Roundhouse. Since his 2010 debut, he’s captivated audiences with ethereal vocals and deeply personal songwriting.
From the defiant Queen to his GRAMMY-nominated No Shape, his music pushes boundaries. Don’t miss a night of visionary artistry as he takes the stage live.
BOOK TICKETS 
￼
Pitchfork Festival London: Laurie Anderson
Sat 8 November
Legendary artist Laurie Anderson headlines the Roundhouse with a special performance, spanning her iconic Big Science to new recordings with SexMob. A trailblazer in music, art, and technology, she’s joined by an all-star lineup, including Steven Bernstein, Briggan Krauss, Tony Scherr, Kenny Wollesen, and Doug Wieselman. 
Expect an unforgettable night of boundary-pushing sound.
BOOK TICKETS 

GET CREATIVE. GET INSPIRED
We don't just put on unforgettable gigs and performances. Every ticket purchased helps us empower young people with affordable opportunities for ages 11-30 in music, media, performing arts and professional development. 
Are you a creative aged 30 or under looking for new opportunities? Check out what's on below or find more here. 
￼
Roundhouse Resident Artist Programme
Apply by Mon 5 May, 10am | Ages 18-25 
Are you a musician, theatre maker or poet looking to take your next big step? 
The Roundhouse Resident Artist programme is a year-long opportunity to develop your creative voice, connect with industry experts, and perform on major stages – all while being part of a supportive community of emerging artists.
Over 12 months, you’ll take part in expert-led workshops, receive one-to-one mentoring, and get access to career-shaping performance opportunities inside and outside the Roundhouse.
MORE INFO 
￼
Transmission Roundhouse Podcast Academy
Apply by Mon 12 May, 12pm | Ages 18-25
Passionate about podcasting? 
Over 11 weeks, master podcast production with workshops, guest speakers, and career support. Develop your skills in story-telling, audio editing, studio operations and more! 
The project runs Sat 24 May – Tue 29 July. The price of the programme is £25 (Pay only if selected).
MORE INFO 

￼ 

￼   ￼   ￼   ￼   ￼
Roundhouse, Chalk Farm Road, London, NW1 8EH 
© Roundhouse Trust Ltd.
Registered Charity No. 1071487

subject: Mac DeMarco, UK Pink Floyd Experience, William Dalrymple, The Céline Experience plus many more!
body:
Discover our on sale shows
 
Is this email not displaying correctly? View it in your browser.
￼
￼
BOX OFFICE: Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk | Phone: 01223 357851 | Mon - Fri, 10am - 5pm
￼
On Sale This Week
￼
Mac DeMarco
￼

12 November 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale: 11 April 2025, 10 AM
￼
Indie icon Mac DeMarco brings his unmistakable sound to Cambridge Corn Exchange as part of his highly anticipated UK, European, and North American tour. Catch the Canadian multi-instrumentalist, songwriter, and producer live on stage for a night of offbeat charm, lo-fi grooves, and fan favourites. Don’t miss this rare chance to see DeMarco—tickets are expected to sell fast!
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
UK Pink Floyd Experience
￼

29 June 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Celebrate 50 years of Pink Floyd’s iconic Wish You Were Here album with the UK Pink Floyd Experience, delivering over two hours of incredible music, top-flight musicianship, and a stunning light show. The brand-new 2025 show features the full Wish You Were Here album, plus classics from The Wall, Animals, The Division Bell, and The Dark Side of the Moon, alongside fan favourites like Lucifer Sam and Childhood’s End. Don’t miss this immersive celebration of all things Floyd!
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
William Dalrymple
￼

30 June 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Join historian and Empire podcast co-host William Dalrymple as he reveals the fascinating, often overlooked story of India’s role as a cultural and scientific superpower from 250BC to 1200AD. In this captivating talk, Dalrymple explores how ancient India transformed the world—exporting religion, art, science, and philosophy along a Golden Road stretching from the Red Sea to the Pacific. Don’t miss this chance to hear one of Britain’s greatest living historians bring to life the empire of ideas that shaped Asia and beyond.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Celebrating Céline - The Ultimate Celine Dion Tribute Concert
￼

26 July 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Join us for an electrifying tribute to Céline Dion, featuring dazzling costumes, powerful vocals, and a live band led by Andy Mudd. With hits like My Heart Will Go On and The Power of Love, January captures Céline’s essence in a show that’s the next best thing to the real deal.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Kid Creole and The Coconuts
￼

19 June 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Disco king August Darnell aka Kid Creole who had several hits in the 80s including Annie, I'm Not Your Daddy and Stool Pigeon. Kid is ably supported by his outrageous backing singers The Coconuts. Still playing 80's festivals and events, the Kid has also branched out in recent years into musicals, most notably the touring production of Oh! What A Night.
￼
BOOK HERE
￼
The Rocket Man
￼

20 June 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now
￼
Get ready for a magical night as The Rocket Man and his incredible live band take you down the Yellow Brick Road in a dazzling tribute to Sir Elton John. Packed with hits like I'm Still Standing, Crocodile Rock, and Philadelphia Freedom, this spectacular show celebrates the music, the memories, and the moments of Elton’s legendary career. Catch a star and join us for two hours of non-stop classics, laughter, and pure musical joy!

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Discover More
￼
Garden House
￼
We're delighted so many Corn Exchange customers have been enjoying the special restaurant discount offered by our partner, Garden House, which continues throughout spring and summer.
 
Garden House is just a 7-minute walk from the Corn Exchange, making it the perfect spot to enjoy a meal before or after your event. If you haven't already, why not make your night out extra special with this fabulous offer exclusively for Corn Exchange ticket holders!
 
T&Cs apply. Visit website for more info.

BOOK HERE
￼
Want to skip the queues?
￼
The age-old tradition of queuing for interval drinks is becoming a thing of the past at the Corn Exchange.
 
Simply follow this link and place your order in just a few easy steps. Whether you're craving a bag of Haribos, a Coke, a glass of wine, a beer, a ready-mixed cocktail, or an award-winning Saffron Ice Cream, you can sit back, relax, and enjoy the show while your interval drinks and snacks are delivered straight to your seat!
PRE-ORDER NOW
￼
CornEx Membership
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange, run by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council, depends on ticket sales, sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants, and concessions to bring top-quality shows to the city. By becoming a member, you make a significant impact, helping us continue to deliver the music, comedy, and performances you love. As a thank you, we offer great perks in return.
BECOME A MEMBER
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
￼
Cambridge Corn Exchange is operated by the not-for-profit Cambridge City Council. As well as Corn Exchange ticket income, we rely on income raised through sponsorship, donations, memberships, grants and concessions to ensure that we can continue to bring the biggest and best shows to the city.
 
We also organise an annual programme of diverse and greatly valued events including free Fireworks Night, Out of the Ordinary Festival and Music in the Parks. These events are free in order to offer residents the opportunity to participate in the cultural life of the city and to provide access to all. They contribute to creating a united city, ‘One Cambridge - Fair for All’, in which economic dynamism and prosperity are combined with social justice and equality. Again, these events are also an opportunity to develop valued partnerships with local businesses and other organisations that make up the Cambridge Community.
3 Parson's Court, Wheeler Street, Cambridge, CB2 3QE
 
Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk
Phone: 01223 357851

Cambridge Corn Exchange is provided by Cambridge City Council
￼

If you no longer wish to receive these emails, please click here to unsubscribe.
 
If you have any suggestions, queries or comments, why not send us an email to tickets@cambridge.gov.uk.
 
© Cambridge City Council.
￼

subject: News & Club Runs
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 

Dear Roger,

Ladies Social Road Ride
Saturday 12th April 2025

We meet outside The Norris Museum on The Waits, St Ives at 8:45 with the first group leaving at 9:00 prompt.

We will be cycling to The Kings Arms in Polebrooke.

This is a new route and 'cafe' stop.  The Kings Arms are now open on a Saturday morning serving breakfast, cake, pastries, tea and coffee.  I have been in contact, the prices are competitive and we have a large table reserved for 10:30.  I know a few ladies are available and the consensus was for a slightly longer ride, please join us! You're welcome to bring a friend, new riders are always welcomed.  This is a social ride and no one will be dropped.

This may be the last official club ladies ride for a while as our evening rides restart on 1st May.

Thanks
Nat
Saturday Ladies - 140 - Polebrooke
￼ 

Sunday Club Run
Photo's from last week...
￼ 

13th April 2025

We meet outside The Norris Museum on The Waits, St Ives at 8:45 with the first group leaving at 9:00 prompt.

This week's club run will be heading to Saffron Walden and Fowlmere.

Groups A and B will ride the same route of 65 miles stopping at The Mixing Shed in Saffron Walden.

Group C will ride the shorter route of 46 miles stopping at Cafe Amigo in Fowlmere.*

*The pace of the C group is around 14-16mph giving opportunity to new riders to join us.  Please welcome new riders to this group.
Sunday Long Route - 08 - Saffron Walden
Sunday Short Route - 110 - Folwmere
Thursday Evening Ride
Facebook Event Page - Please show support to get these rides kick started 👊
1st May 2025

We meet outside The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen on The Boulevard, Alconbury Weald at 18:15 with the first group leaving at 18:30 prompt

EVENING RIDES RESTARTING ON 1ST MAY!!
	•	Routes will be here the week before each ride.
	•	Multiple paced groups.
	•	2 routes
	•	25 - 35 miles
	•	No stop ride
	•	The Watch Office Bar & Kitchen will be open until 11pm.
	•	Free Parking available outside The Club gym and near The Pavillion.
	•	New riders are welcomed so please bring a friend.  Membership is required after 2 club rides for insurance purposes.
Thursday Long Route - TBA
Thursday Short Route - TBA
Polite Reminders (for all club rides):
	•	Download the route.
	•	Remember your cafe bike locks.
	•	Look after your club mates.
	•	TT/Aero bars are not to be used.

Thank you.


Upcoming events in the SICC Calendar
For more information please click on the buttons below which will take you to our members only Facebook page.

We always hope for good numbers so that we can form suitable pace related groups.  Please hit 'GOING' to show support.  Thank you. 
Double Dutch, Ship of the Fens Audax
Peaks Away Day Club Run
Double Dutch, Ship of the Fens Audax

Saturday 19th April 2025

ENTER ONLINE HERE

Peaks Away Day Club Run

Sunday 5th May 2025

Book a place to stay!!  OR drive down for the day!

We will be meeting in Hathersage outside the swimming pool.
There's a car park at the swimming pool, a pay and display opposite and other parking options in the town. Please allow plenty of time to get parked and make your way to the meet point. There's also toilets and a newly refurbished cafe at the pool if you wanted a pre/post ride coffee. They're open 8am-5pm and they're expecting us.

Meet: Oddfellows Rd, Hathersage, Hope Valley S32 1DU
Time: 9.15am (to be arranged into groups)
Depart: 9.30am
Route: https://ridewithgps.com/routes/45989392
Pool Cafe: https://www.hathersageswimmingpool.co.uk/.../the-pool-cafe/

It would be a good idea to carry snacks and gels on the bike and maybe extra supplies in the car.

The Old Smithy Cafe in Monyash (mile 38) and Hassop Station Cafe (mile 44) are marked on the ridewithgps route. There's also plenty of places to stop in Bakewell. Please take a look before the ride. We can agree in our groups when we would like to stop.  The Pool Cafe will allow us to catch up at the end.

Please feel free to use this Facebook event page to arrange car shares.
Now's the time to start training!  ￼

Please hit 'GOING' on Facebook to show support. Thank you.

subject: Member News: Bike fit
body:
View in browser
￼
￼
￼
Thursday 10 April 2025
Membership number: 1519986
￼
Are you a micro- or macro-adjuster?
In the last two months we've asked (via the poll) how comfortable you are on the bike and whether you've had a bike fit.
 
Most riders fall into two camps: micro- or macro-adjusters. Those towards the micro end of the spectrum regularly experiment with set-up and can notice tiny adjustments such as moving your handlebars up or down. If you're more macro, you tend to leave things as they are and feel no need to adapt.
 
In this edition we've got a DIY guide to checking your set-up, plus news on our official sports nutrition partner and a tasty recipe to try out. 
DIY bike fit
￼
No matter how often you tinker with your bike set-up, it's useful to be familiar with a few fundamentals that will give you a solid, neutral position. Our guide gives step-by-step instructions to set things such as saddle height, handlebar reach and foot position (if you use cleats).
Open the guide
￼
￼


A powerhouse pairing
￼
We're excited to welcome Science in Sport (SiS) as our official sports nutrition partner for the next four years, covering the Los Angeles Olympic and Paralympic cycle.
 
SiS will support the health and wellbeing of over 140 athletes with their elite level nutrition products, while developing cutting-edge solutions to help riders optimise training, racing, and competitions.
Read more
￼
￼

Banana and oat muffins
￼
Food is fuel - and no matter how you take on your calories, it's important to give your body the nutrients and energy it needs to get you through every adventure.
 
These muffins are ideal as a breakfast option or tasty snack that is low in fat. You could even cut and wrap them up to take with you on the bike.
View the recipe
￼
￼

Your thoughts on our membership
￼
This survey is an opportunity for you to share thoughts on your membership and some of the communication we send to you. Your feedback - together with that of other members - will be useful in helping us to evolve our products to best suit your needs. 
 
You can expect it to take less than 10 minutes. Plus on completion there is a chance to enter a draw to win one of five Amazon vouchers (with the top prize being £100).
Get started
￼
￼

Spring into action with a course
￼
Whether you're eager to give back or already volunteering, now's the time to elevate your skills. We offer courses in ride leadership, coaching, and officiating to help you make an impact and pass on the joy of riding a bike.
Browse courses
See all dates and venues
￼
Could you be a tandem pilot?
￼
We are looking for experienced riders who would be interested in supporting visually impaired cyclists to reach their goals. If you are over 16 and might be interested in racing, we'd love to hear from you.
 
Never ridden a tandem before? Doesn't matter. Join our event on Sunday 20 April from 1-4pm at Derby Velodrome to give it a go. Click below to register and we'll be in touch with more information.
Register now
￼
￼

An opportunity to chair the Road Commission
￼
Are you passionate about helping to grow and shape the future of road cycling in Britain? We are recruiting for the position of Road Commission Chair, with the term lasting from one to three years.  Our cycle-sport commissions play a crucial role in British Cycling governance, providing expert support and advice. They typically meet twice a year virtually, and members will occasionally be expected to contribute to meetings or by email.
 
The deadline for applications is Sunday 13 April 2025. If you have any questions about the role, you can contact KatieSpray@britishcycling.org.uk.
Express interest
￼
￼


Racing round-up
￼
Last weekend was a busy one, with Lloyds National Series events taking place across several disciplines.
 
Check out our weekend round-up for reports from cross-country MTB at Cannock Chase, disability and para-cycling racing on the Darley Moor circuit in Derbyshire and Seagrave in Leicestershire, indoor BMX racing in Manchester, track racing at Lee Valley and the Witham Hall 2-Day road races in Lincolnshire.
See race reports & results
￼
￼

Events coming up
￼
There's no let-up over the next couple of weeks, with the following all coming up. Best of luck to everyone racing and involved in running these events.
 
Internationally there is British representation at Paris-Roubaix Femmes avec Zwift (12 April), Paris-Roubaix Juniors and Paris-Roubaix (13 April), plus the UCI MTB World Cup (Short track and cross-country) in Brazil (11-12 April) and Nals MTB Hrs Class Merlene Sudtirol Sunshine Race and UCI XCO Junior Series in Italy (12-13 April).
 
Closer to home is the Youth Circuit Series Round 1: Youth Tour of Scotland (12-13 April) - Lloyds National 4X Rounds 1-2: Chicksands Bike Park (12-14 April) - Lloyds National Road Series (Open: Round 1, Women: Round 2): East Cleveland Classic (13 April) - Lloyds National Downhill Series Round 1: Cwmcarn, South Wales (12-13 April) - Youth Circuit Round 1: Ride Flux GP, Pembrey (19-20 April).
￼
￼

The poll: Results
Just before the clocks changed we talked night riding and whether it's something you've tried. Here are the results!
￼

subject: Google Ironwood TPU 💻, Claude Max 🤖, Grok API 📚
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-10
AI-led merchandising is reshaping ecommerce (Sponsor) 

Leading retailers like Kiko Milano, Flaconi, and Maisons Du Monde are using AI to boost conversions, automate repetitive tasks, and gain full control of their merchandising—without relying on developers.

Want to know the secrets behind their success? Watch the Algolia webinar recording and learn how to turn your merchandising challenges into growth opportunities — from dynamic re-ranking to advanced personalization.
Watch the recording here → 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Google Ironwood TPU (7 minute read) 

With improvements on podsize, bandwidth, memory, and overall flops, the 7th generation of Google's TPUs is a step change improvement over any chip on the market. 
Claude's Max Plan (2 minute read) 

The new Max plan for Claude offers expanded usage with priority access to features and models, supporting users with demanding projects. It provides two levels: Expanded Usage for $100/month with 5x usage and Maximum Flexibility for $200/month with 20x usage. The plan is ideal for those who frequently work with substantial documents and complex data. 
Grok API (4 minute read) 

Grok 3 has an API for its models, including multiple reasoning modes. This link includes pricing, which is reasonable given the assumed size of the model itself. 
🧠
Research & Innovation
Omni SVG (9 minute read) 

By treating SVGs as a foreign language, a pretrained Qwen model can generate novel SVGs based on text and images. It is easily the state-of-the-art model. An open release is coming soon. 
OLMoTrace (17 minute read) 

There is a debate in the language modeling world about how much a model actually learns and how much it just memorizes. This feature, in the AI2 Playground, searches through billions of input documents, in real time, to figure out if the output of a model is just regurgitated or if it is novel. It includes the source of the utterance from multiple documents. 
AI Scientist v2 (PDF) 

Sakana AI had a research paper accepted to an ICLR workshop that was fully generated, executed, and written by a language model system. They improved their system by using VLMs, more general purpose search, and more. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Resources
Efficient MoE Inference (GitHub Repo) 

HybriMoE is a new framework for hybrid CPU-GPU inference on Mixture of Experts models that tackles instability and overhead with smarter scheduling and caching strategies. 
Dynamic Knowledge Circuits (GitHub Repo) 

This research explores how LLMs structurally internalize new knowledge by analyzing computational subgraphs. It reveals patterns in knowledge acquisition, optimization phases, and potential strategies for improving continual pre-training. 
Protein Backbone Generation (GitHub Repo) 

ReQFlow sets a new benchmark in protein backbone generation, delivering state-of-the-art results while being significantly faster than existing models. It is 37x faster than RFDiffusion and 62x faster than Genie2 for sequences of length 300. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Cogito v1 Preview: Introducing IDA as a path to general superintelligence (22 minute read) 

The Cognito team has released open-source LLMs ranging from 3B to 70B parameters, all of which outperform top open models of similar sizes, with the 70B model surpassing Llama 4 109B MoE. These models are trained using Iterated Distillation and Amplification (IDA), support both direct and reflective answering, and are available on Hugging Face, Ollama, Fireworks AI, and Together AI. 
Generative Media Upgrades in Vertex AI (1 minute read) 

Google Cloud has added enhanced generative tools to Vertex AI, including new capabilities in text-to-music (Lyria), video editing (Veo 2), voice customization (Chirp 3), and image inpainting (Imagen 3). 
Introducing Firebase Studio (5 minute read) 

Firebase Studio is launching as a cloud-based development environment for building, testing, and deploying AI applications. It combines tools like Project IDX, Genkit, and Gemini within a unified platform, offering rapid AI prototyping and a customizable coding workspace. Developers can leverage features such as natural language prototyping, instant device previews, and easy collaboration to accelerate app development. 
⚡
Quick Links
Last day to invest in the AI company that's 17x-ed its valuation in ~3 years (Sponsor) 

Adobe-backed RAD Intel has raised $37M by identifying content and creators that can drive results - and it's closing a round meant to fuel explosive growth. Last day at $0.55 per share. 
Hugging Face and Cloudflare Partnership (4 minute read) 

Developers can now easily build real-time voice and video apps using FastRTC, with enterprise-grade WebRTC infrastructure provided by Cloudflare and simple access via Hugging Face tokens. 
GitHub Copilot introduces new limits, charges for 'premium' AI models (2 minute read) 

GitHub Copilot users will face rate limits on AI models beyond the base GPT-4o model, with premium requests capped for paid tiers. 
Shopify CEO declares AI proficiency a baseline expectation for employees (2 minute read) 

Shopify CEO Tobi Lütke announced that reflexive AI usage is now a fundamental expectation for all employees. 
Love TLDR? Tell your friends and get rewards! 
Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag! 
https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here. 
Want to advertise in TLDR? 📰 
If your company is interested in reaching an audience of AI professionals and decision makers, you may want to advertise with us. 

Want to work at TLDR? 💼 
Apply here or send a friend's resume to jobs@tldr.tech and get $1k if we hire them! 

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian & Andrew Carr

subject: Deadly Live! & ASAP Natin ‘To are heading to Brum! Plus the latest news and more! ⭐

body:

￼

Get tickets from 10am today
Get Tickets
￼
ASAP NATIN 'TO IN ENGLAND
Get tickets from 9am today
Get Tickets
It's All Happening
Unmissable Shows Coming Soon!
A wildlife adventure for the whole family is coming to Birmingham as Steve Backshall hosts Deadly Live! in October half term. We're celebrating 30 years of the Philippines' longest-running musical variety program ASAP Natin 'To this August with a special live UK show!

This weekend, comedian Paul Smith is bringing the laughs to Utilita Arena Birmingham, whilst  Michael Ball and Alfie Boe play bp pulse LIVE on Friday night, followed by Sugababes  on Saturday night - secure the final tickets today!
￼
￼
JOHN LEGEND

John Legend's 'Get Lifted 20th Anniversary World Tour' heads to Utilita Arena Birmingham next month! The 13-time Grammy winner will perform his iconic debut album in full, including hits like 'Ordinary People', alongside other career-spanning songs. Get ready for a soulful night celebrating two decades of music.
                                                                                 
Get Tickets
Great events coming soon
￼
￼
CENTRAL CEE
One week to go until UK rap superstar Central Cee brings his world tour to you! Expect a night of groundbreaking hits and raw storytelling. Upgrade your night and book the Icon Experience
 with private entrance, access to an exclusive bar and lounge, and premium category seats!  
Get Tickets
￼
BILLY OCEAN
Get ready for the legendary Billy Ocean at bp pulse LIVE on Saturday 5 July! Celebrating the 40th anniversary of his album, ‘Suddenly,’ he'll be performing all his iconic hits and fan favorites. Don't miss this chance to experience the best of Billy Ocean live!
Get Tickets
￼
WICKED WIZARD OF OZ - A CIRQUE SPECTACULAR
Panto meets Cirque… Be amazed at Wicked Wizard of Oz – A Cirque Spectacular. With a cast of 40, outstanding aerial stunts and amazing special effects this international class arena show is the event of the year, not to be missed. Book early to secure the best seats!
Get Tickets
￼
BASTILLE
Bastille's 'Songs From The First 15 Years' UK arena tour hits Birmingham on 15 November, their only global shows in 2025! Featuring songs from across Bastille’s entire discography, don't miss this celebration of their incredible career!
Get Tickets
￼
￼
PAUL CHOWDHRY

Fresh off his huge show at the O2, multi-award winning comedian Paul Chowdhry brings his 'Englandia' tour to Birmingham on 31 May! Read all about Paul's new show and how comedy has changed over his career in this recent interview with  Chortle.

Get Tickets
￼
EVS GET VIP TREATMENT
If you own an EV, you get free access to the EVIP Lounge at bp pulse LIVE before the show. You can bring up to four friends, and you’ll skip the queue thanks to our ultra-fast private entrance. Spaces are limited so book your spot now.  
Book Now
Trending
￼

LYNYRD SKYNYRD
THE LUMINEERS
PAW PATROL LIVE!

subject: State of AI Index 2025 🤖, Waymo’s Privacy Concerns 🚗, Together AI DeepCoder 💻
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-09
[EXCLUSIVE, EARLY RELEASE] Test & Build Performant Agentic Applications (Sponsor) 

As LLM and agentic AI adoption grows, managing costs while maintaining performance is critical for enterprise success. An LLM Mesh enables cost-efficient and performant AI at scale.

In this technical guide from O'Reilly and Dataiku, discover how the LLM Mesh addresses key challenges around using agentic applications at scale, making it easier and safer for IT teams to harness the power of GenAI.
Read Chapter 4 in "The LLM Mesh: An Architecture for Building Agentic Applications in the Enterprise" here. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
State of AI Index 2025 (18 minute read) 

A great, high level, and comprehensive summary in 10 charts of the current state of AI across models, investment, and costs. 
Waymo's Privacy Concerns (5 minute read) 

Waymo's draft privacy policy reveals it may use in-cabin camera footage to train AI models and personalize ads, prompting fresh concerns over data use in autonomous vehicles. 
AI Startups in Healthcare (4 minute read) 

Google for Startups has launched its 2025 AI for Health cohort, supporting 25 startups across EMEA with mentorship, product support, and AI best practices. 
🧠
Research & Innovation
Benchmarking Open Source models for OCR (17 minute read) 

OCR is the task of recognizing text in images. It is challenging in the long tail and immensely valuable when done right. Many closed models such as the Gemini series are exceptional at this task. The new suite of Llama 4 models pushes the state of the art for open models forward substantially. 
DeepCoder (12 minute read) 

Together AI has trained a coding model that is competitive with closed source reasoning models. It has released data, code, training recipes, and showcased the model's strong long context ability. 
A New Batch Normalization (16 minute read) 

This paper proposes a new batch normalization method for SPD manifolds that uses a learnable Generalized Bures-Wasserstein metric. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Resources
Hi Dream Image Generation Model (GitHub Repo) 

A strong 17B parameter image generation model that uses 4 different text encoders for generation. It has strong overall performance and is permissively licensed. 
A Framework for Dynamic Multi-Product Pricing (18 minute read) 

This paper introduces a new framework for dynamic multi-product pricing that uses a censored multinomial logit model where buyers only consider products below their valuations. 
MotifBench for Protein Design (GitHub Repo) 

MotifBench is a benchmark designed for computational protein design that focuses on the motif-scaffolding problem by identifying protein structures that stabilize target motifs. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
How Students Use Claude in Education (12 minute read) 

Anthropic analyzed one million student conversations to understand AI usage in education. STEM students dominate usage, primarily leveraging Claude for content creation, technical problem-solving, and higher-order learning tasks. 
Arabic AI Benchmarks (9 minute read) 

Inception and MBZUAI have launched a unified Arabic AI evaluation platform featuring updated AraGen benchmarks and a new instruction-following leaderboard built on the Arabic IFEval benchmark. 
17K reasoning traces from R1 (Hugging Face Hub) 

A great set of reasoning traces from R1 that can be used as training data to distill a smaller reasoner or kick start the RL process. 
⚡
Quick Links
How Google Built the Pixel's Add Me Feature (5 minute read) 

The "Add Me" feature on Pixel devices leverages advanced image segmentation and AI for personalized video experiences. 
Microsoft's Copilot can now browse the web and perform actions for you (4 minute read) 

Microsoft's Copilot AI chatbot now performs tasks on popular websites, remembers user preferences, and analyzes real-time video. 
ElevenLabs releases official MCP server for AI-driven audio processing (3 minute read) 

ElevenLabs has launched an official Model Context Protocol server for Text-to-Speech and audio processing that is compatible with clients like Claude Desktop and OpenAI Agents.

Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian & Andrew Carr

subject: ROGER, staying safe online
body:
￼
Hi ROGER,
Scammers are constantly finding new ways to trick people and businesses into sharing personal or financial information. It’s important more than ever to stay vigilant and know how to spot the signs. We’re committed to keeping our customers safe by raising awareness of common scams – stay informed and protect yourself from fraud.
Discover more 
Latest scams
￼
Remote access
Scammers often trick individuals or businesses into granting them access to their devices often under a disguise of your bank, a utility company, or even the police – like an impersonation scam or HMRC scam. Fraudster will try to pressure you and insist there is a problem to fix, and they might even try to convince you that you could get into trouble with the police if you don’t agree.
	•	If you’re being rushed – stop, challenge, protect, and take five to stop fraud.
	•	Metro Bank, or any other reputable company, will never contact you asking for remote access to your device or accounts
Read more 
￼
HMRC fraud
Criminals impersonate His Majesty's Revenue and Customs (HMRC) staff to persuade you into giving them money or personal details – be cautious as they may take an aggressive approach and threaten legal action or police. These scams may come through as an email, text or phone call urging you to click a link, share personal details or make an urgent payment.
	•	HMRC will never ask for sensitive information or demand immediate payment via text or email.
	•	If you receive a suspicious message, don’t respond, report it instead.
Read more 
￼
Romance scam
Romance scams are on the rise, with fraudsters exploiting individuals to steal money. Fraudsters pretend to form a genuine relationship online, often through dating apps, social media or other messaging platforms. They spend weeks or even months building trust to find out personal information about you and tend to avoid video calls or in‑person meetings.
	•	Stop and think twice before sending money or gift cards to someone you haven’t met.
	•	If you think you’ve been scammed, call your bank straight away, or contact Action Fraud.
Read more 
In other fraud news:
Metro Bank is the first British bank to partner with award winning* AI scam checker Ask Silver to help protect all Metro Bank customers. The tool lives within your WhatsApp message and all you have to do is take a screenshot or a picture of the item you are suspicious about (i.e., message, email, leaflet, website). Simply upload it on your Metro Bank Scam Checker WhatsApp chat and within minutes you’ll receive a response. There are no sign–up fees nor hidden costs – it’s free to use**.
Find out more here
We have partnered with Victim Support to provide an independent support service available for our customers who have been a victim of fraud or a scam. Their support is free, confidential, and non‑judgemental, and can be a one‑off call or ongoing caseworker support. If you’d like to access the service or know more about it, please contact them on 0808 168 9285.
For more information, please visit our fraud and security page.
￼
Take Five offers impartial advice to help prevent email, phone and online fraud. The national campaign focuses on criminals who impersonate trusted organisations and gives you tools to help fight fraud.
Read more 
Think you’re a victim?
Do you think you’re the victim of a scam or fraud? Please call us immediately so we can help you through the next steps. Our phone lines are open 24/7:
	•	To report card fraud: 0345 0808 509
	•	To report non-card fraud: 0345 0808 500
	•	To report fraud from overseas: +4420 3402 8312
Stay safe from fraud,
The Metro Bank Team
￼
We’re here to help
￼
Find your local store
Follow us
￼
￼
￼
￼
*For more information about the award.

**Subject to WhatsApp and scam checker availability. The checker may miss things. You may need to consider acting without delay, such as contacting your bank. Metro Bank won't charge you for your call or data. However, you may be charged by your service provider.

We'll never send you an email, text or a website link asking you to enter your Internet Banking or card details. If you're suspicious of any emails you receive from Metro Bank, don't reply to them. Instead forward the email to phishing@metrobank.plc.uk or contact us immediately and we'll get our security team on the case.

Metro Bank PLC is registered in England and Wales, company number 6419578. Registered office: One Southampton Row, London, WC1B 5HA. We're authorised by the Prudential Regulation Authority and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority and Prudential Regulation Authority. 'Metrobank' and 'RateSetter' are registered trademarks of Metro Bank PLC.
 
￼

subject: FW: Text
body:
Tenants are usually responsible for keeping drains clear of everyday build-up — things like food waste, hair, or grease, which can sometimes lead to blockages over time.
Simple steps like using sink strainers or occasionally flushing through with hot water can help keep things flowing smoothly. If you've already tried this and the issue is still ongoing, it might be worth reaching out to a professional drainage service such as Dyno-Rod, who can help with more stubborn blockages. They offer nationwide support and can be contacted on 0333 242 2178 or via their website: www.dyno.com.
Of course, if you feel the issue may be due to something more serious within the property’s drainage system itself, please don’t hesitate to let us know — we’re always happy to take a look.
Thanks so much for your understanding, and do get in touch if you need anything further.
Warm regards,
 
 
From: claire@pembery.com <claire@pembery.com>  Sent: 08 April 2025 19:02 To: roger@pembery.com; 'Claire Pembery' <claire@pembery.com> Subject: Text
 


Thank you for your messages about slow draining plug holes. This is just a gentle reminder that as tenants, it is your responsibility to keep household drains clear from blockages caused by everyday use — such as debris, hair, or grease — as outlined in your tenancy agreement. Regular upkeep, like using sink strainers or periodically flushing drains with hot water, can really help prevent issues from developing.
If you’re experiencing a persistent blockage and standard remedies haven’t resolved it, you may need to contact a professional drainage company such as Dyno-Rod or a similar local service. They offer 24-hour emergency response across the UK and can be reached at 0333 242 2178 or through their website: www.dyno.com
If you suspect there may be a more serious underlying issue with the property’s drainage system itself, do let us know so we can look into it further.
Thanks very much for your understanding.
Warm regards,

subject: Text
body:
Thank you for your messages about slow draining plug holes. If you suspect there may be a more serious underlying issue with the property’s drainage system itself, do let us know so we can look into it further.

Warm regards,

subject: Hello Developer: April 2025
body:
APRIL 2025
Hello Developer
Revisit foundational sessions, join us to dive into SwiftUI, and meet an Apple Design Award winner that defies description. 
￼
SWIFT AND XCODE
Brush up on the essentials
With WWDC25 on the horizon, now is a great time to make sure your apps and games are in their best possible shape. Watch (or revisit) these foundational sessions — they’re a great way to be ready for what’s next.
A Swift tour￼
SwiftUI essentials￼
Xcode essentials￼

￼
MEET WITH APPLE
Swiftly elevate your app with SwiftUI
SwiftUI can level up your apps — and in this online activity, we’ll show you how. You’ll learn about SwiftUI’s declarative approach, discover best practices for layout, animations, and data flow, and find out how to power up your prototyping.
Find a SwiftUI activity near you￼

Online activities coming soon
Discover what’s new in watchOS 11 (April 21, from Shanghai)￼
Measure and improve acquisition with App Analytics (April 22, from Cupertino)￼
Request a one-on-one design and technology appointment (Multiple dates)￼

Browse all worldwide developer activities￼

￼
BEHIND THE DESIGN
The Rooms where it happened
Ask Jason Toff whether his Apple Design Award winner Rooms is an app or a game, and his answer is yes. “There’s no one-sentence description for Rooms,” he says, “and that can be a blessing.” No one else could have made this inventive app/game; here’s how Toff and team did it.
Read the story￼

￼
GROW YOUR BUSINESS
Level up your emails to customers
Make your emails to customers look better than ever with an Apple Business Connect feature that lets you display your logo and brand name in emails in the Mail app and iCloud Mail.
Learn more￼

NEWS SNIPPETS
Get your apps ready for deployment at work and school
The new ManagedApp framework gives apps used in managed environments an easy and secure way to receive configurations and sensitive information like passwords, identities, and certificates.
Find out more￼
Plus, check out these updates across Apple platforms:
Add synthesized speech to calls￼
Download and install additional Xcode components￼
Minimize download time with Background Assets￼
Adopt unified Maps URLs￼
Create an App Clip with Xcode￼

View all Apple Developer Documentation updates￼

Share your thoughts
We’d love to hear from you. If you have suggestions for our activities or stories, please let us know.
