subject: Be the first to see The Return
body:
￼
￼

THE RETURN
Live from The British Museum 
Preview + Q&A with Ralph Fiennes 
Wed 09 Apr  |  Get tickets 
★★★★
ScreenRant

 "Ralph Fiennes and Juliette Binoche burn through the screen" 
New York Times
A thrilling take on Homer's epic Ancient Greek tale The Odyssey, The Return sees Ralph Fiennes and Juliette Binoche reunite years on from The English Patient, turning in two spectacular performances at the heart of this gripping retelling. Before its release on 11 April, see it first with The Return: Live from The British Museum: a preview followed by a live-broadcast conversation with Academy Award nominee Ralph Fiennes and the British Museum's Tom Harrison and Vicky Donnellan.

Its story begins when Odysseus (Fiennes) washes up on the shores of Ithaca, haggard and unrecognisable after twenty years away. Scarred by his experience of the Trojan War, he is no longer a mighty warrior – but he must rediscover his strength to win back his kingdom, his beloved wife Penelope (Binoche), and all that he has lost.
Book now 

 
Hi Roger,
Membership No.

subject: Re: Notice period
body:
Hi Roger,

That sounds great, I will transfer the remainder now.
I think I should be done by about 2pm on the 6th, I will put the keys through the door.

The only damage I am currently aware of is a paint chip on the wall. I am happy to repair this myself, but don't want to use the wrong colour!
I will let you know if I come across anything else.

Many thanks,
Flora

On Mon, Mar 31, 2025, 10:59 Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> wrote:
Hi Flora,

We calculate it on a daily basis, so you divide 6 by the number of days in April (30) multiplied by your monthly rental.

I make this £150.

All we need to do is to on the 6th is for us to verify that there is no damage to the room. Do you know what sort of time you plan to leave? We don't need to be there necessarily when you actually move out: you can always post the keys through the front door.

It's helpful if you are aware of any damage in advance to let us know so we can discuss it so no misunderstanding. We don't charge for normal wear and tear so we usually release the full deposit back: it comes from the DPS a few days normally but they can take up to 10.

I hope that this is ok, let me know if you need any more info

Thanks 

Roger

On Mon, 31 Mar 2025, 10:29 Flora Littlewood, <floralittlewood@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi Roger,

Please would it be possible to know the calculation for up to the 6th of April?
Additionally, are there any actions I need to take for moving out? Leaving keys etc.

Many thanks,
Flora

On Tue, Mar 11, 2025, 06:39 Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> wrote:
Hi Flora,

Yes, that is fine. Up to and including the 6th April.

Thanks,

Roger

On Mon, 10 Mar 2025, 21:07 Flora Littlewood, <floralittlewood@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi Roger,

Looking at my calendar, would it be possible to extend up to the 6th of April? 

Many thanks,
Flora

On Thu, Mar 6, 2025, 18:01 Flora Littlewood <floralittlewood@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi Roger,

Brilliant! Thank you

Flora

On Thu, Mar 6, 2025, 11:15 Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> wrote:
Hi Flora,

Thanks for the th notice and best of luck for the future. There will be a few days to be up to and including the 4th April. I'll get the calculation to you.

I've also completed your reference positively.

Any Q's about the checkout let me know.

Regards,

Roger

On Wed, 5 Mar 2025, 20:55 Flora Littlewood, <floralittlewood@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi Roger and Claire,

I am planning to move out, so I am handing in my months notice. I am moving out in order to move in with my partner.

You may be contacted in regards to referencing for the next landlord, I hope this is okay with you.

Please let me know any further steps, that I need to take.

Many thanks,
Flora

subject: OpenAI Open Weight Model 🌐, Amazon Nova Act 🤖, Runway New Video Model 📹
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-04-01
Report: New data on navigating the AI adoption gap (Sponsor) 

Around 2 out of 3 executives say generative AI adoption has created tension — 42% say it's tearing their company apart. For many enterprises, conflicts, silos, and even sabotage are stalling progress. Yet there's reason for optimism: 77% of employees using AI are, or could become, an AI champion.

The Writer 2025 generative AI report explores the pain points and potential of AI in the enterprise. In partnership with Workplace Intelligence, we uncovered what leaders are struggling with, where there's opportunity, and what employees think about AI adoption efforts.
Read the full report for more insights and takeaways. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Amazon Nova Act (2 minute read) 

Amazon has introduced Nova Act, an AI model that allows agents to perform tasks within web browsers. A research preview SDK is available. The SDK helps developers create agents to execute complex, multi-step tasks by breaking them down into atomic commands and enabling browser manipulation for improved reliability. Nova Act aims to expand agent capabilities beyond simple tasks covered by APIs, enhancing business productivity and task automation. 
Runway's new video model (8 minute read) 

Runway has released its next-generation video model, which excels at prompt adherence and cinematic motion generation. 
OpenAI to release an Open Weight model (3 minute read) 

OpenAI is soliciting feedback for an open weight model that has reasoning. 
🧠
Research & Innovation
Video Generation Faithfulness Benchmark (12 minute read) 

A benchmark to determine how faithful video generation is to the prompt given. It also proposes methods to encourage model generation quality with respect to the user's input prompt. 
Unlearning Sensitive Content from LLMs (9 minute read) 

This paper proposes a model merging technique to selectively forget sensitive content in LLMs while preserving general knowledge. 
Optimal Stepsize in Diffusion Models (GitHub Repo) 

Optimal Stepsize for Diffusion Sampling (OSS) optimizes sampling in diffusion models by learning efficient stepsize schedules through dynamic programming. It achieves 10x speedup while preserving nearly full generation quality. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Resources
Invest in the AI boom with GPU-powered supercomputers (Sponsor) 

InfraHub Compute lets private investors own income-generating GPUs—an opportunity once exclusive to Big Tech. With a 4-year track record, 3-4% monthly revenue, and real-time earnings monitoring, it's a hands-off way to invest in AI infrastructure.

🔹Limited capacity. Learn how to get in early → 
SAMWISE video segmentation (GitHub Repo) 

This work gives SAM 2 open vocabulary segmentation and more precise semantic tracking over long videos. 
Orpheus (GitHub Repo) 

Orpheus is a text-to-speech system. It is easy to install and runs without a GPU, similar to Llama cpp. 
Video-R1 (GitHub Repo) 

Video-R1 introduces a rule-based RL approach for video reasoning using a temporal variant of GRPO and new datasets. It can be trained efficiently on 4 H20 or 5 A100 GPUs. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Fast Text-to-3D (7 minute read) 

Using Progressive Rendering Distillation to train 3D generators from text prompts without ground-truth meshes generates high-quality 3D meshes in 1.2 seconds and outperforms prior methods. 
TIDE for Underwater Scene Understanding (3 minute read) 

A text-to-image and dense annotation generation method for underwater scenes that enables high-quality synthetic datasets with consistent pixel-level labels. 
Earth AI's algorithms found critical minerals in places everyone else ignored (3 minute read) 

Earth AI has discovered promising mineral deposits in previously overlooked regions of Australia using AI-driven analysis. Unlike traditional methods, Earth AI's technology scans large areas rapidly to identify potential sites for minerals like copper and cobalt. This innovative approach highlights a shift in mining towards leveraging AI for more efficient exploration. 
⚡
Quick Links
Quora's Poe launches its most affordable subscription plan for $5/month (2 minute read) 

Quora's chatbot app, Poe, launched new subscription plans at $5/month for 10,000 daily points and $250/month for 12.5 million points. 
Nvidia's AI assistant is here to optimize your gaming PC (2 minute read) 

Nvidia's Project G-Assist is a real AI assistant for RTX GPU owners that optimizes game settings, measures frame rates, and controls accessory lighting. 
Nvidia is reportedly in talks to acquire Lepton AI (1 minute read) 

Nvidia is in talks to acquire server rental company Lepton AI for several hundred million dollars.

Claire
 
Dear Claire

Easter Revision 2025 Course dates: 
 
Week 1:             31st March – 4th April 2025
Week 2:             7th – 11th April 2025 
Week 3:             13th – 18th April 2025 (including Good Friday) 
 
On the first Monday of the course, Immy should report to our Brookside site (3-4 Brookside, Cambridge, CB2 1JE) at 08:30 for full day and half-day mornings. If their first session is not at 09:00, they should report to Brookside 30 minutes before their scheduled start time.
 
Immy will receive their timetable and further welcome instructions. On subsequent days, students will go directly to classroom for the start of the lesson.
 
IMPORTANT IT INFORMATION – PLEASE READ THE ATTACHED IT DOCUMENTS AND FOLLOW THE LINK BELOW:
Acceptable Use Policy for Easter Revision Students - Cambridge 2025 
Immy should bring paper, pens, an electronic device (laptop or tablet) if available, any other materials that would normally be used in their lessons (dictionary, calculator, maths set, etc), class notes and textbooks.
 
Full-day students are provided with a lunch, and everyone is provided with drinks/snacks at break times.
 
Please note that there is no student parking at MPW.
For students who are driving our advice is to use park and ride facilities
https://cambridgeparkandride.info
 
We look forward to seeing Immy at Easter. Please check the details carefully and should you have any queries in the meantime, please do not hesitate to contact us.
 
 
 
Kind Regards
 
Jill

subject: xAI acquires X 🤝, Perplexity addresses rumors 🗣️, ARC-AGI-2 & ARC Prize 2025 💰
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-03-31
👀 AI Power Users Are Leaving—And That's a Problem (Sponsor) 

New research from Betterworks shows that AI-savvy employees are 4x more likely to be job-hunting than their AI-resistant peers. While these power users are driving productivity and innovation, most companies are failing to create the AI-forward culture needed to keep them.

Even more surprising? Only 22% of employees use AI for strategic tasks—despite 93% of daily users saying its full potential remains untapped.
If you're responsible for AI adoption, workforce strategy, or retention, this is a must-read.  The 2025 State of Performance Enablement Report breaks down what's happening—and what HR and business leaders need to do next.
👉 Check it out 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
xAI acquires X in $80B all-stock deal (1 minute read) 

xAI has officially acquired X in an all-stock transaction that values the combined company at over $110 billion. 
Gemini 2.5: Our most intelligent AI model (1 minute read) 

Gemini 2.5 Pro, an advanced AI model, is leading LMArena benchmarks by a significant margin. It enhances performance and accuracy through improved reasoning capabilities. The model "thinks" by analyzing information and making informed decisions, building on Gemini 2.0 Flash Thinking advancements. 
Announcing ARC-AGI-2 and ARC Prize 2025 (12 minute read) 

The ARC Prize has launched ARC-AGI-2, a challenging benchmark aimed at advancing general AI systems. Current AIs score significantly lower compared to humans. The accompanying ARC Prize 2025 competition, hosted on Kaggle with a $1 million prize pool, aims to drive open-source innovation by rewarding efficiency and capability in solving ARC-AGI-2 tasks. 
🧠
Research & Innovation
Test-Time Visual In-Context Tuning (14 minute read) 

A novel method to adapt VICL models at test time using only the test sample, improving generalization under domain shifts across various visual tasks. 
Harmful Fine-Tuning Attacks (14 minute read) 

Researchers highlight vulnerabilities in existing defenses against harmful fine-tuning attacks and propose Panacea, an adaptive perturbation method that preserves model safety while maintaining fine-tuning performance. 
High-Fidelity Simultaneous Speech-To-Speech Translation (30 minute read) 

Kyutai has released its next amazing audio system which is a real time, audio to audio, translation system. It is built on a powerful multi stream transformer and boasts expressive voice ability. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Resources
Tools and Weapons: Microsoft's Story, Told by Its CEOs (Sponsor) 

Hosted by Microsoft Vice Chair and President Brad Smith, the Tools and Weapons podcast explores technology's global impact. In the latest episodes, Bill Gates, Steve Ballmer, and Satya Nadella reflect on Microsoft's 50-year journey—past, present, and what's next. Listen to the podcast here. 
Mobile-VideoGPT (GitHub Repo) 

A lightweight multimodal video model under 1B parameters that features dual visual encoders and token pruning for real-time inference on edge devices. 
Multimodal Adaptation Methods (GitHub Repo) 

A curated list of approaches for multimodal adaptation that covers traditional domain adaptation, test-time adaptation, and newer methods. 
Reasoning augmented generation code (GitHub Repo) 

Traditional Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems rely on a two-step process: first, semantic search retrieves documents based on surface-level similarities. Then, a language model generates answers from those documents. While this method works, it often misses deeper contextual insights and can pull in irrelevant information. ReAG – Reasoning Augmented Generation – offers a robust alternative by feeding raw documents directly to the language model, allowing it to assess and integrate the full context. This unified approach leads to more accurate, nuanced, and context-aware responses. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Awesome Vision-to-Music Generation (GitHub Repo) 

A curated and regularly updated list of methods, datasets, and demos for turning visual inputs into music. It covers both academic and industrial advances in V2M. 
OpenAI reshuffles Sam Altman's job once again (2 minute read) 

OpenAI has expanded Brad Lightcap's role to oversee operations and partnerships, allowing CEO Sam Altman to concentrate on research and product development. Mark Chen and Julia Villagra have been promoted within the company amid leadership restructuring following recent executive departures. OpenAI is also transitioning to a for-profit model, leading to a lawsuit from cofounder Elon Musk. 
Tim Cook says China's DeepSeek AI is 'excellent' during visit (3 minute read) 

Despite DeepSeek AI's security and privacy issues, Tim Cook praised it as "excellent" during his China visit. The AI, developed in China, rivals top global models at lower development costs but faces investigations in the US and Europe. Cook, who is attending the China Development Forum, often has to make diplomatic remarks about China due to Apple's business interests there. 
⚡
Quick Links
Google's AI-focused Education Tools AI (3 minute read) 

Google's new AI-focused educational tools include training for educators, student resources, and expanded access to Gemini for younger users. 
Microsoft announces security AI agents to help overwhelmed humans (2 minute read) 

Microsoft has introduced six AI-powered security agents for its Security Copilot to help teams handle phishing and data loss incidents more efficiently. 
Perplexity CEO Addresses Financial Rumors (2 minute read) 

Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas has denied financial trouble rumors, stating the company has healthy funding and no IPO plans before 2028.

subject: Leavers hoodies
body:
Dear Parent / Carer,
We emailed your young person on Friday with the information on how to order Hills Road leavers hoodies. Please see the key information below:
They are available in six colours and cost £24 each, with the option to add initials for an extra £3. 
Free shipping to college is included, and they will be ready for collection week commencing 28 April.
To order, visit: https://www.thestitchlab.co.uk/product/hills-road-sixth-form-leavers-hoody/
Orders close at 9am on Monday, 14 April to allow time for production and distribution before study leave start.
Many thanks,
The Student Council

subject: Your Week Ahead
body:
￼
￼
April is around the corner, but don't be fooled. we're serious about what's coming!
We’re kicking things off with a week full of fun, fresh rides, and tons of chances to share the love with Ride Ons. Take a peek at what’s coming up!
EXPLORE EVENTS
￼
Time To Catch Up
￼
 
MARCH 31 - APRIL 7
Miss a stage or two of The Zwift Big Spin? Still trying for the grand prize, the BMX Bandit bike? No sweat!
There’s still one week left to complete any of the four stages and spin the prize wheel and the end. Register today, and don’t forget to RIDE! SPIN! WIN!
SIGN UP
￼
Lucy Charles: Spicy Spikes
￼
 
APRIL 2
Spicy Spikes all about building strength at, and around, your threshold—a key area of fitness that helped Lucy Charles-Barclay win the 2023 Ironman World Championships.
This one is one of Lucy’s favorites, an efficient interval session that goes hard but it is good to do on a regular basis to keep up your FTP!
SIGN UP
￼
After Party: Race to the Finish
Five stages. Fast packs. A final hilltop test. With three brand-new routes, this month’s ZRacing is all about strategy and that last explosive push.
Be among the first to take them on—and see how you stack up in our new General Classification (GC) results page!
SIGN UP
￼
Your Weekly Sunday Ride
￼
 
MARCH 30
Running now through the end of the year, Shimano Super Cycling Sunday is your place to ride, chat, and talk about all things cycling with one of the most exciting new cycling communities.
Join us every Sunday on some of Zwift’s newest and most exciting routes! Plus, the first ride of each month is guest-led—next up on April 6th is Shimano Bike’s Marketing Director, David Greenfield.

subject: Rhino Racing WTRL TTT sign-up success.
body:
Can't see this message? View in a browser
 
￼

Thanks for registering.

If you are new to Team Time Trials then have a read of the below - it will give you all the info needed to get lined up in the pen with your fellow team mates.
​
Please remember that everyone is equally important to the team, the keyword is Team!
  
There are 2 forms used for TTT’s, you have obviously found the first as you made your way here...⁠ 
 The sign-up form (that you've just filled in) is available each week on Friday and is where you can select your availability for the following Thursday - timezone availability, including a comments section if you want to request an easy ride, harder ride etc.
 The team-sheet is usually finalised on a Wednesday afternoon / evening and confirmed via a message in ⁠ttt-chat on the Rhino Racing Discord server (all riders will get tagged - as long as we have your discord tag).
The team sheet confirms which team you are on and who you ride with.
TEAM SHEET
￼
You need to click the RacePass link for your team, and you need to have a registered WTRL account:
WTRL REGISTRATION
￼
Most teams have a chat beforehand if needed, in the ⁠ttt-chat channel. (Some regular competitive teams have dedicated channels to discuss tactics beforehand) but if you have any questions please ask or DM any Rhino you have spoken with and they will help you or point you in the right direction.
​
Make sure you click the RacePass in the team sheet ASAP and are registered for the event. You have to sign up to the RacePass before that TimeZone begins, but so long as you have then you don’t actually have to join the event Race Pen in Zwift up until a few minutes before your official start time. However, it's always recommended to be in the Race Pen and in the Team Voice Channel 5-10 minutes before your start time.
​
You can confirm you’ve signed up correctly using the RacePass, as you should then see the TTT event on the home screen of your Zwift Companion App listed under Events.
Change kit to the Rhino jersey (if you have it - if you are new it might take a week for Gordon to get it unlocked for you).
 Make sure you select a TT bike from your garage!! If you want to look at the fastest bike setup, try Zwifter Bikes and use the settings to adjust for the course, your Zwift level, your Drops level and FTP and weight etc.
ZWIFTER BIKES
￼
Add (Rhino) after your Zwift name (this can be done in the Companion App settings).
At least 10 minutes before your event start time, please log on to Zwift (in case of software updates) and join the Discord Team Voice Channel of the team name you are riding with (Albino, Thundering, Rapids, Nuclear etc) meet your teammates, discuss a plan, make sure everyone is ready etc.
​
Please check your discord if you have not used it before (turn on noise suppression in settings to remove trainer/fan noise).
​
The aim is to stay with the group, always in the draft. If you are stronger rider do more work on the front. If weak just try hang on in the draft. Sometimes a race is just too fast and riders need to be dropped (especially for experienced teams going for the win).
​
For teams of 5 or more, the team time is taken from 4th rider to cross the line. For teams of 3 or 4, it is from the 3rd rider crossing the line.
​
Don't feel bad if you get dropped just continue the race at your own pace but please DON'T INTERFERE OR TRY DRAFTING OTHER TEAMS. If another team passes you then it is respectful to ease your power for 10-20s until they are passed and a few seconds clear of you.
​
If you finding that you are not enjoying the TTTs and maybe getting put in a team that drops you each week then please feel free to comment on sign up form – you can ask for an easier ride, a harder ride – we are always flexible to try place riders in a team that suits their needs.
 Communication is key, don’t be afraid to talk to your team even if you are new and learning - if you see the group stretching try call it out when you see gaps of 3-4 meters before it gets to 5+ and out the draft. If you can’t last any longer then tell them you are dropping so that they know to carry on etc.
​
We are all racing to have fun and there are some very experienced TTT riders active in ⁠ttt-chat who are happy to answer any and all questions.
​
Support your teammates and have fun. Remember it’s a Team Time Trial!  
 
There are lots of videos in streaming links on the Rhino Racing Discord server to see how a TTT is done if you would like to have a look beforehand.
​
Well done on getting to the end of this and remember... Have fun... the type 2 kind!

Unbox Easter in style with our special offer on gift sets


This weekend we have a special online offer on all of our Easter gift sets. You can save:

£5 off all Gift Bags (now £30)
£10 off all Hamper Bags (now £55)
£15 off our Giant Hamper Box (now £95)

Each set includes a host of Easter treats to spoil your loved ones with, including Easter eggs, Bunnies, Bars, Shapes and much more!

This offer ends at midnight on Monday 31st March.

Shop Easter Gift Sets 
 
￼

A fresh look and taste for our Minty Love chocolate slabs


Our famous Minty Love slabs are back with a new recipe.

To make them, we infuse our Gold Great Taste award-winning 72% Ecuador origin dark chocolate with mint oil and stud it with dark chocolate chips.

 The original version of these crowdpleasers won a Gold Great Taste award back in 2014, and we think this new version is even better!

Try it now online or in store at any of our Chocolate Houses.

Shop Mint Choc Chip Slabs 
 
￼

Egg-stra, egg-stra!


We've had another exciting week of Easter reviews...

We loved this quote about our Dino egg from Stylist... "Why don't dinosaurs lay eggs? Because they're all egg-stinct... Ahem. Chococo's ethical 47% Colombia-origin milk chocolate egg is a winner for all ages"!

Meanwhile, our Blonde chocolate Bunny also featured in Red Magazine's 'Best Luxury Easter eggs and chocolate treats for 2025', described as "containing only ethically-made chocolate and boasting toasty, caramelised biscuit flavours, it's a grown-up treat any chocolate lover will enjoy", and our Earth egg was recommended for "those who don't want dairy but crave a creamy taste" in Hampshire Life and was #1 in Green Parent's recommendations of vegan Easter eggs!

Shop Easter eggs 
 
￼

How did you score in our chocolate quiz?


Last weekend we put your cocoa wits to the test with a chocolate quiz. 

Within just 48 hours, well over 400 of you had a try so we thought we'd let you know some results (no spoilers!) The average score was 8/15, with the toughest questions being #7, #13 and #14.

36 people of you took top marks - a very well done to you all! If you haven't had a go yet, you can try it here and keep an eye out as we have more quizzes planned before Easter! 

Try our quiz

subject: Anthropic LLM Traces 🤖, OpenAI Cybersecurity Grant 💰, Claude Usage Trends 📃
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-03-28
How AI is changing search, from back-end to front (Sponsor) 

The early days of search were heavily keyword-based. Later, ML and NLP enabled search engines to interpret the semantics behind queries, allowing for more accurate and contextually relevant results.

Today search is changing again with the rise of AI and especially genAI — and companies that sleep on these changes risk falling behind.
This white paper by Algolia explores how AI has transformed both the front-end and back-end landscapes of search technology, including:
	•	The evolution of search
	•	The current state of AI-driven solutions
	•	Challenges and opportunities in this space
	•	The specific impact of AI on front-end and back-end systems
Download the white paper → 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Anthropic Researchers Trace the Thoughts of LLMs (16 minute read) 

Two new studies from Anthropic trace internal pathways in Claude models, uncovering planning behaviors, shared conceptual spaces across languages, and instances of fabricated reasoning. 
OpenAI Expands Cybersecurity Grant Program (6 minute read) 

OpenAI has outlined its ongoing efforts to support AI-native cybersecurity research. They now include microgrants and expanded areas like model privacy and agentic security. 
Claude 3.7 Sonnet Usage Trends in Labor (8 minute read) 

Anthropic's latest report revealed how Claude 3.7 Sonnet is used across coding, education, and healthcare tasks. It offers new insights into how AI augments or automates different occupations. 
🧠
Research & Innovation
Diffusion-Based Counterfactuals (28 minute read) 

This paper introduces two methods that use diffusion models to generate counterfactual explanations in image regression tasks, highlighting trade-offs in sparsity and quality between pixel and latent space approaches. 
Mixture-of-Mamba (16 minute read) 

Mixture-of-Mamba introduces modality-aware sparsity to state-space models (SSMs), enabling efficient multi-modal pretraining. It achieves similar performance to Transformers with significantly lower computational cost across text, image, and speech modalities. 
Open Problems in Mechanistic Interpretability (24 minute read) 

A great paper that talks through some of the challenges and unsolved problems facing the field when trying to understand how knowledge and skills are represented internally in a language model. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Resources
Bria AI, The Belle of the Ball for Visual Generative AI @NVIDIA GTC 2025! (Sponsor) 

Over 20K attendees roamed downtown San Jose for 2025 GTC last week; AI developers learned from Bria.ai How to build predictable, controllable, on-brand visual content at scale while respecting artists' rights.

See a few of the key topics they covered:
	•	The Future of a Sustainable Economy Around Visual Generative AI is Built on Licensed Data, Not Scraped (a.k.a stolen) Data.
	•	Visual AI Cookbooks (GitHub projects) For Visual Generative AI Model Customization
	•	Explore All Bria APIs for Content Creation
Get your free API token to play with Bria today, with 1000 credits on your new account. 
Measuring Internal Bias in Vision Models (GitHub Repo) 

A new metric that uses attention maps to quantify internal bias in vision models. It is capable of identifying confounding features and going beyond group-based accuracy disparities. 
Guidance-Free Training for Image Models (14 minute read) 

Guidance-Free Training (GFT) removes the need for Classifier-Free Guidance (CFG) in visual generative models, reducing computational cost without sacrificing performance. Unlike distillation-based approaches, GFT trains from scratch and requires minimal modifications to existing codebases. 
A Universal Interatomic Potential (GitHub Repo) 

PET-MAD is a universal interatomic potential model trained on the MAD dataset that is capable of predicting energies and forces for complex materials modeling across the periodic table. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Flux Inpainting (Hugging Face Hub) 

Inpainting support for the new powerful diffusion model Flux. 
Hugging Face Custom Reranker Training (22 minute read) 

This post walks through how to fine-tune high-performing reranker models using Sentence Transformers 4.0, outperforming many large public rerankers with smaller, specialized versions. 
AI prediction model is a major breakthrough in weather forecasting (5 minute read) 

Aardvark Weather, developed by the University of Cambridge, offers rapid AI-driven weather forecasting on desktop computers while needing less data and computing power than traditional models. It surpasses conventional systems like the U.S. GFS in accuracy across multiple metrics and provides customizable, location-specific predictions. The system's accessibility democratizes forecasting, making it viable even in regions with limited infrastructure. 
⚡
Quick Links
Running RAG Locally with DeepSeek, Elasticsearch, Ollama, and Kibana (Sponsor) 

Follow this step-by-step tutorial to install Ollama locally, run it in a container, connect to Kibana, and run local RAG and inference with DeepSeek R1. Read the blog 
AWS generative AI exec leaves to launch startup (2 minute read) 

Raj Aggarwal is leaving AWS, where he served as GM of generative AI, to start a new company. 
Browser Use, the tool making it easier for AI 'agents' to navigate websites, raises $17M (3 minute read) 

Browser Use, a Y Combinator startup, enhances AI agent navigation on websites by converting site elements into a text-like format. 
XR Training with Llama-Powered Simulations (7 minute read) 

Cornerstone is transforming enterprise training with XR and the Llama 3.1 model, enabling the fast creation of personalized simulations that feature intelligent virtual mentors and real-time multilingual capabilities.

Track your referrals here.

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian & Andrew Carr

subject: Cian Ducrot, John Simpson, Baga Chipz plus many more!
body:
Discover our on sale shows
 
Is this email not displaying correctly? View it in your browser.
￼
￼
BOX OFFICE: Email: tickets@cambridge.gov.uk | Phone: 01223 357851 | Mon - Fri, 10am - 5pm
￼
On Sale This Week
￼
Cian Ducrot
￼
14 September 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale: 28 March 2025, 10 AM
￼
Irish singer-songwriter, producer, and multi-instrumentalist Cian Ducrot has captivated audiences worldwide with his heartfelt storytelling and powerful melodies. Rising to fame with his 2023 #1 debut album Victory, Cian quickly established himself as one of the most exciting new voices in pop music. He is set to release his second album, Little Dreaming, this summer, showcasing his evolution as an artist with a blend of ‘70s and ‘80s influences and raw, emotional songwriting.

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
John Simpson: The Leaders and Lunatics Tour
￼
16 November 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
Pre-sale for Members: now
On general sale: 28.03.2025, 10 AM
￼
After a sell-out 2024 tour, John returns with a bold look at leadership — why some inspire while others become tyrants. With nearly 60 years of access to world leaders, he’ll share insights on figures from Putin to Mandela, revealing the quirks and traits that shaped history.
 
In a world of war, famine, and economic crisis, how do leaders influence our biggest challenges? In the second half, it’s your turn to ask questions.

￼
BOOK HERE
￼
Baga Chipz - 'Chip Off The Old Block' Tour
￼
30 August 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
Pre-sale for Members: now

On general sale: 28.03.2025, 10 AM
￼
After smash-hit tours ‘Material Girl’ and ‘Much Betta!’, Baga returns this year with live vocals, outrageous comedy, and a heartfelt nod to her dear friend, The Vivienne.
 
Expect big ballads, disco classics, and plenty of X-rated laughs — not one for the faint-hearted! Sequins, wigs, wild stories, and an audience Q&A… it’s the ultimate knees-up for all the huns.

￼
BOOK HERE

Saturday 17 May 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange

Get ready for a night of non-stop laughs as the Anglia Comedy Allstars return to Cambridge Corn Exchange this May! With a show-stopping line-up featuring Joel Dommett, Gary Delaney, Larry Dean & Amy Gledhill!

The Dinosaur That Pooped

27 May 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange
On general sale now

Adapted from the number 1 best-selling books by Tom Fletcher and Dougie Poynter, the whole family will have a poopy good time enjoying a brand, new story for the stage.
 
When Danny and Dino’s favourite rock band are playing their last ever concert, they go on a quest to get the last two tickets. But with a villainous band manager lurking, nothing goes to plan. Will the band perform? Will Danny rock out? Or will Dino’s rumbling tummy save the day?

The Robert Cray Band

14 June 2025 | Cambridge Corn Exchange

Legendary guitarist and singer-songwriter Robert Cray returns to the UK in 2025!
 
A five-time Grammy winner, Cray’s soulful guitar work has shaped blues for over 40 years. Known for collaborations with Eric Clapton, Stevie Ray Vaughan, and John Lee Hooker, his music remains a powerful force in Blues & Soul.

subject: News & Club Runs
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 

Dear Roger,

Membership Renewal
Don't forget to purchase your 2025 membership!  This could be the last email from us if you haven't paid.  Quick link button above.

Thank you. 

Upcoming events in the SICC Calendar
For more information please click on the buttons below which will take you to our members only Facebook page.

We always hope for good numbers so that we can form suitable pace related groups.  Please hit 'GOING' to show support.  Thank you. 
Ladies Social Ride
Double Dutch, Ship of the Fens Audax
Peaks Away Day Club Run
Ladies Road Ride

Saturday 12th April 2025

A few ladies are available, please join us!  You're welcome to bring a friend, new riders are always welcomed.  Full details will be in the event page soon and included in the club email sent out on 10th April.

We will meet outside The Norris Museum on The Waits, St Ives at 8:45 with the first group leaving at 9:00 prompt.

The route will be around 30-40 miles and will include a cafe stop.  This is a social ride, no one will be dropped.

This may be the last official club ladies ride for a while as our evening rides restart on 1st May.

Thanks
Nat
Double Dutch, Ship of the Fens Audax

Saturday 19th April 2025

ENTER ONLINE HERE

Peaks Away Day Club Run

Sunday 5th May 2025

Book a place to stay!!  OR drive down for the day!

We will be meeting in Hathersage outside the swimming pool.
There's a car park at the swimming pool, a pay and display opposite and other parking options in the town. Please allow plenty of time to get parked and make your way to the meet point. There's also toilets and a newly refurbished cafe at the pool if you wanted a pre/post ride coffee. They're open 8am-5pm and they're expecting us.

Meet: Oddfellows Rd, Hathersage, Hope Valley S32 1DU
Time: 9.15am (to be arranged into groups)
Depart: 9.30am
Route: https://ridewithgps.com/routes/45989392
Pool Cafe: https://www.hathersageswimmingpool.co.uk/.../the-pool-cafe/

It would be a good idea to carry snacks and gels on the bike and maybe extra supplies in the car.

The Old Smithy Cafe in Monyash (mile 38) and Hassop Station Cafe (mile 44) are marked on the ridewithgps route. There's also plenty of places to stop in Bakewell. Please take a look before the ride. We can agree in our groups when we would like to stop.  The Pool Cafe will allow us to catch up at the end.

Please feel free to use this Facebook event page to arrange car shares.
Now's the time to start training!  ￼

Please hit 'GOING' on Facebook to show support. Thank you. 
￼ 

Sunday Club Run
30th March 2025

We meet outside The Norris Museum on The Waits, St Ives at 8:45 with the first group leaving at 9:00 prompt.

This week's club run will be heading to Stanwick and Upton.

Groups A and B will ride the same route of 60 miles stopping at Cafe Solar in Stanwick Lakes.

Group C will ride the shorter route of 38 miles stopping at Holly Lodge Cafe in Upton.*

It is Mother's Day on Sunday so most cafes contacted have said they will be very busy.  Stanwick Lakes have said they have an event on at 12.30 but are happy for us to visit and will be prepared.  We should be gone by the time their event starts and we'll have a beautiful tailwind all the way back to St Ives.

*The pace of the C group is around 14-16mph giving opportunity for new riders to join us.  We have a number of members wishing to ride at this pace over the winter, please join them and ask to be added to their messenger group so you can keep in contact.  Leaders have the opportunity to pick the route.
Sunday Long Route - 36 - Stanwick
Sunday Short Route - 116 - Upton
Photo's from last week...
￼ 
Polite Reminders:
	•	Download the route.
	•	Remember your cafe bike locks.
	•	Look after your club mates.
	•	TT/Aero bars are not to be used.

Thank you.


2025
Dates for your Calendar
 
	•	Social Evening (off the bike) - Tuesday 25th February
	•	International Women's Day Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 8th March
	•	Ladies Social Ride - Saturday 12th April
	•	Double Dutch Audax - Saturday 19th April
	•	Easter Club Run - Sunday 20th April
	•	Evening Social Rides (Alconbury) Start - Thursday 1st May
	•	Peaks Away Day Club Run - Sunday 4th May (stay for the weekend, it's a Bank Holiday!)
	•	Club Summer BBQ Club Run - Sunday 29th June
	•	Summer Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 19th July
	•	Bank Holiday Weekend Longer Club Run - Sunday 24th August (ideas welcome!)
	•	Last Evening Social Ride (Alconbury) - Thursday 28th August
	•	Cafe Ventoux Away Day Club Run - Sunday 7th September
	•	Remembrance Club Run - Sunday 9th Novemeber
	•	Christmas Dress Up Club Run - Sunday 21st December
	•	Festive 500 - Wednesday 24th - 31st December
	•	Winter Blue Egg Ride - Saturday 27th December
	•	Short New Years Eve Ride - Wednesday 31st December
 
	•	SICC hosts Eastern League CX - TBC
	•	Christmas Meal - TBC
	•	AGM & Awards Presentation - TBC

 
Club 10 mile Time trials
May - September
(dependent on volunteers and an Events Officer being appointed to the committee ASAP)

￼ 
This is Marta Gamez, a researcher at Anglia Ruskin University (Cambridge) in sport and nutritional science.

We are currently doing a series of free online talks that cover aspects of scientific evidence in areas of nutrition and training for cyclists and would like to kindly ask you to circulate this among your club as members may find this of interest.

The first event is on the 3rd of April 6-7pm. There is more info on the link to the event. Please feel free to share it! 

We are confirming speakers/dates of next talks, but they will all become available on our Eventbrite page.

If you can share the link /information above it would be great.
Any questions, please let me know.
 
Thank you very much and have a great weekend!
Marta M. Gamez-Fernandez
Research Fellow |Exercise and Nutritional Science
Cambridge Centre of Sport and Exercise Science
Anglia Ruskin University | Cambridge | UK

Thought of the week

subject: Member News: People power
body:
View in browser
￼
￼
￼
Thursday 27 March 2025
Membership number: 1519986
￼
We're a community
As a British Cycling member you're in good company. Beyond your club mates, fellow commuters or those you line up with at an event, our membership covers riders across the country, all using their bikes in different ways.
 
This week is all about people power. No matter what your relationship with the bike is, be proud that by pedalling, supporting or volunteering you are helping to make cycling look and feel accessible to all.


Meet Ryan
￼ 
￼
￼

￼
Come on a ride with fellow member, Ryan, as he tells us about his journey into cycling, how the bike has grown into a lifelong passion and why rides like this are an important part of his life.
Watch on YouTube
￼
￼

Riding through Ramadan 
￼
Waheed is a mountain biker with 20 years under his tyres, a qualified mountain bike leader and member of The Colour Collective. As a Muslim he celebrates Ramadan, and will mark the end of the holy month this weekend by riding the Helvellyn peak in the Lake District.
 
“Cycling through Ramadan brings me closer to Allah. It reminds me to appreciate what I have: a healthy body, a clear mind, and this amazing world around us.” 
Hear more from Waheed
￼
￼

Improving social justice in active travel 
￼
We believe that everyone should have the opportunity to ride a bike, but barriers still exist that prevent many people - and particularly disabled people, those from minoritised ethnic backgrounds, women and children - from doing so. This is unjust and needs to change.
 
That’s why we were in Parliament last night launching a report together with our partner Leigh Day, calling for social justice and outlining what policymakers need to do to address this urgent and important matter.
 
A big thank you to those who responded to the call for evidence back in December. Read the report below, and please share with your local MP.

Learn more & read the report
￼
￼

Be more Betty
￼ 
￼
￼

￼
We've another video for you, and this time it features Betty from Didsbury in Manchester, who shares her walk to school with Chris Boardman, National Active Travel Commissioner.  Betty wrote a letter to the Prime Minister requesting more safe spaces for walking, wheeling and cycling. Plus the rest of her class share a wish to walk, scoot or ride to and from school.
View on YouTube
￼
￼

Your new monthly competition
￼
Launching today is our next monthly competition: to win a very swish coffee machine and £100 in coffee credit from Pact Coffee.
 
Check out full details (including T&Cs) on our member giveaway page, or you can head straight to your Rewards Hub.

Go via your dashboard
￼
￼

Pothole progress
￼
Cast your mind back to January when 94% of you told us that you encounter potholes regularly or more when riding. There has been good news this week, with councils now under pressure to prove that they are taking action on road defects like these - or they will lose important investment.
 
As part of a Pothole Partnership with The AA, JCB and National Motorcyclists Council, we'll be continuing to ensure that action is taken to protect riders, racers - and all road users.
Read the BBC News article
￼
￼


A membership loyalty scheme
￼
We recently announced ambitious plans for change together with Elixirr, our Official Digital Transformation Partner. As part of this, we're exploring a loyalty scheme for members which would mean you can earn points to redeem, simply through riding and supporting cycling.
 
We need your help to develop this offer though, so would really appreciate a few minutes of your time to complete our survey.
Start the survey
￼
￼

Lloyds National Road Championships head to Wales
￼
Together with the Welsh Government, we have confirmed a landmark agreement to host the next three Lloyds National Road Championships (2025-2027). This forms part of Wales’ commitment to hosting world-class cycling in the coming years, following on from last week's announcement that the Tour de France and Tour de France Femmes avec Zwift will both take place in the UK in 2027.
 
The first of the hosts will be Ceredigion this year, which will stage three days of racing with the time-trial on Thursday 26 June, the circuit race on Friday 27 June, and the road race concluding the action on Sunday 29 June.
Read more
￼
￼


Racing round-up
￼
The Lloyds National Road Series (women and junior open) kicked off in style in Melton Mowbray on Sunday 23 March, with Lucy Harris (Smurfit Westrock Cycling Team) and Harry Hudson (Harrogate Nova) taking the women’s and junior open victories respectively. You can read the race reports on our website.
￼
￼

Events coming up
￼
You'll be hearing the phrase 'Round one' a lot over the next couple of weeks, with the following series all rolling into action or continuing:
 
U23 Open National Road Series Round 1: PB Performance Espoirs Road Race (30 March) - Lloyds BMX National Series Rounds 1&2: Manchester Indoor Arena (5-6 April) - Lloyds National Cross-Country MTB Series Round 1: Cannock Chase (5-6 April) - Lloyds National Disability and Para-cycling Road Series Round 1: Darley Moor Sports Centre (5-6 April) - Junior Open and Junior Women National Road Series Round 2: Witham Hall 2-Day (5-6 April) - National Sprint Futures Series R1: Lee Valley (6 April).
 
If you're not racing, do get along to support if you can!
￼
￼

The poll: Results
Last time around we focused on saddles, and it's great to see that so many people are sitting comfortably! Still some set-up gremlins to iron out though - and we'll have some more information coming on that soon.
￼

This week
With the clocks about to change, we want to know whether you've been doing any night riding. Or if it's something you'd like to try as dusk turns to dark.
 
Night rides are something I...
do regularly
do occasionally
want to try

subject: Amazon Personalized Shopping 🛍️, Grok AI on Telegram 📱, OpenAI & Anthropic MCP 💻
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR 

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-03-27
Apple just traded your privacy for $20 Billion… (Sponsor) 

In a secret deal to keep Google as the primary search engine on iPhones, Apple continues to fuel Google's ad revenue engine which made an eye-popping +$250B in 2024.

Mode Mobile wants smartphone users to get their piece of that money.
They're splitting the data profits with their users by turning smartphones into an income-generating asset. With over $325M earned by over 45M users they were ranked #1 fastest-growing software company by Deloitte in 2023.
And they're gearing up for a potential IPO on the Nasdaq (ticker: $MODE).
Invest in Mode's pre-IPO offering and earn your stake in this $1T industry. 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
Amazon Launches Interests for Personalized Shopping (2 minute read) 

Amazon has introduced an AI-powered feature that tailors product discovery based on user-defined prompts that automatically surfaces relevant items and deals. 
OpenAI adopts rival Anthropic's standard for connecting AI models to data (2 minute read) 

OpenAI will support Anthropic's Model Context Protocol (MCP) across its products, enhancing AI models' data-driven capabilities. MCP, an open-source standard, allows AI models to connect with various data sources like business tools and software. Companies like Block, Replit, and Sourcegraph have adopted MCP. OpenAI plans to share more about its integration soon. 
Elon Musk's Grok AI lands on Telegram, gaining access to over 1 billion users: A new era for search and chat (4 minute read) 

Elon Musk's AI chatbot, Grok, is now available on Telegram, offering its sarcastic assistant to over 1 billion users. Bundled with Telegram Premium, Grok expands beyond X, enhancing the platform with real-time reasoning and coding capabilities. While it raises privacy concerns, this move positions Telegram in the competitive AI landscape alongside giants like ChatGPT and Google's Gemini. 
🧠
Research & Innovation
Qwen Omni Model (Hugging Face Hub) 

Qwen has released a model that can natively understand many different modalities while responding in either text or speech. 
A Modular RAG Framework (5 minute read) 

RGL streamlines the RAG pipeline for graph-structured data with modular components and optimized performance. It offers up to 143x speedup over traditional methods. 
Detecting Subtle Deepfake Manipulations (11 minute read) 

Leveraging CLIP's visual encoder and parameter-efficient tuning, this method robustly detects partial deepfake forgeries across diverse datasets with minimal model changes. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Resources
How to speed up AI delivery in healthcare—reliably (Sponsor) 

Building healthcare AI solutions? You'll want to read this case study. This healthcare company used Vellum's CI/CD tools to reliably ship AI updates 40% faster and earn clinician trust. Get it here. 
Frame AutoRegressive Video Modeling (4 minute read) 

FAR improves video generation by modeling temporal dependencies between frames and introduces FlexRoPE to better handle long-range contexts using temporal decay. 
Enhanced Multimodal Vision Foundation Models (2 minute read) 

The CoMP pipeline improves cross-modal alignment and resolution adaptability in vision-language models through continual pretraining and custom embeddings. 
Improved 3D Gaussian Splatting with HoGS (3 minute read) 

HoGS boosts rendering accuracy of distant objects in 3DGS pipelines using homogeneous coordinates, enabling better performance in outdoor scene reconstruction. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
OpenAI research lead Noam Brown thinks certain AI 'reasoning' models could've arrived decades ago (3 minute read) 

AI reasoning models could have emerged 20 years earlier with the right approach and algorithms. Academic institutions can still contribute by focusing on areas requiring less computing, such as model architecture design. The poor state of AI benchmarks is an area where academia can make a significant impact. 
AI Companions: Weird and Creepy or Worth Your Attention? (5 minute read) 

AI companions, which offer personalized and empathetic interactions, are rapidly transitioning from fantasy to reality. They are particularly appealing to Gen Z and Gen Alpha for safe exploration and engagement. Despite challenges like quirky interactions and emotional boundary concerns, AI companions provide substantial value by enhancing online experiences, storytelling, and personalized learning. Companies like Genies are leveraging avatar technology and generative AI to create immersive, context-aware digital companions that aim to form authentic connections with users. 
How Trump's AI Czar Plans to Rewrite US Tech Policy (5 minute read) 

President Trump has appointed David Sacks as AI and cryptocurrency czar. Tasked with leading the Presidential Council of Advisors for Science and Technology, Sacks, alongside others, is charged with crafting a new AI action plan to replace what he describes as burdensome regulations from the previous administration. Sacks has raised concerns about China's AI advancements and emphasized the need for the US to ease regulations to maintain its leadership in AI. 
⚡
Quick Links
Apple faces lawsuit over Apple Intelligence delays (1 minute read) 

Apple is facing a class-action lawsuit for allegedly misleading advertising regarding its Apple Intelligence features. 
Hollywood vs AI: 400 celebs urge Trump to rein in OpenAI, Google (4 minute read) 

Hollywood creatives have signed an open letter urging the U.S. government not to weaken copyright protections for AI companies like OpenAI and Google. 
AI-driven weather prediction breakthrough reported (3 minute read) 

Aardvark Weather introduces an AI approach capable of delivering faster and more accurate weather forecasts using significantly less computing power than traditional systems.

subject: Ofsted Inspection of Hills Road Sixth Form College 1st April 2025
body:
Dear Hills Road Parents and Carers 
 
This email is just to let you know that we heard this week that we will be visited for our next routine full Ofsted inspection from Tuesday 1st to Friday 4th April next week. 
 
Hills Road was last inspected in February 2022. All Sixth Form Colleges, who are still part of the Further Education sector, are due to be inspected as a requirement between September 2022 and September 2025 with an added focus on the skills that we develop in our students that serve to support them well, whatever they choose to do once they leave us.  As you may be aware, 93% of our students choose a university route from Hills Road and the annual data from the Higher Education Statistics Authority (HESA) suggests that the gap between the performance of Hills Road students, once at university, continues to strengthen against all other types of schools and colleges, which is exceptionally pleasing.
 
In advance of their visit, Ofsted have asked us to send out their short survey to gather your feedback about your views of the College. We do not see this survey feedback at all. Ofsted collect the feedback anonymously and share it with us as data only. Their survey contains only four questions and no free text box, so it would hopefully be quick to complete and we hope you will have a chance to do that. In the summer term, we will be sending our own College survey to you as parents and carers which will ask you for more in depth feedback about your young person’s experience at Hills Road and will allow for a free text response too. 
 
In the meantime, however, this is the message and the survey link from Ofsted to gather your views through their four questions. Their message is:
 
“Ofsted is inspecting your College on 01 April 2025 to 04 April 2025 and would welcome your views. You can do this by completing Ofsted's online parents’ and carers’ questionnaire:   
 
https://ofsted.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/ParentCarer/10325554 
   
Your views are important to Ofsted and will help inspectors understand your experiences of the College’s provision. Please take the time to give your views.  
  
The questionnaire will close at 11am on 02 April 2025 to give inspectors time to consider the responses.” 
 
The survey looks to be very quick to fill in, so I hope as many as possible of you will be able to feedback about your experience as a parent at Hills Road to Ofsted. 
 
Many thanks in advance if you are able to. 
 
Best wishes 
 
Jo Trump, on behalf of the whole staff team
 



Please consider the environment and don't print this email unless you really need to.

subject: Tax Year End Queries
body:
Hi All,
 
Hope you are all keeping well as tax year end is approaching. 
 
Appreciate have spoken with many of you already with various top ups and withdrawals as well as tax year end general queries. 
 
We have just over a week left for tax year end with most providers realistically cutting off next Friday 4th April. 
 
If there are any tax year queries you have or wish to discuss, please let me know. 
 
All the best,
Gary
 
Gary Edwards, DipPFS, Cert CII (MP) Director

subject: OpenAI Image Generation 🖼️, DeepSeek-V3-0324 Release 🤖, Qwen 2.5 32B Vision Language Model 👓
body:
Sign Up |Advertise|View Online 
TLDR

Together With ￼
TLDR AI 2025-03-26
The playbook behind OpenAI's pricing strategy (Sponsor) 

AI companies face a unique problem when it comes to pricing: On one hand, users expect a frictionless experience that allows experimentation without barriers. On the other, every product interaction comes at a very real price. Training models can cost millions, and expenses for API calls quickly add up.

That tension can make profitability a delicate balancing act – but it doesn't have to. As the billing engine powering OpenAI, Metronome wrote the pricing and billing playbook that AI startups need to get their pricing right. The playbook dives deep into the pricing strategies that enabled OpenAI's soaring revenue, including:
	•	Token-based pricing metrics to bridge resource consumption + user engagement
	•	Redefining billing as a product experience
	•	The nuances of OpenAI's PayGo + prepaid credits model
Read the OpenAI playbook 
🚀
Headlines & Launches
OpenAI's Improved Image Generation (6 minute read) 

OpenAI's GPT-4o introduces improved image generation with precise text rendering, instruction following, and multi-turn editing. 
DeepSeek-V3-0324 Release with MIT License (3 minute read) 

DeepSeek has released its new V3-0324 model, which outperforms GPT 4.5 in most benchmarks and features major improvements in performance. 
Qwen 2.5 32B Vision Language Model (6 minute read) 

Qwen has released a strong vision language model that is open and can run reasonably well on consumer hardware. 
🧠
Research & Innovation
Modifying Large Language Model Post-Training for Diverse Creative Writing (20 minute read) 

Midjourney has released some work to improve diversity in creative writing models. It was able to post-train a small 7B model that outperforms much larger open and closed models in creative writing. 
Video T1 (27 minute read) 

Test time compute for video that uses a guidance model to reject frame paths that don't conform to physics or the user specified prompt. Using test time compute for this task dramatically improves performance on benchmarks. 
3D Face Editing (22 minute read) 

FFaceNeRF enhances 3D face editing by overcoming fixed mask limitations in NeRF-based methods. 
🧑‍💻
Engineering & Resources
Visual Geometry Grounded Transformer (GitHub Repo) 

VGGT is a feed-forward neural network that directly infers all key 3D attributes of a scene, including extrinsic and intrinsic camera parameters, point maps, depth maps, and 3D point tracks, from one, a few, or hundreds of its views, within seconds. 
Dereflection Any Image (2 minute read) 

Dereflection Any Image (DAI) introduces a new diffusion-based approach for reflection removal, leveraging a high-quality dataset and progressive training. 
Slow-Thinking Reasoning Model with FastCuRL (GitHub Repo) 

FastCuRL-1.5B-Preview advances slow-thinking reasoning models with curriculum reinforcement learning, achieving state-of-the-art results in fewer training steps. 
🎁
Miscellaneous
Single Image Iterative Subject-driven Generation and Editing (8 minute read) 

SISO is an inference-time optimization method that personalizes images from a single subject image without training. It can personalize the subject of a given image or generate new images with the personal subject. 
Manny Medina's New Startup: Paid (5 minute read) 

Outreach founder Manny Medina has launched Paid, a platform designed to help AI agent startups manage pricing and profitability. With backing from top investors, Paid aims to redefine how AI agents are billed and valued in the emerging agent economy. 
A key DeepMind robotics researcher left Google, and Nvidia has already backed his stealth startup (2 minute read) 

Pete Florence, previously a senior research scientist at DeepMind, has left to form Generalist AI, a robotics startup backed by Nvidia's VC arm, NVentures. The company aims to create general-purpose robots, with Florence highlighting the vision of reducing the marginal cost of physical labor to zero. Florence joins other former DeepMind scientists in launching tech ventures amidst Nvidia's growing influence in AI. 
⚡
Quick Links
Claude can now search the web (2 minute read) 

Claude now features web search functionality for real-time insights and up-to-date responses, complete with source citations. 
Introducing next-generation audio models in the API (4 minute read) 

OpenAI has introduced new audio models, including Voice Engine, capable of generating realistic voices from short samples. 
Perplexity is reportedly in talks to raise up to $1B at an $18B valuation (2 minute read) 

AI search startup Perplexity is in talks to raise $1 billion at a valuation of $18 billion.

Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag! 
https://refer.tldr.tech/b8c44167/2 

Track your referrals here.
Want to advertise in TLDR? 📰 
If your company is interested in reaching an audience of AI professionals and decision makers, you may want to advertise with us.

Apply here or send a friend's resume to jobs@tldr.tech and get $1k if we hire them! 

If you have any comments or feedback, just respond to this email! 

Thanks for reading, 
Andrew Tan, Ali Aminian & Andrew Carr

subject: FW: Employer Fair @ Hills Road on Thursday!
body:
Dear Parents and Carers, 
 
Please see email below that was sent to your young person this week about Thursday's Employer Fair. The list of employers attending is attached. Please do encourage your young person to attend. 
 
Kind regards
 
Bekki Clark (she/her)
Head of Careers
￼
01223 247251 Ext 462 | bclark@hillsroad.ac.uk | www.hillsroad.ac.uk
Hills Road Sixth form College, Cambridge, CB2 8PE
 ￼
Please consider the environment and don't print this email unless you really need to.
 

From: Clark, Bekki (Hills Road Staff) Sent: Tuesday, March 25, 2025 08:30 To: DL-Year12; DL-Year13 Cc: DL-Careers; DL-Tutors; DL-Learning Support Mentors Subject: Employer Fair @ Hills Road on Thursday! 
 
Dear Students,
 
We’re excited about the Employer Fair that is taking place on:
 
Thursday 27th March
11.30am to 2.30pm
In the Zone and the Atrium
 
We are expecting all students to attend at some point during the day. This is a great chance for you to find out about:
	•	Part-time jobs
	•	Apprenticeships
	•	Gap year jobs
	•	Work experience
	•	Graduate jobs
 
Here are some questions you could ask:
	•	What does your company do and what type of roles do you have?
	•	I’m planning to a degree in (subject), what type of roles might I be able to apply to at your company when I graduate?
	•	What types of degrees are you looking for in your graduate recruits?
	•	Do you offer apprenticeships; what level and in what type of roles?
	•	Do you offer internships/part-time jobs/gap year jobs?
	•	Can I do work experience with your organisation?
	•	What is your job and how did you get into it?
	•	What type of employability skills are you looking for in your employees?
 
The list of employers attending is attached. Do note that all big companies will have people who work in management, HR, marketing, finance, legal departments and much more, so don’t limit the companies you speak to.
 
Any questions? Pop into Careers or email careers@hrsfc.ac.uk
 
Best wishes
 
Bekki Clark (she/her)
Head of Careers
￼
01223 247251 Ext 462 | bclark@hillsroad.ac.uk | www.hillsroad.ac.uk
Hills Road Sixth form College, Cambridge, CB2 8PE
 ￼
Please consider the environment and don't print this email unless you really need to.

subject: Delivery issues for Google email accounts - may require action
body:
￼
  
  
Delivery issues for Google email accounts 
Emails sent from FreeAgent to customers with Google addresses may have been incorrectly classified as spam - but the issue has now been resolved. 
An issue affecting Google email services throughout yesterday (Monday 24th March) meant that certain emails sent by FreeAgent or sent using the FreeAgent software, including invoice emails and automatic payment reminders, were incorrectly being classified as spam and delivered to recipients’ spam folders. 
We were made aware yesterday morning, Monday 24th March, and our email provider worked with Google and implemented a fix at 2.11am today, Tuesday 25th March. We’re sorry for any disruption this has caused for you or your customers. 
This may have affected delivery to all addresses using Google email services, including Gmail addresses and also those where Google is the email provider behind the scenes but a company email address is used. 
Please note that emails will show as delivered in FreeAgent regardless of whether or not they have reached the recipient’s inbox, as the recipient’s email provider won’t send an error message if they're marked as spam. 
If you think that any of the emails sent from your FreeAgent account yesterday or early this morning may have been affected, we recommend that you check with any customers who use Google email services and advise them to check their spam or junk folders. Alternatively, you may wish to consider resending the email as any emails sent from FreeAgent should now be working as normal. And if you use a Google email service, don’t forget to check your own spam folder for any emails from FreeAgent.

subject: RLAM - Project Manager
body:
Hi Roger,
 
Nice to chat just now.
 
As promised, attached is your cv that was sent over in March 2024. Please also find below the JD for the position.
 
 
 
We are currently looking for a Project Manager to join our dynamic RLAM Change team on a permanent basis in London.
 
You will deliver change projects which support achievements of the Group strategy in an effective and efficient manner. You will ensure business outcomes are clearly understood and associated solutions are delivered to enable the business to release benefits on time, within budget and to agreed quality standards.
 
To be successful in this role you will have strong experience in Front Office projects such as, Private Assets, property, and illiquid assets, driving our strategy of growing our 3rd Party business and continuously improving our service to clients.
 
About the role
 
	•	Planning and leading the delivery of the whole change lifecycle for projects.
	•	Developing and leading cross functional change teams which may include both task and line/people management, establishing an environment of trust and empowerment.
	•	Developing and agreeing budgets for projects, controlling forecasts and actual costs against these.
	•	Identifying and monitoring project risks, planning and implementing responses to these and responding to other issues that may affect projects and portfolios.
	•	Developing, maintaining, and applying quality management processes for project activities and outputs
	•	Managing stakeholders, taking account of their levels of influence and particular interests.
	•	Establishing and managing reviews at appropriate points during and after projects, which will inform governance of projects by providing evaluations of progress, methodologies and continuing relevance.
 
About you
 
	•	Experience of leading project teams with minimal support and supervision.
	•	Strong knowledge of project management principles and practices.
	•	Experience and / or knowledge of Agile and Waterfall delivery practices.
	•	Ability to work effectively on multiple, concurrent, or competing projects.
	•	Highly competent in using planning tools and experienced in implementing and operating financial control frameworks.
	•	Has previously delivered Change Projects in a Financial Services organisation.
	•	Front Office projects delivery experience is desirable.
	•	Asset Management Experience is desirable.
	•	Experience in alternative asset classes (e.g. Real Estate) is desirable.
 
Thanks,
Oscar
Oscar Pope‑Moody 
Senior Consultant

Oscar.Pope-Moody@goodmanmasson.com

From: Peak Tours <info@peak-tours.com>  Sent: Wednesday, July 10, 2024 10:58 AM To: undisclosed-recipients: Subject: Good luck!
 
Hi everyone,
The time has nearly come for your Channel to the Med tour!
Thursday 
Tomorrow (Thursday) Tony and Michael will be on their way down to Portsmouth, meeting some of you en route to collect bikes at the A3 Wiseley services - likely at around 1:30-2:30pm, but they will update you as to their ETA on the day. The third guide, Isabelle, lives in France so will be making her way north to meet the team in Ouistreham on Friday.
If you are handing your bike over in Portsmouth, Tony and Michael would like to meet you at the Travelodge Car Park, Kingston Crescent, North End, Portsmouth PO2 8AB, and will update you of their ETA en route, but they should be there by 4:30pm.
Please find their contact details below:
Tony +447730 608045
Michael +44 7362 360 986
Isabelle +33 6 73 38 29 60
Friday
Please feel free to contact your guides when you arrive in Ouistreham, they will be around all afternoon and evening on Friday 12th July, staying at the Ibis Styles Hotel. If you are on the Friday morning or afternoon ferry then you should be able to access your bike so that you can check it is all OK and ready to go, the guides will give you a specific time to get in to the bike room. If you are on the Friday overnight ferry you can check your bike when you arrive on Saturday morning. 
Saturday
Everyone should meet at the Ibis Hotel in Ouistreham on Saturday morning at 8:30 ready to go. If you are staying in the Ibis then you will leave your bags in reception to be loaded into the van.
M-check
It is important to check your bike every day before setting off to ensure that it is in good working order and there are no mechanical or safety issues that need rectifying before you set off. A simple way to do this is by performing a quick M-check on your bike every morning. You can see how to do an M-Check here.
—
I hope that your ferry over is fun and it won't be long before you're in France ready to start your epic adventure. You'll soon be in the Channel to Med bubble where you'll have left your normal life behind and enjoy the simplicity of "Eat. Sleep. Cycle. Repeat" as you meander your way southwards across the length of France.
 
You'll see some fantastic sights, visit some lovely places, see the diversity of Northern France to the Central Massif, Mediterranean and everything in between. At times the weather, terrain and scenery will be just perfect and you'll want to cycle forever whilst you'll have other times when the weather is bad, you're feeling tired, struggling up and hill wondering what the hell you're doing - all part of what will hopefully be an amazing experience for you. You'll meet lots of like-minded people, meet many interesting characters on the road and hopefully have lots of laughs and great memories to cherish.
 
It is important to remember to cycle at your own pace. Don't try and keep up with others if they're cycling at a speed that's too fast for you and likewise if you like to go fast then don't feel like you have to wait for others. The important thing is that you cycle safely and enjoy the ride and remember it's a marathon, not a sprint. You'll most likely split into different groups when you're cycling and end up cycling with people of a similar pace or maybe you prefer to cycle on your own, whichever way is fine. Generally all these things will happen naturally and after a few days you'll be into your new routine.
 
As the days pass by your day to day routines will become second nature and all you'll be thinking about is enjoying the ride and wondering where the next brew stop is!
 
Each evening you'll stay in a different town, a different hotel, eat in a different hotel or restaurant and have many stories to share with your new found friends. When you finally reach your finale at the Mediterranean you’ll have mixed emotions of joy and sadness as you'll be overjoyed, having completed (hopefully) an amazing ride but sad that your journey has come to an end.
 
I truly hope that you have a great time and enjoy your two weeks in France.
 
I'll wish you a Bon Voyage for now and all the very best for your tour, but if you have any final questions then please do get in touch.
 
May the sun shine and the god of tail winds be with you.
 Liz      

-- 


￼
Peak Tours
Cycling and Walking Holidays

mobile: +44 (0) 7495 023 022
email: info@peak-tours.com
Rear of 75 Station Rd, Hadfield

  Hi all, we hope you're enjoying 2024 and your training for the upcoming race year is well underway!  The Haverhill Running Festival is now just a month away Sunday 7 April, with the 10k Haver10, the 13.1-mile HaverHalf - the JMP Furniture Solutions Half Marathon, the full 26.2-mile HaverMara, and the HaverSports Family Fun Run to suit all ages and abilities.  All races will be chip timed and ARC licensed, with medals and goodies for all finishers.  2024 is HaverSports' 10 year anniversary, and we'll be celebrating with a festival atmosphere at the race! We'll have local bands performing at the race village, the climbing wall available outside, sports activities on the astroturf, BBQ food and drinks, and FREE soft play available for families accompanying athletes (up to capacity).   We look forward to seeing you at the start line! You can get full details and enter by clicking here.
Also open for entries are our three 2024 triathlons, one open water and two pool-based. All feature chip timing, with medals and goodies for all finishers, and we will aim to hold them under a BTF licence.  The first two are fast, flat courses afording you and ideal PB opportunity! Our open water race includes Sprint and Standard distances, while our pool-based triathlons include Sprint and Sprint+ races, along with duathlons, while HaverTri also features and aquathlon open to ages 8 and above.  
	•	The Cambridge Sport Lakes Triathlon will be held at Milton Country Park on Sunday 4 August. You can get full details and enter by clicking here.
	•	The Stowmarket HaverSports West Suffolk Triathlon is at the Mid-Suffolk Leisure Centre on Sunday 15 September. You can get full details and enter by clicking here.
	•	HaverTri - the Adams Harrison Triathlon Festival is at Haverhill Leisure Centre. You can get full details and enter by clicking here.
Enter here

subject: Milton Cross Race - Refund / Donation Info
body:
￼ 

The following message has been sent to you by the organiser of Cambridge Juniors CX Eastern League rd 13 28/01/2024

Hi,

Sorry for having to cancel your race at Milton yesterday, please see below about refund/donate options.
 
If you were not fully aware of what happened, Brian suffered a cardiac event, stopped breathing and had to be resuscitated. Due to the fast actions of all those at the event, he responded well and was conscious before the ambulance arrived. Although the air ambulance was present he was transferred by road, had a procedure in hospital and is doing well. 
 
We then took the decision to cancel the remaining races, based on a number of factors:
- The need to debrief those involved after the incident
- The impact that this would have on the schedule given the available daylight
- The impact the incident had on those involved and their ability to operate afterwards
- The impact the incident would have had on riders, I know some were not keen to race afterwards.
- Lack of timescale before the air ambulance departed and the inability to race whilst it was in the area.
 
You may have seen messages on Facebook about refunds for entries and the League involvement with this.  
If you would like a refund , please reply to this email with bank details such that you can be refunded directly by the league. 
If you would like to donate your entry fee to the air ambulance charity please respond with the word "Donate" 
Please respond to this message as otherwise we will not know what to do with your entry fee.
 
Prize monies from the races which didn't happen will be donated to the air ambulance by ourselves as the race organiser.
 
Thank you for all your support after the racing finished, we will be back, hope to see you all next season.
 
Milton CX Team
 



This email has been delivered to you via the British Cycling online entry system.

If you wish to send a reply, please respond to richard@millerzone.co.uk

￼ 
￼

subject: Open Time Trials
body:
View this email in your browser 
￼ 
2024 Time Trials  I am the St Ives CC Time Trial secretary for 2024. I aim to encourage more members to ride open time trials (Most races are at fixed distances 10, 25, 50 and 100 miles or fixed time 12 and 24 hours).  In 2023 the CTT (Cycling Time Trials) introduced a separate Road Bike classification allowing an opportunity for riders to compete within this class and is proving very popular. No need to invest in a Time Trial bike!  The Sawtry course (Course code N1) on the Old North Road is our local course.  This year the Open Events are as follows:
	•	Saturday 30th March St Ives CC - 10 – N1/10 
	•	Sunday 28th April - National Road Bike Championships – 23 - MTT - NC26 
	•	Sunday 19th May – Fenland Clarion CC – 25 - N1/25C 
	•	Saturday 8th June - Northampton & District CA – 15 – N1/15 
	•	Saturday 31st August - Northampton & District CA – 10 - N1/10 
 The CTT National Road Bike Championships this year is held part on the Sawtry 10 course before heading west through Glatton – Great Gidding – Steeple Gidding and left top of Hamerton Hill back towards Sawtry. It would be great to see St Ives members entering this event.  To enter the events and for more information click on CTT site: https://cyclingtimetrials.org.uk/  Courses local to St Ives area are in the South East Midlands and courses are prefixed with the letter “N” and London North district courses prefixed with the letter “F”. Other fairly local course are prefixed with “A” and “E”  Contact me if you have any questions or would like to know more.  The minimum age for competitors is 12 years. It is essential that competitors under 18 know the law and the Highway Code, and are competent to ride on public roads alone. They must have the authorisation of their parents to compete.
 
Steve Cornish
steve@stevecornish.net
07957 881349
 
￼

subject: Support in Maths
body:
Dear Parent/Guardian,  I’m getting in touch from the Maths department at Hills Road just to let you know that we have added some additional maths support to your child’s timetable. These support sessions are an extra resource we provide to give students some extra time with a member of staff to help them improve. The groups are much smaller than their class groups so there will be more opportunity to ask about material they’ve seen in lessons or questions they’ve tried but are stuck on. 
 
Students received an email last week to let them know the details of when their session will be and we also invited them to a brief information session to explain how to get the most out of these sessions and to reassure them that we’re investing in them to help them achieve their potential.
 We would greatly appreciate your support in ensuring they attend and take full advantage of these extra sessions.
 
Best Wishes,
 
Rob Whittaker (he/him) 
Second in Mathematics
Year 12 Course Coordinator
 
￼
 
 
01223 247251 Ext 243 | rwhittaker@hillsroad.ac.uk | www.hillsroad.ac.uk 
Hills Road Sixth form College, Cambridge, CB2 8PE



P Please consider the environment and don't print this email unless you really need to.
