subject: Eastern Cyclo-Cross League
sender: Saint Ives Cycling Club Development Squad <sicc.development.squad@gmail.com>
recipient: charlie@gts-trees.com, matthew.bell@gts-trees.com, roger@pembery.com, jacobtwood06@gmail.com, isaac@pembery.com, angelagemmell@hotmail.com, ojmaynard@outlook.com, burgin.jack@gmail.com
body:
Good Morning All,

I have created a google calendar for the group and given you all access. 

I'm in the process of adding the Eastern Cyclo-Cross League events to it, including links to the ECCL page for each of the events and locations. The ECCL page for each event will include entry details, race times and other relevant details. At present there are only links to the first three events but these are likely to be updated shortly by the organisers.

It would be great if you could all accept the invitation to events that you enter so we know who is going to each event and plan accordingly. 

The CX events usually sell out fairly quickly so it's worth getting your entries in quickly and keeping an eye on the main page to see when the links to the events open up. the main page is here 

https://www.easterncross.org.uk/league.htm

If anyone has any questions about the CX season or needs assistance with the races, please let us know.

I've also added the SICC track session at Lee Valley Velodrome on 6 December. An email notification will be circulated by the club in the near future that will allow you to book a place through the club shop. Again, please accept the invitation if you plan to go.

subject: ☀️ Cambridge Solar / Initial enquiry follow up
body:
Good afternoon,
I hope you are well.
I appreciate this was some time ago, but I can see on our system that you made an enquiry with us regarding the installation of either a solar PV, battery or EV charging solution for your property, therefore I am contacting you to see whether you would still like to pursue this with us further.
If you are still interested in receiving a quotation please reply to this email and a member of the team will be in touch soon to ascertain a little more information regarding your requirements. From there you will be sent a comprehensive proposal which will outline costs as well as potential yields and benefits etc. further for you, and our sales team will be on hand to answer any further questions you may have.  If you would like to learn more about solar panels and battery storage in general as well as more detail about the options offered above, we would encourage you to attend our weekly webinar which is full of useful information. The webinar is held at 12 o'clock every Thursday and includes a chance for you to ask any questions you have via a Q&A session at the end.
To book your slot please register here: Webinar Booking Link 
If you are no longer interested, please let us know and we will remove your details from our database.
We will close your file one week from today's date if we receive no response, but should you ever wish to consider a solution from us in the future, please do get in touch and we can re-activate your file.
We look forward to hearing from you soon.
Kind regards,
Joanna Houseman
(I currently work Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday)

01223 863 885
joanna@cambridge-solar.co.uk

subject: C2M - Menu choices
body:
Hi all,

On your Channel to the Med tour we have organised a few group meals in the evening. These are by no means obligatory but we have found that people find them a great way to socialise with people that they haven’t necessarily been riding with. We will have group evening meals on the following nights:
Day 1 - Bagnoles del Orme
Day 2 - La Flèche. All of the restaurants in La Flèche are closed on Sunday, so one of them opens especially for us but we need a pre-order before we arrive.
Day 9,  Day 11 (after Mont Ventoux) and Day 14 (these pre-orders will be taken by your guides on tour)

I know it is quite a way off but I would like to ask you for your menu choices for evening 1 and 2. The restaurants like to have them well in advance, and it often takes some time to gather everyone’s choices so I would be grateful if you could take a look at the menus and input your choices by clicking on the following link: July 14 Day Channel to the Med Menu Choices

We don’t organise any other group meals as it gives people a chance to enjoy and explore each town in the evenings (we will give you a list of suggestions of where to eat), and often the restaurants want a pre-order with group meals so there is less choice. There is a set price for the five x 3 course meals we do have booked: 143 Euros (26+30+30+27+30) - to be paid for by you. Last year we found it easiest to collect this at the start of the tour so that the guides don't have to keep asking you for money (some of the restaurants find it easier to have the cash rather than lots of people all trying to pay by card). 

All lunches will be provided and paid for by Peak Tours except during the Mont Ventoux day. The reason for this is that we like to have both vans supporting you on the mountain and usually the group spreads out a lot, so it is difficult to have guides either setting up a picnic, or being present at a café / restaurant to welcome you. There is a restaurant 4 miles into the descent, Chalet Reynard, that we would recommend you eat at, or alternatively you can have a late lunch after finishing the day in Sault. For this reason, although the cost of the four group evening meals is 143 Euros, we would ask you to bring 130 Euros, rather than 143 Euros, to the main brief at the hotel in Bagnoles del Orme on the first Saturday. Please use the 13 Euros we don’t ask for to cover your lunch on the Mont Ventoux day.

I will be sending you the GPX files and route notes for the tour soon, but I didn't want to bombard you with too many emails today! Thanks to all who have already paid their final balance and filled in the Bike Details for EU Transportation form.

If you have any queries at all then please don't hesitate to contact me.

Many Thanks

Liz

subject: new programme
Fwd: Re: Training and races after Easter
body:
On 13 Apr 2023, at 00:20, CCRC Junior Lead Coach <ccrcjuniorcoach@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi all,

Apologies for another longer email, but there are a few things to cover. 

First, a reminder to please set your availability in Ludum for Ball Cup if you have not already done so. Last year we came home with 5 medals (including Tilly's gold in a double with St Mary's). So far I see 10 of you signed up - I know we can do better than that! 

Tomorrow I expect to add the other races we are considering between now and the end of the summer holidays. I will send another message when this is done so that you can plan ahead. 

Finally, but very importantly, please see below a message from our Entries Secretary regarding payment of race fees. In the time I have been coaching the junior squad, we have only had to bar people from racing for non-payment on one occasion, but it is something I am keen to avoid repeating. 

Hello all, hope your children enjoyed their first race experience at Champs Junior Sculling head a few weekends ago. 

With regards to race fees, these costs are passed on to the athletes and monitored in the race account spreadsheet, found below, in it there is a tab called Juniors and if you scroll along to the right you will (hopefully) find your child. It is ordered alphabetically by surname. 

The club is currently operating a, must have credit in the race account before entries can be made, policy, this will be less strictly enforced for the junior section but please try and keep on top of things. 

If you have any questions or need any guidance/a longer time frame please get in contact with me: 
Tom Upton - ccrc.race.entries@gmail.com 

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1KyeKPiveezQyOOIl6u2v8ryqTLNrs6qe7X8mtRVyspc/edit?usp=sharing 

The race bank account is different from the main club account that memberships are paid to, the race account is: 
name
City of Cambridge Rowing Club 
account no
36888963
sort code
09-01-28

Thanks very much 
-- 
Tom Upton 

Enjoy your last few days of the Easter Break - see you all soon, 
Bruce 

On Thu, 6 Apr 2023 at 23:07, CCRC Junior Lead Coach < ccrcjuniorcoach@gmail.com> wrote: 
Happy Easter, everybody.

I wanted to clarify that training takes a pause for the Easter Holidays, and that there is no training this weekend or during the week after (contrary to land training sessions still in Ludum at present - we'll fix that!) 

The weekend at the end of the break, it is not clear whether we will be able to run any water sessions - many of our coaches will be tied up with senior and/or masters training camps. If we are able to put anything on, I will make sure a post goes out on Ludum so that you get a chance to sign up. 

Meanwhile I would like to draw your attention to the Ball Cup on 7th May. This is a wonderful event aimed specifically at smaller clubs. As such it may be the last year we are eligible as we grow the junior squad, so I'd love it if we can hit it in style this year, including entries in the actual Ball Cup events (coxed fours). Entries close 20th April so please get your availability set as soon as possible and definitely no later than next Friday. (Note that, since this is a British Rowing event, you will need BR membership. This is £30 for the year for juniors; you can get it set up very quickly if down to be entered, but that will need to be done before we can submit entries.) 

See you all in a week or so when we get back into the swing of training, 
Bruce

subject: Long Road Sixth Form College Advice and Guidance Meetings – Bookings Now Open!
body:
￼
                                                                                                                                                                23rd January 2023
 
 
Dear Isaac and Parent/Carer,
Student ID: PEM202300968  Advice and Guidance Meetings, Thursday 9th & Friday 10th February - Now open for booking!
We are delighted that you are considering Long Road Sixth Form College for your next steps.
 
We would like to invite you and your parent/carer to attend an Advice and Guidance Meeting with us. These will be held via video call, over two days: Thursday 9th and Friday 10th February, from 09:00am to 16:30pm. 
 
Bookings are open from today, Monday 23rd January until 12pm on Monday 30th January.
 
A guide on how to book your meeting can be found at the bottom of this email.
 
Meetings are open for booking on a first-come first-served basis. If you are not able to secure a meeting on either of these two days, please don’t worry. Due to the high number of applications we receive we will be holding additional meetings on Monday 6th March so that everyone has an opportunity to attend. We will send out more detailed information to affected applicants once this first round of meetings has taken place but please be reassured that the date of your interview will not affect your offer in any way.  
 
All Advice and Guidance Meetings will ideally place with your cameras and microphones on so that we can engage with you face to face. We want to have focused, and meaningful conversations so that we can understand your individual goals and help you to make the best-informed decisions about your future at Long Road.
 
We are using the online appointment booking system SchoolCloud to conduct our meetings. This allows you to choose your own virtual meeting time with an experienced member of staff. 
 How do I book an Advice and Guidance Meeting?
You and your primary Parent/Carer have both been registered on the SchoolCloud system, you will therefore need to login with the following information:
·           Your parent/carer’s name and email address (this is where the email booking confirmation will be sent) 
·           Your preferred name (NOT first name) and surname as it appears in their application with us
·           Your date of birth 
 
The login information will be based on details submitted in your application, which can be viewed via your MyLongRoad account, but we have also included these below:
 
Applicant’s Preferred Name(s): Isaac
Applicant’s Surname: Pembery
Applicant’s date of birth: 25/10/2006
 
When you log in to SchoolCloud, you will be able choose the date and time of your meeting, as well as an interviewer. All our staff are trained and experienced interviewers and will be able to guide you through all your available options at the college. You are only able to book one meeting per applicant, and once it is booked your parent/carer will receive a confirmation email.
 
Our meeting slots are 25 minutes long and the times are fixed. It is important that you attend on time as video calls will end automatically at the end of the designated meeting slot.   
The SchoolCloud platform automatically sets up access for you and your primary parent/carer, but you can also give one additional parent/carer access to join your video call from a different device. You can grant this access at the time of booking, or later if required. Instructions on how to do so can be found below.
 
We understand that this stage can be exciting but maybe a little daunting. To support you every step of the way, we will keep in touch via out monthly applicant newsletters. The February edition will be sent to your email soon: it includes helpful tips on preparing for your virtual Advice and Guidance Meeting, so keep an eye out!
 
If you are having trouble booking a meeting or have specific questions or concerns, please email us at admissions@longroad.ac.uk. 
We are really looking forward to meeting you!
 
Best wishes,
Long Road Admissions Team
 
Step-by-Step Guide for using SchoolCloud
 
In order to make a video call you need to have as a minimum:
·         A device with a microphone and speaker/headphones
·         A compatible up-to-date web browser:
iPhone/iPad: Safari, Chrome Note: there is a known issue joining video calls using iOS 14.2. Please upgrade any iOS 14.2 devices to iOS 14.3, or use a different device
Android: Chrome, Firefox or the Samsung Browser
Windows: Chrome, Firefox or Microsoft Edge (Chromium-download here (https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/edge))
Mac: Safari, Chrome or Firefox
Linux: Chrome or Firefox
We also recommend:
·         Using your smartphone for video appointments. If you don’t have a smartphone with a front-facing camera, use a laptop or computer with a webcam
·         Using a headset (or earphones with a microphone) to reduce echo
 
 
1.     Booking Your Appointment - Please go to our SchoolCloud booking page: https://longroad.schoolcloud.co.uk/ 
￼ 
Step 1: Login
Type the parent/carer’s details under the Your Details section, followed by your personal details under Student Details, then click the Log In button.
A confirmation of your meeting will be sent to the parent/carer’s email provide here so make sure it’s correct.
￼ 
Step 2: Select the Long Road Advice and Guidance Meetings event
Click on the date you wish to book.
Unable to make any of the dates listed? Click I'm unable to attend and we will contact you at a later stage.
￼ 
Step 3: Select Booking Mode
To pick the times to book with each interviewer, select Manual. Then press Next.
￼ 
Step 4: Choose an Interviewer
Select all the interviewers to view maximum available time slots. A green tick indicates they’re selected. To de-select, click on their name. All our staff are equally trained and experienced interviewers.
￼ 
Step 5: Book Your Meeting
Click any of the green cells to make your booking. Blue cells signify where you already have a meeting. Grey cells are unavailable.
To change your meeting slot, delete the original by hovering over the blue box and clicking Delete. Then choose an alternate time.
Once you’re finished booking, at the top of the page in the alert box, press click here to finish the booking process.
￼ 
Step 6: Finished
Your meeting slot now appears on the My Bookings page. An email confirmation has been sent to your parent/carer.
 
It is possible to change your meeting time, by clicking on Amend Bookings but please be advised that slots are quickly booked up!
 
2.     Inviting another parent/guardian to join your meeting
￼
Step 1: Accessing Your Booking
Once you have made your booking (or when you later log in and go to My Bookings) click on the Invite Parent/Guardian link at the top of the list. 
 
￼
Step 2: Adding Additional Attendees
You will then be presented with a box asking for the details of the parent/guardian to be given access.  If there is more than one student linked to a parent and involved in the event they will all be shown. Choose the correct student from the list.
You must enter a Name, and an Email address, for the additional parent/carer as well as tick the box to consent to that person being given access to the information used to make the meeting.  When you click the blue Send Invite button an email is sent to the address entered, giving them a link and details on how to join the call.   
￼
Step 3: Managing Invitations
You will then see a Manage invites box that shows your sent invitation(s), allows you to Resend invites or Remove them for an additional parent/carer. 
 
If you click Remove the link in the previously sent invitation will no longer work and that person can no longer join the video call.
 
Please note that a maximum of TWO guests can use this link. Anyone else using it (including the parent that sent the invite, who should log in via their own confirmation email) will knock the guest out of appointments.
 
3.     Attending Your Video Meeting
￼
Step 1: Log in and go to the Event
On the day of the video meeting, login to SchoolCloud at least 15 minutes before your scheduled time.
At the top of the page, you will see a blue notice telling you that you have an upcoming video meeting, as well as a "click here" link which allows you to check that your internet connection and device can successfully connect to a video call.
The green Join Video Appointments button allows you to join your meeting on the day - or to test your camera/microphone at any time.
￼
Step 2: Check Audio and Video
When you click Join Video Appointments the Check Audio and Video screen will be displayed. You may at this point be asked if you wish to allow access to your camera/microphone, in which case please click yes.  From here you can blur your background in video calls, turn on or off your microphone and camera, change which devices are being used for the call, and check your microphone and speakers. Once you are happy, click Proceed to Video Call.
 
￼
Step 3: The Video Call
On this screen you can see the following, when in a call:
	•	At the top left the interviewer’s name.
	•	At the top right a countdown to the start of the appointment.
	•	At the bottom the control buttons allow you to mute the mic or turn off the camera. The cogwheel allows you to change the settings, such as blurring your background, or choosing to use a different mic or camera (if you have more than one available).
·         In the middle, when your meeting is due to start, the Start Appointment button.
Once the call has been joined, an option to Open Chat will also appear. This allows you to chat via text if that is required.
Click the Start Appointment button. You will see yourself in the bottom right corner of the screen. If the interviewer has not yet joined you will see a notice to that effect in the centre of the screen.
 
 
Note that if you or the interviewer are late, or leave and re-join the call, it does not reset the timer. The appointment will always end at the scheduled time. If there are any issues with the video call, the interviewer will attempt to contact you via telephone instead. Please ensure the mobile number we have for you is correct by logging in to your MyLongRoad Application and selecting “Personal Details”.

Subject: Results and more races
To: Junior Squad Coordinator <ccrcjuniors@gmail.com>



Hi all,

First off, congratulations to those who raced on Sunday. Conditions were variable through the day, but challenging throughout! All crews showed true grit in pushing their boats all the way to the finish. Times are below, along with other boats in your category where we had any competition.

Across the rest of the club, it was a good day with wins in several categories and the fastest women's 8+ in the whole event.

Looking ahead, I have added the following race events to Ludum. Note that the list includes events which the whole squad could potentially enter. If you see it on Ludum then set your availability and the coaches will select crews based on that, plus an assessment of your ability nearer the time. Apart from Champs Junior Sculling Head, you will need a BR race license to enter these events, which can usually be sorted quite quickly.

Feb.4 - Peterborough Head of the Nene
This one is very much for the more experienced members (and is only J15+ anyway) since it is not as easy to follow crews by bike as it is on the Cam. 2.6km of pretty straight river.

Mar 12 - Easter Region JIRR trials
JIRR stands Junior Inter-Regional Regatta. This is the session where the Eastern Region clubs compete to represent the region in the national event at the National Water Sports Centre (Nottingham) on April 22nd. J14-J16, but good J13s can race up as J14. (Note that, annoyingly, this clashes with the final leg of the Winter League, so some rowers may need to make a choice between events.)

Mar 18 (provisional) - Champs Junior Sculling head
This is a great first head racing experience for many, as it's a relatively short 1450m course on the Cam.

Mar 20 - Oarsport Junior Sculling Head
Although a head race, this takes place on the rowing lake near Windsor. It is therefore a great experience for those who have progressed enough in their age category (J14-J17). Note that it's a school day, though we expect most schools would accept competing in this event to be a sufficiently educational activity to allow the day out of school. We will consider availability (rowers and coaches!) and abilities very carefully before committing to going. Also it's 4x (and 8x) only, so we will need sufficient availability for a given category in order to enter crews.

Please set your availability for this one based on whether you are willing, and think you would probably be able, to take the day off school if selected for a crew.

Bruce
-- 
CCRC Junior Lead Coach

Race Account

subject: RE: Some digging at 85 Gilbert on Tuesday
body:
Hi Roger
 
Further to my visit yesterday, I confirm that I did not see any damage to your boundary wall. I understand why the men made the sewer connection in front of your property and the men seem competent.  
 
Could you please check your wall for any damage once they have finished their work and let me know the outcome? 
 
Regards
 
George Voyias
Ashton Consulting Engineers
 
15 Station Road
Histon
Cambridge
CB24 9LQ
T: 01223 560255
M: 07821 623337
W: www.ashtonce.co.uk
 
From: Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com>  Sent: 08 December 2022 08:28 To: g.voyias@ashtonce.co.uk Cc: 'Brian Pope' <fampope83@gmail.com>; roger@pembery.com Subject: RE: Some digging at 85 Gilbert on Tuesday
 
George,
 
As you may gather from the email chain below, there are additional excavations being done very close to my property (#87) which were not part of the original party wall agreement. I feel that it is prudent to at least review the risks of the additional work. Without getting a tape-measure out, they are within 12 inches of the boundary and about 4 feet deep. I am concerned that the actual work being done is not in accordance to what the owner nor the main contractor were lead to believe, which leads me to assume that sufficient planning may not be undertaken, leading to additional risk.
 
Can you let me know what you advise? 
 
Kind regards,
 
Roger.
 
From: Christopher Church <christopherchurch74@yahoo.co.uk>  Sent: 06 December 2022 16:06 To: Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> Cc: 'Phil Ward' <philipward@argyledesign.co.uk>; g.voyias@ashtonce.co.uk; 'Brian Pope' <fampope83@gmail.com> Subject: Re: Some digging at 85 Gilbert on Tuesday
 
Hi Roger,
 
Sorry to hear this. I will follow up with Jason. I didn't know your drive would be dug up, that much is accurate.  I'll follow up with CBG as well (not least for the 7:15 knock on the door; they told me they'd be onsite at 8am, which I why I said as much in the earlier mail) nor did they tell me I should expect to be informed by Jason. As far as I was made aware they'd be digging up my driveway, not yours.
 
I do have a copy of the Anglian permission and the Section 50 licence - attached here for your reference.  Fun fact: we originally applied back in July. You'll notice the 23rd Sept as the application date to the council. That's cos nobody thought to ask me to also sign a Section 50 application when we asked CBG to apply for us (so in effect 2 months wasted sitting wondering why I hadn't heard back from the council)
 
Thanks
Chris
 
 
 
On Tuesday, 6 December 2022, 08:21:40 GMT, Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> wrote: 
 
 
Chris,
 
FYI: The contractor knocked on our door at 7.15am to inform us that he would be digging up our drive. Your email below makes no mention of this, which I assume is because you were not made aware. The contractor assured me that JP Developments knew at least 2 weeks ago the detail of the works. The contractor seemed very surprised that the builder had not informed us of the requirement to dig up the drive: apparently it is the main contractor’s responsibility. 
 
Do you have a copy of the permit/work notice from Anglian water? I will be needing the reference on the notice if I need to rely on the warranty for the work, which apparently is 12 months.
 
Kind regards,
 
Roger.
 
From: Christopher Church <christopherchurch74@yahoo.co.uk>  Sent: 02 December 2022 13:54 To: Phil Ward <philipward@argyledesign.co.uk>; g.voyias@ashtonce.co.uk; Brian Pope <fampope83@gmail.com>; Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> Subject: Some digging at 85 Gilbert on Tuesday
 
Afternoon all,
 
I've just gotten confirmation from our contractor CB Groundworks they'll be at 85 Gilbert road on Tuesday morning to connect the foul drain up, which is going to involve a bit of digging etc. They have promised to minimise disruption as far as they possibly can. They expect to be onsite around 8am.
 
For my part, I'll be travelling to the USA tomorrow morning on business for the week, but I will be available for contact as usual in case of issues, albeit a couple of hours behind (please give Junko a shout if it's before noon UK time as she's definitely going to be awake)
 
Wishing you all a good weekend.  
 
Chris

On Tue, Nov 29, 2022 at 2:11 PM Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> wrote:
Anna,
 
This email outlines the next steps to prepare the paperwork for the lease on Room 2 in 8, The Terrace, Hampden Gardens, Cambridge. Can you provide the following:
 
	1.	Contact details: confirm phone number and email address (done, unless you want to provide an alternative). We will use these contact details with the deposit agency so you should still have access to at least one of them at the end of the tenancy to make it easier for them to return your deposit.
	a.	akuroshenkova@gmail.com
	b.	+44 7397 805261
	2.	Evidence of your ability to pay the rent -   copies of your 3 latest pay slips or a copy of your contract of employment or some equivalent. If you are unsure about what to provide then let me know and we can discuss.
	3.	The contact details (name, email address, and telephone number) of your current/a past landlord to take up a reference
	4.	A scanned copy of your passport (photograph page). I will also need to check the original in your presence before you move in
	5.	Your current address (required to put on the new lease documents)
	6.	How long you would like your contract term for (e.g. 6 months, 12 months), and when you would like your idea start date to be.
 
Once I have these and I am comfortable with your renting status then I will prepare the lease contract which I will send to you for electronic signing. Once signed, then all you need to do is to provide before you move in the 1st month’s rent in advance and 1 month’s deposit.
 
If you have any questions, let me know. I am delighted that you are interested in the room. I’m copying in my wife, Claire, who can also answer any questions you may have.
 
Thanks,
 
Roger.


-- 
Thank you,

Anna

subject: Applications are open
body:
￼ 
￼ 
Dear Roger Pembery,  We hope you enjoyed your visit to the College during our Open Event and you managed to meet with all of the subject departments on your list.   If you weren't able to make the event, please don't worry! There will be another opportunity to visit the College if you become an offer holder, as you will be invited to attend a welcome event in July.  Making your application  We are now accepting applications for entry in 2023. If you are thinking about applying, please follow the guidance on our website to ensure you are qualified for the subjects you would like to take. Apply now >>  Keep reading for a quick recap of what's on offer to every student at Hills Road, just in case you need any more information.

￼
Subjects
The College offers 36 A level subjects which can be taken in almost any combination. Each subject page on our website includes a video sharing more information about what's included in the course plus some helpful FAQs.
Read more >>
￼
Support & Guidance
Every student at the College has a dedicated tutor as well as access to Student Services, the Wellbeing and Counselling Team, and Study and SEND support. Follow the link below to also find out more about the Bursary Fund.
Read more >>

￼
Extended Project Qualification
At the heart of our study programme is the requirement for every Y12 student to develop and realise an Advanced level project entirely of your own devising. The qualification is also equivalent to half an A level!
Read more >>
￼
Enrichment

All Year 12 students have an exciting opportunity to follow an enrichment activity when they join the College. With over 75 different teams, groups and activities, you are likely to find one that sparks your interest.
Read more >>

Still not sure what you want to do next?
If you are undecided about what you want to do after you have finished Y11, try downloading our guide on taking your next step. Included is information about the options available to you and the transferable skills you will gain by studying at Advanced level.
Download now >>


￼ 

￼ 
Our fly-through video will give you a good reminder about what the campus is like and the amazing opportunities available to our students. 

We wish you every success if you decide to apply to Hills Road.  Kindest regards, The Admissions Team
￼
￼
￼
￼

Copyright © 2020, Hills Road Sixth Form College
All rights reserved.

Hills Road Sixth Form College | Hills Road | Cambridge | CB2 8PE

T 01223 278038
E WelcomeTo Hills@hillsroad.ac.uk

subject: INVITATION: Dunelm Days 2022 in Cambridge
body:
Join fellow Durham graduates in Cambridge!
 
View in browser
 
 
￼
 
 
 
 
 
 
￼
Dunelm Days in Cambridge
Tuesday 1 November, 6.30pm
 
Dear Roger,
We are delighted to see the return of Dunelm Days, a global alumni celebration being held this November where alumni who are united by shared experiences and memories of Durham, get together to strengthen existing friendships and make new ones. As part of the Dunelm Days celebration you are invited to attend a Durham alumni meet-up in Cambridge on 1 November 2022.  
Get involved with the fun by joining Durham Ambassadors Catriona Wilson (St Aidan's College, Chemistry, 2013) and Celine Ophelders (Ustinov College, International Relations, 2013) for a game of mini golf followed by drinks. 
Date: Tuesday 1 November  Time: 6.30pm Venue: Tivoli, 6 Chesterton Road Cambridge, CB4 3AX
If you would like to attend this event, please register your place here. The event is free to attend with food and drinks available to buy on the night. Partners and friends are more than welcome to attend - the more the merrier!
No longer living in Cambridge? Don't worry, there may still be an event taking place near you! A list of all events can be found here. 
If you can't see one near you, why not organise your own with our full support? To find out more, please get in touch.
We hope to see you there!
Best wishes, Your Alumni and Supporter Engagement Team

subject: Re: Re: 113 Darwin Drive contacts
body:
Absolutely Roger, please do. We thank you and Claire for moving forward with us for this deal and we finally get to this point. All the best wishes to you both and we look forward to working with you in the future. We might get a lump sum in the end of this year or beginning of next from our other investment and would want to invest more in properties in Cambridge. If you ever consider to sell any of your other properties, please bear us in mind. Anyway we wish your business continued success. 

Kind regards

Yours, Yang


 
From: Roger Pembery
Date: 2022-07-12 10:30
To: Yang CHEN
Subject: Re: 113 Darwin Drive contacts
Yang.

I understand that we have completed. Tucker's have the keys. 

I am having the rubbish removed from the back this afternoon. Let me know if you would prefer that we didn't do this. I don't need access to the inside of the house.

Many thanks,

Roger

On Mon, 11 Jul 2022, 22:49 Yang CHEN, <Ramonhaha@hotmail.com> wrote:
Thanks Roger! I will contact my silicitor fornthose documents. 

I will contact Tucker and see who could help to handle the keys. 

Kind regards

Yours, Yang 

Sent from my iPhone

On Jul 11, 2022, at 17:16, Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> wrote:

﻿
Hi Yang – apologies – I have been busy with other properties. 
 
I need to attend other properties tomorrow and won’t be able to give you a time when I will be available unfortunately. The house has been professional cleaned – I have some rubbish to dispose of: waiting on Tuckers to give me a name of someone who they say can do that. If they don’t then I’ll use one of my existing contacts.
 
Your solicitor has been provided with all those documents in December, with an up-to-date EICR more recently. Can you request it from them? I’m not at my desk at the moment to find them for you so your solicitor should be your quickest way of getting them.
 
Thanks,
 
Roger.
 
From: Yang CHEN <ramonhaha@hotmail.com>  Sent: 11 July 2022 17:10 To: ramonhaha@hotmail.com Cc: roger <roger@pembery.com> Subject: Re: 113 Darwin Drive contacts
 
﻿Hi Roger I was wondering if we could have a look of the property tonight or early tomorrow morning before the completion of the contract? Many thanks!
 
Also could you please forward us the gas certificate , EPC and EICR testing document, so we could legally rent the house straight away or sooner? 
  
Kind regards
  
Yours, Yang
 
 
Sent from my iPhone
  
On Jul 7, 2022, at 08:46, ramonhaha@hotmail.com wrote:
﻿ 
No Worries Roger if it's too stressed then let's leave it to 12th July. Thanks!
 
Roger as we are going to do some advertisement to rent the property, Would you please forward the annual gas certificate , EPC and EICR testing document to us? Please don’t worry if you don’t have them and we can arrange them ourselves in due course. 
 
Kind regards
 
Yours, Yang
 

 
From: Roger Pembery
Date: 2022-07-07 08:38
To: 'Yang CHEN'
Subject: RE: 113 Darwin Drive contacts
Hi Yang – sorry for the delay in responding to you.
 
I am arranging to have the locks changed (they are currently all part of our master lock system) and also to have the property cleaned. If I manage to get all this done before the 10th then I’ll let you know that you can get access to take photographs.
 
Kind regards,
 
Roger.
 
 
From: Yang CHEN <Ramonhaha@hotmail.com>  Sent: 05 July 2022 17:42 To: Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> Subject: Re: 113 Darwin Drive contacts
 
Thank you very much Roger and we really appreciate it!
 
Yes agree to visit the house after they’ve moved out. How does 10am on 10th July sound to you? Or please advise a convenient time for you. Thanks!
 
Yours, Yang 
Sent from my iPhone
   
On Jul 5, 2022, at 16:47, Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> wrote:
﻿ 
Hi Yang,
 
I have informed Arkash that he needs to move out on or before the 9th July. I agree that any additional days stay may get complicated.
 
Re: the appliances, furniture, etc. we advertised the property including everything in it, so you will have beds, sofas, washing machines, sofas, fridges, kettles, etc.
 
I’d suggest that we arrange a time for photos after the current guys have left if that is OK with you? 
 
Thanks,
 
Roger.
 
From: ramonhaha@hotmail.com <ramonhaha@hotmail.com>  Sent: 05 July 2022 16:44 To: roger <roger@pembery.com> Subject: Re: RE: 113 Darwin Drive contacts
 
Hi Roger, 
 
I have informed them and Akash is requesting to leave before 12th July. I told him we were not the owner of the house yet and can't decide it for him. He might come to you but I worry if we leave it for the last day say 11th July, things might get more complicated for all parties as nobody will be assured they are genuinely moving out on the completion day. 
    
Roger as we are going to do some advertisement urgently to rent the house, could you kindly help to clarify if any appliances or furniture would be left with the house? Also could you arrange an convinient time for all parties so we have a chance to visit the house and take some photos? Many thanks!
    
Yours, Yang

Thanks.
 
Once you have told them then I will liaise with their checkout.

Roger.

Kind regards

Thanks for this. I will check them out as per the original plan.
 
Have you informed them?

I have just received the bank statments from Arkash. I am not sure if I should forward that to you due to data protection but I can tell you that looks really bad. He litterally has nothing left in his bank accout, and it's the same to all the people he listed that wanted to live in 113 Darwin Drive. 
 
Would you please let them move out on 9th July as originally scheduled? 
 
I would suggest you think twice if you are thinking of moving them to your other letting properties. I doubt they are able to pay for next week. Sorry!

subject: Fuel Your Adventures/The Bicycle Ambulance Camb Gravel Jam!
body:
￼ 



This was sent to you by the organizer of Fuel Your Adventures/The Bicycle Ambulance Camb Gravel Jam! 


 


Hi Folks,
Firstly thanks for signing up for the ride this coming weekend. The Bicycle Ambulance will be open from around 9am where you will be able to sign on. We will be heading off between 9:30-10am but feel free to head out once you have signed up and filled in a few details.
There are two different routes for you to choose from depending on the distance you want to cover. Both the 75km and 100km have a good mixture of surfaces, pub stops and cafes to refuel.
Here are the links to the two distances.
https://ridewithgps.com/trips/94908069
https://ridewithgps.com/trips/94908094
Having tested the route two weeks ago it was dry and very compact. Various sections had become overgrown so expect a little hike-a-bike. Make sure you have everything you need should you have any issues as a couple of sections are in the middle of nowhere and hard to get to.
If the weather is as hot as last year then please make sure you have plenty of water. There are shops on-route to stock up should you need water etc.
If you have ordered the t-shirt please can you let us know what size? These should be back from the printers on Friday but if they don't turn up in time please let us know your address on Saturday to post them out to you.
There are a couple of people who have asked about camping. There are a few campsites we know of in Cambridge but here is a link to Pitchup where you can find more.
Thanks once again for signing up and we look forward to meeting faces both old and new on Saturday.
All the best,
Richard, Claire, Sam & Rick
 
Details to remember.
Leave the meeting point any time you like before 10am.
It’ll take you at least 6 hours (depending on how fit you are) especially if stopping more than once so make sure you have everything you need.
Bring your buddies, it’s not a big group ride, it’s not a lead ride, you will need your own navigation. Do not expect to be able to turn up and just follow someone around.
There has been a lot of storm damage in the woods so tree felling has been on-going....watch out! There have been a few cases of falling branches but felling rarely happens at weekends.
We have ridden the route several times and have had no issues with shared paths and bridleways. There are some sections of hike-a-bike on footpaths, so smile, say thank you and giving people space normally goes a long way.
Go at your own pace, enjoy it. This is a social ride and a great place to meet up with like-minded people. When you are back at the shop we hope to hear about your day over a beer and some food.
Please wear a helmet! Some of the route is very tricky and we wouldn't want anyone to have an accident.
Disclaimer!
As with each route we publish, if you choose to cycle this route, do so at your own risk. Prior to setting out, check current local weather, conditions, and land/road closures. While riding, obey all public and private land use restrictions and rules, carry proper safety and navigational equipment, and of course, follow the #leavenotrace guidelines. The information found herein is simply a planning resource to be used as a point of inspiration in conjunction with your own due-diligence. In spite of the fact that this route, associated GPS track (GPX and maps), and all route guidelines were prepared under diligent research by the specified contributor and/or contributors, the accuracy of such and judgement of the author is not guaranteed. Fuel Y our Adventures, its partners, associates, and contributors are in no way liable for personal injury, damage to personal property, or any other such situation that might happen to individual riders cycling or following this route.
 
 
 


 
 

 

Fuel Your Adventures/The Bicycle Ambulance Camb Gravel Jam! 
Saturday, July 2, 2022 from 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM (BST) 
The Bicycle Ambulance Unit 2 61 Ditton Walk Cambridge CB5 8QD United Kingdom 

Download Tickets 



 
 
Questions about the event? 
Contact the organizer

subject: Re: 78 Petersfield Mansions: draft contract for review.
body:
Current address  317 Harston house, Adrian way,Cambridge 
The first day of contract can be 28May that is if the place is ready

On Tue, 24 May 2022, 15:57 Roger Pembery, <roger@pembery.com> wrote:
Motlalepula 
 
Please find the attached draft contract. Can you review it and let me know if you have any questions? I have highlighted the yellow sections that I still need information on:
 
	•	Date of agreement: we will complete this date when we both sign it
	•	Motlalepula Oteng Mogotsi of __________________: I need your current address. Seems odd but this is the way that the UK law currently works.
	•	A fixed term of 6 months from the _____ day of ____ 2022: We need to agree which is the first day of the contract.
 
Once you are ready to move forward then I can add this information, issue the execution version and we can sign it. 
 
Thanks,
 
Roger.
 
From: Lolo Mmipi <mmipimotlalepula@gmail.com>  Sent: 22 May 2022 16:07 To: Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> Subject: Rent
 
Hello again.
 
I do understand your reservations about my ability to afford the property, however I will be able to make my payments that I will commit to. My husband and I have other sources of income and I am in a position to cover my living costs.I only presented you with my job offer as it is the only  document I have here in the UK to validate my income. 
 
I am able to provide you with a detailed bank statement once we meet again in person, however at the moment I have attached a screenshot of my funds I have which is able to cover my payments for the first six months as we discussed.(it is in Pulas my currency).Along with that I will be recieving my monthly income. 
If there are any other concerns or queries please do not hesitate to contact me.
 
Kind regards,
Motlalepula

subject: Re: S21 notice revocation
body:
Cheers Roge, I appreciate it! 

That’s all okay by me then, given the keys can’t be copied.

Zane has told me that as he’s already signed on a new place, he’ll still be moving out. Please do double check with him first, but would it be okay with you if I took the large room upstairs from next month?

Let me know how much I’d owe you for that?

Best,

Sam

On 22 May 2022, at 15:02, Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> wrote:

﻿
Hi Sam – sorry in the delay in getting back to you.
 
I have instructed Eoin not to use the key and withdrawn any authority for him to act on my behalf. Unfortunately, it is not very easy to change the locks because it is a security master lock system but it also means that they cannot copy the key.
 
Re: your Aunt: very happy for her to stay.
 
 
From: Samuel East <smr.east@outlook.com>  Sent: 20 May 2022 21:06 To: Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> Subject: Re: S21 notice revocation
 
Hi Roge,
 
Thank you so much for the incredibly prompt response to this. I really am exceedingly grateful for your understanding in this matter.
 
I’m very happy to accept the retraction of the s21 notice; I fully understand that you intend to return the property to the market to find a more suitable buyer. My intention in this scenario is to remain a tenant here at 113 Darwin Drive - please do let me know when you’ve found another buyer, and I’ll start looking for other places then!
 
I must say - I’m a tad uncomfortable with the prospect that Tucker Gardner agency and Mr Yang Chen may have made copies of their keys to the property (especially considering how inappropriately they have acted thus far) - is there any chance I could get the lock to my room changed? I would be happy to pay for that myself out of my own pocket.
 
Finally, quick question - my parents were due in Cambridge this weekend to help me pack/look for other properties, and you kindly offered me the key to the spare room for them to stay in. They’ve now cancelled that visit due to these unforeseen updates. However, my Aunt will still be in town (she was also going to help) - would it be okay if she stays in the spare room which you gave me the key for on Saturday night?
 
Best, and thanks again,
 
Sam
 On 20 May 2022, at 20:32, Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> wrote:
﻿ 
Sam, 
 
As discussed on the phone just now, I will retract the s21 notice. We still intend to sell the property in due course but for the time being we are not then happy for you to stay on.
 
I'd like to apologise for all the aggravation that you and Zane have had to put up with over the last week. 
 
This offer is extended to have if he so wishes. 
 
Roger
 
On Fri, 20 May 2022, 20:18 Samuel East, <smr.east@outlook.com> wrote:
Hi Roge,
 
Thanks for understanding. I’m only aware that they were inside the property as Zane has just informed me - he discovered them inside the house, and entering rooms.
 
Best,
 
Sam
 On 20 May 2022, at 20:11, Roger Pembery <roger@pembery.com> wrote:
﻿ 
Sam, 
 
This is disturbing indeed. Many thanks for bringing this to our attention. 
 
Can you let me know how you know that they were inside the property? Once I have this information then I will raise it at a formal complaint with the agent and, of necessary, through their regulator.
 
I can confirm that we have not given permission for anything like this.
 
I hope that you both have a note peaceful weekend and I recommend no further contact with them.
 
Roger
 
 
On Fri, 20 May 2022, 19:48 Samuel East, <smr.east@outlook.com> wrote:
Hi Claire and Roge,  Hope all well. I’m afraid we’ve got some pretty disturbing news regarding Eoin (from Tucker Gardner) and the new owner of 113 Darwin Drive.  As it turns out (Zane has just informed me) Eoin and the new owner not only turned up at the property last night, but entered it without permission using their own set of keys and went into the individual rooms.  I’m sure you can understand how utterly unacceptable behaviour this is from them, and what a violation it is of our privacy and rights to quiet enjoyment. I fully understand that you will not have been aware of this - and that this is in no way your fault! - but I wanted to flag it with you to ask for your advice.  I’m sure you’ll understand that I will need reassurance that nothing like this can happen again, and that I may have to consider making a complaint to the ombudsman regarding Eoin and the new owner?  Sorry have to send such a stress-inducing email; again, I truly do recognise that this is not your fault at all!  Best,  Sam

subject: Sale of 113 Darwin Drive, Cambridge, Cambridgeshire CB4 3HQ [BIRKETTS-LEGAL.FID10066188]
body:
Dear Roger
 
Thank you for your email of Friday evening advising you are not proceeding with the proposed sale to the current purchasers.  It seems there have been so many issues with the sale from start to finish so I can understand your position.
 
I will hold off for now.  If you put the property back on the market and there is likely to be a new sale soon I will keep my file open.  If, on the other hand, you decide to continue to rent the property please let me know and in that case I would raise an invoice for the abortive sale but I will try to keep costs to a minimum as I know of all the issues you have had through no fault of your own.
 
I look forward to hearing from you.
 
Yours sincerely
 
Paul Eastall
